feed.title: AATF AI News Aggregator - Research (Full)
feed.subtitle: Research items from AI News Aggregator

author.name: AATF AI News Aggregator

entry.title: Research Summary: February 03, 2026

author.name: AATF AI News Aggregator

entry.summary:
Today's research features potentially transformative efficiency advances and critical safety findings. A symmetry-aware Taylor approximation claims to achieve constant-cost self-attention per token—if validated, a fundamental breakthrough. Meta introduces Fault Tolerant HSDP enabling training on 100K+ GPUs with graceful failure recovery.

  • Kimi K2.5 releases as open-source multimodal agent with novel Agent Swarm parallel orchestration architecture
  • Tele-Lens probing reveals myopic planning in Chain-of-Thought without global task awareness—challenging CoT assumptions
  • BLOCK-EM achieves 95% reduction in emergent misalignment by constraining causal features during fine-tuning
  • ReasoningBomb exposes DoS vulnerabilities in reasoning models by inducing pathologically long traces

Theoretical advances include polylog(1/δ) sampling complexity for diffusion models (exponential improvement), formal proofs that transformers learn factored representations in orthogonal subspaces, and a relative-budget theory explaining when RLVR succeeds. Grad2Reward extracts dense process rewards directly from LLM judge gradients, addressing reward sparsity in long-form reasoning.

entry.title: Self-Attention at Constant Cost per Token via Symmetry-Aware Taylor Approximation

author.name: Franz A. Heinsen, Leo Kozachkov

entry.summary: Shows self-attention is efficiently computable to arbitrary precision with constant cost per token by decomposing Taylor expansion into symmetric chains of tensor products, achieving orders-of-magnitude efficiency gains.

entry.title: Training LLMs with Fault Tolerant HSDP on 100,000 GPUs

author.name: Omkar Salpekar, Rohan Varma, Kenny Yu, Vladimir Ivanov, Yang Wang, Ahmed Sharif, Min Si, Shawn Xu, Feng Tian, Shengbao Zheng, Tristan Rice, Ankush Garg, Shangfu Peng, Shreyas Siravara, Wenyin Fu, Rodrigo de Castro, Adithya Gangidi, Andrey Obraztsov, Sharan Narang, Sergey Edunov, Maxim Naumov, Chunqiang Tang, Mathew Oldham

entry.summary: Introduces Fault Tolerant HSDP for training on 100K+ GPUs, allowing individual data-parallel replicas to restart on failure while others continue. Includes novel fault-tolerant all-reduce protocol.

entry.title: Kimi K2.5: Visual Agentic Intelligence

author.name: Kimi Team, Tongtong Bai, Yifan Bai, Yiping Bao, S. H. Cai, Yuan Cao, Y. Charles, H. S. Che, Cheng Chen, Guanduo Chen, Huarong Chen, Jia Chen, Jiahao Chen, Jianlong Chen, Jun Chen, Kefan Chen, Liang Chen, Ruijue Chen, Xinhao Chen, Yanru Chen, Yanxu Chen, Yicun Chen, Yimin Chen, Yingjiang Chen, Yuankun Chen, Yujie Chen, Yutian Chen, Zhirong Chen, Ziwei Chen, Dazhi Cheng, Minghan Chu, Jialei Cui, Jiaqi Deng, Muxi Diao, Hao Ding, Mengfan Dong, Mengnan Dong, Yuxin Dong, Yuhao Dong, Angang Du, Chenzhuang Du, Dikang Du, Lingxiao Du, Yulun Du, Yu Fan, Shengjun Fang, Qiulin Feng, Yichen Feng, Garimugai Fu, Kelin Fu, Hongcheng Gao, Tong Gao, Yuyao Ge, Shangyi Geng, Chengyang Gong, Xiaochen Gong, Zhuoma Gongque, Qizheng Gu, Xinran Gu, Yicheng Gu, Longyu Guan, Yuanying Guo, Xiaoru Hao, Weiran He, Wenyang He, Yunjia He, Chao Hong, Hao Hu, Jiaxi Hu, Yangyang Hu, Zhenxing Hu, Ke Huang, Ruiyuan Huang, Weixiao Huang, Zhiqi Huang, Tao Jiang, Zhejun Jiang, Xinyi Jin, Yu Jing, Guokun Lai, Aidi Li, C. Xu, Lin Xu, Suting Xu, Weixin Xu, Xinbo Xu, Xinran Xu, Yangchuan Xu, Yichang Xu, Yuemeng Xu, Zelai Xu, Ziyao Xu, Junjie Yan, Yuzi Yan, Guangyao Yang, Hao Yang, Junwei Yang, Kai Yang, Ningyuan Yang, Ruihan Yang, Xiaofei Yang, Xinlong Yang, Ying Yang, Yi Yang, Yi Yang, Zhen Yang, Zhilin Yang, Zonghan Yang, Haotian Yao, Dan Ye, Wenjie Ye, Zhuorui Ye, Bohong Yin, Chengzhen Yu, Longhui Yu, Tao Yu, Tianxiang Yu, Enming Yuan, Mengjie Yuan, Xiaokun Yuan, Yang Yue, Weihao Zeng, Dunyuan Zha, Haobing Zhan, Dehao Zhang, Hao Zhang, Jin Zhang, Puqi Zhang, Qiao Zhang, Rui Zhang, Xiaobin Zhang, Y. Zhou, Runjie Zhou, Xinyu Zhou, Zaida Zhou, Jinguo Zhu, Liya Zhu, Xinhao Zhu, Yuxuan Zhu, Zhen Zhu, Jingze Zhuang, Weiyu Zhuang, Ying Zou, Xinxing Zu

entry.summary: Kimi K2.5 is an open-source multimodal agentic model featuring joint text-vision optimization and Agent Swarm—a parallel agent orchestration framework that dynamically decomposes complex tasks. Claims SOTA across coding, vision, reasoning, and agentic tasks.

entry.title: ReasoningBomb: A Stealthy Denial-of-Service Attack by Inducing Pathologically Long Reasoning in Large Reasoning Models

author.name: Xiaogeng Liu, Xinyan Wang, Yechao Zhang, Sanjay Kariyappa, Chong Xiang, Muhao Chen, G. Edward Suh, Chaowei Xiao

entry.summary: Introduces ReasoningBomb, a new class of denial-of-service attacks targeting large reasoning models by inducing pathologically long reasoning traces. Formalizes PI-DoS attacks with three key properties: amplification, stealthiness, and optimizability.

entry.title: No Global Plan in Chain-of-Thought: Uncover the Latent Planning Horizon of LLMs

author.name: Liyan Xu, Mo Yu, Fandong Meng, Jie Zhou

entry.summary: Proposes Tele-Lens probing method revealing LLMs exhibit myopic planning horizon in Chain-of-Thought, conducting incremental transitions without precise global planning.

entry.title: AICD Bench: A Challenging Benchmark for AI-Generated Code Detection

author.name: Daniil Orel, Dilshod Azizov, Indraneil Paul, Yuxia Wang, Iryna Gurevych, Preslav Nakov

entry.summary: Introduces AICD Bench, comprehensive benchmark for AI-generated code detection with 2M examples, 77 models across 11 families, 9 languages, including reasoning models and three realistic detection tasks.

entry.title: BLOCK-EM: Preventing Emergent Misalignment by Blocking Causal Features

author.name: Muhammed Ustaomeroglu, Guannan Qu

entry.summary: Proposes BLOCK-EM for preventing emergent misalignment by identifying and constraining internal features that control misaligned behavior during fine-tuning. Achieves up to 95% reduction in emergent misalignment across six domains.

entry.title: Grad2Reward: From Sparse Judgment to Dense Rewards for Improving Open-Ended LLM Reasoning

author.name: Zheng Zhang, Ao Lu, Yuanhao Zeng, Ziwei Shan, Jinjin Guo, Lufei Li, Yexin Li, Kan Ren

entry.summary: Introduces Grad2Reward framework that extracts dense process rewards directly from LLM judge gradients, converting sparse sequence-level rewards into fine-grained supervision for RLHF on open-ended tasks.

entry.title: MAGIC: A Co-Evolving Attacker-Defender Adversarial Game for Robust LLM Safety

author.name: Xiaoyu Wen, Zhida He, Han Qi, Ziyu Wan, Zhongtian Ma, Ying Wen, Tianhang Zheng, Xingcheng Xu, Chaochao Lu, Qiaosheng Zhang

entry.summary: MAGIC frames LLM safety alignment as adversarial game where attacker agent discovers vulnerabilities while defender agent learns to refuse, enabling co-evolution that uncovers long-tail vulnerabilities.

entry.title: Breaking the Reversal Curse in Autoregressive Language Models via Identity Bridge

author.name: Xutao Ma, Yixiao Huang, Hanlin Zhu, Somayeh Sojoudi

entry.summary: Proposes 'Identity Bridge' to address the reversal curse in autoregressive LLMs, where models trained on 'A→B' cannot deduce 'B→A'. Claims to mitigate what was previously considered a fundamental limitation of causal LLMs.

entry.title: Learning Robust Reasoning through Guided Adversarial Self-Play

author.name: Shuozhe Li, Vaishnav Tadiparthi, Kwonjoon Lee, Nakul Agarwal, Hossein Nourkhiz Mahjoub, Ehsan Moradi Pari, Lizhang Chen, Amy Zhang, Liu Leqi

entry.summary: GASP introduces adversarial self-play within a single model to train detect-and-repair capabilities for reasoning, using only outcome verification. A polluter induces coherent corruptions while an agent learns to recover.

entry.title: Jailbreaking LLMs via Calibration

author.name: Yuxuan Lu, Yongkang Guo, Yuqing Kong

entry.summary: Models safety alignment in LLMs as a systematic distortion of pre-alignment distributions and casts jailbreaking as a forecast aggregation problem. Derives optimal aggregation strategy and shows logit-arithmetic methods are a special case, proposing broader family of attacks.

entry.title: Good SFT Optimizes for SFT, Better SFT Prepares for Reinforcement Learning

author.name: Dylan Zhang, Yufeng Xu, Haojin Wang, Qingzhi Chen, Hao Peng

entry.summary: Demonstrates that stronger SFT checkpoints can significantly underperform weaker ones after identical RL training due to distribution mismatch. Proposes PEAR to re-weight SFT samples to prepare for RL.

entry.title: A Relative-Budget Theory for Reinforcement Learning with Verifiable Rewards in Large Language Model Reasoning

author.name: Akifumi Wachi, Hirota Kinoshita, Shokichi Takakura, Rei Higuchi, Taiji Suzuki

entry.summary: Proposes relative-budget theory explaining RL effectiveness for LLM reasoning through ξ=H/E[T]. Identifies three regimes: deficient (rare informative trajectories), efficient, and wasteful.

entry.title: SafePred: A Predictive Guardrail for Computer-Using Agents via World Models

author.name: Yurun Chen, Zeyi Liao, Ping Yin, Taotao Xie, Keting Yin, Shengyu Zhang

entry.summary: SafePred introduces predictive guardrails for computer-using agents using world models to proactively identify long-term risks from seemingly reasonable actions, unlike reactive guardrails that only detect immediate threats.

entry.title: High-accuracy sampling for diffusion models and log-concave distributions

author.name: Fan Chen, Sinho Chewi, Constantinos Daskalakis, Alexander Rakhlin

entry.summary: Presents algorithms achieving δ-error in polylog(1/δ) steps for diffusion model sampling, exponential improvement over prior work. Also yields first polylog complexity sampler for strongly log-concave distributions.

entry.title: How Implicit Bias Accumulates and Propagates in LLM Long-term Memory

author.name: Yiming Ma, Lixu Wang, Lionel Z. Wang, Hongkun Yang, Haoming Sun, Xin Xu, Jiaqi Wu, Bin Chen, Wei Dong

entry.summary: Studies how implicit bias accumulates and propagates in LLMs with long-term memory mechanisms. Introduces DIB Benchmark with 3,776 decision-making scenarios across 9 domains, evaluating 6 SOTA LLMs with 3 memory architectures.

entry.title: Transformers learn factored representations

author.name: Adam Shai, Loren Amdahl-Culleton, Casper L. Christensen, Henry R. Bigelow, Fernando E. Rosas, Alexander B. Boyd, Eric A. Alt, Kyle J. Ray, Paul M. Riechers

entry.summary: Formalizes how transformers pretrained via next-token prediction learn factored representations in orthogonal subspaces of the residual stream. Derives precise geometric predictions about activation structure and validates empirically.

entry.title: Towards Long-Horizon Interpretability: Efficient and Faithful Multi-Token Attribution for Reasoning LLMs

author.name: Wenbo Pan, Zhichao Liu, Xianlong Wang, Haining Yu, Xiaohua Jia

entry.summary: Introduces FlashTrace for efficient multi-token attribution in reasoning LLMs, reducing complexity from O(M*N) to O(N) through span-wise aggregation. Addresses attribution mass absorption by intermediate reasoning tokens.

entry.title: Adversarial Reward Auditing for Active Detection and Mitigation of Reward Hacking

author.name: Mohammad Beigi, Ming Jin, Junshan Zhang, Qifan Wang, Lifu Huang

entry.summary: Adversarial Reward Auditing (ARA) reconceptualizes reward hacking as dynamic adversarial game where Hacker policy discovers vulnerabilities while Auditor detects exploitation, enabling Auditor-Guided RLHF.

entry.title: The Blessing of Dimensionality in LLM Fine-tuning: A Variance-Curvature Perspective

author.name: Qiyao Liang, Jinyeop Song, Yizhou Liu, Jeff Gore, Ila Fiete, Risto Miikkulainen, Xin Qiu

entry.summary: Explains why evolution strategies can fine-tune billion-parameter LLMs with small populations (~30) through a variance-curvature perspective. Shows fine-tuning landscapes are low-dimensional in curvature.

entry.title: TQL: Scaling Q-Functions with Transformers by Preventing Attention Collapse

author.name: Perry Dong, Kuo-Han Hung, Alexander Swerdlow, Dorsa Sadigh, Chelsea Finn

entry.summary: Identifies attention collapse as the critical failure mode preventing transformer scaling for RL value functions. Proposes TQL controlling attention entropy to enable larger models.

entry.title: What Do Agents Learn from Trajectory-SFT: Semantics or Interfaces?

author.name: Weizheng Gu, Chengze Li, Zhuohao Yu, Mengyuan Sun, Zhibang Yang, Wei Wang, Hongrui Jia, Shikun Zhang, Wei Ye

entry.summary: Introduces PIPE protocol to diagnose whether agents learn semantic tool-use or merely memorize interface patterns. Testing across 16 environments reveals trajectory-SFT substantially amplifies interface reliance over semantic understanding.

entry.title: DASH: Faster Shampoo via Batched Block Preconditioning and Efficient Inverse-Root Solvers

author.name: Ionut-Vlad Modoranu, Philip Zmushko, Erik Schultheis, Mher Safaryan, Dan Alistarh

entry.summary: Proposes DASH for faster Shampoo optimizer via batched block preconditioning in 3D tensors and Newton-DB iteration for inverse roots. Significant speedup over distributed Shampoo.

entry.title: Expanding the Capabilities of Reinforcement Learning via Text Feedback

author.name: Yuda Song, Lili Chen, Fahim Tajwar, Remi Munos, Deepak Pathak, J. Andrew Bagnell, Aarti Singh, Andrea Zanette

entry.summary: Studies text feedback as an intermediate signal between scalar rewards and demonstrations for RL. Formalizes RL from Text Feedback (RLTF) as multi-turn RL setup where text critiques are available during training.

entry.title: Hallucination is a Consequence of Space-Optimality: A Rate-Distortion Theorem for Membership Testing

author.name: Anxin Guo, Jingwei Li

entry.summary: Establishes rate-distortion theorem formalizing hallucination as consequence of space-optimality in membership testing. Shows optimal memory efficiency characterized by minimum KL divergence, explaining hallucination as information-theoretically fundamental.

entry.title: A Provable Expressiveness Hierarchy in Hybrid Linear-Full Attention

author.name: Xiaowei Ye, Xiaoyu He, Chao Liao, Chen Wu, Pinyan Lu

entry.summary: Establishes theoretical expressiveness hierarchy showing full attention > hybrid attention > linear attention for sequential function composition (multi-step reasoning), proving linear attention variants cannot match full attention on specific tasks.

entry.title: Chance-Constrained Inference for Hallucination Risk Control in Large Language Models

author.name: Sreenivasan Mohandas

entry.summary: Formulates LLM inference as a deployment-time risk control problem and introduces chance-constrained inference to bound hallucination probability. Proposes sequential, anytime-valid algorithm providing statistical guarantees on accepted generations.

entry.title: Learning While Staying Curious: Entropy-Preserving Supervised Fine-Tuning via Adaptive Self-Distillation for Large Reasoning Models

author.name: Hao Wang, Hao Gu, Hongming Piao, Kaixiong Gong, Yuxiao Ye, Xiangyu Yue, Sirui Han, Yike Guo, Dapeng Wu

entry.summary: Proposes CurioSFT entropy-preserving SFT method with Self-Exploratory Distillation to maintain exploration capability for subsequent RL, addressing overconfidence from standard SFT.

entry.title: An Empirical Study on Noisy Data and LLM Pretraining Loss Divergence

author.name: Qizhen Zhang, Ankush Garg, Jakob Foerster, Niladri Chatterji, Kshitiz Malik, Mike Lewis

entry.summary: Systematic empirical study on how noisy data causes LLM pretraining loss divergence across models from 480M to 5.2B parameters. Shows that noise injection leads to predictable instability patterns and divergence thresholds.

entry.title: How RLHF Amplifies Sycophancy

author.name: Itai Shapira, Gerdus Benade, Ariel D. Procaccia

entry.summary: Provides formal analysis of how RLHF amplifies sycophancy, identifying explicit mechanism linking reward optimization to bias in preference data. Shows behavioral drift depends on covariance under base policy.

entry.title: Building Better Deception Probes Using Targeted Instruction Pairs

author.name: Vikram Natarajan, Devina Jain, Shivam Arora, Satvik Golechha, Joseph Bloom

entry.summary: Shows that targeted instruction pairs using human-interpretable taxonomy of deception types significantly improves linear probes for detecting AI deceptive behavior compared to generic approaches.

entry.title: Simple Role Assignment is Extraordinarily Effective for Safety Alignment

author.name: Zhou Ziheng, Jiakun Ding, Zhaowei Zhang, Ruosen Gao, Yingnian Wu, Demetri Terzopoulos, Yipeng Kang, Fangwei Zhong, Junqi Wang

entry.summary: Proposes role conditioning as compact alternative to principle-based alignment, using social roles (mother, judge) to implicitly encode values. Achieves dramatic reduction in unsafe outputs from 81.4% to 3.6% on WildJailbreak with DeepSeek-V3.

entry.title: Beyond the Loss Curve: Scaling Laws, Active Learning, and the Limits of Learning from Exact Posteriors

author.name: Arian Khorasani, Nathaniel Chen, Yug D Oswal, Akshat Santhana Gopalan, Egemen Kolemen, Ravid Shwartz-Ziv

entry.summary: Uses class-conditional normalizing flows as oracles with exact posteriors to study scaling laws, decomposing error into aleatoric and epistemic components. Shows architectural differences in approaching aleatoric floor.

entry.title: ZEST: Zero-shot Embodied Skill Transfer for Athletic Robot Control

author.name: Jean Pierre Sleiman, He Li, Alphonsus Adu-Bredu, Robin Deits, Arun Kumar, Kevin Bergamin, Mohak Bhardwaj, Scott Biddlestone, Nicola Burger, Matthew A. Estrada, Francesco Iacobelli, Twan Koolen, Alexander Lambert, Erica Lin, M. Eva Mungai, Zach Nobles, Shane Rozen-Levy, Yuyao Shi, Jiashun Wang, Jakob Welner, Fangzhou Yu, Mike Zhang, Alfred Rizzi, Jessica Hodgins, Sylvain Bertrand, Yeuhi Abe, Scott Kuindersma, Farbod Farshidian

entry.summary: ZEST enables zero-shot transfer of athletic behaviors to humanoid robots from diverse motion sources (mocap, video, animation) via RL without contact labels, state estimators, or extensive reward shaping.

entry.title: Rethinking Hallucinations: Correctness, Consistency, and Prompt Multiplicity

author.name: Prakhar Ganesh, Reza Shokri, Golnoosh Farnadi

entry.summary: Introduces prompt multiplicity framework for quantifying consistency in LLM hallucination evaluations. Reveals over 50% inconsistency in benchmarks like Med-HALT and studies consistency's role in hallucination detection and mitigation.

entry.title: MarkovScale: Towards Optimal Sequential Scaling at Inference Time

author.name: Youkang Wang, Jian Wang, Rubing Chen, Tianyi Zeng, Xiao-Yong Wei, Qing Li

entry.summary: Models sequential inference-time scaling as a two-state Markov process, deriving closed-form solutions for performance bounds and conditions for accuracy improvement. Proposes MarkovScale system.

entry.title: Provable Defense Framework for LLM Jailbreaks via Noise-Augumented Alignment

author.name: Zehua Cheng, Jianwei Yang, Wei Dai, Jiahao Sun

entry.summary: Proposes certifiable defense against LLM jailbreaks via Certified Semantic Smoothing using stratified randomized ablation with Noise-Augmented Alignment Tuning for semantic denoising.

entry.title: A Practical Tensor-Network Compression Pipeline for Production-Scale Large Language Models

author.name: Sergii Kozyrev (Minima AI, Inc.), Davyd Maiboroda (Minima AI, Inc.)

entry.summary: Minima presents a production-ready LLM compression pipeline using tensor decomposition (Tucker, tensor-train, tensor-ring) with sensitivity prediction, healing fine-tuning, and custom kernels. Achieves 64GB→<32GB VRAM reduction on Qwen3-32B.

entry.title: SWE-Universe: Scale Real-World Verifiable Environments to Millions

author.name: Mouxiang Chen, Lei Zhang, Yunlong Feng, Xuwu Wang, Wenting Zhao, Ruisheng Cao, Jiaxi Yang, Jiawei Chen, Mingze Li, Zeyao Ma, Hao Ge, Zongmeng Zhang, Zeyu Cui, Dayiheng Liu, Jingren Zhou, Jianling Sun, Junyang Lin, Binyuan Hui

entry.summary: SWE-Universe framework automatically constructs 807,693 real-world multilingual software engineering environments from GitHub PRs using building agent with iterative self-verification and hacking detection.

entry.title: Nearly Optimal Active Preference Learning and Its Application to LLM Alignment

author.name: Yao Zhao, Kwang-Sung Jun

entry.summary: Proposes two active learning algorithms for preference learning with instance-dependent label complexity guarantees. Shows classical experimental design criteria (G/D-optimality) are suboptimal for preference learning's specific structure.

entry.title: Statistical Learning Theory in Lean 4: Empirical Processes from Scratch

author.name: Yuanhe Zhang, Jason D. Lee, Fanghui Liu

entry.summary: Presents the first comprehensive Lean 4 formalization of statistical learning theory, including Gaussian Lipschitz concentration and Dudley's entropy integral theorem. Uses a human-AI collaborative workflow where humans design proof strategies and AI executes tactical construction.

entry.title: Expected Harm: Rethinking Safety Evaluation of (Mis)Aligned LLMs

author.name: Yen-Shan Chen, Zhi Rui Tam, Cheng-Kuang Wu, Yun-Nung Chen

entry.summary: Introduces Expected Harm metric for LLM safety that weights severity by Execution Likelihood. Reveals systematic Inverse Risk Calibration where models refuse low-likelihood threats but remain vulnerable to high-likelihood ones.

entry.title: Temporal Leakage in Search-Engine Date-Filtered Web Retrieval: A Case Study from Retrospective Forecasting

author.name: Ali El Lahib, Ying-Jieh Xia, Zehan Li, Yuxuan Wang, Xinyu Pi

entry.summary: Reveals that 71% of date-filtered Google Search queries return post-cutoff leakage, with 41% directly revealing answers. Demonstrates inflated forecasting accuracy (Brier 0.108 vs 0.242) when using leaked documents.

entry.title: Simplicity Prevails: The Emergence of Generalizable AIGI Detection in Visual Foundation Models

author.name: Yue Zhou, Xinan He, Kaiqing Lin, Bing Fan, Feng Ding, Bin Li

entry.summary: Demonstrates that simple linear classifiers on frozen Vision Foundation Model features (Perception Encoder, MetaCLIP 2, DINOv3) establish new SOTA for AI-generated image detection, outperforming specialized detectors on in-the-wild data.

entry.title: Structure Enables Effective Self-Localization of Errors in LLMs

author.name: Ankur Samanta, Akshayaa Magesh, Ayush Jain, Kavosh Asadi, Youliang Yu, Daniel Jiang, Boris Vidolov, Kaveh Hassani, Paul Sajda, Jalaj Bhandari, Yonathan Efroni

entry.summary: Shows structured reasoning as discrete thought steps enables reliable error self-localization in LLMs, proposing Thought-ICS for iterative correction sampling inspired by human brain error monitoring.

entry.title: Multi-Agent Teams Hold Experts Back

author.name: Aneesh Pappu, Batu El, Hancheng Cao, Carmelo di Nolfo, Yanchao Sun, Meng Cao, James Zou

entry.summary: Studies whether self-organizing LLM teams achieve synergy comparable to human teams. Finds that unlike human teams, multi-agent LLM systems fail to match or exceed best individual member performance.

entry.title: P-EAGLE: Parallel-Drafting EAGLE with Scalable Training

author.name: Mude Hui, Xin Huang, Jaime Campos Salas, Yue Sun, Nathan Pemberton, Xiang Song, Ashish Khetan, George Karypis

entry.summary: Proposes P-EAGLE transforming EAGLE from autoregressive to parallel multi-token prediction via shared hidden state, with scalable training framework for long-context reasoning LLMs.

entry.title: Human Society-Inspired Approaches to Agentic AI Security: The 4C Framework

author.name: Alsharif Abuadbba, Nazatul Sultan, Surya Nepal, Sanjay Jha

entry.summary: Proposes 4C Framework (Containment, Coordination, Compliance, Consensus) for agentic AI security, inspired by human society mechanisms for governing autonomous actors in complex ecosystems.

entry.title: MSign: An Optimizer Preventing Training Instability in Large Language Models via Stable Rank Restoration

author.name: Lianhai Ren, Yucheng Ding, Xiao Liu, Qianxiao Li, Peng Cheng, Yeyun Gong

entry.summary: Identifies that training instability in LLMs is preceded by declining weight matrix stable rank and increasing layer Jacobian alignment. Proposes MSign optimizer that periodically applies matrix sign operations to restore stable rank.

entry.title: Omni-RRM: Advancing Omni Reward Modeling via Automatic Rubric-Grounded Preference Synthesis

author.name: Zicheng Kong, Dehua Ma, Zhenbo Xu, Alven Yang, Yiwei Ru, Haoran Wang, Zixuan Zhou, Fuqing Bie, Liuyu Xiang, Huijia Wu, Jian Zhao, Zhaofeng He

entry.summary: Introduces Omni-RRM, the first open-source rubric-grounded reward model producing structured multi-dimension judgments with justifications across text, image, video, and audio modalities.

entry.title: ProjDevBench: Benchmarking AI Coding Agents on End-to-End Project Development

author.name: Pengrui Lu, Shiqi Zhang, Yunzhong Hou, Lyumanshan Ye, Chaoyi Huang, Zixi Chen, Ji Zeng, Hantao Jiang, Pengfei Liu, Yiwei Wang, Ming-Hsuan Yang

entry.summary: ProjDevBench benchmarks coding agents on end-to-end project development from requirements to full repositories, evaluating architecture design, functional correctness, and iterative refinement across 20 problems.

entry.title: Mitigating Safety Tax via Distribution-Grounded Refinement in Large Reasoning Models

author.name: Yingsha Xie, Tiansheng Huang, Enneng Yang, Rui Min, Wenjie Lu, Xiaochun Cao, Naiqiang Tan, Li Shen

entry.summary: DGR addresses safety tax in reasoning models by transforming out-of-distribution safety datasets to align with target LRM's inner distribution, mitigating reasoning ability degradation.

entry.title: MCP-Atlas: A Large-Scale Benchmark for Tool-Use Competency with Real MCP Servers

author.name: Chaithanya Bandi, Ben Hertzberg, Geobio Boo, Tejas Polakam, Jeff Da, Sami Hassaan, Manasi Sharma, Andrew Park, Ernesto Hernandez, Dan Rambado, Ivan Salazar, Rafael Cruz, Chetan Rane, Ben Levin, Brad Kenstler, Bing Liu

entry.summary: Introduces MCP-Atlas benchmark for evaluating tool-use competency with 36 real MCP servers, 220 tools, and 1000 tasks requiring 3-6 tool calls across multiple servers. Uses natural language prompts without naming specific tools.

entry.title: You Need an Encoder for Native Position-Independent Caching

author.name: Shiju Zhao, Junhao Hu, Jiaqi Zheng, Guihai Chen

entry.summary: Proposes reintroducing encoders to decoder-only LLMs for native position-independent caching, enabling KV reuse without positional constraints. COMB system reduces TTFT by 51-94%.

entry.title: RedVisor: Reasoning-Aware Prompt Injection Defense via Zero-Copy KV Cache Reuse

author.name: Mingrui Liu, Sixiao Zhang, Cheng Long, Kwok-Yan Lam

entry.summary: RedVisor defends against prompt injection using reasoning-aware zero-copy KV cache reuse, leveraging fine-grained reasoning paths to simultaneously detect attacks and guide safe responses without fine-tuning penalty.

entry.title: $\textbf{AGT$^{AO}$}$: Robust and Stabilized LLM Unlearning via Adversarial Gating Training with Adaptive Orthogonality

author.name: Pengyu Li, Lingling Zhang, Zhitao Gao, Yanrui Wu, Yuxuan Dong, Huan Liu, Bifan Wei, Jun Liu

entry.summary: Proposes AGT^AO for LLM unlearning that reconciles robust erasure with utility preservation through adversarial gating training and adaptive orthogonality. Addresses catastrophic forgetting vs superficial forgetting tradeoff.

entry.title: Prism: Efficient Test-Time Scaling via Hierarchical Search and Self-Verification for Discrete Diffusion Language Models

author.name: Jinbin Bai, Yixuan Li, Yuchen Zhu, Yi Xin, Qingyu Shi, Aosong Feng, Xiaohong Liu, Molei Tao, Jianru Xue, Xiangtai Li, Ming-Hsuan Yang

entry.summary: Proposes Prism, a test-time scaling framework for discrete diffusion language models using hierarchical trajectory search, local branching with partial remasking, and self-verification.

entry.title: Hessian Spectral Analysis at Foundation Model Scale

author.name: Diego Granziol, Khurshid Juarev

entry.summary: First large-scale Hessian spectral analysis of foundation models up to 100B parameters using shard-local finite-difference with FSDP. Characterizes numerical behavior and derives practical operating regions.

entry.title: Causal Forcing: Autoregressive Diffusion Distillation Done Right for High-Quality Real-Time Interactive Video Generation

author.name: Hongzhou Zhu, Min Zhao, Guande He, Hang Su, Chongxuan Li, Jun Zhu

entry.summary: Proposes Causal Forcing for autoregressive diffusion distillation, identifying that bidirectional-to-AR distillation violates frame-level injectivity causing conditional-expectation degradation.

entry.title: Assessing Domain-Level Susceptibility to Emergent Misalignment from Narrow Finetuning

author.name: Abhishek Mishra, Mugilan Arulvanan, Reshma Ashok, Polina Petrova, Deepesh Suranjandass, Donnie Winkelmann

entry.summary: Studies emergent misalignment from finetuning on insecure data across 11 domains, finding backdoor triggers increase misalignment in 77.8% of domains. Tests Qwen2.5-Coder-7B and GPT-4o-mini, revealing domain-specific vulnerability patterns.

entry.title: Self-Guard: Defending Large Reasoning Models via enhanced self-reflection

author.name: Jingnan Zheng, Jingjun Xu, Yanzhen Luo, Chenhang Cui, Gelei Deng, Zhenkai Liang, Xiang Wang, An Zhang, Tat-Seng Chua

entry.summary: Proposes Self-Guard framework for defending Large Reasoning Models against risks like reasoning manipulation and information leakage. Addresses awareness-compliance gap where models recognize risks but follow harmful instructions anyway.

entry.title: HalluHard: A Hard Multi-Turn Hallucination Benchmark

author.name: Dongyang Fan, Sebastien Delsad, Nicolas Flammarion, Maksym Andriushchenko

entry.summary: Introduces HalluHard, challenging multi-turn hallucination benchmark with 950 questions across legal, research, medical, and coding domains. Uses citation-based groundedness with web search verification.

entry.title: Legal Infrastructure for Transformative AI Governance

author.name: Gillian K. Hadfield

entry.summary: PNAS Perspective piece arguing AI governance needs to focus on legal/regulatory infrastructure, not just substantive rules, proposing registration regimes for frontier models, autonomous agents, and regulatory markets.

entry.title: Understanding the Reversal Curse Mitigation in Masked Diffusion Models through Attention and Training Dynamics

author.name: Sangwoo Shin, BumJun Kim, Kyelim Lee, Moongyu Jeon, Albert No

entry.summary: Explains why Masked Diffusion Models mitigate reversal curse better than autoregressive models, showing it arises from architectural weight sharing coupling forward and reverse directions, not just any-order training.

entry.title: Adoption and Use of LLMs at an Academic Medical Center

author.name: Nigam H. Shah, Nerissa Ambers, Abby Pandya, Timothy Keyes, Juan M. Banda, Srikar Nallan, Carlene Lugtu, Artem A. Trotsyuk, Suhana Bedi, Alyssa Unell, Miguel Fuentes, Francois Grolleau, Sneha S. Jain, Jonathan Chen, Devdutta Dash, Danton Char, Aditya Sharma, Duncan McElfresh, Patrick Scully, Vishanthan Kumar, Connor OBrien, Satchi Mouniswamy, Elvis Jones, Krishna Jasti, Gunavathi Mannika Lakshmanan, Sree Ram Akula, Varun Kumar Singh, Ramesh Rajmanickam, Sudhir Sinha, Vicky Zhou, Xu Wang, Bilal Mawji, Joshua Ge, Wencheng Li, Travis Lyons, Jarrod Helzer, Vikas Kakkar, Ramesh Powar, Darren Batara, Cheryl Cordova, William Frederick III, Olivia Tang, Phoebe Morgan, April S. Liang, Stephen P. Ma, Shivam Vedak, Dong-han Yao, Akshay Swaminathan, Mehr Kashyap, Brian Ng, Jamie Hellman, Nikesh Kotecha, Christopher Sharp, Gretchen Brown, Christian Lindmark, Anurang Revri, Michael A. Pfeffer

entry.summary: Describes ChatEHR deployment at Stanford enabling LLM use with patient timelines across years for pre-visit review, transfer screening, and chart abstraction. 85,000 automations and 5,700 interactive sessions deployed across 30 workflows.

entry.title: TimeBlind: A Spatio-Temporal Compositionality Benchmark for Video LLMs

author.name: Baiqi Li, Kangyi Zhao, Ce Zhang, Chancharik Mitra, Jean de Dieu Nyandwi, Gedas Bertasius

entry.summary: TimeBlind is a diagnostic benchmark for video LLM spatio-temporal understanding using minimal-pairs paradigm where videos share static content but differ solely in temporal structure.

entry.title: When RAG Hurts: Diagnosing and Mitigating Attention Distraction in Retrieval-Augmented LVLMs

author.name: Beidi Zhao, Wenlong Deng, Xinting Liao, Yushu Li, Nazim Shaikh, Yao Nie, Xiaoxiao Li

entry.summary: Identifies Attention Distraction failure mode in RAG where retrieved context suppresses visual attention globally and shifts focus away from question-relevant regions, causing failures on previously correct questions.

entry.title: Learning to Decode Against Compositional Hallucination in Video Multimodal Large Language Models

author.name: Wenbin Xing, Quanxing Zha, Lizheng Zu, Mengran Li, Ming Li, Junchi Yan

entry.summary: Introduces OmniVCHall benchmark for systematically evaluating compositional hallucinations in video multimodal LLMs, spanning diverse domains with adversarial answer options. Evaluates 39 representative VLLMs revealing that even advanced models struggle.

entry.title: EverMemBench: Benchmarking Long-Term Interactive Memory in Large Language ModelsEverMemBench: Benchmarking Long-Term Interactive Memory in Large Language Models

author.name: Chuanrui Hu, Tong Li, Xingze Gao, Hongda Chen, Dannong Xu, Yi Bai, Tianwei Lin, Xinda Zhao, Xiaohong Li, Jiaqi An, Yunyun Han, Jian Pei, Yafeng Deng

entry.summary: Introduces EverMemBench, a benchmark for long-term conversational memory spanning 1M+ tokens with multi-party, multi-group conversations. Reveals critical limitations: multi-hop reasoning collapses to 26%.

entry.title: When Domains Interact: Asymmetric and Order-Sensitive Cross-Domain Effects in Reinforcement Learning for Reasoning

author.name: Wang Yang, Shouren Wang, Chaoda Song, Chuang Ma, Xinpeng Li, Nengbo Wang, Kaixiong Zhou, Vipin Chaudhary, Xiaotian Han

entry.summary: First systematic analysis of training-order effects in GRPO finding highly asymmetric cross-domain transfer: other domains improve math by 25% but yield negligible transfer to logic/puzzle tasks.

entry.title: The Multiple Ticket Hypothesis: Random Sparse Subnetworks Suffice for RLVR

author.name: Israel Adewuyi, Solomon Okibe, Vladmir Ivanov

entry.summary: Shows training only 1% of randomly selected parameters matches or exceeds full-parameter RLVR fine-tuning. Different random masks with minimal overlap all succeed, suggesting multiple tickets.

entry.title: From Perception to Action: Spatial AI Agents and World Models

author.name: Gloria Felicia, Nolan Bryant, Handi Putra, Ayaan Gazali, Eliel Lobo, Esteban Rojas

entry.summary: Comprehensive survey of 742 papers introducing a unified three-axis taxonomy connecting agentic capabilities with spatial intelligence, bridging the gap between LLM-based reasoning and embodied physical world understanding.

entry.title: ReasonCACHE: Teaching LLMs To Reason Without Weight Updates

author.name: Sharut Gupta, Phillip Isola, Stefanie Jegelka, David Lopez-Paz, Kartik Ahuja, Mark Ibrahim, Mohammad Pezeshki

entry.summary: ReasonCACHE shows LLMs can learn to reason without weight updates through in-context learning using Prefix Tuning to bypass context window limitations, achieving performance competitive with in-weight learning.

entry.title: Poly-attention: a general scheme for higher-order self-attention

author.name: Sayak Chakrabarti, Toniann Pitassi, Josh Alman

entry.summary: Poly-attention defines vast class of generalizations of self-attention that can model higher-order token interactions beyond pairwise, with mechanisms that maintain near-quadratic running time.

entry.title: Beyond What Seems Necessary: Hidden Gains from Scaling Training-Time Reasoning Length under Outcome Supervision

author.name: Yihao Xue, Allan Zhang, Jianhao Huang, Amit Sahai, Baharan Mirzasoleiman

entry.summary: Discovers that out-of-distribution performance continues improving as training-time reasoning length increases even after in-distribution performance saturates. Provides both theoretical analysis and experiments on RL fine-tuning and looped transformers.

entry.title: LRAgent: Efficient KV Cache Sharing for Multi-LoRA LLM Agents

author.name: Hyesung Jeon, Hyeongju Ha, Jae-Joon Kim

entry.summary: Proposes LRAgent for KV cache sharing in multi-LoRA agent systems, decomposing cache into shared base components and lightweight adapter deltas. Reduces redundant computation across agents sharing backbone.

entry.title: Phase Transitions for Feature Learning in Neural Networks

author.name: Andrea Montanari, Zihao Wang

entry.summary: Studies phase transitions in neural network feature learning under proportional asymptotics, characterizing when networks recover latent space in multi-index models as function of sample complexity and width.

entry.title: Predicting and improving test-time scaling laws via reward tail-guided search

author.name: Muheng Li, Jian Qian, Wenlong Mou

entry.summary: Proposes tail-guided search for predicting and improving LLM test-time scaling laws by estimating reward distribution tails. Enables predicting scaling without exhaustive evaluation and optimal budget allocation.

entry.title: Optimal Sample Complexity for Single Time-Scale Actor-Critic with Momentum

author.name: Navdeep Kumar, Tehila Dahan, Lior Cohen, Ananyabrata Barua, Giorgia Ramponi, Kfir Yehuda Levy, Shie Mannor

entry.summary: Establishes optimal O(ε^-2) sample complexity for single-timescale actor-critic algorithms, improving from prior O(ε^-3) bounds. Uses STORM variance reduction combined with a sample buffer to handle nonstationarity from evolving policies.

entry.title: Alignment-Aware Model Adaptation via Feedback-Guided Optimization

author.name: Gaurav Bhatt, Aditya Chinchure, Jiawei Zhou, Leonid Sigal

entry.summary: Proposes alignment-aware fine-tuning framework integrating external alignment signals through policy-gradient regularization with adaptive gating to balance task and alignment objectives.

entry.title: SLIME: Stabilized Likelihood Implicit Margin Enforcement for Preference Optimization

author.name: Maksim Afanasyev, Illarion Iov

entry.summary: SLIME addresses the objective mismatch in direct preference optimization where optimizing margins can degrade the likelihood of preferred responses ('unlearning') and cause 'formatting collapse'. Proposes stabilized likelihood implicit margin enforcement.

entry.title: Harmful Overfitting in Sobolev Spaces

author.name: Kedar Karhadkar, Alexander Sietsema, Deanna Needell, Guido Montufar

entry.summary: Shows that norm-minimizing interpolators in Sobolev spaces exhibit harmful overfitting - generalization error stays positive even as n→∞. Contrasts with benign overfitting results for RKHS.

entry.title: Restoring Exploration after Post-Training: Latent Exploration Decoding for Large Reasoning Models

author.name: Wenhui Tan, Fiorenzo Parascandolo, Enver Sangineto, Jianzhong Ju, Zhenbo Luo, Qian Cao, Rita Cucchiara, Ruihua Song, Jian Luan

entry.summary: Proposes Latent Exploration Decoding (LED) addressing exploration collapse in post-trained Large Reasoning Models. Shows RL post-training reduces output entropy while intermediate layers retain high entropy.

entry.title: APR: Penalizing Structural Redundancy in Large Reasoning Models via Anchor-based Process Rewards

author.name: Kaiyan Chang, Chenwei Zhu, Yingfeng Luo, Yifu Huo, Chenglong Wang, Xiaoqian Liu, Qiaozhi He, Tong Xiao, Zhengtao Yu, Jingbo Zhu

entry.summary: Identifies 'Reasoning Anchor' where answers first stabilize and 'Answer-Stable Tail' of redundant verification in LRMs. Proposes Anchor-based Process Rewards to penalize structural redundancy.

entry.title: PretrainRL: Alleviating Factuality Hallucination of Large Language Models at the Beginning

author.name: Langming Liu, Kangtao Lv, Haibin Chen, Weidong Zhang, Yejing Wang, Shilei Liu, Xin Tong, Yujin Yuan, Yongwei Wang, Wenbo Su, Bo Zheng

entry.summary: PretrainRL integrates reinforcement learning directly into pretraining to address hallucination at its root—imbalanced data distribution causing 'low-probability truth' and 'high-probability falsehood'. Uses debiasing-then-learning principle to consolidate factual knowledge.

entry.title: FSVideo: Fast Speed Video Diffusion Model in a Highly-Compressed Latent Space

author.name: FSVideo Team, Qingyu Chen, Zhiyuan Fang, Haibin Huang, Xinwei Huang, Tong Jin, Minxuan Lin, Bo Liu, Celong Liu, Chongyang Ma, Xing Mei, Xiaohui Shen, Yaojie Shen, Fuwen Tan, Angtian Wang, Xiao Yang, Yiding Yang, Jiamin Yuan, Lingxi Zhang, Yuxin Zhang

entry.summary: Introduces FSVideo, a fast transformer-based I2V diffusion framework with 64x64x4 compression ratio video autoencoder and 14B DIT models achieving competitive quality at order of magnitude faster speed.

entry.title: What LLMs Think When You Don't Tell Them What to Think About?

author.name: Yongchan Kwon, James Zou

entry.summary: Studies what LLMs generate from minimal topic-neutral inputs, finding systematic topical preferences across model families: GPT-OSS generates programming/math, Llama generates literary content, DeepSeek generates religious content.

entry.title: Emergent Analogical Reasoning in Transformers

author.name: Gouki Minegishi, Jingyuan Feng, Hiroki Furuta, Takeshi Kojima, Yusuke Iwasawa, Yutaka Matsuo

entry.summary: Formalizes analogical reasoning inspired by category theory functors, introducing synthetic tasks to evaluate emergence conditions. Finds emergence is sensitive to data, optimization, and scale.

entry.title: Light Alignment Improves LLM Safety via Model Self-Reflection with a Single Neuron

author.name: Sicheng Shen, Mingyang Lv, Han Shen, Jialin Wu, Binghao Wang, Zhou Yang, Guobin Shen, Dongcheng Zhao, Feifei Zhao, Yi Zeng

entry.summary: Proposes lightweight safety alignment using single neuron as gating mechanism for safety-aware decoding, requiring only low-cost expert model training while maintaining generation usability.

entry.title: Fast Forward: Accelerating LLM Prefill with Predictive FFN Sparsity

author.name: Aayush Gautam, Mukul Gagrani, Junyoung Park, Mingu Lee, Chiris Lott, Narasimha Reddy

entry.summary: FastForward accelerates LLM prefill through predictive FFN sparsity with lightweight expert predictor, error compensation network, and locality-aware parallelism achieving 2x+ speedup on long contexts.

entry.title: Decouple Searching from Training: Scaling Data Mixing via Model Merging for Large Language Model Pre-training

author.name: Shengrui Li, Fei Zhao, Kaiyan Zhao, Jieying Ye, Haifeng Liu, Fangcheng Shi, Zheyong Xie, Yao Hu, Shaosheng Cao

entry.summary: Proposes DeMix, a framework that decouples data mixture search from training by using model merging to predict optimal data ratios. Trains component models separately and derives mixtures via weighted merging.

entry.title: Toward Universal and Transferable Jailbreak Attacks on Vision-Language Models

author.name: Kaiyuan Cui, Yige Li, Yutao Wu, Xingjun Ma, Sarah Erfani, Christopher Leckie, Hanxun Huang

entry.summary: Proposes UltraBreak for universal and transferable jailbreak attacks on VLMs, constraining adversarial patterns through vision-space transformations while relaxing textual targets through semantic objectives.

entry.title: The Gradient-Causal Gap: Why Gradient Importance Fails on Complex Tasks

author.name: Donald Ye

entry.summary: Demonstrates gradient-causal gap in transformers: gradient magnitude poorly predicts causal importance on complex tasks, sometimes inversely. Pruning experiments reveal 'Hidden Heroes' with low gradients.

entry.title: Softmax Linear Attention: Reclaiming Global Competition

author.name: Mingwei Xu, Xuan Lin, Xinnan Guo, Wanqing Xu, Wanyun Cui

entry.summary: Softmax Linear Attention (SLA) restores global competition in linear attention by lifting softmax from token to head level, using attention heads as semantic slots with competitive gating for subspace selection.

entry.title: Internal Flow Signatures for Self-Checking and Refinement in LLMs

author.name: Sungheon Jeong, Sanggeon Yun, Ryozo Masukawa, Wenjun Haung, Hanning Chen, Mohsen Imani

entry.summary: Introduces internal flow signatures that audit LLM decision formation from depthwise dynamics, providing bias-centered monitoring to detect unfaithful generations without external verification.

entry.title: Co-RedTeam: Orchestrated Security Discovery and Exploitation with LLM Agents

author.name: Pengfei He, Ash Fox, Lesly Miculicich, Stefan Friedli, Daniel Fabian, Burak Gokturk, Jiliang Tang, Chen-Yu Lee, Tomas Pfister, Long T. Le

entry.summary: Proposes Co-RedTeam, multi-agent framework for automated vulnerability discovery and exploitation integrating security knowledge, code-aware analysis, execution-grounded reasoning, and long-term memory.

entry.title: Emergence of Distortions in High-Dimensional Guided Diffusion Models

author.name: Enrico Ventura, Beatrice Achilli, Luca Ambrogioni, Carlo Lucibello

entry.summary: Formalizes generative distortion in classifier-free guidance as mismatch between CFG-induced and true conditional distributions. Uses statistical physics to characterize phase transition in distortion onset.

entry.title: Attention Sink Forges Native MoE in Attention Layers: Sink-Aware Training to Address Head Collapse

author.name: Zizhuo Fu, Wenxuan Zeng, Runsheng Wang, Meng Li

entry.summary: Analyzes attention sink phenomenon in LLMs, showing it naturally creates MoE structure within attention layers. Explains head collapse and proposes sink-aware training to address it. References GPT-OSS and Qwen3-Next mechanisms.

entry.title: ASTER: Agentic Scaling with Tool-integrated Extended Reasoning

author.name: Xuqin Zhang, Quan He, Zhenrui Zheng, Zongzhang Zhang, Xu He, Dong Li

entry.summary: Proposes ASTER for scaling tool-integrated reasoning via RL, addressing interaction collapse where models degenerate into heavy internal reasoning. Studies how cold-start SFT and interaction density affect outcomes.

entry.title: Persuasion Propagation in LLM Agents

author.name: Hyejun Jeong, Amir Houmansadr, Shlomo Zilberstein, Eugene Bagdasarian

entry.summary: Studies persuasion propagation in LLM agents - how belief-level interventions influence task behavior in coding and web research. Finds belief-prefilled agents conduct more biased searches than on-the-fly persuasion.

entry.title: Capabilities and Fundamental Limits of Latent Chain-of-Thought

author.name: Jiaxuan Zou, Yaozhong Xiong, Yong Liu

entry.summary: Characterizes fundamental Exploration-Execution Trade-off in latent CoT, proving high certainty enables execution but inhibits exploration. Introduces Symbolic Index quantifying decisional commitment.

entry.title: A State-Transition Framework for Efficient LLM Reasoning

author.name: Liang Zhang, Yu Zhao, Longyue Wang, Tianqi Shi, Weihua Luo, Kaifu Zhang, Jinsong Su

entry.summary: Proposes modeling LLM reasoning as a state-transition process using linear attention to track reasoning state, enabling efficient long Chain-of-Thought without sequence compression. Aims to maintain reasoning capacity while improving efficiency.

entry.title: Do I Really Know? Learning Factual Self-Verification for Hallucination Reduction

author.name: Enes Altinisik, Masoomali Fatehkia, Fatih Deniz, Nadir Durrani, Majd Hawasly, Mohammad Raza, Husrev Taha Sencar

entry.summary: VeriFY teaches LLMs factual self-verification through consistency-based reasoning, augmenting training with verification traces guiding models to generate answers, probing queries, consistency judgments, and abstention decisions.

entry.title: MentisOculi: Revealing the Limits of Reasoning with Mental Imagery

author.name: Jana Zeller, Thadd\"aus Wiedemer, Fanfei Li, Thomas Klein, Prasanna Mayilvahanan, Matthias Bethge, Felix Wichmann, Ryan Cotterell, Wieland Brendel

entry.summary: MentisOculi evaluates visual mental imagery for reasoning in unified multimodal models, finding visual strategies from latent tokens to explicit imagery generally fail to improve reasoning.

entry.title: Text is All You Need for Vision-Language Model Jailbreaking

author.name: Yihang Chen, Zhao Xu, Youyuan Jiang, Tianle Zheng, Cho-Jui Hsieh

entry.summary: Text-DJ jailbreaks VLMs by exploiting OCR capability, decomposing harmful queries into benign sub-queries mixed with distraction queries presented as text in images.

entry.title: Bypassing Prompt Injection Detectors through Evasive Injections

author.name: Md Jahedur Rahman, Ihsen Alouani

entry.summary: Evaluates robustness of linear probe-based task drift detectors against adversarially optimized suffixes. Shows single suffixes can achieve 93-99% attack success rates against prompt injection detectors.

entry.title: How Does Unfaithful Reasoning Emerge from Autoregressive Training? A Study of Synthetic Experiments

author.name: Fuxin Wang, Amr Alazali, Yiqiao Zhong

entry.summary: Studies unfaithful CoT reasoning emergence through synthetic experiments training transformers on modular arithmetic. Finds faithful reasoning requires low training noise, with small noise increases causing collapse to unfaithful shortcuts.

entry.title: Superposition unifies power-law training dynamics

author.name: Zixin Jessie Chen, Hao Chen, Yizhou Liu, Jeff Gore

entry.summary: Discovers that superposition bottlenecks in neural networks induce a universal power-law training exponent of ~1, independent of data statistics, representing up to 10x acceleration over sequential learning.

entry.title: Semantic-aware Wasserstein Policy Regularization for Large Language Model Alignment

author.name: Byeonghu Na, Hyungho Na, Yeongmin Kim, Suhyeon Jo, HeeSun Bae, Mina Kang, Il-Chul Moon

entry.summary: Proposes Wasserstein Policy Regularization (WPR) for RLHF that uses entropy-regularized Wasserstein distance to incorporate token space geometry, addressing KL divergence's inability to capture semantic similarity.

entry.title: On the Limits of Layer Pruning for Generative Reasoning in LLMs

author.name: Safal Shrestha, Anubhav Shrestha, Aadim Nepal, Minwu Kim, Keith Ross

entry.summary: Studies layer pruning limits for generative reasoning in LLMs, finding multi-step reasoning is particularly sensitive to depth reduction with degradation in arithmetic and code generation capabilities.

entry.title: SimpleGPT: Improving GPT via A Simple Normalization Strategy

author.name: Marco Chen, Xianbiao Qi, Yelin He, Jiaquan Ye, Rong Xiao

entry.summary: Proposes SimpleNorm for GPT training, a normalization strategy that stabilizes activation scales and reduces Hessian spectral norm, enabling larger learning rates. Validates on models from 1B to 8B parameters.

entry.title: Grounding Generated Videos in Feasible Plans via World Models

author.name: Christos Ziakas, Amir Bar, Alessandra Russo

entry.summary: Proposes GVP-WM to ground video-generated plans from large video models into feasible action sequences using learned action-conditioned world models via video-guided latent collocation.

entry.title: Dissecting Outlier Dynamics in LLM NVFP4 Pretraining

author.name: Peijie Dong, Ruibo Fan, Yuechen Tao, Di Mou, Wenhu Hu, Zhenheng Tang, Yinghao Yu, Jiamang Wang, Wenbo Su, Guodong Yang, Liping Zhang, Xiaowen Chu, Baochun Li, Bo Li

entry.summary: Conducts longitudinal analysis of outlier dynamics during LLM NVFP4 pretraining, identifying architectural sources (Softmax, gating) and comparing Linear vs Softmax attention.

entry.title: Safety-Efficacy Trade Off: Robustness against Data-Poisoning

author.name: Diego Granziol

entry.summary: Shows backdoor attacks achieve high success while evading detection due to fundamental geometric mechanism. Proves clustered poisons induce rank-one spike with near-clone regime making attacks undetectable.

entry.title: Making Bias Non-Predictive: Training Robust LLM Judges via Reinforcement Learning

author.name: Qian Wang, Xuandong Zhao, Zirui Zhang, Zhanzhi Lou, Nuo Chen, Dawn Song, Bingsheng He

entry.summary: Proposes Epistemic Independence Training (EIT) to make LLM judges robust to cognitive biases via RL where bias cues are made non-predictive of reward through balanced conflict strategy.

entry.title: Sparse Reward Subsystem in Large Language Models

author.name: Guowei Xu, Mert Yuksekgonul, James Zou

entry.summary: Identifies a sparse reward subsystem in LLMs containing 'value neurons' representing state value expectations and 'dopamine neurons' encoding prediction errors, drawing analogy to biological reward systems.

entry.title: Steering Vector Fields for Context-Aware Inference-Time Control in Large Language Models

author.name: Jiaqian Li, Yanshu Li, Kuan-Hao Huang

entry.summary: Proposes Steering Vector Fields for context-aware inference-time control, learning locally effective steering directions that vary with activation position rather than using static global vectors.

entry.title: Seeing Is Believing? A Benchmark for Multimodal Large Language Models on Visual Illusions and Anomalies

author.name: Wenjin Hou, Wei Liu, Han Hu, Xiaoxiao Sun, Serena Yeung-Levy, Hehe Fan

entry.summary: Presents VIA-Bench, a benchmark for evaluating MLLMs on visual illusions and anomalies across six categories. Reveals that current models achieving human-level performance on standard benchmarks fail on these edge cases.

entry.title: Do Latent-CoT Models Think Step-by-Step? A Mechanistic Study on Sequential Reasoning Tasks

author.name: Jia Liang, Liangming Pan

entry.summary: Mechanistically studies CODI latent CoT model using probes, attention analysis, and activation patching on sequential tasks. Finds intermediate states are formed and fused at end-of-thought boundary, but longer reasoning chains fail.

entry.title: Reasoning and Tool-use Compete in Agentic RL:From Quantifying Interference to Disentangled Tuning

author.name: Yu Li, Mingyang Yi, Xiuyu Li, Ju Fan, Fuxin Jiang, Binbin Chen, Peng Li, Jie Song, Tieying Zhang

entry.summary: Introduces LEAS framework showing reasoning and tool-use capabilities interfere during joint agentic RL training. Proposes disentangled tuning approach based on quantitative analysis of interference patterns.

entry.title: PersistBench: When Should Long-Term Memories Be Forgotten by LLMs?

author.name: Sidharth Pulipaka, Oliver Chen, Manas Sharma, Taaha S Bajwa, Vyas Raina, Ivaxi Sheth

entry.summary: Introduces PersistBench measuring safety risks from persistent long-term memories in conversational AI, identifying cross-domain leakage and memory-induced sycophancy. Evaluates 18 models finding surprisingly high failure rates.

entry.title: Not All Preferences Are Created Equal: Stability-Aware and Gradient-Efficient Alignment for Reasoning Models

author.name: Hui Wu, Hengyi Cai, Jinman Zhao, Xinran Chen, Ziheng Li, Zhejun Zhao, Shuaiqiang Wang, Yuchen Li, Dawei Yin

entry.summary: Proposes SAGE (Stability-Aware Gradient Efficiency), a dynamic framework for preference-based alignment that addresses inefficient training on trivial pairs and noise from uncertain samples by maximizing signal-to-noise ratio of policy updates.

entry.title: Evolving from Tool User to Creator via Training-Free Experience Reuse in Multimodal Reasoning

author.name: Xintian Shen, Jiawei Chen, Lihao Zheng, Hao Ma, Tao Wei, Kun Zhan

entry.summary: UCT transforms agents from tool users to tool creators by harvesting problem-solving capabilities from reasoning traces to generate reusable tools without training.

entry.title: Reasoning in a Combinatorial and Constrained World: Benchmarking LLMs on Natural-Language Combinatorial Optimization

author.name: Xia Jiang, Jing Chen, Cong Zhang, Jie Gao, Chengpeng Hu, Chenhao Zhang, Yaoxin Wu, Yingqian Zhang

entry.summary: NLCO benchmark evaluates LLMs on end-to-end combinatorial optimization reasoning from natural language, covering 43 problems with taxonomy of variable types, constraint families, and objective classes.

entry.title: Avenir-Web: Human-Experience-Imitating Multimodal Web Agents with Mixture of Grounding Experts

author.name: Aiden Yiliu Li, Xinyue Hao, Shilong Liu, Mengdi Wang

entry.summary: Introduces Avenir-Web, a web agent achieving new open-source SOTA on Online-Mind2Web benchmark through Mixture of Grounding Experts, experience-imitation planning, and task-tracking checklists. Addresses key limitations in autonomous web agents including element grounding and long-horizon task execution.

entry.title: LSSF: Safety Alignment for Large Language Models through Low-Rank Safety Subspace Fusion

author.name: Guanghao Zhou, Panjia Qiu, Cen Chen, Hongyu Li, Mingyuan Chu, Xin Zhang, Jun Zhou

entry.summary: Introduces LSSF for LLM safety re-alignment using low-rank projection to extract principal components of safety vectors, enabling efficient safety restoration after fine-tuning without full retraining.

entry.title: CARE-RFT: Confidence-Anchored Reinforcement Finetuning for Reliable Reasoning in Large Language Models

author.name: Shuozhe Li, Jincheng Cao, Bodun Hu, Aryan Mokhtari, Leqi Liu, Amy Zhang

entry.summary: Proposes CARE-RFT using skew reverse KL divergence for reinforcement finetuning, providing confidence-sensitive penalty that preserves trustworthiness while enabling reasoning gains.

entry.title: The Illusion of Forgetting: Attack Unlearned Diffusion via Initial Latent Variable Optimization

author.name: Manyi Li, Yufan Liu, Lai Jiang, Bing Li, Yuming Li, Weiming Hu

entry.summary: Demonstrates that diffusion model unlearning is largely illusory - NSFW concepts remain as 'dormant memories'. Proposes IVO attack that reactivates forgotten content by reconstructing broken linguistic mappings.

entry.title: Detecting AI-Generated Content in Academic Peer Reviews

author.name: Siyuan Shen, Kai Wang

entry.summary: Detects AI-generated content in academic peer reviews, finding ~20% of ICLR reviews and ~12% of Nature Communications reviews classified as AI-generated in 2025, with substantial growth post-2022.

entry.title: Physiology as Language: Translating Respiration to Sleep EEG

author.name: Kaiwen Zha, Chao Li, Hao He, Peng Cao, Tianhong Li, Ali Mirzazadeh, Ellen Zhang, Jong Woo Lee, Yoon Kim, Dina Katabi

entry.summary: Introduces a novel task of synthesizing sleep EEG signals from respiration data using a waveform-conditional generative framework. Trained on 28,000+ individuals, achieves 7% MAE in EEG spectrogram reconstruction with downstream task performance comparable to real EEG.

entry.title: JTok: On Token Embedding as another Axis of Scaling Law via Joint Token Self-modulation

author.name: Yebin Yang, Huaijin Wu, Fu Guo, Lin Yao, Xiaohan Qin, Jingzhi Wang, Debing Zhang, Junchi Yan

entry.summary: Proposes token-indexed parameters as a novel scaling axis orthogonal to dense dimensions and MoE, decoupling model capacity from FLOPs. JTok augments Transformers with modulation vectors retrieved from auxiliary embedding tables.

entry.title: Statistical MIA: Rethinking Membership Inference Attack for Reliable Unlearning Auditing

author.name: Jialong Sun, Zeming Wei, Jiaxuan Zou, Jiacheng Gong, Guanheng Wang, Chengyang Dong, Jialong Li, Bo Liu

entry.summary: Demonstrates that membership inference attack-based auditing for machine unlearning is flawed—failed detection doesn't imply true forgetting. Proposes reformulation as statistical hypothesis testing.

entry.title: Toward Cognitive Supersensing in Multimodal Large Language Model

author.name: Boyi Li, Yifan Shen, Yuanzhe Liu, Yifan Xu, Jiateng Liu, Xinzhuo Li, Zhengyuan Li, Jingyuan Zhu, Yunhan Zhong, Fangzhou Lan, Jianguo Cao, James M. Rehg, Heng Ji, Ismini Lourentzou, Xu Cao

entry.summary: Introduces Cognitive Supersensing training paradigm endowing MLLMs with visual imagery capabilities via Latent Visual Imagery Prediction head, enabling mental visualization during reasoning.

entry.title: HuPER: A Human-Inspired Framework for Phonetic Perception

author.name: Chenxu Guo, Jiachen Lian, Yisi Liu, Baihe Huang, Shriyaa Narayanan, Cheol Jun Cho, Gopala Anumanchipalli

entry.summary: HuPER models phonetic perception as adaptive inference over acoustic-phonetics and linguistic knowledge, achieving SOTA error rates on English benchmarks with only 100 hours of training and strong zero-shot transfer to 95 languages. Open-sourced.

entry.title: Fast Autoregressive Video Diffusion and World Models with Temporal Cache Compression and Sparse Attention

author.name: Dvir Samuel, Issar Tzachor, Matan Levy, Micahel Green, Gal Chechik, Rami Ben-Ari

entry.summary: Identifies three sources of redundancy in autoregressive video diffusion (duplicate keys, slowly evolving queries, sparse prompt attention) and proposes temporal cache compression and sparse attention for efficiency.

entry.title: Spectral Superposition: A Theory of Feature Geometry

author.name: Georgi Ivanov, Narmeen Oozeer, Shivam Raval, Tasana Pejovic, Shriyash Upadhyay, Amir Abdullah

entry.summary: Develops theory for studying geometric structure of features in superposition by analyzing spectra of weight-derived matrices, introducing frame operator for global geometry analysis beyond pairwise interactions.

entry.title: Why Steering Works: Toward a Unified View of Language Model Parameter Dynamics

author.name: Ziwen Xu, Chenyan Wu, Hengyu Sun, Haiwen Hong, Mengru Wang, Yunzhi Yao, Longtao Huang, Hui Xue, Shumin Deng, Zhixuan Chu, Huajun Chen, Ningyu Zhang

entry.summary: Unified framework showing that local weight fine-tuning, LoRA, and activation interventions can all be understood as dynamic weight updates from control signals, with preference-utility analysis on shared log-odds scale.

entry.title: David vs. Goliath: Verifiable Agent-to-Agent Jailbreaking via Reinforcement Learning

author.name: Samuel Nellessen, Tal Kachman

entry.summary: Slingshot RL framework discovers agent-to-agent jailbreaking attacks where tool-less adversary exploits trusted agent's tool privileges, revealing attacks converge to short instruction-like patterns.

entry.title: Flow Policy Gradients for Robot Control

author.name: Brent Yi, Hongsuk Choi, Himanshu Gaurav Singh, Xiaoyu Huang, Takara E. Truong, Carmelo Sferrazza, Yi Ma, Rocky Duan, Pieter Abbeel, Guanya Shi, Karen Liu, Angjoo Kanazawa

entry.summary: Shows flow matching policy gradients can effectively train expressive robot policies without requiring differentiable action likelihoods, demonstrating sim-to-real transfer on two humanoid robots.

entry.title: Why LoRA Resists Label Noise: A Theoretical Framework for Noise-Robust Parameter-Efficient Fine-Tuning

author.name: Brady Steele

entry.summary: Provides theoretical framework explaining LoRA's inherent resistance to label noise. Proves rank-r LoRA cannot memorize arbitrary labels beyond O(r(d+k-r)) samples, derives optimal rank balancing bias-variance tradeoff, and shows temporal separation of clean vs noise learning.

entry.title: A Fragile Guardrail: Diffusion LLM's Safety Blessing and Its Failure Mode

author.name: Zeyuan He, Yupeng Chen, Lang Lin, Yihan Wang, Shenxu Chang, Eric Sommerlade, Philip Torr, Junchi Yu, Adel Bibi, Jialin Yu

entry.summary: Analyzes diffusion LLMs' intrinsic safety properties, finding stepwise reduction effect suppressing unsafe generations. Identifies 'context nesting' failure mode where harmful requests embedded in structured benign content bypass safety.

entry.title: Provably Protecting Fine-Tuned LLMs from Training Data Extraction

author.name: Tom Segal, Asaf Shabtai, Yuval Elovici

entry.summary: Proposes SCP-Δr, an algorithm to protect fine-tuned LLMs from training data extraction attacks with formal privacy guarantees (Near Access Freeness). The key insight is that only a small subset of token-level probability shifts are important for utility, allowing aggressive smoothing of low-impact tokens.

entry.title: Dynamic Expert Sharing: Decoupling Memory from Parallelism in Mixture-of-Experts Diffusion LLMs

author.name: Hao Mark Chen, Zhiwen Mo, Royson Lee, Qianzhou Wang, Da Li, Shell Xu Hu, Wayne Luk, Timothy Hospedales, Hongxiang Fan

entry.summary: Proposes Dynamic Expert Sharing (DES) for MoE diffusion LLMs, addressing expert explosion where parallel decoding activates too many experts. Shifts from token-centric to sequence-level expert optimization.

entry.title: On the Spectral Flattening of Quantized Embeddings

author.name: Junlin Huang, Wenyi Fang, Zhenheng Tang, Yuxin Wang, Xueze Kang, Yang Zheng, Bo Li, Xiaowen Chu

entry.summary: Proves that power-law decay in embedding singular value spectra is fundamental for semantic encoding, and that uniform quantization causes spectral flattening that truncates this tail. Provides theoretical bounds on stable rank increase.

entry.title: Self-Generative Adversarial Fine-Tuning for Large Language Models

author.name: Shiguang Wu, Yaqing Wang, Quanming Yao

entry.summary: Proposes SGALM, a self-generative adversarial framework for LLM fine-tuning that formulates alignment as a min-max game within a single LLM, jointly evolving generation and discrimination without external rewards.

entry.title: PolySAE: Modeling Feature Interactions in Sparse Autoencoders via Polynomial Decoding

author.name: Panagiotis Koromilas, Andreas D. Demou, James Oldfield, Yannis Panagakis, Mihalis Nicolaou

entry.summary: Proposes PolySAE extending sparse autoencoders with polynomial decoder terms to model feature interactions, enabling decomposition of compound concepts rather than monolithic features.

entry.title: Your Self-Play Algorithm is Secretly an Adversarial Imitator: Understanding LLM Self-Play through the Lens of Imitation Learning

author.name: Shangzhe Li, Xuchao Zhang, Chetan Bansal, Weitong Zhang

entry.summary: Connects self-play fine-tuning with adversarial imitation learning, showing LLM self-play is a min-max game between model and implicit reward player. Proves convergence to equilibrium.

entry.title: When Is Rank-1 Enough? Geometry-Guided Initialization for Parameter-Efficient Fine-Tuning

author.name: Haoran Zhao, Soyeon Caren Han, Eduard Hovy

entry.summary: Investigates why rank-1 LoRA is unstable, discovering that pretrained vision and text features form mismatched anisotropic regions with a dominant 'gap' direction that hijacks early gradients. Proposes geometry-aware initialization to address this.

entry.title: Self-Rewarding Sequential Monte Carlo for Masked Diffusion Language Models

author.name: Ziwei Luo, Ziqi Jin, Lei Wang, Lidong Bing, Thomas B. Sch\"on

entry.summary: Presents self-rewarding SMC for masked diffusion language models that launches parallel diffusion processes with trajectory-level confidence as self-reward, addressing diversity collapse from greedy decoding.

entry.title: Efficient Swap Regret Minimization in Combinatorial Bandits

author.name: Andreas Kontogiannis, Vasilis Pollatos, Panayotis Mertikopoulos, Ioannis Panageas

entry.summary: Designs efficient no-swap regret algorithm for combinatorial bandits with polylogarithmic dependence on exponentially large action space N, resolving long-standing challenge.

entry.title: ECHO-2: A Large Scale Distributed Rollout Framework for Cost-efficient Reinforcement Learning

author.name: Jie Xiao, Meng Chen, Qingnan Ren, Song Jingwei, Jiaqi Huang, Yangshen Deng, Chris Tong, Wanyi Chen, Suli Wang, Ziqian Bi, Shuo Lu, Yiqun Duan, Lynn Ai, Eric Yang, Bill Shi

entry.summary: Presents ECHO-2, distributed RL framework for LLM post-training with remote inference workers, treating bounded policy staleness as tunable parameter to enable overlap of rollout, dissemination, and training.

entry.title: MEG-XL: Data-Efficient Brain-to-Text via Long-Context Pre-Training

author.name: Dulhan Jayalath, Oiwi Parker Jones

entry.summary: MEG-XL is a brain-to-text model pre-trained with 2.5 minutes of MEG context (5-300x longer than prior work). Matches supervised performance with a fraction of data (1hr vs 50hrs) and outperforms brain foundation models.

entry.title: Trust in One Round: Confidence Estimation for Large Language Models via Structural Signals

author.name: Pengyue Yang, Jiawen Wen, Haolin Jin, Linghan Huang, Huaming Chen, Ling Chen

entry.summary: Introduces Structural Confidence, a single-pass method for estimating LLM output reliability using hidden-state trajectory analysis. Combines spectral, local-variation, and global shape descriptors from final-layer representations without multiple inference passes.

entry.title: Zero2Text: Zero-Training Cross-Domain Inversion Attacks on Textual Embeddings

author.name: Doohyun Kim, Donghwa Kang, Kyungjae Lee, Hyeongboo Baek, Brent Byunghoon Kang

entry.summary: Introduces Zero2Text, training-free framework for embedding inversion attacks on RAG systems via recursive online alignment. Demonstrates privacy risks of vector databases.

entry.title: Think Dense, Not Long: Dynamic Decoupled Conditional Advantage for Efficient Reasoning

author.name: Keqin Peng, Yuanxin Ouyang, Xuebo Liu, Zhiliang Tian, Ruijian Han, Yancheng Yuan, Liang Ding

entry.summary: Proposes Dynamic Decoupled Conditional Advantage (DDCA) addressing verbose reasoning traces in RLVR by decoupling efficiency from correctness optimization with difficulty-adaptive penalties.

entry.title: Segment-Level Attribution for Selective Learning of Long Reasoning Traces

author.name: Siyuan Wang, Yanchen Liu, Xiang Ren

entry.summary: Uses integrated gradient attribution to identify meaningful segments in long reasoning traces, defining attribution strength and direction consistency metrics. Enables selective learning to avoid imitating verbose uninformative patterns.

entry.title: On the Power of (Approximate) Reward Models for Inference-Time Scaling

author.name: Youheng Zhu, Yiping Lu

entry.summary: Provides theoretical analysis of why approximate reward models work for inference-time scaling, introducing formal notion of information utility for SMC-based reasoning.

entry.title: Out of the Memory Barrier: A Highly Memory Efficient Training System for LLMs with Million-Token Contexts

author.name: Wenhao Li, Daohai Yu, Gen Luo, Yuxin Zhang, Fei Chao, Rongrong Ji, Yifan Wu, Jiaxin Liu, Ziyang Gong, Zimu Liao

entry.summary: OOMB training system enables million-token context training with O(1) activation memory through chunk-recurrent training with on-the-fly recomputation, paged memory management, and asynchronous CPU offloading.

entry.title: Towards Interpretable Hallucination Analysis and Mitigation in LVLMs via Contrastive Neuron Steering

author.name: Guangtao Lyu, Xinyi Cheng, Qi Liu, Chenghao Xu, Jiexi Yan, Muli Yang, Fen Fang, Cheng Deng

entry.summary: Uses sparse autoencoders to decompose visual embeddings in LVLMs into interpretable neurons, identifying always-on and image-specific neurons to understand and mitigate hallucinations via contrastive neuron steering.

entry.title: Omni-Judge: Can Omni-LLMs Serve as Human-Aligned Judges for Text-Conditioned Audio-Video Generation?

author.name: Susan Liang, Chao Huang, Filippos Bellos, Yolo Yunlong Tang, Qianxiang Shen, Jing Bi, Luchuan Song, Zeliang Zhang, Jason Corso, Chenliang Xu

entry.summary: Presents Omni-Judge benchmark to evaluate whether omni-modal LLMs can serve as human-aligned judges for text-conditioned audio-video generation. Addresses evaluation gap for tri-modal outputs from models like Sora 2 and Veo 3.

entry.title: Q Cache: Visual Attention is Valuable in Less than Half of Decode Layers for Multimodal Large Language Model

author.name: Jiedong Zhuang, Lu Lu, Ming Dai, Rui Hu, Jian Chen, Qiang Liu, Haoji Hu

entry.summary: Reveals that visual attention in MLLMs is only valuable in less than half of decode layers, proposing Q Cache to eliminate redundant visual KV cache computations.

entry.title: Inject Once Survive Later: Backdooring Vision-Language-Action Models to Persist Through Downstream Fine-tuning

author.name: Jianyi Zhou, Yujie Wei, Ruichen Zhen, Bo Zhao, Xiaobo Xia, Rui Shao, Xiu Su, Shuo Yang

entry.summary: Introduces INFUSE for injecting backdoors into VLA models that persist through downstream fine-tuning, demonstrating security vulnerabilities in embodied AI systems.

entry.title: Cross-Layer Transcoders are incentivized to learn Unfaithful Circuits

author.name: Georg Lange

entry.summary: Demonstrates that cross-layer transcoders (CLTs) can learn unfaithful circuits by rewriting deep multi-hop circuits into shallow single-hop approximations. Shows sparsity penalties incentivize this unfaithfulness, with preliminary evidence in real language models.

entry.title: Reasoning with Autoregressive-Diffusion Collaborative Thoughts

author.name: Mu Yuan, Liekang Zeng, Guoliang Xing, Lan Zhang, Yunhao Liu

entry.summary: Collaborative Thoughts unifies autoregressive and diffusion models for reasoning, where autoregressive models handle structured planning while diffusion models provide spatial grounding through closed-loop interaction.

entry.title: ProcMEM: Learning Reusable Procedural Memory from Experience via Non-Parametric PPO for LLM Agents

author.name: Qirui Mi, Zhijian Ma, Mengyue Yang, Haoxuan Li, Yisen Wang, Haifeng Zhang, Jun Wang

entry.summary: ProcMEM enables agents to learn procedural memory from interactions via Non-Parametric PPO, transforming episodic narratives into executable Skills with activation, execution, and termination conditions.

entry.title: Hunt Instead of Wait: Evaluating Deep Data Research on Large Language Models

author.name: Wei Liu, Peijie Yu, Michele Orini, Yali Du, Yulan He

entry.summary: DDR-Bench introduces Deep Data Research task where LLMs autonomously extract key insights from databases without explicit queries, evaluating investigatory rather than executional intelligence.

entry.title: Evolving Interpretable Constitutions for Multi-Agent Simulation

author.name: Ujwal Kumar, Alice Saito, Hershraj Niranjani, Rayan Yessou, Phan Xuan Tan

entry.summary: Presents Constitutional Evolution framework for discovering behavioral norms in multi-agent LLM systems through grid-world simulation. Shows designed constitutions fail while genetic evolution discovers stable rules achieving 87.1% reduction in agent death.

entry.title: Continuous-Utility Direct Preference Optimization

author.name: Muhammad Ahmed Mohsin, Muhammad Umer, Ahsan Bilal, Zihao He, Muhammad Usman Rafique, Asad Aali, Muhammad Ali Jamshed, John M. Cioffi, Emily Fox

entry.summary: Introduces CU-DPO replacing binary preference labels with continuous scores capturing fine-grained reasoning quality. Proves K strategies yield Θ(K log K) sample complexity improvement over binary preferences.

entry.title: Multi-LLM Adaptive Conformal Inference for Reliable LLM Responses

author.name: Kangjun Noh, Seongchan Lee, Ilmun Kim, Kyungwoo Song

entry.summary: Proposes MACI, using multi-LLM ensembles with conformal inference to provide distribution-free factuality guarantees while maintaining higher claim retention than conservative baselines.

entry.title: Beyond Mode Elicitation: Diversity-Preserving Reinforcement Learning via Latent Diffusion Reasoner

author.name: Haoqiang Kang, Yizhe Zhang, Nikki Lijing Kuang, Yi-An Ma, Lianhui Qin

entry.summary: LaDi-RL conducts RL exploration in continuous latent space via guided diffusion to prevent diversity collapse in LLM reasoning, preserving multiple solution modes without mutual suppression.

entry.title: Beyond Precision: Training-Inference Mismatch is an Optimization Problem and Simple LR Scheduling Fixes It

author.name: Yaxiang Zhang, Yingru Li, Jiacai Liu, Jiawei Xu, Ziniu Li, Qian Liu, Haoyuan Li

entry.summary: Analyzes RL instability for LLM training through optimization lens, showing training-inference mismatch escalates with training progress and can be suppressed by learning rate scheduling.

entry.title: Self-Consolidation for Self-Evolving Agents

author.name: Hongzhuo Yu, Fei Zhu, Guo-Sen Xie, Ling Shao

entry.summary: Proposes Self-Consolidation for agents to learn from both successful and failed trajectories, distilling experiences into model parameters to avoid context exhaustion and retrieval noise.

entry.title: Alignment of Diffusion Model and Flow Matching for Text-to-Image Generation

author.name: Yidong Ouyang, Liyan Xie, Hongyuan Zha, Guang Cheng

entry.summary: Novel alignment framework for diffusion models by sampling from reward-weighted distributions. Decomposes score into pre-trained and reward gradient components, avoiding expensive fine-tuning.

entry.title: ConPress: Learning Efficient Reasoning from Multi-Question Contextual Pressure

author.name: Jie Deng, Shining Liang, Jun Li, Hongzhi Li, Yutao Xie

entry.summary: Discovers Self-Compression phenomenon where LRMs spontaneously produce shorter reasoning when multiple questions are in one prompt. Proposes ConPress fine-tuning to induce efficient reasoning.

entry.title: Unified Personalized Reward Model for Vision Generation

author.name: Yibin Wang, Yuhang Zang, Feng Han, Jiazi Bu, Yujie Zhou, Cheng Jin, Jiaqi Wang

entry.summary: Proposes UnifiedReward-Flex, a unified personalized reward model for visual generation that adapts to content-specific and user-dependent preferences rather than assuming monolithic preferences.

entry.title: World Models as an Intermediary between Agents and the Real World

author.name: Sherry Yang

entry.summary: Position paper by Sherry Yang arguing world models should serve as intermediary between agents and real world to reduce cost of acquiring reward signals. Discusses applications to robotics, ML engineering, and scientific experiments.

entry.title: Multi-Head Attention Is a Multi-Player Game

author.name: Kushal Chakrabarti, Nirmal Balachundar

entry.summary: Formalizes multi-head attention as implicit multi-player game where heads compete and coordinate. Proves Price of Anarchy bounds excess hallucination and redundancy, unifying two failure modes.

entry.title: Hard Constraints Meet Soft Generation: Guaranteed Feasibility for LLM-based Combinatorial Optimization

author.name: Yang Liu, Chuan Zhou, Yancheng Chen, Shuai Zhang, Xixun Lin, Xiaoqing Wang

entry.summary: Introduces FALCON ensuring 100% feasibility for LLM combinatorial optimization through grammar-constrained decoding, repair layer, and adaptive sampling. Uses BOPO training weighting preferences by objective value.

entry.title: Predictive Scheduling for Efficient Inference-Time Reasoning in Large Language Models

author.name: Katrina Brown, Aneesh Muppidi, Rana Shahout

entry.summary: Introduces Predictive Scheduling to dynamically allocate token budgets across queries based on predicted difficulty before generation, using lightweight predictors on hidden states or fine-tuned classifiers.

entry.title: Beyond Dense States: Elevating Sparse Transcoders to Active Operators for Latent Reasoning

author.name: Yadong Wang, Haodong Chen, Yu Tian, Chuanxing Geng, Dong Liang, Xiang Chen

entry.summary: LSTR elevates sparse transcoders from post-hoc analysis to active reasoning operators, performing multi-step computation through sparse semantic transitions with Latent Transition Transcoder architecture.

entry.title: Edit Knowledge, Not Just Facts via Multi-Step Reasoning over Background Stories

author.name: Ya Gao, Kalle Kujanp\"a\"a, Pekka Marttinen, Harri Valpola, Alexander Ilin
