entry.summary: Proposes MoR for federated alignment of heterogeneous vision-language models using GRPO with Mixture-of-Rewards. Enables privacy-preserving alignment across clients with different architectures by replacing parameter sharing with preference sharing.

entry.title: Supervised sparse auto-encoders as unconstrained feature models for semantic composition

author.name: Ouns El Harzli, Hugo Wallner, Yoonsoo Nam, Haixuan Xavier Tao

entry.summary: Adapts unconstrained feature models from neural collapse theory for supervised sparse autoencoders on Stable Diffusion 3.5. Demonstrates compositional generalization to unseen concept combinations.

entry.title: AutoHealth: An Uncertainty-Aware Multi-Agent System for Autonomous Health Data Modeling

author.name: Tong Xia, Weibin Li, Gang Liu, Yong Li

entry.summary: Proposes AutoHealth, uncertainty-aware multi-agent system for autonomous health data modeling with five specialized agents. Addresses heterogeneous modality handling and task-specific adaptation with reliability estimation.

entry.title: Addressing Explainability of Generative AI using SMILE (Statistical Model-agnostic Interpretability with Local Explanations)

author.name: Zeinab Dehghani

entry.summary: Extends the SMILE interpretability method to generative models (gSMILE), using controlled perturbations and Wasserstein distance to explain how prompt components influence LLM outputs.

entry.title: Efficient Cross-Architecture Knowledge Transfer for Large-Scale Online User Response Prediction

author.name: Yucheng Wu, Yuekui Yang, Hongzheng Li, Anan Liu, Jian Xiao, Junjie Zhai, Huan Yu, Shaoping Ma, Leye Wang

entry.summary: CrossAdapt enables efficient cross-architecture knowledge transfer for user response prediction through dimension-adaptive embedding projections and asymmetric co-distillation, reducing model switching costs.

entry.title: SIDiffAgent: Self-Improving Diffusion Agent

author.name: Shivank Garg, Ayush Singh, Gaurav Kumar Nayak

entry.summary: SIDiffAgent is training-free agentic framework for text-to-image diffusion using Qwen model family to address prompt sensitivity, semantic ambiguity, and generation artifacts.

entry.title: Reinforcement Learning via Conservative Agent for Environments with Random Delays

author.name: Jongsoo Lee, Jangwon Kim, Jiseok Jeong, Soohee Han

entry.summary: Proposes a 'conservative agent' that reformulates random-delay environments into constant-delay equivalents, enabling existing constant-delay RL methods to work with random delays without modification.

entry.title: PPoGA: Predictive Plan-on-Graph with Action for Knowledge Graph Question Answering

author.name: MinGyu Jeon, SuWan Cho, JaeYoung Shu

entry.summary: Introduces PPoGA for knowledge graph QA with a Planner-Executor architecture and predictive processing mechanism to enable self-correction when initial reasoning plans are flawed.

entry.title: OGD4All: A Framework for Accessible Interaction with Geospatial Open Government Data Based on Large Language Models

author.name: Michael Siebenmann (Professorship of Computational Social Science, ETH Zurich), Javier Argota S\'anchez-Vaquerizo (Professorship of Computational Social Science, ETH Zurich), Stefan Arisona (Esri R&D Center Zurich), Krystian Samp (Esri R&D Center Zurich), Luis Gisler (Esri R&D Center Zurich), Dirk Helbing (Professorship of Computational Social Science, ETH Zurich, Complexity Science Hub, Vienna)

entry.summary: Presents OGD4All, an LLM framework for citizen interaction with geospatial open government data achieving 98% analytical correctness and 94% recall while rejecting unsupported questions to minimize hallucinations.

entry.title: Early Warning Signals Appear Long Before Dropping Out: An Idiographic Approach Grounded in Complex Dynamic Systems Theory

author.name: Mohammed Saqr, Sonsoles L\'opez-Pernas, Santtu Tikka, Markus Wolfgang Hermann Spitzer

entry.summary: Tests whether early warning signals from critical slowing down theory can predict student disengagement before dropout, analyzing 1.67M practice attempts from 9,401 students using digital math learning.

entry.title: Standards for trustworthy AI in the European Union: technical rationale, structural challenges, and an implementation path

author.name: Piercosma Bisconti, Marcello Galisai

entry.summary: White paper examining technical foundations of EU AI standardization under AI Act, proposing layered approach with horizontal standards for process obligations and sectoral profiles for domain-specific thresholds.

entry.title: SPARC-RAG: Adaptive Sequential-Parallel Scaling with Context Management for Retrieval-Augmented Generation

author.name: Yuxin Yang, Gangda Deng, \"Omer Faruk Akg\"ul, Nima Chitsazan, Yash Govilkar, Akasha Tigalappanavara, Shi-Xiong Zhang, Sambit Sahu, Viktor Prasanna

entry.summary: Introduces SPARC-RAG for multi-hop QA with unified context management across sequential and parallel scaling. Addresses context contamination and scaling inefficiency in naive RAG approaches.

entry.title: ECCO: Evidence-Driven Causal Reasoning for Compiler Optimization

author.name: Haolin Pan, Lianghong Huang, Jinyuan Dong, Mingjie Xing, Yanjun Wu

entry.summary: Introduces ECCO for compiler auto-tuning using LLMs with chain-of-thought dataset mapping code features to performance evidence, enabling causal reasoning rather than pattern matching.

entry.title: Autonomous Multi-Agent AI for High-Throughput Polymer Informatics: From Property Prediction to Generative Design Across Synthetic and Bio-Polymers

author.name: Mahule Roy, Adib Bazgir, Arthur da Silva Sousa Santos, Yuwen Zhang

entry.summary: Presents autonomous multi-agent AI ecosystem for polymer discovery unifying workflows, AI, and computational modeling within single pipeline using DeepSeek models for property prediction and generative design.

entry.title: R3G: A Reasoning--Retrieval--Reranking Framework for Vision-Centric Answer Generation

author.name: Zhuohong Chen, Zhengxian Wu, Zirui Liao, Shenao Jiang, Hangrui Xu, Yang Chen, Chaokui Su, Xiaoyu Liu, Haoqian Wang

entry.summary: Proposes R3G framework for vision-centric VQA with reasoning plan, two-stage retrieval, and sufficiency-aware reranking, achieving SOTA on MRAG-Bench across multiple MLLM backbones.

entry.title: Why Are AI Agent Involved Pull Requests (Fix-Related) Remain Unmerged? An Empirical Study

author.name: Khairul Alam, Saikat Mondal, Banani Roy

entry.summary: Empirical study analyzing 8,106 fix-related pull requests from AI coding agents, examining integration outcomes and factors preventing successful merging. Provides insights into practical AI agent effectiveness.

entry.title: EigenAI: Deterministic Inference, Verifiable Results

author.name: David Ribeiro Alves, Vishnu Patankar, Matheus Pereira, Jamie Stephens, Nima Vaziri, Sreeram Kannan

entry.summary: EigenAI combines deterministic LLM inference with cryptoeconomically secured optimistic re-execution protocol on EigenLayer, enabling verifiable and auditable AI inference through TEE re-computation.

entry.title: TABES: Trajectory-Aware Backward-on-Entropy Steering for Masked Diffusion Models

author.name: Shreshth Saini, Avinab Saha, Balu Adsumilli, Neil Birkbeck, Yilin Wang, Alan C. Bovik

entry.summary: TABES proposes Backward-on-Entropy Steering for masked diffusion models, using gradient-guided inference to approximate infinite-horizon lookahead via single backward pass.

entry.title: A Conditional Companion: Lived Experiences of People with Mental Health Disorders Using LLMs

author.name: Aditya Kumar Purohit, Hendrik Heuer

entry.summary: Qualitative study of 20 UK participants with mental health conditions using LLMs for support, finding conditional engagement patterns including immediacy, non-judgment, and cognitive reframing alongside clear boundaries.

entry.title: Contrastive Domain Generalization for Cross-Instrument Molecular Identification in Mass Spectrometry

author.name: Seunghyun Yoo, Sanghong Kim, Namkyung Yoon, Hwangnam Kim

entry.summary: Proposes a cross-modal alignment framework for identifying molecules from mass spectrometry data by mapping spectra into a pretrained chemical language model's embedding space. Achieves 42.2% Top-1 accuracy on scaffold-disjoint zero-shot retrieval.

entry.title: MoDEx: Mixture of Depth-specific Experts for Multivariate Long-term Time Series Forecasting

author.name: Hyekyung Yoon, Minhyuk Lee, Imseung Park, Myungjoo Kang

entry.summary: Introduces layer sensitivity metric for analyzing backbone layer behavior in time series forecasting, revealing depth-specific specialization. Proposes MoDEx, a Mixture of Depth-specific Experts architecture motivated by these findings.

entry.title: Don't Forget Its Variance! The Minimum Path Variance Principle for Accurate and Stable Score-Based Density Ratio Estimation

author.name: Wei Chen, Jiacheng Li, Shigui Li, Zhiqi Lin, Junmei Yang, John Paisley, Delu Zeng

entry.summary: Resolves path-dependence paradox in score-based density ratio estimation by deriving closed-form expression for path variance. Proposes MinPV principle for principled path selection.

entry.title: FinEvo: From Isolated Backtests to Ecological Market Games for Multi-Agent Financial Strategy Evolution

author.name: Mingxi Zou, Jiaxiang Chen, Aotian Luo, Jingyi Dai, Chi Zhang, Dongning Sun, Zenglin Xu

entry.summary: Introduces FinEvo, an ecological game framework for studying evolutionary dynamics of multi-agent financial strategies including ML, RL, and LLM traders interacting in a shared market.

entry.title: OLion: Approaching the Hadamard Ideal by Intersecting Spectral and $\ell_{\infty}$ Implicit Biases

author.name: Zixiao Wang, Yifei Shen, Huishuai Zhang

entry.summary: Introduces OLion optimizer combining spectral control from orthogonalized updates with coordinate control from sign updates, approximating steps over Hadamard-like constraint sets.

entry.title: The Gaussian-Head OFL Family: One-Shot Federated Learning from Client Global Statistics

author.name: Fabio Turazza, Marco Picone, Marco Mamei

entry.summary: Introduces Gaussian-Head OFL family for one-shot federated learning using client global statistics, eliminating need for public datasets or homogeneous models.

entry.title: Sample Efficient Active Algorithms for Offline Reinforcement Learning

author.name: Soumyadeep Roy, Shashwat Kushwaha, Ambedkar Dukkipati

entry.summary: Develops theoretical sample-complexity analysis of Active Reinforcement Learning using Gaussian Process uncertainty modeling, deriving bounds via information-gain analysis.

entry.title: Beyond Pixels: Visual Metaphor Transfer via Schema-Driven Agentic Reasoning

author.name: Yu Xu, Yuxin Zhang, Juan Cao, Lin Gao, Chunyu Wang, Oliver Deussen, Tong-Yee Lee, Fan Tang

entry.summary: Introduces Visual Metaphor Transfer task and proposes multi-agent framework that decouples creative essence from reference images and re-materializes abstract logic onto target subjects.

entry.title: OpInf-LLM: Parametric PDE Solving with LLMs via Operator Inference

author.name: Zhuoyuan Wang, Hanjiang Hu, Xiyu Deng, Saviz Mowlavi, Yorie Nakahira

entry.summary: Proposes OpInf-LLM, using LLMs with operator inference for parametric PDE solving, addressing execution success vs accuracy tradeoff in LLM-based scientific computing.

entry.title: MarkCleaner: High-Fidelity Watermark Removal via Imperceptible Micro-Geometric Perturbation

author.name: Xiaoxi Kong, Jieyu Yuan, Pengdi Chen, Yuanlin Zhang, Chongyi Li, Bin Li

entry.summary: Shows semantic watermarks don't survive micro-geometric perturbations that break phase alignment. Proposes MarkCleaner watermark removal framework trained with micro-geometry-perturbed supervision.

entry.title: Toward Enhancing Representation Learning in Federated Multi-Task Settings

author.name: Mehdi Setayesh, Mahdi Beitollahi, Yasser H. Khalil, Hongliang Li

entry.summary: Introduces Muscle loss, a contrastive learning objective for federated multi-task learning that simultaneously aligns representations from all participating models rather than pairwise alignment, enabling heterogeneous model architectures.

entry.title: Efficient Adversarial Attacks on High-dimensional Offline Bandits

author.name: Seyed Mohammad Hadi Hosseini, Amir Najafi, Mahdieh Soleymani Baghshah

entry.summary: Studies adversarial robustness of offline bandit evaluation when attackers perturb the reward model rather than training data, showing vulnerability of methods used for evaluating LLMs and image models.

entry.title: Counting Hypothesis: Potential Mechanism of In-Context Learning

author.name: Jung H. Lee, Sujith Vijayan

entry.summary: Proposes the counting hypothesis for in-context learning: LLMs use counting mechanisms to track input-label patterns, explaining ICL capabilities through functional module analysis.

entry.title: The Verification Crisis: Expert Perceptions of GenAI Disinformation and the Case for Reproducible Provenance

author.name: Alexander Loth, Martin Kappes, Marc-Oliver Pahl

entry.summary: Expert survey (N=21) reveals that while deepfake video has immediate shock value, large-scale text generation poses systemic risks of 'epistemic fragmentation' and 'synthetic consensus,' with skepticism about technical detection effectiveness.

entry.title: CAM: A Causality-based Analysis Framework for Multi-Agent Code Generation Systems

author.name: Lyu Zongyi, Ji Zhenlan, Chen Songqiang, Wang Liwen, Huang Yuheng, Wang Shuai, Cheung Shing-Chi

entry.summary: CAM provides the first causality-based analysis framework for multi-agent code generation systems, quantifying the contribution of different intermediate outputs to system correctness through systematic error simulation.

entry.title: ECHO: Entropy-Confidence Hybrid Optimization for Test-Time Reinforcement Learning

author.name: Chu Zhao, Enneng Yang, Yuting Liu, Jianzhe Zhao, Guibing Guo

entry.summary: ECHO addresses test-time RL challenges by preventing rollout collapse at high-entropy branches and avoiding premature policy sharpening from noisy early pseudo-labels through entropy-confidence hybrid optimization.

entry.title: Hierarchical Adaptive Eviction for KV Cache Management in Multimodal Language Models

author.name: Xindian Ma, Yidi Lu, Peng Zhang, Jing Zhang

entry.summary: HAE optimizes KV cache management in multimodal LLMs through hierarchical eviction that accounts for different attention patterns between visual and text tokens, using dual-attention pruning and dynamic decoding strategy.

entry.title: Backpropagation as Physical Relaxation: Exact Gradients in Finite Time

author.name: Antonino Emanuele Scurria

entry.summary: Proves backpropagation emerges exactly as finite-time relaxation of a physical dynamical system through Lagrangian theory, with unit-step Euler discretization recovering standard backprop.

entry.title: Decoupling Generalizability and Membership Privacy Risks in Neural Networks

author.name: Xingli Fang, Jung-Eun Kim

entry.summary: Privacy-Preserving Training Principle (PPTP) identifies that generalization and privacy risks exist in different network regions, enabling protection of vulnerable components while maintaining generalizability.

entry.title: A Large-Scale Dataset for Molecular Structure-Language Description via a Rule-Regularized Method

author.name: Feiyang Cai, Guijuan He, Yi Hu, Jingjing Wang, Joshua Luo, Tianyu Zhu, Srikanth Pilla, Gang Li, Ling Liu, Feng Luo

entry.summary: Automated framework for generating precise molecular structure descriptions at scale by extending rule-based chemical nomenclature parser to create XML metadata guiding LLM description generation.

entry.title: ReasonEdit: Editing Vision-Language Models using Human Reasoning

author.name: Jiaxing Qiu, Kaihua Hou, Roxana Daneshjou, Ahmed Alaa, Thomas Hartvigsen

entry.summary: ReasonEdit enables VLM editing using human reasoning explanations through topology-balanced multimodal embedding codebook that stores and retrieves relevant reasoning facts during inference.

entry.title: UniReason 1.0: A Unified Reasoning Framework for World Knowledge Aligned Image Generation and Editing

author.name: Dianyi Wang, Chaofan Ma, Feng Han, Size Wu, Wei Song, Yibin Wang, Zhixiong Zhang, Tianhang Wang, Siyuan Wang, Zhongyu Wei, Jiaqi Wang

entry.summary: UniReason unifies text-to-image generation and image editing through dual reasoning paradigm: generation as world knowledge-enhanced planning and editing for fine-grained visual refinement.

entry.title: Extending Beacon to Hindi: Cultural Adaptation Drives Cross-Lingual Sycophancy

author.name: Sarthak Sattigeri

entry.summary: Extends sycophancy diagnostic to Hindi through three conditions (English, literal translation, cultural adaptation), finding sycophancy rates consistently higher for culturally adapted prompts across all models.

entry.title: Monte Carlo Tree Search for Execution-Guided Program Repair with Large Language Models

author.name: Yixuan Liang

entry.summary: Presents CodePilot, integrating MCTS with LLMs for execution-guided program repair. Performs hierarchical fault localization, explores patch trajectories with MCTS, and uses execution feedback as reward signal. Evaluated on SWE-bench Lite.

entry.title: FedMOA: Federated GRPO for Personalized Reasoning LLMs under Heterogeneous Rewards

author.name: Ziyao Wang, Daeun Jung, Yexiao He, Guoheng Sun, Zheyu Shen, Myungjin Lee, Ang Li

entry.summary: Proposes FedMOA extending GRPO to federated setting for personalized reasoning LLMs. Addresses heterogeneous reward definitions, imbalanced multi-objective optimization, and high training costs in federated RLHF.

entry.title: One Loss to Rule Them All: Marked Time-to-Event for Structured EHR Foundation Models

author.name: Zilin Jing, Vincent Jeanselme, Yuta Kobayashi, Simon A. Lee, Chao Pang, Aparajita Kashyap, Yanwei Li, Xinzhuo Jiang, Shalmali Joshi

entry.summary: Proposes ORA, a marked time-to-event pretraining objective for EHR foundation models jointly modeling event timing and associated measurements. Outperforms next-token prediction across multiple architectures and tasks.

entry.title: Topology and Geometry of the Learning Space of ReLU Networks: Connectivity and Singularities

author.name: Marco Nurisso, Pierrick Leroy, Giovanni Petri, Francesco Vaccarino

entry.summary: Studies the topology and geometry of ReLU network parameter spaces, characterizing connectedness and singularities for general DAG architectures. Extends understanding of how bottleneck nodes and balance conditions affect parameter space structure.

entry.title: Sporadic Gradient Tracking over Directed Graphs: A Theoretical Perspective on Decentralized Federated Learning

author.name: Shahryar Zehtabi, Dong-Jun Han, Seyyedali Hosseinalipour, Christopher Brinton

entry.summary: Proposes Sporadic Gradient Tracking (Spod-GT), unifying gradient tracking for data heterogeneity with heterogeneous client availability in decentralized federated learning over directed graphs.

entry.title: Dynamic Prior Thompson Sampling for Cold-Start Exploration in Recommender Systems

author.name: Zhenyu Zhao, David Zhang, Ellie Zhao, Ehsan Saberian

entry.summary: Proposes Dynamic Prior Thompson Sampling for cold-start exploration in recommender systems, addressing the mismatch between uniform Beta(1,1) priors and actual low success rates of new items.

entry.title: Scalable Random Wavelet Features: Efficient Non-Stationary Kernel Approximation with Convergence Guarantees

author.name: Sawan Kumar, Souvik Chakraborty

entry.summary: Proposes Random Wavelet Features (RWF) for scalable non-stationary kernel approximation, using wavelet sampling for explicit feature maps that capture input-dependent patterns with convergence guarantees.

entry.title: Single-Edge Node Injection Threats to GNN-Based Security Monitoring in Industrial Graph Systems

author.name: Wenjie Liang, Ranhui Yan, Jia Cai, You-Gan Wang

entry.summary: Formulates Single-Edge Graph Injection Attack (SEGIA) for industrial GNN-based monitoring systems, where adversaries inject counterfeit nodes with minimal connections to bias decisions.

entry.title: Rethinking the Flow-Based Gradual Domain Adaption: A Semi-Dual Optimal Transport Perspective

author.name: Zhichao Chen, Zhan Zhuang, Yunfei Teng, Hao Wang, Fangyikang Wang, Zhengnan Li, Tianqiao Liu, Haoxuan Li, Zhouchen Lin

entry.summary: Proposes entropy-regularized semi-dual unbalanced optimal transport for gradual domain adaptation, addressing limitations of flow-based methods that rely on sample-based log-likelihood.

entry.title: From Intents to Actions: Agentic AI in Autonomous Networks

author.name: Burak Demirel, Pablo Soldati, Yu Wang

entry.summary: Introduces agentic AI system for intent-driven autonomous telecom networks with interpreter, radio resource allocation, and adaptation agents transforming high-level intents to control actions.

entry.title: Theoretical Analysis of Measure Consistency Regularization for Partially Observed Data

author.name: Yinsong Wang, Shahin Shahrampour

entry.summary: Provides theoretical analysis of measure consistency regularization for partially observed data, explaining when and how MCR improves generalization under missing features or modalities.

entry.title: Local Exponential Stability of Mean-Field Langevin Descent-Ascent in Wasserstein Space

author.name: Geuntaek Seo, Minseop Shin, Pierre Monmarch\'e, Beomjun Choi

entry.summary: Proves local exponential stability for mean-field Langevin descent-ascent dynamics in entropically regularized two-player zero-sum games. Answers an open question from COLT 2024 about convergence to Nash equilibrium.

entry.title: AdaptNC: Adaptive Nonconformity Scores for Uncertainty-Aware Autonomous Systems in Dynamic Environments

author.name: Renukanandan Tumu, Aditya Singh, Rahul Mangharam

entry.summary: Proposes AdaptNC framework for conformal prediction in autonomous systems that jointly adapts both the conformal threshold and nonconformity score function online, addressing distribution shifts in robotics deployments.

entry.title: Position: Beyond Model-Centric Prediction -- Agentic Time Series Forecasting

author.name: Mingyue Cheng, Xiaoyu Tao, Qi Liu, Ze Guo, Enhong Chen

entry.summary: Position paper proposing agentic time series forecasting (ATSF) paradigm that reframes forecasting as an agentic workflow with perception, planning, action, reflection, and memory components.

entry.title: Data- and Variance-dependent Regret Bounds for Online Tabular MDPs

author.name: Mingyi Li, Taira Tsuchiya, Kenji Yamanishi

entry.summary: Develops best-of-both-worlds algorithms for online episodic MDPs achieving refined data-dependent regret bounds in adversarial regime and variance-dependent bounds in stochastic regime.

entry.title: An Empirical Study of World Model Quantization

author.name: Zhongqian Fu, Tianyi Zhao, Kai Han, Hang Zhou, Xinghao Chen, Yunhe Wang

entry.summary: Systematic empirical study of post-training quantization for world models using DINO-WM, evaluating diverse PTQ methods under weight-only and joint settings across visual planning tasks.

entry.title: Generating Causal Temporal Interaction Graphs for Counterfactual Validation of Temporal Link Prediction

author.name: Aniq Ur Rahman, Justin P. Coon

entry.summary: Proposes framework for counterfactual validation of temporal link prediction models by generating causal temporal interaction graphs with known ground-truth causal structure.

entry.title: Trust Region Continual Learning as an Implicit Meta-Learner

author.name: Zekun Wang, Anant Gupta, Christopher J. MacLellan

entry.summary: Shows that trust region continual learning combining generative replay with Fisher-metric constraints admits a MAML-style interpretation with implicit inner steps. Unifies regularization and replay approaches.

entry.title: IntentCoding: Amplifying User Intent in Code Generation

author.name: Zheng Fang, Yihong Dong, Lili Mou, Dongming Jin, Zhi Jin, Ge Li

entry.summary: IntentCoding improves code generation by amplifying user intent influence on decoding. Shows model performance degrades with more constraints and proposes multi-strength enhancement strategy.

entry.title: Topological Residual Asymmetry for Bivariate Causal Direction

author.name: Mouad El Bouchattaoui

entry.summary: Topological Residual Asymmetry (TRA) uses persistent homology to infer causal direction by detecting bulk-tube contrast in regressor-residual clouds after copula standardization.

entry.title: Score-based Metropolis-Hastings for Fractional Langevin Algorithms

author.name: Ahmed Aloui, Junyi Liao, Ali Hasan, Jose Blanchet, Vahid Tarokh

entry.summary: MAFLA enables Metropolis-Hastings correction for fractional Langevin algorithms without density evaluation using score-based approach. Enables sampling from heavy-tailed distributions.

entry.title: Optimal Decision-Making Based on Prediction Sets

author.name: Tao Wang, Edgar Dobriban

entry.summary: Develops decision-theoretic framework for using conformal prediction sets in downstream decision-making, deriving minimax optimal policies and optimal prediction set construction. Introduces Risk-Optimal Conformal Prediction.

entry.title: PromptRL: Prompt Matters in RL for Flow-Based Image Generation

author.name: Fu-Yun Wang, Han Zhang, Michael Gharbi, Hongsheng Li, Taesung Park

entry.summary: Proposes PromptRL framework showing that prompt diversity matters in RL fine-tuning of flow matching models. Uses LLM as trainable prompt refinement agent to address sample inefficiency and prompt overfitting.

entry.title: Rethinking Multinomial Logistic Mixture of Experts with Sigmoid Gating Function

author.name: Tuan Minh Pham, Thinh Cao, Viet Nguyen, Huy Nguyen, Nhat Ho, Alessandro Rinaldo

entry.summary: Establishes theoretical benefits of sigmoid gating over softmax in MoE for classification, addressing convergence guarantees and temperature parameter effects.

entry.title: RAPT: Model-Predictive Out-of-Distribution Detection and Failure Diagnosis for Sim-to-Real Humanoid Robots

author.name: Humphrey Munn, Brendan Tidd, Peter Bohm, Marcus Gallagher, David Howard

entry.summary: Introduces RAPT, lightweight deployment-time monitor for humanoid robot control detecting OOD states and explaining failures. Self-supervised approach for 50Hz control with low false-positive rates.

entry.title: Grappa: Gradient-Only Communication for Scalable Graph Neural Network Training

author.name: Chongyang Xu, Christoph Siebenbrunner, Laurent Bindschaedler

entry.summary: Proposes Grappa for distributed GNN training with gradient-only communication, using periodic repartitioning and coverage-corrected aggregation to eliminate feature/activation transfers.

entry.title: Provably Data-driven Multiple Hyper-parameter Tuning with Structured Loss Function

author.name: Tung Quoc Le, Anh Tuan Nguyen, Viet Anh Nguyen

entry.summary: Establishes first general framework for multi-dimensional hyperparameter tuning generalization guarantees using semi-algebraic function analysis and real algebraic geometry tools.

entry.title: DecompressionLM: Deterministic, Diagnostic, and Zero-Shot Concept Graph Extraction from Language Models

author.name: Zhaochen Hong, Jiaxuan You

entry.summary: Proposes DecompressionLM, a framework for extracting concept graphs from LLMs without pre-specified queries using Van der Corput sequences with arithmetic decoding. Enables deterministic, parallel generation avoiding cross-sequence coupling.

entry.title: From Knowledge to Inference: Scaling Laws of Specialized Reasoning on GlobalHealthAtlas

author.name: Zhaokun Yan, Zhaohan Liu, Wuzheng Dong, Lijie Feng, Chengxiao Dai

entry.summary: Introduces GlobalHealthAtlas, a large-scale multilingual dataset of 280K instances across 15 public health domains and 17 languages with three difficulty levels. Proposes LLM-assisted construction and evaluation methodology.

entry.title: HyLRA: Hybrid Layer Reuse Attention for Efficient Long-Context Inference

author.name: Xuan Ai, Qingqing Yang, Peng Wang, Lei Deng, Lin Zhang, Renhai Chen, Gong Zhang

entry.summary: Introduces HyLRA, a hybrid attention framework using layer-wise sparsity profiling. Identifies dual characteristics: intra-layer sensitivity requiring full attention and opportunities for layer reuse.

entry.title: Large Language Models as Students Who Think Aloud: Overly Coherent, Verbose, and Confident

author.name: Conrad Borchers, Jill-J\^enn Vie, Roger Azevedo

entry.summary: Evaluates LLMs as student simulators for think-aloud protocols in tutoring, finding they are overly coherent, verbose, and confident compared to real human learners.

entry.title: Chronos: Learning Temporal Dynamics of Reasoning Chains for Test-Time Scaling

author.name: Kai Zhang, Jiayi Liao, Chengpeng Li, Ziyuan Xie, Sihang Li, Xiang Wang

entry.summary: Introduces Chronos, a lightweight chronological reasoning scorer that models trajectories as time series for test-time scaling. Uses weighted voting based on trajectory quality features.

entry.title: Rethinking Selective Knowledge Distillation

author.name: Almog Tavor, Itay Ebenspanger, Neil Cnaan, Mor Geva

entry.summary: Systematically studies selective knowledge distillation in LLMs, disentangling position, class, and sample axes. Introduces student-entropy-guided position selection (SE-KD) based on analysis.

entry.title: Read As Human: Compressing Context via Parallelizable Close Reading and Skimming

author.name: Jiwei Tang, Shilei Liu, Zhicheng Zhang, Qingsong Lv, Runsong Zhao, Tingwei Lu, Langming Liu, Haibin Chen, Yujin Yuan, Hai-Tao Zheng, Wenbo Su, Bo Zheng

entry.summary: RAM framework compresses long contexts by mimicking human reading strategies—fully retaining important segments while compressing less relevant ones into summary vectors. Enables parallel processing of context segments.

entry.title: Quantifying the Gap between Understanding and Generation within Unified Multimodal Models

author.name: Chenlong Wang, Yuhang Chen, Zhihan Hu, Dongping Chen, Wenhu Chen, Sarah Wiegreffe, Tianyi Zhou

entry.summary: GapEval benchmark quantifies the gap between understanding and generation in unified multimodal models by enabling bidirectional answering (image and text) for the same questions, measuring cross-modal consistency.

entry.title: AR-MAP: Are Autoregressive Large Language Models Implicit Teachers for Diffusion Large Language Models?

author.name: Liang Lin, Feng Xiong, Zengbin Wang, Kun Wang, Junhao Dong, Xuecai Hu, Yong Wang, Xiangxiang Chu

entry.summary: AR-MAP enables preference alignment of diffusion LLMs by using autoregressive LLMs as implicit teachers, transferring alignment knowledge through weight scaling while avoiding high-variance ELBO estimation.

entry.title: ReLAPSe: Reinforcement-Learning-trained Adversarial Prompt Search for Erased concepts in unlearned diffusion models

author.name: Ignacy Kolton, Kacper Marzol, Pawe{\l} Batorski, Marcin Mazur, Paul Swoboda, Przemys{\l}aw Spurek

entry.summary: ReLAPSe uses reinforcement learning to find adversarial prompts that restore erased concepts in unlearned diffusion models, providing red-teaming capability for machine unlearning.

entry.title: RGBX-R1: Visual Modality Chain-of-Thought Guided Reinforcement Learning for Multimodal Grounding

author.name: Jiahe Wu, Bing Cao, Qilong Wang, Qinghua Hu, Dongdong Li, Pengfei Zhu

entry.summary: RGBX-R1 extends MLLM perception to non-RGB modalities (infrared, depth, event) using Visual Modality Chain-of-Thought and two-stage training with reinforcement learning.

entry.title: A Hybrid Mamba-SAM Architecture for Efficient 3D Medical Image Segmentation

author.name: Mohammadreza Gholipour Shahraki, Mehdi Rezaeian, Mohammad Ghasemzadeh

entry.summary: Proposes Mamba-SAM, a hybrid architecture combining frozen SAM encoder with Mamba state space models for efficient 3D medical image segmentation with parameter-efficient adaptation strategies.

entry.title: Generating a Paracosm for Training-Free Zero-Shot Composed Image Retrieval

author.name: Tong Wang, Yunhan Zhao, Shu Kong

entry.summary: Proposes generating a 'paracosm' (imaginary parallel world) for zero-shot composed image retrieval using large multimodal models to generate synthetic images matching mental queries rather than textual descriptions.

entry.title: OCTOPUS: Enhancing the Spatial-Awareness of Vision SSMs with Multi-Dimensional Scans and Traversal Selection

author.name: Kunal Mahatha, Ali Bahri, Pierre Marza, Sahar Dastani, Maria Vakalopoulou, Stergios Christodoulidis, Jose Dolz, Christian Desrosiers

entry.summary: Introduces OCTOPUS architecture for Vision State Space Models with multi-dimensional scans to preserve both global context and local spatial structure while maintaining linear complexity.

entry.title: Robust Harmful Meme Detection under Missing Modalities via Shared Representation Learning

author.name: Felix Breiteneder, Mohammad Belal, Muhammad Saad Saeed, Shahed Masoudian, Usman Naseem, Kulshrestha Juhi, Markus Schedl, Shah Nawaz

entry.summary: First comprehensive study of harmful meme detection under missing modalities, proposing shared representation learning to maintain robustness when text is missing due to OCR failures.

entry.title: Stronger Semantic Encoders Can Harm Relighting Performance: Probing Visual Priors via Augmented Latent Intrinsics

author.name: Xiaoyan Xing, Xiao Zhang, Sezer Karaoglu, Theo Gevers, Anand Bhattad

entry.summary: Discovers that stronger semantic encoders can harm relighting performance, revealing trade-off between semantic abstraction and photometric fidelity. Proposes ALI to balance both.

entry.title: ReCALL: Recalibrating Capability Degradation for MLLM-based Composed Image Retrieval

author.name: Tianyu Yang, ChenWei He, Xiangzhao Hao, Tianyue Wang, Jiarui Guo, Haiyun Guo, Leigang Qu, Jinqiao Wang, Tat-Seng Chua

entry.summary: Introduces ReCALL framework addressing capability degradation when adapting generative MLLMs for composed image retrieval. Identifies paradigm conflict between generative and discriminative retrieval.

entry.title: ObjEmbed: Towards Universal Multimodal Object Embeddings

author.name: Shenghao Fu, Yukun Su, Fengyun Rao, Jing Lyu, Xiaohua Xie, Wei-Shi Zheng

entry.summary: Introduces ObjEmbed for universal multimodal object embeddings that decompose images into regional embeddings per object plus global embeddings, supporting grounding, local and global retrieval.

entry.title: FlowBypass: Rectified Flow Trajectory Bypass for Training-Free Image Editing

author.name: Menglin Han, Zhangkai Ni

entry.summary: Introduces FlowBypass, a training-free image editing framework using Rectified Flow that constructs a bypass between inversion and reconstruction trajectories to reduce error accumulation.

entry.title: MAIN-VLA: Modeling Abstraction of Intention and eNvironment for Vision-Language-Action Models

author.name: Zheyuan Zhou, Liang Du, Zixun Sun, Xiaoyu Zhou, Ruimin Ye, Qihao Chen, Yinda Chen, Lemiao Qiu

entry.summary: Introduces MAIN-VLA framework modeling abstraction of intention and environment for VLA models in complex dynamic environments like 3D open worlds and PvP games.

entry.title: Can Vision-Language Models Handle Long-Context Code? An Empirical Study on Visual Compression

author.name: Jianping Zhong, Guochang Li, Chen Zhi, Junxiao Han, Zhen Qin, Xinkui Zhao, Nan Wang, Shuiguang Deng, Jianwei Yin

entry.summary: Proposes LongCodeOCR, a visual compression framework that renders code as images for VLMs to handle long-context code, preserving dependency closure that text-based methods break.

entry.title: Agentic Reward Modeling: Verifying GUI Agent via Online Proactive Interaction

author.name: Chaoqun Cui, Jing Huang, Shijing Wang, Liming Zheng, Qingchao Kong, Zhixiong Zeng

entry.summary: Presents VAGEN, an agentic reward modeling framework where a verifier agent actively probes the environment to assess GUI agent task completion, moving beyond passive evaluation.

entry.title: UniMorphGrasp: Diffusion Model with Morphology-Awareness for Cross-Embodiment Dexterous Grasp Generation

author.name: Zhiyuan Wu, Xiangyu Zhang, Zhuo Chen, Jiankang Deng, Rolandos Alexandros Potamias, Shan Luo

entry.summary: Proposes UniMorphGrasp, a diffusion-based framework for cross-embodiment dexterous grasping that generalizes to unseen hand morphologies using canonical pose representation.

entry.title: UniForce: A Unified Latent Force Model for Robot Manipulation with Diverse Tactile Sensors

author.name: Zhuo Chen, Fei Ni, Kaiyao Luo, Zhiyuan Wu, Xuyang Zhang, Emmanouil Spyrakos-Papastavridis, Lorenzo Jamone, Nathan F. Lepora, Jiankang Deng, Shan Luo

entry.summary: Proposes UniForce, a unified tactile representation learning framework that learns shared latent force space across diverse tactile sensors.

entry.title: Three ways to make Claude’s constitution better

author.name: Parv Mahajan

entry.summary: Provides critique of Anthropic's new Claude constitution from AI safety researchers, recommending increased transparency about character training process, empirical data on behavioral changes, and evidence on corrigibility.

entry.title: Welcome to Moltbook

author.name: Zvi

entry.summary: Overview of Moltbook, a public social network for AI agents. Describes emergent behaviors, agent interactions, and the phenomenon's significance for understanding AI agent ecosystems.

entry.title: Exploring Information Seeking Agent Consolidation

author.name: Guochen Yan, Jialong Wu, Zhengwei Tao, Bo Li, Qintong Zhang, Jiahao Xu, Haitao Mi, Yuejian Fang, Qingni Shen, Wentao Zhang, Zhonghai Wu

entry.summary: Investigates consolidating heterogeneous information-seeking agents into unified models through data-level and parameter-level consolidation. Compares performance retention and cross-domain generalization.

entry.title: AdaFuse: Adaptive Multimodal Fusion for Lung Cancer Risk Prediction via Reinforcement Learning

author.name: Chongyu Qu, Zhengyi Lu, Yuxiang Lai, Thomas Z. Li, Junchao Zhu, Junlin Guo, Juming Xiong, Yanfan Zhu, Yuechen Yang, Allen J. Luna, Kim L. Sandler, Bennett A. Landman, Yuankai Huo

entry.summary: AdaFuse uses reinforcement learning to learn patient-specific modality selection and fusion strategies for lung cancer risk prediction, rather than processing all modalities equally.

entry.title: Pareto-Conditioned Diffusion Models for Offline Multi-Objective Optimization

author.name: Jatan Shrestha, Santeri Heiskanen, Kari Hepola, Severi Rissanen, Pekka J\"a\"askel\"ainen, Joni Pajarinen

entry.summary: Introduces Pareto-Conditioned Diffusion (PCD) for offline multi-objective optimization that conditions directly on desired trade-offs and uses reweighting strategies to explore the Pareto front.

entry.title: Towards Multiscale Graph-based Protein Learning with Geometric Secondary Structural Motifs

author.name: Shih-Hsin Wang, Yuhao Huang, Taos Transue, Justin Baker, Jonathan Forstater, Thomas Strohmer, Bao Wang

entry.summary: Proposes hierarchical graph-based learning for proteins with secondary structure motifs, constructing fine-grained subgraphs for motifs and coarse-grained graph connecting them spatially.

entry.title: Physics Informed Generative AI Enabling Labour Free Segmentation For Microscopy Analysis

author.name: Salma Zahran, Zhou Ao, Zhengyang Zhang, Chen Chi, Chenchen Yuan, Yanming Wang

entry.summary: Uses physics-informed generative AI to bridge simulation-to-reality gap for microscopy image segmentation, enabling label-free training by generating realistic textures from phase-field simulations.

entry.title: Mixture-of-Experts with Intermediate CTC Supervision for Accented Speech Recognition

author.name: Wonjun Lee, Hyounghun Kim, Gary Geunbae Lee

entry.summary: Moe-CTC uses Mixture-of-Experts with intermediate CTC supervision for accented speech recognition, transitioning from accent-aware routing during training to label-free routing at inference.

entry.title: Early warning prediction: Onsager-Machlup vs Schr\"{o}dinger

author.name: Xiaoai Xu, Yixuan Zhou, Xiang Zhou, Jingqiao Duan, Ting Gao

entry.summary: Proposes early-warning framework for critical transitions using manifold learning and stochastic differential equations. Defines Score Function indicator based on Onsager-Machlup and Schrödinger approaches.

entry.title: Reinforcement Learning-assisted Constraint Relaxation for Constrained Expensive Optimization

author.name: Qianhao Zhu, Sijie Ma, Zeyuan Ma, Hongshu Guo, Yue-Jiao Gong

entry.summary: Uses reinforcement learning to learn adaptive constraint relaxation policies for constrained expensive optimization, framing constraint handling as MDP.

entry.title: Edge-Native Generative De-identification: Inversion-Free Flow for Privacy-Preserving Federated Skin Image Analysis

author.name: Konstantinos Moutselos, Ilias Maglogiannis

entry.summary: Proposes edge-native framework for privacy-preserving federated learning in dermatology using inversion-free Rectified Flow Transformers for identity transformation on clinical edge devices.

entry.title: Exposing and Defending the Achilles' Heel of Video Mixture-of-Experts

author.name: Songping Wang, Qinglong Liu, Yueming Lyu, Ning Li, Ziwen He, Caifeng Shan

entry.summary: Proposes TLGA for adversarial attacks on video MoE models by targeting both routers and experts, revealing component-level vulnerabilities and proposing defense mechanisms.

entry.title: Learning More from Less: Unlocking Internal Representations for Benchmark Compression

author.name: Yueqi Zhang, Jin Hu, Shaoxiong Feng, Peiwen Yuan, Xinglin Wang, Yiwei Li, Jiayi Shi, Chuyi Tan, Ji Zhang, Boyuan Pan, Yao Hu, Kan Li

entry.summary: Introduces REPCORE for benchmark compression using internal LLM representations to select coreset items. Addresses statistical instability when few source models available for traditional methods.

entry.title: LingLanMiDian: Systematic Evaluation of LLMs on TCM Knowledge and Clinical Reasoning

author.name: Rui Hua, Yu Wei, Zixin Shu, Kai Chang, Dengying Yan, Jianan Xia, Zeyu Liu, Hui Zhu, Shujie Song, Mingzhong Xiao, Xiaodong Li, Dongmei Jia, Zhuye Gao, Yanyan Meng, Naixuan Zhao, Yu Fu, Haibin Yu, Benman Yu, Yuanyuan Chen, Fei Dong, Zhizhou Meng, Pengcheng Yang, Songxue Zhao, Lijuan Pei, Yunhui Hu, Kan Ding, Jiayuan Duan, Wenmao Yin, Yang Gu, Runshun Zhang, Qiang Zhu, Jian Yu, Jiansheng Li, Baoyan Liu, Wenjia Wang, Xuezhong Zhou

entry.summary: LingLanMiDian is large-scale expert-curated benchmark for Traditional Chinese Medicine evaluation across knowledge recall, multi-hop reasoning, information extraction, and clinical decision-making.

entry.title: Joint Continual Learning of Local Language Models and Cloud Offloading Decisions with Budget Constraints

author.name: Evan Chen, Wenzhi Fang, Shiqiang Wang, Christopher Brinton

entry.summary: DA-GRPO enables joint learning of local SLM task competence and cloud LLM offloading decisions under budget constraints, avoiding catastrophic forgetting during continual learning.

entry.title: Opportunistic Promptable Segmentation: Leveraging Routine Radiological Annotations to Guide 3D CT Lesion Segmentation

author.name: Samuel Church, Joshua D. Warner, Danyal Maqbool, Xin Tie, Junjie Hu, Meghan G. Lubner, Tyler J. Bradshaw

entry.summary: Proposes using sparse radiological annotations (line measurements, arrows) from routine clinical reads to generate 3D CT segmentations via promptable segmentation models.

entry.title: Sparse Shortcuts: Facilitating Efficient Fusion in Multimodal Large Language Models

author.name: Jingrui Zhang, Feng Liang, Yong Zhang, Wei Wang, Runhao Zeng, Xiping Hu

entry.summary: SparseCut enables efficient multimodal fusion in MLLMs by incorporating mid- and low-level visual features through sparse shortcuts, preserving semantic information typically discarded.

entry.title: Augmenting Clinical Decision-Making with an Interactive and Interpretable AI Copilot: A Real-World User Study with Clinicians in Nephrology and Obstetrics

author.name: Yinghao Zhu, Dehao Sui, Zixiang Wang, Xuning Hu, Lei Gu, Yifan Qi, Tianchen Wu, Ling Wang, Yuan Wei, Wen Tang, Zhihan Cui, Yasha Wang, Lequan Yu, Ewen M Harrison, Junyi Gao, Liantao Ma

entry.summary: Presents AICare, an interactive AI copilot for clinical decision-making with scrutable visualizations and LLM-driven recommendations. User study with 16 clinicians across nephrology and obstetrics shows reduced cognitive workload.

entry.title: Multi-Objective Multi-Fidelity Bayesian Optimization with Causal Priors

author.name: Md Abir Hossen, Mohammad Ali Javidian, Vignesh Narayanan, Jason M. O'Kane, Pooyan Jamshidi

entry.summary: Proposes RESCUE, a multi-objective multi-fidelity Bayesian optimization method incorporating causal calculus to handle poorly aligned low-fidelity proxies better than associational approaches.

entry.title: DeALOG: Decentralized Multi-Agents Log-Mediated Reasoning Framework

author.name: Abhijit Chakraborty, Ashish Raj Shekhar, Shiven Agarwal, Vivek Gupta

entry.summary: Introduces DeALOG, a decentralized multi-agent framework for multimodal QA where specialized agents communicate through a shared natural-language log enabling collaborative error detection without central control.

entry.title: Learning from Anonymized and Incomplete Tabular Data

author.name: Lucas Lange, Adrian B\"ottinger, Victor Christen, Anushka Vidanage, Peter Christen, Erhard Rahm

entry.summary: Proposes data transformation strategies for machine learning on datasets with mixed original, generalized, and missing values resulting from user-driven privacy controls.

entry.title: Understanding vision transformer robustness through the lens of out-of-distribution detection

author.name: Joey Kuang, Alexander Wong

entry.summary: Studies quantized vision transformer robustness through OOD detection lens, finding initial instabilities in 4-bit models and degradation patterns in ImageNet-22k trained models.

entry.title: Spectral Text Fusion: A Frequency-Aware Approach to Multimodal Time-Series Forecasting

author.name: Huu Hiep Nguyen, Minh Hoang Nguyen, Dung Nguyen, Hung Le

entry.summary: Proposes SpecTF for multimodal time series forecasting using spectral decomposition to align textual context with different frequency components capturing short-term and long-term patterns.

entry.title: BBPE16: UTF-16-based byte-level byte-pair encoding for improved multilingual speech recognition

author.name: Hyunsik Kim, Haeri Kim, Munhak Lee, Kyungmin Lee

entry.summary: BBPE16 proposes UTF-16-based byte-level BPE tokenization for multilingual ASR, representing most modern scripts with uniform 2-byte codes to improve token sharing for CJK languages while maintaining language-agnostic properties.

entry.title: ES-MemEval: Benchmarking Conversational Agents on Personalized Long-Term Emotional Support

author.name: Tiantian Chen, Jiaqi Lu, Ying Shen, Lin Zhang

entry.summary: ES-MemEval benchmarks conversational agents on five memory capabilities for long-term emotional support: extraction, temporal reasoning, conflict detection, abstention, and user modeling in evolving scenarios.

entry.title: Bandwidth-Efficient Multi-Agent Communication through Information Bottleneck and Vector Quantization

author.name: Ahmad Farooq, Kamran Iqbal

entry.summary: Combines information bottleneck theory with vector quantization for bandwidth-efficient multi-agent communication, learning to compress messages while preserving task-critical information with gated communication.

entry.title: From Observations to States: Latent Time Series Forecasting

author.name: Jie Yang, Yifan Hu, Yuante Li, Kexin Zhang, Kaize Ding, Philip S. Yu

entry.summary: Identifies 'Latent Chaos' paradox where accurate TSF models learn temporally disordered latent representations. Proposes LatentTSF paradigm shifting from observation regression to latent state prediction using AutoEncoder.

entry.title: AIRE-Prune: Asymptotic Impulse-Response Energy for State Pruning in State Space Models

author.name: Apurba Prasad Padhy, Fernando Camacho, Saibal Mukhopadhyay

entry.summary: Introduces AIRE-Prune for state space model pruning using asymptotic impulse-response energy scores. Extends modal truncation to deep SSM stacks with closed-form layer-normalized scoring for global cross-layer selection.

entry.title: Sparsity-Aware Unlearning for Large Language Models

author.name: Yuze Wang, Yujia Tong, Ke Xu, Jingling Yuan, Jiawei Jiang, Chuang Hu

entry.summary: Proposes SparseLLM for machine unlearning in sparse LLMs, revealing unlearning degradation occurs because existing methods require updating all parameters but sparsification limits forgetting capacity.

entry.title: Repair Brain Damage: Real-Numbered Error Correction Code for Neural Network

author.name: Ziqing Li, Myung Cho, Qiutong Jin, Weiyu Xu

entry.summary: Proposes real-number error correction code for neural networks that can detect and correct both memory errors and computational errors by introducing linear constraints on weights.

entry.title: Audio-to-Image Bird Species Retrieval without Audio-Image Pairs via Text Distillation

author.name: Ilyass Moummad, Marius Miron, Lukas Rauch, David Robinson, Alexis Joly, Olivier Pietquin, Emmanuel Chemla, Matthieu Geist

entry.summary: Enables audio-to-image retrieval for bird species without paired audio-image data by distilling text embedding space from image-text model (BioCLIP-2) into audio-text model (BioLingual).

entry.title: Multivariate Time Series Data Imputation via Distributionally Robust Regularization

author.name: Che-Yi Liao, Zheng Dong, Gian-Gabriel Garcia, Kamran Paynabar

entry.summary: DRIO uses distributionally robust regularization for multivariate time series imputation, addressing bias from non-stationarity and systematic missingness via Wasserstein ambiguity sets.

entry.title: Large-Scale Terminal Agentic Trajectory Generation from Dockerized Environments

author.name: Siwei Wu, Yizhi Li, Yuyang Song, Wei Zhang, Yang Wang, Riza Batista-Navarro, Xian Yang, Mingjie Tang, Bryan Dai, Jian Yang, Chenghua Lin

entry.summary: Proposes TerminalTraj pipeline for generating terminal agent training data at scale using Dockerized environments with automatic executability and verifiability.

entry.title: V2X-DSC: Multi-Agent Collaborative Perception with Distributed Source Coding Guided Communication

author.name: Yuankun Zeng, Shaohui Li, Zhi Li, Shulan Ruan, Yu Liu, You He

entry.summary: Proposes V2X-DSC for collaborative perception using distributed source coding, where receivers perform conditional reconstruction using local features as side information to reduce bandwidth requirements.

entry.title: SRVAU-R1: Enhancing Video Anomaly Understanding via Reflection-Aware Learning

author.name: Zihao Zhao, Shengting Cao, Muchao Ye

entry.summary: Proposes SRVAU-R1 for video anomaly understanding with reflection-aware learning, introducing first reflection-oriented Chain-of-Thought dataset for VAU with self-reflection and self-correction.

entry.title: EEmo-Logic: A Unified Dataset and Multi-Stage Framework for Comprehensive Image-Evoked Emotion Assessment

author.name: Lancheng Gao, Ziheng Jia, Zixuan Xing, Wei Sun, Huiyu Duan, Guangtao Zhai, Xiongkuo Min

entry.summary: Introduces EEmoDB, largest image-evoked emotion understanding dataset with 1.2M QA pairs and 5 analysis dimensions, plus EEmo-Logic framework for comprehensive emotion assessment.

entry.title: From Frames to Sequences: Temporally Consistent Human-Centric Dense Prediction

author.name: Xingyu Miao, Junting Dong, Qin Zhao, Yuhang Yang, Junhao Chen, Yang Long

entry.summary: Proposes scalable synthetic data pipeline for temporally consistent human-centric dense prediction with motion-aligned sequences. Addresses flickering under motion, occlusion, and lighting changes.

entry.title: RobustDebias: Debiasing Language Models using Distributionally Robust Optimization

author.name: Deep Gandhi, Katyani Singh, Nidhi Hegde

entry.summary: Proposes RobustDebias using distributionally robust optimization to counter bias amplification during fine-tuning of BERT models. Addresses scalability issues with pretraining-based debiasing approaches.

entry.title: Engineering AI Agents for Clinical Workflows: A Case Study in Architecture,MLOps, and Governance

author.name: Cl\'audio L\'ucio do Val Lopes, Jo\~ao Marcus Pitta, Fabiano Bel\'em, Gildson Alves, Fl\'avio Vin\'icius Cruzeiro Martins

entry.summary: Industry case study of 'Maria' platform for production-grade clinical AI integrating Clean Architecture, MLOps, Regulatory Traceability, and Human-AI Teaming. Proposes four foundational engineering pillars for trustworthy clinical AI.

entry.title: Synapse Compendium Aware Federated Knowledge Exchange for Tool Routed LLMs

author.name: Abhijit Chakraborty, Sandipan De, Yash Shah, Chahana Dahal, Vivek Gupta

entry.summary: Introduces Synapse framework for federated learning among tool-using LLM agents, training shared global knowledge model of tool usage. Uses templated representations with adaptive masking for privacy.

entry.title: EvoOpt-LLM: Evolving industrial optimization models with large language models

author.name: Yiliu He, Tianle Li, Binghao Ji, Zhiyuan Liu, Di Huang

entry.summary: Introduces EvoOpt-LLM for evolving industrial MILP optimization models including construction, dynamic constraint injection, and variable pruning. Addresses expertise-intensive translation from requirements to solver models.

entry.title: ASP-Bench: From Natural Language to Logic Programs

author.name: Stefan Szeider

entry.summary: Introduces ASP-Bench, a benchmark of 128 natural language problems for evaluating translation to Answer Set Programs (logic programming). Provides systematic coverage of ASP features with reference validators.

entry.title: Synesthesia of Vehicles: Tactile Data Synthesis from Visual Inputs

author.name: Rui Wang, Yaoguang Cao, Yuyi Chen, Jianyi Xu, Zhuoyang Li, Jiachen Shang, Shichun Yang

entry.summary: Synesthesia of Vehicles predicts tactile road excitations from visual inputs using cross-modal alignment and visual-tactile synesthetic generative model based on latent diffusion.

entry.title: Federated Learning With Individualized Privacy Through Client Sampling

author.name: Lucas Lange, Ole Borchardt, Erhard Rahm

entry.summary: Extends individualized differential privacy to federated learning by adapting the SAMPLE algorithm, allowing clients to specify heterogeneous privacy budgets and computing client-specific sampling rates.

entry.title: Efficient Multilingual Search Relevance Modeling in E-Commerce via LLM Mixture-of-Experts

author.name: Ye Liu, Xu Chen, Wuji Chen, Mang Li

entry.summary: Proposes LLM Mixture-of-Experts framework for multilingual e-commerce search relevance, leveraging complementary strengths of different LLM base models across languages and regions.

entry.title: What Artificial Intelligence can do for High-Performance Computing systems?

author.name: Pierrick Pochelu, Hyacinthe Cartiaux, Julien Schleich

entry.summary: Comprehensive review of AI/ML applications for HPC systems covering ~1,800 publications, identifying six application areas: performance estimation, optimization, scheduling, surrogate modeling, fault detection, and LLM automation.

entry.title: PTCBENCH: Benchmarking Contextual Stability of Personality Traits in LLM Systems

author.name: Jiongchi Yu, Yuhan Ma, Xiaoyu Zhang, Junjie Wang, Qiang Hu, Chao Shen, Xiaofei Xie

entry.summary: Introduces PTCBENCH benchmark for measuring LLM personality consistency across 12 situational contexts, revealing certain traits remain stable while others vary with context.

entry.title: Construct, Align, and Reason: Large Ontology Models for Enterprise Knowledge Management

author.name: Yao Zhang, Hongyin Zhu

entry.summary: Introduces Large Ontology Model (LOM) framework for enterprise knowledge management with construct-align-reason pipeline and three-stage training for instruction-aligned reasoning over enterprise ontologies.

entry.title: LOGOS-CA: A Cellular Automaton Using Natural Language as State and Rule

author.name: Keishu Utimula

entry.summary: Proposes LOGOS-CA, cellular automata using natural language as state and rule with LLM-driven updates, enabling richer simulation beyond numerical states and fixed rules.

entry.title: Enhancing few-shot time series forecasting with LLM-guided diffusion

author.name: Haonan Shi, Dehua Shuai, Liming Wang, Xiyang Liu, Long Tian

entry.summary: Proposes LTSM-DIFF combining LLMs as temporal memory with diffusion models for few-shot time series forecasting, using LLM representations as conditional guidance for diffusion process.

entry.title: AI-assisted Protocol Information Extraction For Improved Accuracy and Efficiency in Clinical Trial Workflows

author.name: Ramtin Babaeipour, Fran\c{c}ois Charest, Madison Wright

entry.summary: Evaluates AI system using LLMs with RAG for automated clinical trial protocol information extraction, showing 87.8% accuracy and operational efficiency gains in simulated workflows.

entry.title: Explore Brain-Inspired Machine Intelligence for Connecting Dots on Graphs Through Holographic Blueprint of Oscillatory Synchronization

author.name: Tingting Dan, Jiaqi Ding, Guorong Wu

entry.summary: Proposes brain-inspired machine intelligence based on oscillatory synchronization, introducing HoloBrain for modeling brain rhythms and HoloGraph for graph learning using shared synchronization mechanism.

entry.title: The Impact of Machine Learning Uncertainty on the Robustness of Counterfactual Explanations

author.name: Leonidas Christodoulou, Chang Sun

entry.summary: Investigates robustness of counterfactual explanations under model and data uncertainty, finding explanations highly sensitive to uncertainty with small changes invalidating explanations.

entry.title: From Numbers to Prompts: A Cognitive Symbolic Transition Mechanism for Lightweight Time-Series Forecasting

author.name: Namkyung Yoon, Hwangnam Kim

entry.summary: Proposes Symbolic Transition Mechanism (STM) transforming time series to symbols using human cognitive-inspired quantization, enabling lightweight LLM-based forecasting through prompt engineering.

entry.title: EDU-CIRCUIT-HW: Evaluating Multimodal Large Language Models on Real-World University-Level STEM Student Handwritten Solutions

author.name: Weiyu Sun, Liangliang Chen, Yongnuo Cai, Huiru Xie, Yi Zeng, Ying Zhang

entry.summary: Releases EDU-CIRCUIT-HW benchmark of 1,300+ authentic student handwritten solutions with intertwined formulas, diagrams, and reasoning for evaluating MLLM understanding of complex STEM work.

entry.title: HYPE-EDIT-1: Benchmark for Measuring Reliability in Frontier Image Editing Models

author.name: Wing Chan, Richard Allen

entry.summary: Introduces HYPE-EDIT-1 benchmark with 100 reference-based marketing/design editing tasks measuring per-attempt pass rate and effective cost per success including human review time.

entry.title: 1S-DAug: One-Shot Data Augmentation for Robust Few-Shot Generalization

author.name: Yunwei Bai, Ying Kiat Tan, Yao Shu, Tsuhan Chen

entry.summary: Proposes 1S-DAug for one-shot test-time augmentation using diffusion models to generate diverse variants from single example for few-shot learning, improving FSL across multiple backbones.

entry.title: IC-EO: Interpretable Code-based assistant for Earth Observation

author.name: Lamia Lahouel, Laurynas Lopata, Simon Gruening, Gabriele Meoni, Gaetan Petit, Sylvain Lobry

entry.summary: Proposes IC-EO, conversational code-generating LLM agent for Earth Observation that transforms natural language queries into auditable Python workflows over unified API for classification, segmentation, and geospatial operations.

entry.title: Scalable Analytic Classifiers with Associative Drift Compensation for Class-Incremental Learning of Vision Transformers

author.name: Xuan Rao, Mingming Ha, Bo Zhao, Derong Liu, Cesare Alippi

entry.summary: Proposes LR-RGDA for scalable class-incremental learning with ViTs, using low-rank factorization of covariance to achieve RGDA expressivity with linear classifier efficiency.

entry.title: ProDCARL: Reinforcement Learning-Aligned Diffusion Models for De Novo Antimicrobial Peptide Design

author.name: Fang Sheng, Mohammad Noaeen, Zahra Shakeri

entry.summary: ProDCARL combines diffusion-based protein generation with reinforcement learning to design antimicrobial peptides, fine-tuning EvoDiff with rewards for AMP activity and low toxicity.

entry.title: Semantic-Aware Advanced Persistent Threat Detection Using Autoencoders on LLM-Encoded System Logs

author.name: Waleed Khan Mohammed, Zahirul Arief Irfan Bin Shahrul Anuar, Mousa Sufian Mousa Mitani, Hezerul Abdul Karim, Nouar AlDahoul

entry.summary: Proposes APT detection using LLM embeddings of system logs to capture semantic intent behind activities, addressing limitations of statistical methods for low-and-slow attack patterns.

entry.title: Optimal Transport-Guided Adversarial Attacks on Graph Neural Network-Based Bot Detection

author.name: Kunal Mukherjee, Zulfikar Alom, Tran Gia Bao Ngo, Cuneyt Gurcan Akcora, Murat Kantarcioglu

entry.summary: BOCLOAK introduces optimal transport-guided adversarial attacks on GNN-based social bot detectors under realistic domain-specific and temporal constraints.

entry.title: LLMs as High-Dimensional Nonlinear Autoregressive Models with Attention: Training, Alignment and Inference

author.name: Vikram Krishnamurthy

entry.summary: Provides explicit mathematical reference for LLMs as high-dimensional nonlinear autoregressive models with attention, covering pretraining, RLHF, DPO, RSFT, and RLVR.

entry.title: Quality-Diversity Optimization as Multi-Objective Optimization

author.name: Xi Lin, Ping Guo, Yilu Liu, Qingfu Zhang, Jianyong Sun

entry.summary: Reformulates Quality-Diversity optimization as multi-objective optimization with many objectives, enabling adoption of established MOO techniques for QD problems.

entry.title: RecGOAT: Graph Optimal Adaptive Transport for LLM-Enhanced Multimodal Recommendation with Dual Semantic Alignment

author.name: Yuecheng Li, Hengwei Ju, Zeyu Song, Wei Yang, Chi Lu, Peng Jiang, Kun Gai

entry.summary: Proposes RecGOAT for multimodal recommendation that addresses representational divergence between LMs and recommendation systems using graph optimal transport for dual semantic alignment.

entry.title: Multimodal Scientific Learning Beyond Diffusions and Flows

author.name: Leonardo Ferreira Guilhoto, Akshat Kaushal, Paris Perdikaris

entry.summary: Demonstrates that Mixture Density Networks provide a principled yet overlooked alternative to diffusion/flow models for multimodal uncertainty quantification in scientific ML, better suited to low-dimensional structured solution spaces.

entry.title: Offline Discovery of Interpretable Skills from Multi-Task Trajectories

author.name: Chongyu Zhu, Mithun Vanniasinghe, Jiayu Chen, Chi-Guhn Lee

entry.summary: Introduces LOKI, a three-stage framework for offline skill discovery combining task-aware macro-segmentation with self-supervised micro-segmentation for hierarchical imitation learning.

entry.title: Adaptive Dual-Weighting Framework for Federated Learning via Out-of-Distribution Detection

author.name: Zhiwei Ling, Hailiang Zhao, Chao Zhang, Xiang Ao, Ziqi Wang, Cheng Zhang, Zhen Qin, Xinkui Zhao, Kingsum Chow, Yuanqing Wu, MengChu Zhou

entry.summary: Proposes FLood, a federated learning framework using out-of-distribution detection to handle data heterogeneity through dual-weighting mechanisms that counteract non-IID data effects.

entry.title: Vortex Stretching in the Navier-Stokes Equations and Information Dissipation in Diffusion Models: A Reformulation from a Partial Differential Equation Viewpoint

author.name: Tsuyoshi Yoneda

entry.summary: Reformulates vortex stretching in Navier-Stokes equations using a PDE framework inspired by score-based diffusion models, learning score functions via neural networks for backward-time dynamics.

entry.title: PaAno: Patch-Based Representation Learning for Time-Series Anomaly Detection

author.name: Jinju Park, Seokho Kang

entry.summary: Proposes PaAno, a lightweight patch-based representation learning method for time-series anomaly detection using 1D CNNs, designed for efficiency on resource-constrained scenarios.

entry.title: From Pragmas to Partners: A Symbiotic Evolution of Agentic High-Level Synthesis

author.name: Niansong Zhang, Sunwoo Kim, Shreesha Srinath, Zhiru Zhang

entry.summary: Position paper arguing HLS remains essential in the agentic AI era, offering faster iteration and design permutability for agentic optimization of hardware designs.

entry.title: Governance at the Edge of Architecture: Regulating NeuroAI and Neuromorphic Systems

author.name: Afifah Kashif, Abdul Muhsin Hameed, Asim Iqbal

entry.summary: Examines limitations of current AI governance frameworks for NeuroAI systems, arguing assurance methods must co-evolve with neuromorphic architectures and spiking neural networks.

entry.title: Making Avatars Interact: Towards Text-Driven Human-Object Interaction for Controllable Talking Avatars

author.name: Youliang Zhang, Zhengguang Zhou, Zhentao Yu, Ziyao Huang, Teng Hu, Sen Liang, Guozhen Zhang, Ziqiao Peng, Shunkai Li, Yi Chen, Zixiang Zhou, Yuan Zhou, Qinglin Lu, Xiu Li

entry.summary: Proposes InteractAvatar for text-driven human-object interaction in talking avatar generation, using dual-stream framework decoupling perception/planning from video synthesis.

entry.title: On the Fragility of AI-Based Channel Decoders under Small Channel Perturbations

author.name: Haoyu Lei, Mohammad Jalali, Chin Wa Lau, Farzan Farnia

entry.summary: Studies robustness of AI-based channel decoders to adversarial perturbations, showing recent models like ECCT vulnerable to distributional shifts despite AWGN performance gains.

entry.title: SUSD: Structured Unsupervised Skill Discovery through State Factorization

author.name: Seyed Mohammad Hadi Hosseini, Mahdieh Soleymani Baghshah

entry.summary: SUSD proposes structured unsupervised skill discovery that leverages compositional environment structure via state factorization, addressing limitations of MI-based methods that favor static skills.

entry.title: TABX: A High-Throughput Sandbox Battle Simulator for Multi-Agent Reinforcement Learning

author.name: Hayeong Lee, JunHyeok Oh, Byung-Jun Lee

entry.summary: TABX is a JAX-based high-throughput sandbox for cooperative multi-agent RL research, providing granular environmental control and massive GPU parallelization for systematic investigation of emergent behaviors.

entry.title: Towards Exploratory and Focused Manipulation with Bimanual Active Perception: A New Problem, Benchmark and Strategy

author.name: Yuxin He, Ruihao Zhang, Tianao Shen, Cheng Liu, Qiang Nie

entry.summary: Introduces Exploratory and Focused Manipulation (EFM) problem and EFM-10 benchmark for bimanual active perception, addressing visual occlusion through active information collection.

entry.title: FiLoRA: Focus-and-Ignore LoRA for Controllable Feature Reliance

author.name: Hyunsuk Chung, Caren Han, Yerin Choi, Seungyeon Ji, Jinwoo Kim, Eun-Jung Holden, Kyungreem Han

entry.summary: FiLoRA enables explicit control over which internal features multimodal foundation models rely on through instruction-conditioned LoRA modules, allowing researchers to study and manipulate feature reliance without changing task semantics.

entry.title: Two-Stage Grid Optimization for Group-wise Quantization of LLMs

author.name: Junhan Kim, Gukryeol Lee, Seungwoo Son, Jeewook Kim, Yongkweon Jeon

entry.summary: Two-stage optimization framework for LLM group-wise quantization that explicitly minimizes layer-wise reconstruction loss by incorporating input statistics and optimizing group scales, improving on GPTQ's heuristics.

entry.title: EvoMU: Evolutionary Machine Unlearning

author.name: Pawel Batorski, Paul Swoboda

entry.summary: EvoMU uses evolutionary search to automatically discover task-specific unlearning loss functions, addressing the challenge that optimal losses vary across different forget/retain data configurations.

entry.title: Unsupervised Physics-Informed Operator Learning through Multi-Stage Curriculum Training

author.name: Paolo Marcandelli, Natansh Mathur, Stefano Markidis, Martina Siena, Stefano Mariani

entry.summary: Multi-stage curriculum training strategy for physics-informed neural operators that progressively enforces boundary conditions then interior residuals, achieving stable convergence without supervised data.

entry.title: FragmentFlow: Scalable Transition State Generation for Large Molecules

author.name: Ron Shprints, Peter Holderrieth, Juno Nam, Rafael G\'omez-Bombarelli, Tommi Jaakkola

entry.summary: FragmentFlow enables transition state generation for large molecules through divide-and-conquer approach, training on fragments then generalizing to larger substrates without requiring large-molecule TS data.

entry.title: Rethinking Generative Recommender Tokenizer: Recsys-Native Encoding and Semantic Quantization Beyond LLMs

author.name: Yu Liang, Zhongjin Zhang, Yuxuan Zhu, Kerui Zhang, Zhiluohan Guo, Wenhang Zhou, Zonqi Yang, Kangle Wu, Yabo Ni, Anxiang Zeng, Cong Fu, Jianxin Wang, Jiazhi Xia

entry.summary: ReSID rethinks semantic ID tokenization for recommendation by designing representation learning and quantization specifically for sequential predictability rather than adapting generic semantic approaches.

entry.title: Benford's Law as a Distributional Prior for Post-Training Quantization of Large Language Models

author.name: Arthur Negr\~ao, Pedro Silva, Vander L. S. Freitas, Gladston Moreira, Eduardo Luz

entry.summary: Proposes Benford-Quant, a data-free non-uniform quantizer for LLMs inspired by Benford's Law. Uses log-spaced codebook to allocate more resolution to frequent small-magnitude weights, matching the observed skewed distributions.

entry.title: Generation Order and Parallel Decoding in Masked Diffusion Models: An Information-Theoretic Perspective

author.name: Shaorong Zhang, Longxuan Yu, Rob Brekelmans, Luhan Tang, Salman Asif, Greg Ver Steeg

entry.summary: Provides information-theoretic framework analyzing generation order and parallelization in Masked Diffusion Models. Shows Easy-First decoding benefits increase with model error, and parallel decoding introduces sampling errors causing coherence failures.

entry.title: Stabilizing Decentralized Federated Fine-Tuning via Topology-Aware Alternating LoRA

author.name: Xiaoyu Wang, Xiaotian Li, Zhixiang Zhou, Chen Li, Yong Liu

entry.summary: Proposes TAD-LoRA for decentralized federated fine-tuning addressing topology-dependent instabilities from LoRA's factorized structure. Coordinates LoRA factor updates to control inter-client misalignment with convergence guarantees.

entry.title: Federated Learning at the Forefront of Fairness: A Multifaceted Perspective

author.name: Noorain Mukhtiar, Adnan Mahmood, Yipeng Zhou, Jian Yang, Jing Teng, Quan Z. Sheng

entry.summary: Comprehensive survey on fairness in federated learning, categorizing approaches from performance-oriented and capability-oriented perspectives. Examines evaluation metrics and proposes future research directions.

entry.title: Fast Non-Episodic Finite-Horizon RL with K-Step Lookahead Thresholding

author.name: Jiamin Xu, Kyra Gan

entry.summary: Introduces K-step lookahead thresholding for non-episodic finite-horizon MDPs, learning truncated Q-functions with time-varying action thresholds. Proves fast finite-time regret bounds.

entry.title: Efficient Deep Learning for Medical Imaging: Bridging the Gap Between High-Performance AI and Clinical Deployment

author.name: Cuong Manh Nguyen, Truong-Son Hy

entry.summary: Reviews efficient deep learning architectures for medical imaging, covering CNNs, lightweight transformers, and linear complexity models. Examines compression strategies for clinical deployment.

entry.title: A Unified Matrix-Spectral Framework for Stability and Interpretability in Deep Learning

author.name: Ronald Katende

entry.summary: Develops unified matrix-spectral framework for neural network stability and interpretability, introducing Global Matrix Stability Index aggregating spectral information across Jacobians, gradients, NTK, and Hessians.

entry.title: Multi-Fidelity Physics-Informed Neural Networks with Bayesian Uncertainty Quantification and Adaptive Residual Learning for Efficient Solution of Parametric Partial Differential Equations

author.name: Olaf Yunus Laitinen Imanov

entry.summary: Presents MF-BPINN, combining multi-fidelity physics-informed neural networks with Bayesian uncertainty quantification and adaptive residual learning for parametric PDEs.

entry.title: The BoBW Algorithms for Heavy-Tailed MDPs

author.name: Yu Chen, Yuhao Liu, Jiatai Huang, Yihan Du, Longbo Huang

entry.summary: Proposes HT-FTRL algorithms achieving Best-of-Both-Worlds guarantees for heavy-tailed MDPs: instance-independent regret adversarially and logarithmic regret in stochastic settings.

entry.title: COMET: Codebook-based Online-adaptive Multi-scale Embedding for Time-series Anomaly Detection

author.name: Jinwoo Park, Hyeongwon Kang, Seung Hun Han, Pilsung Kang

entry.summary: Proposes COMET for time series anomaly detection with multi-scale patch encoding, codebook learning for normal patterns, and online adaptation to handle distribution shifts at inference time.

entry.title: Quantifying Epistemic Predictive Uncertainty in Conformal Prediction

author.name: Siu Lun Chau, Soroush H. Zargarbashi, Yusuf Sale, Michele Caprio

entry.summary: Studies epistemic predictive uncertainty in conformal prediction by showing CP induces a credal set of predictive distributions. Extends characterization from full CP to split CP setting.

entry.title: Position: The Inevitable End of One-Architecture-Fits-All-Domains in Time Series Forecasting

author.name: Qinwei Ma, Jingzhe Shi, Jiahao Qiu, Zaiwen Yang

entry.summary: Position paper arguing against universal one-architecture-fits-all approaches for time series forecasting, highlighting irreconcilable conflicts between single-domain SOTA and general-domain performance.

entry.title: Bayesian Integration of Nonlinear Incomplete Clinical Data

author.name: Luc\'ia Gonz\'alez-Zamorano, Nuria Balb\'as-Esteban, Vanessa G\'omez-Verdejo, Albert Belenguer-Llorens, Carlos Sevilla-Salcedo

entry.summary: Proposes BIONIC framework for integrating heterogeneous multimodal clinical data under missingness using joint generative-discriminative latent architecture with pretrained embeddings.

entry.title: Active learning from positive and unlabeled examples

author.name: Farnam Mansouri, Sandra Zilles, Shai Ben-David

entry.summary: Provides first theoretical analysis of label complexity for active learning from positive and unlabeled (PU) data where labels are revealed only for positives with probability.

entry.title: The Maximum von Neumann Entropy Principle: Theory and Applications in Machine Learning

author.name: Youqi Wu, Farzan Farnia

entry.summary: Extends classical maximum entropy framework to von Neumann entropy, providing game-theoretic justification for VNE maximization over density matrices with applications to ML.

entry.title: Efficient Neural Controlled Differential Equations via Attentive Kernel Smoothing

author.name: Egor Serov, Ilya Kuleshov, Alexey Zaytsev

entry.summary: Proposes using kernel and GP smoothing for Neural CDE path construction instead of exact interpolation, enabling explicit control over trajectory regularity and reducing solver NFE.

entry.title: C-kNN-LSH: A Nearest-Neighbor Algorithm for Sequential Counterfactual Inference

author.name: Jing Wang, Jie Shen, Qiaomin Xie, Jeremy C Weiss

entry.summary: C-kNN-LSH is a nearest-neighbor framework for sequential causal inference in healthcare settings, using locality-sensitive hashing to find 'clinical twins' and doubly-robust correction to handle irregular sampling.

entry.title: Test-Time Adaptation for Non-stationary Time Series: From Synthetic Regime Shifts to Financial Markets

author.name: Yurui Wu, Qingying Deng, Wonou Chung, Mairui Li

entry.summary: Proposes test-time adaptation framework for non-stationary time series where only normalization parameters are updated. Includes entropy minimization, temporal consistency, and uncertainty-triggered fallback.

entry.title: Reinforcement Learning for Control Systems with Time Delays: A Comprehensive Survey

author.name: Armando Alves Neto

entry.summary: Comprehensive survey of RL methods for control systems with time delays, covering sensing delays, actuation latencies, and communication constraints.

entry.title: Communications-Incentivized Collaborative Reasoning in NetGPT through Agentic Reinforcement Learning

author.name: Xiaoxue Yu, Rongpeng Li, Zhifeng Zhao, Honggang Zhang

entry.summary: NetGPT is agentic framework for AI-native wireless networks where core LLM performs reasoning or delegates to specialized agents via agentic communication using RL optimization.

entry.title: Long-range Modeling and Processing of Multimodal Event Sequences

author.name: Jichu Li, Yilun Zhong, Zhiting Li, Feng Zhou, Quyu Kong

entry.summary: Extends LLM-based temporal point processes to visual modality with text generation as core capability. Addresses long-context challenge in multimodal event sequence modeling through novel architecture.

entry.title: Equivalence of Privacy and Stability with Generalization Guarantees in Quantum Learning

author.name: Ayanava Dasgupta, Naqueeb Ahmad Warsi, Masahito Hayashi

entry.summary: Establishes equivalence between differential privacy and algorithmic stability in quantum learning, proving that quantum differential privacy bounds mutual information and generalization error.

entry.title: Importance Weighted Variational Inference without the Reparameterization Trick

author.name: Kam\'elia Daudel, Minh-Ngoc Tran, Cheng Zhang

entry.summary: Provides first comprehensive analysis of REINFORCE gradient estimators in importance weighted variational inference, diagnosing deficiencies in state-of-the-art estimators without reparameterization.

entry.title: Efficient Softmax Reformulation for Homomorphic Encryption via Moment Generating Function

author.name: Hanjun Park, Byeong-Seo Min, Jiheon Woo, Min-Wook Jeong, Jongho Shin, Yongwoo Lee, Young-Sik Kim, Yongjune Kim

entry.summary: Proposes MGF-softmax for homomorphic encryption that reformulates softmax using moment generating functions, reducing multiplicative depth while preserving properties.

entry.title: Sentence Curve Language Models

author.name: DongNyeong Heo, Heelyoul Choi

entry.summary: Proposes sentence curves as continuous sentence representations using spline curves whose control points affect multiple words, addressing local-global structure in language modeling.

entry.title: FluxNet: Learning Capacity-Constrained Local Transport Operators for Conservative and Bounded PDE Surrogates

author.name: Zishuo Lan, Junjie Li, Lei Wang, Jincheng Wang

entry.summary: Proposes FluxNet learning local transport operators for PDE simulation that enforce conservation and boundedness constraints by construction, inspired by lattice Boltzmann methods.

entry.title: Learning Beyond the Gaussian Data: Learning Dynamics of Neural Networks on an Expressive and Cumulant-Controllable Data Model

author.name: Onat Ure, Samet Demir, Zafer Dogan
