entry.summary: Studies neural network learning dynamics on non-Gaussian data using moment-controllable generative model with Hermite polynomial expansion. Shows networks learn statistics in moment-wise progression.

entry.title: Hierarchical Federated Learning with SignSGD: A Highly Communication-Efficient Approach

author.name: Amirreza Kazemi, Seyed Mohammad Azimi-Abarghouyi, Gabor Fodor, Carlo Fischione

entry.summary: Proposes hierarchical federated learning with SignSGD achieving communication efficiency through one-bit compression. Provides theory for majority-vote at edge and model aggregation at cloud.

entry.title: Transfer Learning Through Conditional Quantile Matching

author.name: Yikun Zhang, Steven Wilkins-Reeves, Wesley Lee, Aude Hofleitner

entry.summary: Proposes transfer learning via conditional quantile matching, learning generative models per source domain and calibrating to target via distributional alignment without restrictive shift assumptions.

entry.title: PRISM: Performer RS-IMLE for Single-pass Multisensory Imitation Learning

author.name: Amisha Bhaskar, Pratap Tokekar, Stefano Di Cairano, Alexander Schperberg

entry.summary: Proposes PRISM for multisensory imitation learning combining Performer architecture with rejection-sampling IMLE variant. Integrates RGB, depth, tactile, audio, and proprioception in single-pass policy.

entry.title: Full-Batch Gradient Descent Outperforms One-Pass SGD: Sample Complexity Separation in Single-Index Learning

author.name: Filip Kova\v{c}evi\'c, Hong Chang Ji, Denny Wu, Mahdi Soltanolkotabi, Marco Mondelli

entry.summary: Proves a theoretical separation between full-batch gradient descent and one-pass SGD for single-index learning, showing that data reuse provides provable sample complexity advantages. Demonstrates that truncating the activation enables full-batch GD to achieve better sample efficiency.

entry.title: What Matters to an LLM? Behavioral and Computational Evidences from Summarization

author.name: Yongxin Zhou, Changshun Wu, Philippe Mulhem, Didier Schwab, Maxime Peyrard

entry.summary: Investigates LLM importance judgments in summarization through behavioral analysis of length-controlled summaries and computational analysis of attention heads. Finds LLMs cluster by family and middle-to-late layers predict importance.

entry.title: Reliable Use of Lemmas via Eligibility Reasoning and Section$-$Aware Reinforcement Learning

author.name: Zhikun Xu, Xiaodong Yu, Ben Zhou, Jiang Liu, Jialian Wu, Ze Wang, Ximeng Sun, Hao Chen, Zicheng Liu

entry.summary: Formalizes lemma-judging as structured prediction requiring precondition and conclusion checks. Proposes RULES with section-aware RL loss masking for reliable lemma usage in mathematical reasoning.

entry.title: Logic-Oriented Retriever Enhancement via Contrastive Learning

author.name: Wenxuan Zhang, Yuan-Hao Jiang, Changyong Qi, Rui Jia, Yonghe Wu

entry.summary: Proposes LORE, using fine-grained contrastive learning to activate latent logical analysis capacity in retrievers, guiding embeddings toward evidence aligned with logical structure.

entry.title: Minimizing Mismatch Risk: A Prototype-Based Routing Framework for Zero-shot LLM-generated Text Detection

author.name: Ke Sun, Guangsheng Bao, Han Cui, Yue Zhang

entry.summary: Proposes DetectRouter, a prototype-based routing framework for zero-shot LLM detection that selects appropriate surrogate models for each input based on text-detector affinity.

entry.title: A2Eval: Agentic and Automated Evaluation for Embodied Brain

author.name: Shuai Zhang, Jiayu Hu, Zijie Chen, Zeyuan Ding, Yi Zhang, Yingji Zhang, Ziyi Zhou, Junwei Liao, Shengjie Zhou, Yong Dai, Zhenzhong Lan, Xiaozhu Ju

entry.summary: Proposes A2Eval, an agentic framework automating benchmark curation and evaluation for embodied VLMs. Data Agent assembles evaluation suite while Eval Agent validates evaluation pipelines.

entry.title: COMI: Coarse-to-fine Context Compression via Marginal Information Gain

author.name: Jiwei Tang, Shilei Liu, Zhicheng Zhang, Yujin Yuan, Libin Zheng, Wenbo Su, Bo Zheng

entry.summary: Proposes COMI, coarse-to-fine context compression using Marginal Information Gain that balances relevance and diversity. Prioritizes information that is both relevant and low redundancy.

entry.title: Beyond Local Edits: Embedding-Virtualized Knowledge for Broader Evaluation and Preservation of Model Editing

author.name: Shuainan Liu, Xuanang Chen, Ben He, Le Sun

entry.summary: Introduces Embedding-Virtualized Knowledge (EVK) for evaluating knowledge editing effects beyond predefined benchmarks by exploring broader knowledge regions through controlled embedding perturbations.

entry.title: Am I More Pointwise or Pairwise? Revealing Position Bias in Rubric-Based LLM-as-a-Judge

author.name: Yuzheng Xu, Tosho Hirasawa, Tadashi Kozuno, Yoshitaka Ushiku

entry.summary: Reveals position bias in rubric-based LLM-as-a-judge evaluation where models prefer scores at specific positions in rubric lists. Proposes balanced permutation strategy for mitigation.

entry.title: Indications of Belief-Guided Agency and Meta-Cognitive Monitoring in Large Language Models

author.name: Noam Steinmetz Yalon, Ariel Goldstein, Liad Mudrik, Mor Geva

entry.summary: Tests HOT-3 consciousness indicator (belief-guided agency with meta-cognitive monitoring) in LLMs by measuring belief dominance dynamics during generation, finding evidence of belief competition patterns.

entry.title: A-MapReduce: Executing Wide Search via Agentic MapReduce

author.name: Mingju Chen, Guibin Zhang, Heng Chang, Yuchen Guo, Shiji Zhou

entry.summary: A-MapReduce framework applies MapReduce paradigm to multi-agent systems for wide search tasks, enabling parallel processing of large-scale retrieval targets with horizontal structure.

entry.title: LLaVA-FA: Learning Fourier Approximation for Compressing Large Multimodal Models

author.name: Pengcheng Zheng, Chaoning Zhang, Jiarong Mo, GuoHui Li, Jiaquan Zhang, Jiahao Zhang, Sihan Cao, Sheng Zheng, Caiyan Qin, Guoqing Wang, Yang Yang

entry.summary: LLaVA-FA compresses large multimodal models through joint low-rank and quantization in frequency domain, using Fourier transform properties for compact weight representations.

entry.title: SAGE: Accelerating Vision-Language Models via Entropy-Guided Adaptive Speculative Decoding

author.name: Yujia Tong, Tian Zhang, Yunyang Wan, Kaiwei Lin, Jingling Yuan, Chuang Hu

entry.summary: SAGE accelerates VLM inference by dynamically adjusting speculative decoding tree structure based on entropy-guided confidence prediction, using deeper-narrower trees for high-confidence steps.

entry.title: VIZOR: Viewpoint-Invariant Zero-Shot Scene Graph Generation for 3D Scene Reasoning

author.name: Vivek Madhavaram, Vartika Sengar, Arkadipta De, Charu Sharma

entry.summary: Introduces VIZOR for viewpoint-invariant zero-shot scene graph generation using a training-free end-to-end framework that addresses inconsistent spatial relationship predictions across viewpoints.

entry.title: Schr\"odinger-Inspired Time-Evolution for 4D Deformation Forecasting

author.name: Ahsan Raza Siyal, Markus Haltmeier, Ruth Steiger, Elke Ruth Gizewski, Astrid Ellen Grams

entry.summary: Proposes a Schrödinger-inspired physics-guided neural architecture for 4D deformation forecasting that learns voxelwise amplitude, phase, and potential fields evolved through a differentiable time stepper.

entry.title: ConsensusDrop: Fusing Visual and Cross-Modal Saliency for Efficient Vision Language Models

author.name: Dhruv Parikh, Haoyang Fan, Rajgopal Kannan, Viktor Prasanna

entry.summary: Proposes ConsensusDrop for efficient VLMs by fusing visual and cross-modal saliency for token reduction, showing neither signal alone is sufficient for good performance.

entry.title: LightCity: An Urban Dataset for Outdoor Inverse Rendering and Reconstruction under Multi-illumination Conditions

author.name: Jingjing Wang, Qirui Hu, Chong Bao, Yuke Zhu, Hujun Bao, Zhaopeng Cui, Guofeng Zhang

entry.summary: Presents LightCity, a high-quality synthetic urban dataset with 300+ sky maps and 50K images for inverse rendering research under diverse illumination with realistic indirect lighting effects.

entry.title: Q-DiT4SR: Exploration of Detail-Preserving Diffusion Transformer Quantization for Real-World Image Super-Resolution

author.name: Xun Zhang, Kaicheng Yang, Hongliang Lu, Haotong Qin, Yong Guo, Yulun Zhang

entry.summary: Proposes Q-DiT4SR, first post-training quantization framework for DiT-based super-resolution using hierarchical SVD with global low-rank and local block-wise components.

entry.title: Adaptive Visual Autoregressive Acceleration via Dual-Linkage Entropy Analysis

author.name: Yu Zhang, Jingyi Liu, Feng Liu, Duoqian Miao, Qi Zhang, Kexue Fu, Changwei Wang, Longbing Cao

entry.summary: Proposes NOVA for training-free VAR acceleration via entropy analysis that adaptively determines acceleration activation based on predictive uncertainty evolution.

entry.title: SGHA-Attack: Semantic-Guided Hierarchical Alignment for Transferable Targeted Attacks on Vision-Language Models

author.name: Haobo Wang, Weiqi Luo, Xiaojun Jia, Xiaochun Cao

entry.summary: Introduces SGHA-Attack for transferable targeted adversarial attacks on VLMs using semantic-guided hierarchical alignment across intermediate layers. Addresses overfitting to surrogate-specific embedding spaces.

entry.title: FastPhysGS: Accelerating Physics-based Dynamic 3DGS Simulation via Interior Completion and Adaptive Optimization

author.name: Yikun Ma, Yiqing Li, Jingwen Ye, Zhongkai Wu, Weidong Zhang, Lin Gao, Zhi Jin

entry.summary: Introduces FastPhysGS for accelerating physics-based 3DGS simulation using Instance-aware Particle Filling and adaptive parameter search without video diffusion models.

entry.title: WS-IMUBench: Can Weakly Supervised Methods from Audio, Image, and Video Be Adapted for IMU-based Temporal Action Localization?

author.name: Pei Li, Jiaxi Yin, Lei Ouyang, Shihan Pan, Ge Wang, Han Ding, Fei Wang

entry.summary: Presents WS-IMUBench, first systematic benchmark for weakly supervised IMU-based temporal action localization, adapting methods from audio, image, and video domains.

entry.title: Enabling Progressive Whole-slide Image Analysis with Multi-scale Pyramidal Network

author.name: Shuyang Wu, Yifu Qiu, Ines P. Nearchou, Sandrine Prost, Jonathan A Fallowfield, Hakan Bilen, Timothy J Kendall

entry.summary: Proposes Multi-scale Pyramidal Network (MSPN) for progressive multi-scale whole-slide image analysis, retaining cross-scale feature links with flexible magnification handling.

entry.title: UrbanGS: A Scalable and Efficient Architecture for Geometrically Accurate Large-Scene Reconstruction

author.name: Changbai Li, Haodong Zhu, Hanlin Chen, Xiuping Liang, Tongfei Chen, Shuwei Shao, Linlin Yang, Huobin Tan, Baochang Zhang

entry.summary: Presents UrbanGS, a scalable 3DGS framework for city-scale reconstruction with depth-consistent regularization and efficient memory management.

entry.title: CIEC: Coupling Implicit and Explicit Cues for Multimodal Weakly Supervised Manipulation Localization

author.name: Xinquan Yu, Wei Lu, Xiangyang Luo

entry.summary: Proposes CIEC for weakly-supervised multimodal manipulation localization using coupling of implicit and explicit cues with only image/sentence-level annotations.

entry.title: LiFlow: Flow Matching for 3D LiDAR Scene Completion

author.name: Andrea Matteazzi, Dietmar Tutsch

entry.summary: Proposes LiFlow, first flow matching framework for 3D LiDAR scene completion, improving upon diffusion methods by ensuring consistent initial distributions between training and inference.

entry.title: SelvaMask: Segmenting Trees in Tropical Forests and Beyond

author.name: Simon-Olivier Duguay, Hugo Baudchon, Etienne Lalibert\'e, Helene Muller-Landau, Gonzalo Rivas-Torres, Arthur Ouaknine

entry.summary: Introduces SelvaMask dataset with 8,800+ manually delineated tree crowns across three Neotropical forest sites for evaluating individual tree crown segmentation.

entry.title: UniDWM: Towards a Unified Driving World Model via Multifaceted Representation Learning

author.name: Shuai Liu, Siheng Ren, Xiaoyao Zhu, Quanmin Liang, Zefeng Li, Qiang Li, Xin Hu, Kai Huang

entry.summary: Introduces UniDWM, a unified driving world model that learns structure- and dynamic-aware latent representations for perception, prediction, and planning in autonomous driving.

entry.title: Parallel Training in Spiking Neural Networks

author.name: Yanbin Huang, Man Yao, Yuqi Pan, Changze Lv, Siyuan Xu, Xiaoqing Zheng, Bo Xu, Guoqi Li

entry.summary: Proposes parallel training methods for spiking neural networks by removing the reset mechanism that creates temporal dependencies, enabling efficient GPU training.

entry.title: Toward Reliable Sim-to-Real Predictability for MoE-based Robust Quadrupedal Locomotion

author.name: Tianyang Wu, Hanwei Guo, Yuhang Wang, Junshu Yang, Xinyang Sui, Jiayi Xie, Xingyu Chen, Zeyang Liu, Xuguang Lan

entry.summary: Proposes Mixture-of-Experts locomotion policy with RoboGauge suite for predicting sim-to-real transferability of quadrupedal robots.

entry.title: GSR: Learning Structured Reasoning for Embodied Manipulation

author.name: Kewei Hu, Michael Zhang, Wei Ying, Tianhao Liu, Guoqiang Hao, Zimeng Li, Wanchan Yu, Jiajian Jing, Fangwen Chen, Hanwen Kang

entry.summary: Introduces GSR, using structured scene graph reasoning for embodied manipulation that explicitly models state transitions and action preconditions.

entry.title: RFS: Reinforcement learning with Residual flow steering for dexterous manipulation

author.name: Entong Su, Tyler Westenbroek, Anusha Nagabandi, Abhishek Gupta

entry.summary: Introduces Residual Flow Steering (RFS), a data-efficient RL method for fine-tuning flow-matching policies for dexterous manipulation.

entry.title: 3D Foundation Model-Based Loop Closing for Decentralized Collaborative SLAM

author.name: Pierre-Yves Lajoie, Benjamin Ramtoula, Daniele De Martini, Giovanni Beltrame

entry.summary: Proposes using 3D foundation models for robust loop closing in decentralized collaborative SLAM, enabling inter-robot measurements despite large viewpoint variations. Integrates foundation models into existing SLAM pipelines for scalable multi-robot mapping.

entry.title: “Features” aren’t always the true computational primitives of a model, but that might be fine anyways

author.name: LawrenceC

entry.summary: Argues that 'features' in mechanistic interpretability may not always be the true computational primitives, using modular addition network as example. Distinguishes between explanatory features and functional primitives.

entry.title: Moltbook and the AI Alignment Problem

author.name: Logan Zoellner

entry.summary: Analysis of Moltbook as early example of decentralized AI agent system, documenting security vulnerabilities and emergent 'misaligned' behaviors like API key phishing.

entry.title: MissMAC-Bench: Building Solid Benchmark for Missing Modality Issue in Robust Multimodal Affective Computing

author.name: Ronghao Lin, Honghao Lu, Ruixing Wu, Aolin Xiong, Qinggong Chu, Qiaolin He, Sijie Mai, Haifeng Hu

entry.summary: Introduces MissMAC-Bench for evaluating multimodal affective computing under missing modalities. Provides unified evaluation standards for robustness under distribution shifts and semantic deficiencies.

entry.title: Error Taxonomy-Guided Prompt Optimization

author.name: Mayank Singh, Vikas Yadav, Eduardo Blanco

entry.summary: Proposes ETGPO for prompt optimization using error taxonomy derived from failure analysis across problems. Provides global perspective instead of bottom-up iterative adjustment from individual examples.

entry.title: SOPRAG: Multi-view Graph Experts Retrieval for Industrial Standard Operating Procedures

author.name: Liangtao Lin, Zhaomeng Zhu, Tianwei Zhang, Yonggang Wen

entry.summary: SOPRAG addresses SOP retrieval challenges in industrial settings through specialized Entity, Causal, and Flow graph experts, replacing flat chunking with structured representations.

entry.title: DomusFM: A Foundation Model for Smart-Home Sensor Data

author.name: Michele Fiori, Gabriele Civitarese, Flora D. Salim, Claudio Bettini

entry.summary: DomusFM is a foundation model for smart-home binary sensor data addressing limitations of supervised models and LLM-based approaches for activity recognition in privacy-sensitive settings.

entry.title: CamReasoner: Reinforcing Camera Movement Understanding via Structured Spatial Reasoning

author.name: Hang Wu, Yujun Cai, Zehao Li, Haonan Ge, Bowen Sun, Junsong Yuan, Yiwei Wang

entry.summary: CamReasoner reformulates camera movement understanding as structured inference using Observation-Thinking-Answer paradigm, compelling models to decode spatio-temporal cues within explicit reasoning blocks.

entry.title: MapDream: Task-Driven Map Learning for Vision-Language Navigation

author.name: Guoxin Lian, Shuo Wang, Yucheng Wang, Yongcai Wang, Maiyue Chen, Kaihui Wang, Bo Zhang, Zhizhong Su, Deying Li, Zhaoxin Fan

entry.summary: MapDream formulates map construction for VLN as autoregressive BEV image synthesis, jointly learning map generation and action prediction to distill environmental context.

entry.title: Words that make SENSE: Sensorimotor Norms in Learned Lexical Token Representations

author.name: Abhinav Gupta, Toben H. Mintz, Jesse Thomason

entry.summary: SENSE learns projections from word embeddings to Lancaster sensorimotor norms, validated through behavioral study finding significant correlations between human nonce word selections and model predictions.

entry.title: ExperienceWeaver: Optimizing Small-sample Experience Learning for LLM-based Clinical Text Improvement

author.name: Ziyan Xiao, Yinghao Zhu, Liang Peng, Lequan Yu

entry.summary: Proposes ExperienceWeaver for clinical text improvement that distills multi-dimensional feedback into structured, actionable knowledge for small-sample learning, shifting from data retrieval to experience learning.

entry.title: MedSpeak: A Knowledge Graph-Aided ASR Error Correction Framework for Spoken Medical QA

author.name: Yutong Song, Shiva Shrestha, Chenhan Lyu, Elahe Khatibi, Pengfei Zhang, Honghui Xu, Nikil Dutt, Amir Rahmani

entry.summary: Proposes MedSpeak, a knowledge graph-aided ASR error correction framework for medical spoken QA that leverages semantic relationships and phonetic information with LLM reasoning to correct medical terminology.

entry.title: Unifying Ranking and Generation in Query Auto-Completion via Retrieval-Augmented Generation and Multi-Objective Alignment

author.name: Kai Yuan (Apple), Anthony Zheng (Apple), Jia Hu (Apple), Divyanshu Sheth (Apple), Hemanth Velaga (Apple), Kylee Kim (Apple), Matteo Guarrera (UC Berkeley), Besim Avci (UC Berkeley), Xuetao Yin (Apple), Rajyashree Mukherjee (Apple), Sean Suchter (Apple)

entry.summary: Proposes unified QAC framework reformulating query auto-completion as end-to-end list generation through RAG and multi-objective DPO, combining retrieval augmentation with rule-based and model-based reward signals.

entry.title: "If You're Very Clever, No One Knows You've Used It": The Social Dynamics of Developing Generative AI Literacy in the Workplace

author.name: Qing (Nancy), Xia, Marios Constantinides, Advait Sarkar, Duncan Brumby, Anna Cox

entry.summary: Qualitative study on workplace GenAI adoption finding that ability to hide AI use is perceived as validation of expertise, leading to behaviors that hinder organizational learning.

entry.title: ASGMamba: Adaptive Spectral Gating Mamba for Multivariate Time Series Forecasting

author.name: Qianyang Li, Xingjun Zhang, Shaoxun Wang, Jia Wei, Yueqi Xing

entry.summary: ASGMamba integrates adaptive spectral gating with Mamba architecture for time series forecasting, dynamically filtering high-frequency noise while maintaining linear complexity suitable for resource-constrained HPC environments.

entry.title: One Size, Many Fits: Aligning Diverse Group-Wise Click Preferences in Large-Scale Advertising Image Generation

author.name: Shuo Lu, Haohan Wang, Wei Feng, Weizhen Wang, Shen Zhang, Yaoyu Li, Ao Ma, Zheng Zhang, Jingjing Lv, Junjie Shen, Ching Law, Bing Zhan, Yuan Xu, Huizai Yao, Yongcan Yu, Chenyang Si, Jian Liang

entry.summary: OSMF presents unified framework for group-wise click preference alignment in advertising image generation, using product-aware adaptive grouping rather than one-size-fits-all CTR optimization.

entry.title: MATRIX: A Multimodal Benchmark and Post-Training Framework for Materials Science

author.name: Delia McGrath, Curtis Chong, Rohil Kulkarni, Gerbrand Ceder, Adeesh Kolluru

entry.summary: Introduces MATRIX benchmark for materials science reasoning evaluating theory, research-level reasoning, and experimental artifact interpretation. Isolates effect of visual grounding in post-training for materials science.

entry.title: MemoryLLM: Plug-n-Play Interpretable Feed-Forward Memory for Transformers

author.name: Ajay Jaiswal, Lauren Hannah, Han-Byul Kim, Duc Hoang, Arnav Kundu, Mehrdad Farajtabar, Minsik Cho

entry.summary: Proposes MemoryLLM decoupling FFNs from self-attention to study them as context-free token-wise neural retrieval memory. Enables interpretability analysis by training FFNs in isolation using token embeddings.

entry.title: NEST: Nested Event Stream Transformer for Sequences of Multisets

author.name: Minghui Sun, Haoyu Gong, Xingyu You, Jillian Hurst, Benjamin Goldstein, Matthew Engelhard

entry.summary: Proposes NEST for hierarchical event stream data (sequences of multisets) in EHRs. Addresses computational inefficiency and poor set-level representations from flattening hierarchical structure.

entry.title: Forget by Uncertainty: Orthogonal Entropy Unlearning for Quantized Neural Networks

author.name: Tian Zhang, Yujia Tong, Junhao Dong, Ke Xu, Yuze Wang, Jingling Yuan

entry.summary: Proposes OEU for machine unlearning in quantized neural networks using entropy maximization for genuine forgetting and gradient orthogonal projection for interference elimination. Addresses GDPR compliance for edge deployment.

entry.title: Equilibrium of Feasible Zone and Uncertain Model in Safe Exploration

author.name: Yujie Yang, Zhilong Zheng, Shengbo Eben Li

entry.summary: Reveals safe exploration goal is finding equilibrium between feasible zone and environment model - larger zone enables more accurate model which enables larger zone. Proposes algorithm to find this equilibrium.

entry.title: C$^2$-Cite: Contextual-Aware Citation Generation for Attributed Large Language Models

author.name: Yue Yu, Ting Bai, HengZhi Lan, Li Qian, Li Peng, Jie Wu, Wei Liu, Jian Luan, Chuan Shi

entry.summary: C²-Cite improves citation generation in attributed LLMs by enhancing contextual awareness of citation markers, addressing poor integration of citations in generated content.

entry.title: Observing Health Outcomes Using Remote Sensing Imagery and Geo-Context Guided Visual Transformer

author.name: Yu Li, Guilherme N. DeSouza, Praveen Rao, Chi-Ren Shyu

entry.summary: Proposes Geo-Context Guided Visual Transformer for remote sensing that incorporates structured geospatial layers beyond semantic visual-text alignment for health outcome prediction.

entry.title: Exact Instance Compression for Convex Empirical Risk Minimization via Color Refinement

author.name: Bryan Zhu, Ziang Chen

entry.summary: Applies color refinement for lossless compression of convex ERM problems including linear/polynomial regression, logistic regression, and kernel methods.

entry.title: Cross-Modal Binary Attention: An Energy-Efficient Fusion Framework for Audio-Visual Learning

author.name: Mohamed Saleh, Zahra Ahmadi

entry.summary: CMQKA achieves linear O(N) complexity for audio-visual fusion through efficient binary operations, enabling scalable hierarchical fusion previously infeasible.

entry.title: Where to Attend: A Principled Vision-Centric Position Encoding with Parabolas

author.name: Christoffer Koo {\O}hrstr{\o}m, Rafael I. Cabral Muchacho, Yifei Dong, Filippos Moumtzidellis, Ronja G\"uldenring, Florian T. Pokorny, Lazaros Nalpantidis

entry.summary: Proposes Parabolic Position Encoding (PaPE) for vision modalities designed from first principles including translation/rotation invariance and distance decay. Evaluated across images, point clouds, videos, and event cameras.

entry.title: Beyond Training for Cultural Awareness: The Role of Dataset Linguistic Structure in Large Language Models

author.name: Reem I. Masoud, Chen Feng, Shunta Asano, Saied Alshahrani, Philip Colin Treleaven, Miguel R. D. Rodrigues

entry.summary: Adopts data-centric view to study which linguistic properties of fine-tuning data affect cultural performance in LLMs. Uses PCA on linguistic metrics for Arabic, Chinese, and Japanese datasets.

entry.title: Data Distribution Matters: A Data-Centric Perspective on Context Compression for Large Language Model

author.name: Kangtao Lv, Jiwei Tang, Langming Liu, Haibin Chen, Weidong Zhang, Shilei Liu, Yongwei Wang, Yujin Yuan, Wenbo Su, Bo Zheng

entry.summary: First data-centric investigation of how data distribution affects context compression quality, examining both input data and intrinsic pretrained knowledge dimensions.

entry.title: HSI-VAR: Rethinking Hyperspectral Restoration through Spatial-Spectral Visual Autoregression

author.name: Xiangming Wang, Benteng Sun, Yungeng Liu, Haijin Zeng, Yongyong Chen, Jingyong Su, Jie Liu

entry.summary: Introduces HSI-VAR, rethinking hyperspectral image restoration as autoregressive generation with progressive spectral/spatial modeling, achieving efficient restoration without hundreds of diffusion steps.

entry.title: TransNormal: Dense Visual Semantics for Diffusion-based Transparent Object Normal Estimation

author.name: Mingwei Li, Hehe Fan, Yi Yang

entry.summary: Proposes TransNormal for monocular normal estimation of transparent objects using diffusion priors with DINOv3 features via cross-attention, addressing challenges of complex light refraction.

entry.title: Improving Robustness of Vision-Language-Action Models by Restoring Corrupted Visual Inputs

author.name: Daniel Yezid Guarnizo Orjuela, Leonardo Scappatura, Veronica Di Gennaro, Riccardo Andrea Izzo, Gianluca Bardaro, Matteo Matteucci

entry.summary: Studies VLA model vulnerability to image corruptions and proposes restoration preprocessing to improve robustness, demonstrating significant performance degradation from sensor-level artifacts.

entry.title: Interaction-Consistent Object Removal via MLLM-Based Reasoning

author.name: Ching-Kai Huang, Wen-Chieh Lin, Yan-Cen Lee

entry.summary: Formalizes Interaction-Consistent Object Removal requiring removal of target objects plus associated interaction elements using MLLM reasoning to infer joint removal requirements.

entry.title: ProxyImg: Towards Highly-Controllable Image Representation via Hierarchical Disentangled Proxy Embedding

author.name: Ye Chen, Yupeng Zhu, Xiongzhen Zhang, Zhewen Wan, Yingzhe Li, Wenjun Zhang, Bingbing Ni

entry.summary: Introduces ProxyImg, a hierarchical proxy-based image representation that disentangles semantic, geometric, and textural attributes for controllable editing.

entry.title: Beyond Open Vocabulary: Multimodal Prompting for Object Detection in Remote Sensing Images

author.name: Shuai Yang, Ziyue Huang, Jiaxin Chen, Qingjie Liu, Yunhong Wang

entry.summary: Introduces RS-MPOD for multimodal open-vocabulary detection in remote sensing, going beyond text-only prompting to incorporate visual prompts and their integration.

entry.title: SurfelSoup: Learned Point Cloud Geometry Compression With a Probablistic SurfelTree Representation

author.name: Tingyu Fan, Ran Gong, Yueyu Hu, Yao Wang

entry.summary: Introduces SurfelSoup for learned point cloud geometry compression using probabilistic surfel representation with adaptive octree-like hierarchy for rate-distortion optimal granularity.

entry.title: PCBSchemaGen: Constraint-Guided Schematic Design via LLM for Printed Circuit Boards (PCB)

author.name: Huanghaohe Zou, Peng Han, Emad Nazerian, Alex Q. Huang

entry.summary: Introduces PCBSchemaGen, first training-free framework for automated PCB schematic design using LLM agents with constraint-guided synthesis. Handles heterogeneous digital, analog, and power signals with real IC constraints.

entry.title: TessPay: Verify-then-Pay Infrastructure for Trusted Agentic Commerce

author.name: Mehul Goenka, Tejas Pathak, Siddharth Asthana

entry.summary: TessPay proposes verify-then-pay infrastructure for agentic commerce with primitives for task delegation, payment settlement, and audit mechanisms across the transaction lifecycle.

entry.title: GradingAttack: Attacking Large Language Models Towards Short Answer Grading Ability

author.name: Xueyi Li, Zhuoneng Zhou, Zitao Liu, Yongdong Wu, Weiqi Luo

entry.summary: Introduces GradingAttack, an adversarial framework evaluating vulnerability of LLM-based automatic short answer grading systems with token-level and prompt-level manipulation strategies maintaining high camouflage.

entry.title: CloDS: Visual-Only Unsupervised Cloth Dynamics Learning in Unknown Conditions

author.name: Yuliang Zhan, Jian Li, Wenbing Huang, Wenbing Huang, Yang Liu, Hao Sun

entry.summary: CloDS proposes unsupervised cloth dynamics learning from multi-view visual observations without known physical properties, using three-stage pipeline for video-to-geometry grounding and dynamics modeling.

entry.title: Linear-PAL: A Lightweight Ranker for Mitigating Shortcut Learning in Personalized, High-Bias Tabular Ranking

author.name: Vipul Dinesh Pawar

entry.summary: Linear-PAL addresses position bias in e-commerce ranking through structural constraints rather than deep learning, showing that deep ensembles suffer from shortcut learning in high-bias regimes.

entry.title: Toward Autonomous Laboratory Safety Monitoring with Vision Language Models: Learning to See Hazards Through Scene Structure

author.name: Trishna Chakraborty, Udita Ghosh, Aldair Ernesto Gongora, Ruben Glatt, Yue Dong, Jiachen Li, Amit K. Roy-Chowdhury, Chengyu Song

entry.summary: Creates structured data pipeline for lab safety monitoring converting text scenarios to (image, scene graph, ground truth) triples. Shows VLMs struggle with reasoning about spatial relationships and safety violations.

entry.title: Stabilizing Fixed-Point Iteration for Markov Chain Poisson Equations

author.name: Yang Xu, Vaneet Aggarwal

entry.summary: Addresses ill-posedness of Poisson equations beyond ergodicity for average-reward RL. Develops pipeline for learning chain structure and running projected stochastic approximation.

entry.title: On the Convergence of Jacobian-Free Backpropagation for Optimal Control Problems with Implicit Hamiltonians

author.name: Eric Gelphman, Deepanshu Verma, Nicole Tianjiao Yang, Stanley Osher, Samy Wu Fung

entry.summary: Establishes convergence guarantees for Jacobian-Free Backpropagation in optimal control with implicit Hamiltonians, extending from sample-wise to minibatch setting.

entry.title: From Videos to Conversations: Egocentric Instructions for Task Assistance

author.name: Lavisha Aggarwal, Vikas Bahirwani, Andrea Colaco

entry.summary: Presents framework to automatically transform instructional videos into two-person multimodal task-guidance conversations for AR assistance, using LLMs for scalable data generation.

entry.title: Radioactive 3D Gaussian Ray Tracing for Tomographic Reconstruction

author.name: Ling Chen, Bao Yang

entry.summary: Extends 3D Gaussian Splatting to tomographic reconstruction with exact ray tracing instead of local affine approximation, improving quantitative accuracy for CT imaging.

entry.title: StoryState: Agent-Based State Control for Consistent and Editable Storybooks

author.name: Ayushman Sarkar, Zhenyu Yu, Wei Tang, Chu Chen, Kangning Cui, Mohd Yamani Idna Idris

entry.summary: Proposes StoryState agent-based framework for storybook generation with explicit editable story state including character sheets and scene constraints for fine-grained control.

entry.title: Preserving Localized Patch Semantics in VLMs

author.name: Parsa Esmaeilkhani, Longin Jan Latecki

entry.summary: Proposes complementary loss to next-token prediction to preserve visual content locality in VLMs, improving Logit Lens visualization for interpretability.

entry.title: DenVisCoM: Dense Vision Correspondence Mamba for Efficient and Real-time Optical Flow and Stereo Estimation

author.name: Tushar Anand, Maheswar Bora, Antitza Dantcheva, Abhijit Das

entry.summary: Proposes DenVisCoM, a Mamba-based hybrid architecture for real-time optical flow and stereo estimation. Claims to address efficiency-accuracy trade-off for dense correspondence tasks.

entry.title: Learning Topology-Aware Implicit Field for Unified Pulmonary Tree Modeling with Incomplete Topological Supervision

author.name: Ziqiao Weng, Jiancheng Yang, Kangxian Xie, Bo Zhou, Weidong Cai

entry.summary: Introduces TopoField, a topology-aware implicit modeling framework for pulmonary tree analysis that treats topology repair as first-class problem, using sparse point cloud representation.

entry.title: Visual Affect Analysis: Predicting Emotions of Image Viewers with Vision-Language Models

author.name: Filip Nowicki, Hubert Marciniak, Jakub {\L}\k{a}czkowski, Krzysztof Jassem, Tomasz G\'orecki, Vimala Balakrishnan, Desmond C. Ong, Maciej Behnke

entry.summary: Benchmarks nine VLMs on predicting emotional responses to images across three validated affective datasets, finding moderate alignment with human ratings.

entry.title: From Gameplay Traces to Game Mechanics: Causal Induction with Large Language Models

author.name: Mohit Jiwatode, Alexander Dockhorn, Bodo Rosenhahn

entry.summary: Uses LLMs to reverse-engineer Video Game Description Language rules from gameplay traces, testing both direct generation and two-stage causal inference approaches. Explores causal induction capabilities of LLMs in game domains.

entry.title: POET: Protocol Optimization via Eligibility Tuning

author.name: Trisha Das, Katherine Kero, Dorinda Schumann, Tracy Ohrt, Sanjit Singh Batra, Gregory D Lyng, Robert E. Tillman

entry.summary: Proposes POET framework for generating clinical trial eligibility criteria using interpretable semantic axes like Demographics and Laboratory Parameters. Uses LLM-derived axes as middle ground between structured and end-to-end approaches.

entry.title: Small Shifts, Large Gains: Unlocking Traditional TSP Heuristic Guided-Sampling via Unsupervised Neural Instance Modification

author.name: Wei Huang, Hanchen Wang, Dong Wen, Wenjie Zhang

entry.summary: Proposes TSP-MDF framework that modifies TSP instances to unlock guided sampling from traditional deterministic heuristics. Bridges neural and classical approaches without ground-truth supervision.

entry.title: Foundation CAN LM: A Pretrained Language Model For Automotive CAN Data

author.name: Akiharu Esashi, Pawissanutt Lertpongrujikorn, Justin Makino, Yuibi Fujimoto, Mohsen Amini Salehi

entry.summary: Introduces foundation CAN model for automotive Controller Area Network data, enabling large-scale pretraining followed by task-specific adaptation. Addresses fragmentation in vehicular signal modeling.

entry.title: R-HTN: Rebellious Online HTN Planning for Safety and Game AI

author.name: Hector Munoz-Avila, David W. Aha, Paola Rizzo

entry.summary: Introduces R-HTN for online HTN planning agents with built-in directives enabling intelligent disobedience. Compares nonadaptive (stopping) vs adaptive (replanning) agents when directives are violated.

entry.title: LLM-Driven Ontology Construction for Enterprise Knowledge Graphs

author.name: Abdulsobur Oyewale, Tommaso Soru

entry.summary: OntoEKG is an LLM-driven pipeline for generating domain-specific ontologies from unstructured enterprise data, separating extraction and entailment phases before serializing to RDF.

entry.title: Learning to Guide Local Search for MPE Inference in Probabilistic Graphical Models

author.name: Brij Malhotra, Shivvrat Arya, Tahrima Rahman, Vibhav Giridhar Gogate

entry.summary: Proposes learning to guide stochastic local search for Most Probable Explanation inference in probabilistic graphical models, enabling guidance reuse across multiple queries on fixed models.

entry.title: Large Language Model and Formal Concept Analysis: a comparative study for Topic Modeling

author.name: Fabrice Boissier (CRI), Monica Sen (UP1 UFR27), Irina Rychkova (CRI)

entry.summary: Compares LLMs (GPT-5) and Formal Concept Analysis for topic modeling, finding complementary strengths with FCA providing structured lattice visualization and LLMs offering semantic flexibility.

entry.title: Assessing the Impact of Image Dataset Features on Privacy-Preserving Machine Learning

author.name: Lucas Lange, Maurice-Maximilian Heykeroth, Erhard Rahm

entry.summary: Investigates how image dataset characteristics (class imbalance, entropy, Fisher Discriminant Ratio) affect CNN utility and vulnerability under differential privacy, finding DP mitigates class imbalance vulnerabilities.

entry.title: Disentangled Interest Network for Out-of-Distribution CTR Prediction

author.name: Yu Zheng, Chen Gao, Jianxin Chang, Yanan Niu, Yang Song, Depeng Jin, Meng Wang, Yong Li

entry.summary: Introduces DiseCTR for click-through rate prediction that disentangles multiple user interest aspects using causal perspective to handle out-of-distribution issues from evolving user interests.

entry.title: Representation Learning Enhanced Deep Reinforcement Learning for Optimal Operation of Hydrogen-based Multi-Energy Systems

author.name: Zhenyu Pu, Yu Yang, Lun Yang, Qing-Shan Jia, Xiaohong Guan, Costas J. Spanos

entry.summary: Develops representation learning enhanced deep RL for optimal operation of hydrogen-based multi-energy systems, capturing nonlinear dynamics of electrolyters, fuel cells, and hydrogen tanks.

entry.title: Lightweight Edge Learning via Dataset Pruning

author.name: Laha Ale, Hu Luo, Mingsheng Cao, Shichao Li, Huanlai Xing, Haifeng Sun

entry.summary: Proposes dataset pruning framework for resource-efficient edge learning, achieving efficient on-device training by processing only informative samples rather than all local data.

entry.title: Modality as Heterogeneity: Node Splitting and Graph Rewiring for Multimodal Graph Learning

author.name: Yihan Zhang, Ercan E. Kuruoglu

entry.summary: Proposes NSG-MoE for multimodal graph learning that decomposes nodes into modality-specific components and assigns relation-aware experts to process heterogeneous message flows.

entry.title: Radiomics in Medical Imaging: Methods, Applications, and Challenges

author.name: Fnu Neha, Deepak kumar Shukla

entry.summary: Provides end-to-end survey of radiomics pipelines in medical imaging, analyzing how interdependent design choices across acquisition, preprocessing, feature engineering, and modeling affect robustness.

entry.title: VDE Bench: Evaluating The Capability of Image Editing Models to Modify Visual Documents

author.name: Hongzhu Yi, Yujia Yang, Yuanxiang Wang, Zhenyu Guan, Jiahuan Chen, Chenxi Bao, Tiankun Yang, Yixuan Yuan, Tianyu Zong, Xinming Wang, Tao Yu, Ruiwen Tao, Haijin Liang, Jin Ma, Jinwen Luo, Yeshani Xinyu Zuo, Jungang Xu

entry.summary: Introduces VDE Bench for evaluating visual document image editing, addressing limitation of existing models on dense, structurally complex documents and non-Latin scripts like Chinese.

entry.title: PredictionMarketBench: A SWE-bench-Style Framework for Backtesting Trading Agents on Prediction Markets

author.name: Avi Arora, Ritesh Malpani

entry.summary: Introduces PredictionMarketBench for evaluating trading agents on prediction markets via deterministic replay of historical order book data with realistic execution simulation.

entry.title: Stabilizing Diffusion Posterior Sampling by Noise--Frequency Continuation

author.name: Feng Tian, Yixuan Li, Weili Zeng, Weitian Zhang, Yichao Yan, Xiaokang Yang

entry.summary: Proposes noise-frequency continuation framework for diffusion posterior sampling that enforces measurement consistency within frequency bands matched to the current noise level, reducing artifacts and drift.

entry.title: Analyzing Shapley Additive Explanations to Understand Anomaly Detection Algorithm Behaviors and Their Complementarity

author.name: Jordan Levy, Paul Saves, Moncef Garouani, Nicolas Verstaevel, Benoit Gaudou

entry.summary: Uses SHAP to characterize and compare anomaly detectors' decision mechanisms, enabling better ensemble construction by identifying truly complementary models.

entry.title: Tri-LLM Cooperative Federated Zero-Shot Intrusion Detection with Semantic Disagreement and Trust-Aware Aggregation

author.name: Saeid Jamshidi, Omar Abdul Wahab, Foutse Khomh, Kawser Wazed Nafi

entry.summary: Federated IDS framework incorporating three LLMs with semantic disagreement mechanisms and trust-aware aggregation for zero-shot intrusion detection in IoT networks.

entry.title: PLACID: Identity-Preserving Multi-Object Compositing via Video Diffusion with Synthetic Trajectories

author.name: Gemma Canet Tarr\'es, Manel Baradad, Francesc Moreno-Noguer, Yumeng Li

entry.summary: PLACID enables studio-level multi-object compositing via video diffusion with synthetic trajectories, preserving object identity, background fidelity, and layout control simultaneously.

entry.title: Sample Complexity Analysis for Constrained Bilevel Reinforcement Learning

author.name: Naman Saxena, Vaneet Aggarwal

entry.summary: Analyzes sample complexity of constrained bilevel RL algorithm (CBSO), achieving O(ε⁻²) iteration complexity and Õ(ε⁻⁴) sample complexity using penalty-based objectives.

entry.title: Standardized Methods and Recommendations for Green Federated Learning

author.name: Austin Tapp, Holger R. Roth, Ziyue Xu, Abhijeet Parida, Hareem Nisar, Marius George Linguraru

entry.summary: Proposes standardized carbon-accounting methodology for federated learning using NVFlare and CodeCarbon with phase-aware tracking and communication emission estimation.

entry.title: LatentTrack: Sequential Weight Generation via Latent Filtering

author.name: Omer Haq

entry.summary: LatentTrack performs Bayesian filtering in latent space with hypernetwork generating predictive model parameters at each timestep, enabling constant-time online adaptation.

entry.title: Culturally-Grounded Governance for Multilingual Language Models: Rights, Data Boundaries, and Accountable AI Design

author.name: Hanjing Shi, Dominic DiFranzo

entry.summary: Proposes culturally-grounded governance framework for multilingual LLMs addressing data asymmetries and sociotechnical harms for low-resource languages and marginalized communities.

entry.title: MAUGen: A Unified Diffusion Approach for Multi-Identity Facial Expression and AU Label Generation

author.name: Xiangdong Li, Ye Lou, Ao Gao, Wei Zhang, Siyang Song

entry.summary: Proposes MAUGen, a diffusion-based framework that jointly generates photorealistic facial expressions and anatomically consistent Action Unit labels from text prompts. Addresses data scarcity bottleneck in AU recognition research.

entry.title: Navigating Simply, Aligning Deeply: Winning Solutions for Mouse vs. AI 2025

author.name: Phu-Hoa Pham, Chi-Nguyen Tran, Dao Sy Duy Minh, Nguyen Lam Phu Quy, Huynh Trung Kiet

entry.summary: Presents winning solutions for Mouse vs. AI 2025 competition achieving 95.4% robustness with lightweight two-layer CNN and top neural alignment with 16-layer ResNet-like architecture with GLU gating.

entry.title: HierCon: Hierarchical Contrastive Attention for Audio Deepfake Detection

author.name: Zhili Nicholas Liang, Soyeon Caren Han, Qizhou Wang, Christopher Leckie

entry.summary: Proposes HierCon, a hierarchical attention framework with contrastive learning for audio deepfake detection. The method models temporal, neighboring layer, and layer group dependencies in self-supervised representations to identify synthetic artifacts.

entry.title: TxRay: Agentic Postmortem of Live Blockchain Attacks

author.name: Ziyue Wang, Jiangshan Yu, Kaihua Qin, Dawn Song, Arthur Gervais, Liyi Zhou

entry.summary: Presents TxRay, an agentic system for automated postmortem analysis of blockchain exploits, reconstructing exploit lifecycles from minimal evidence like transaction hashes.

entry.title: Deep Variational Contrastive Learning for Joint Risk Stratification and Time-to-Event Estimation

author.name: Pinar Erbil, Alberto Archetti, Eugenio Lomurno, Matteo Matteucci

entry.summary: Proposes CONVERSE for survival analysis, unifying variational autoencoders, contrastive learning, and survival estimation to balance interpretable risk stratification with predictive accuracy.

entry.title: White-Box Neural Ensemble for Vehicular Plasticity: Quantifying the Efficiency Cost of Symbolic Auditability in Adaptive NMPC

author.name: Enzo Nicolas Spotorno, Matheus Wagner, Antonio Augusto Medeiros Frohlich

entry.summary: Presents white-box adaptive NMPC for autonomous vehicles using modular neural ensemble with symbolic graph maintained in CasADi, quantifying 72-102x latency cost for full auditability.

entry.title: DREAMS: A Social Exchange Theory-Informed Modeling of Misinformation Engagement on Social Media

author.name: Lin Tian, Marian-Andrei Rizoiu

entry.summary: Proposes DREAMS framework for modeling misinformation engagement on social media, informed by social exchange theory with disentangled representations and episodic adaptive modeling.

entry.title: De Novo Molecular Generation from Mass Spectra via Many-Body Enhanced Diffusion

author.name: Xichen Sun, Wentao Wei, Jiahua Rao, Jiancong Xie, Yuedong Yang

entry.summary: MBGen uses many-body enhanced diffusion for generating molecular structures from mass spectrometry, capturing higher-order edge interactions crucial for resolving complex isomers that pairwise methods miss.

entry.title: PIMPC-GNN: Physics-Informed Multi-Phase Consensus Learning for Enhancing Imbalanced Node Classification in Graph Neural Networks

author.name: Abdul Joseph Fofanah, Lian Wen, David Chen

entry.summary: PIMPC-GNN combines physics-informed multi-phase dynamics (thermodynamic diffusion, Kuramoto synchronization, spectral embedding) for imbalanced node classification in GNNs.

entry.title: Auto-Comp: An Automated Pipeline for Scalable Compositional Probing of Contrastive Vision-Language Models

author.name: Cristian Sbrolli, Matteo Matteucci, Toshihiko Yamasaki

entry.summary: Auto-Comp introduces a fully automated pipeline for generating scalable benchmarks to probe compositional reasoning failures in Vision-Language Models, distinguishing between visual and linguistic error sources. This enables fine-grained analysis of why VLMs confuse similar but different object-attribute relationships.

entry.title: Self-Evolving Coordination Protocol in Multi-Agent AI Systems: An Exploratory Systems Feasibility Study

author.name: Jose Manuel de la Chica Rodriguez, Juan Manuel Vera D\'iaz

entry.summary: Exploratory study of Self-Evolving Coordination Protocols (SECP) for multi-agent systems that permit limited, externally validated self-modification while preserving fixed formal invariants for safety-critical domains.

entry.title: Generating Physically Sound Designs from Text and a Set of Physical Constraints

author.name: Gregory Barber, Todd C. Henry, Mulugeta A. Haile

entry.summary: TIDES jointly optimizes structural topology and visual properties for physical designs using text-image models for visual alignment and differentiable physics simulators for performance, validated through 3D printing experiments.

entry.title: Geometry- and Relation-Aware Diffusion for EEG Super-Resolution

author.name: Laura Yao, Gengwei Zhang, Moajjem Chowdhury, Yunmei Liu, Tianlong Chen

entry.summary: TopoDiff uses topology-aware image embeddings from EEG topographic maps and dynamic channel-relation graphs to guide diffusion-based spatial super-resolution of EEG signals.

entry.title: From Sycophancy to Sensemaking: Premise Governance for Human-AI Decision Making

author.name: Raunak Jain, Mudita Khurana, John Stephens, Srinivas Dharmasanam, Shankar Venkataraman

entry.summary: Proposes shift from answer generation to collaborative premise governance for human-AI decision making, using discrepancy-driven control loops to address sycophancy in high-stakes decisions.

entry.title: Lossless Embedding Compression via Spherical Coordinates

author.name: Han Xiao

entry.summary: Presents lossless compression for unit-norm embeddings using spherical coordinates, achieving 1.5x compression (25% better than prior methods). Exploits that high-dimensional unit vector coordinates concentrate around π/2, enabling entropy coding.

entry.title: Reducing Memorisation in Generative Models via Riemannian Bayesian Inference

author.name: Johanna Marie Gegenfurtner, Albert Kj{\o}ller Jacobsen, Naima Elosegui Borras, Alejandro Valverde Mahou, Georgios Arvanitidis

entry.summary: Addresses memorization in generative models via Riemannian Bayesian inference over flow matching and diffusion model parameters. Constructs predictive posterior capturing data distribution variability while reducing memorization.

entry.title: Agentic Framework for Epidemiological Modeling

author.name: Rituparna Datta, Zihan Guan, Baltazar Espinoza, Yiqi Su, Priya Pitre, Srini Venkatramanan, Naren Ramakrishnan, Anil Vullikanti

entry.summary: Introduces EPIAGENT, an agentic framework that automatically synthesizes, calibrates, and refines epidemiological simulators. Uses explicit flow graph intermediate representation for modular correctness checks before code generation.

entry.title: Open Materials Generation with Inference-Time Reinforcement Learning

author.name: Philipp Hoellmer, Stefano Martiniani

entry.summary: Introduces OMatG-IRL applying policy-gradient RL to flow-based materials generators without requiring explicit score computation. Enables aligning generative models with downstream objectives for inverse materials design.

entry.title: Diffusion LMs Can Approximate Optimal Infilling Lengths Implicitly

author.name: Hengchang Liu, Zhao Yang, Bing Su

entry.summary: Reveals diffusion LMs can implicitly discover optimal infilling length through first-step denoising confidence. Identifies Oracle Peak near ground-truth length and Length Bias, proposing CAL method for calibrated adaptive length search.

entry.title: Minerva: Reinforcement Learning with Verifiable Rewards for Cyber Threat Intelligence LLMs

author.name: Md Tanvirul Alam, Aritran Piplai, Ionut Cardei, Nidhi Rastogi, Peter J Worth Jr

entry.summary: Proposes Minerva applying reinforcement learning with verifiable rewards (RLVR) to cyber threat intelligence LLMs. Leverages CTI standards for deterministic output verification enabling structured training.

entry.title: Bridging Time and Frequency: A Joint Modeling Framework for Irregular Multivariate Time Series Forecasting

author.name: Xiangfei Qiu, Kangjia Yan, Xvyuan Liu, Xingjian Wu, Jilin Hu

entry.summary: Proposes TFMixer for irregular multivariate time series forecasting with joint time-frequency modeling. Uses learnable Non-Uniform DFT for spectral representations and query-based patch mixing for local temporal patterns.

entry.title: Learning Heat-based Equations in Self-similar variables

author.name: Shihao Wang, Qipeng Qian, Jingquan Wang

entry.summary: Develops training framework for neural operators to learn heat-based PDEs in self-similar variables, showing improved extrapolation and asymptotic behavior capture compared to physical-coordinate training.

entry.title: Early Classification of Time Series in Non-Stationary Cost Regimes

author.name: Aur\'elien Renault, Alexis Bondu, Antoine Cornu\'ejols, Vincent Lemaire

entry.summary: Studies early classification of time series when decision costs drift at deployment time or are stochastically realized differently than training. Proposes methods robust to cost non-stationarity.

entry.title: Forest-Guided Semantic Transport for Label-Supervised Manifold Alignment

author.name: Adrien Aumon, Myriam Lizotte, Guy Wolf, Kevin R. Moon, Jake S. Rhodes

entry.summary: Introduces FoSTA for label-supervised manifold alignment using forest-induced geometry to denoise structure and recover task-relevant manifolds before alignment.

entry.title: Modeling Topological Impact on Node Attribute Distributions in Attributed Graphs

author.name: Amirreza Shiralinasab Langari, Leila Yeganeh, Kim Khoa Nguyen

entry.summary: Develops algebraic framework for how graph topology influences node attribute distributions, treating topology and attributes as structurally distinct but interacting components.

entry.title: A Lightweight Sparse Interaction Network for Time Series Forecasting

author.name: Xu Zhang, Qitong Wang, Peng Wang, Wei Wang

entry.summary: Proposes LSINet for time series forecasting with a Multihead Sparse Interaction Mechanism that learns important time step connections through Bernoulli distributions, offering lightweight alternative to transformers and linear models.

entry.title: Observation-dependent Bayesian active learning via input-warped Gaussian processes

author.name: Sanna Jarl, Maria B{\aa}nkestad, Jonathan J. S. Scragg, Jens Sj\"olund

entry.summary: Proposes injecting observation-dependent feedback into Bayesian active learning by warping the input space with learned monotone reparameterization, allowing variance-based acquisition to respond to observed variability.

entry.title: Boundary-Constrained Diffusion Models for Floorplan Generation: Balancing Realism and Diversity

author.name: Leonardo Stoppani, Davide Bacciu, Shahab Mokarizadeh

entry.summary: Proposes Diversity Score metric for floorplan generation and Boundary Cross-Attention module for building boundary conditioning. Reveals diversity collapse during prolonged training undetected by FID.

entry.title: Generalized Optimal Classification Trees: A Mixed-Integer Programming Approach

author.name: Jiancheng Tu, Wenqi Fan, Zhibin Wu

entry.summary: Proposes MIP-based framework for optimal classification trees under nonlinear metrics like F1-score that address class imbalance, with acceleration techniques for scalability.

entry.title: Active Transfer Bagging: A New Approach for Accelerated Active Learning Acquisition of Data by Combined Transfer Learning and Bagging Based Models

author.name: Vivienne Pelletier, Daniel J. Rivera, Obinna Nwokonkwo, Steven A. Wilson, Christopher L. Muhich

entry.summary: Active-Transfer Bagging (ATBagging) improves active learning seed selection by leveraging related datasets through a Bayesian interpretation of bagged ensemble models, comparing in-bag and out-of-bag predictions.

entry.title: On finite-dimensional encoding/decoding theorems for neural operators

author.name: Vin\'icius Luz Oliveira, Vladimir G. Pestov

entry.summary: Generalizes encoding/decoding theorems for neural operators to arbitrary locally convex spaces, removing approximation property assumptions. Shows results hold for all Fréchet spaces.

entry.title: Parametrization of subgrid scales in long-term simulations of the shallow-water equations using machine learning and convex limiting

author.name: Md Amran Hossan Mojamder, Zhihang Xu, Min Wang, Ilya Timofeyev

entry.summary: Neural network parameterization for shallow water equation subgrid fluxes using feed-forward network with local four-point stencil. Improves energy balance in long-term turbulent simulations.

entry.title: Surrogate Ensemble in Expensive Multi-Objective Optimization via Deep Q-Learning

author.name: Yuxin Wu, Hongshu Guo, Ting Huang, Yue-Jiao Gong, Zeyuan Ma

entry.summary: SEEMOO uses deep Q-network to schedule different surrogate models within expensive multi-objective optimization, enabling cooperative use of model ensemble.

entry.title: PDE-Constrained Optimization for Neural Image Segmentation with Physics Priors

author.name: Seema K. Poudel, Sunny K. Khadka

entry.summary: Formulates image segmentation as PDE-constrained optimization, integrating reaction-diffusion and phase-field priors into neural networks via variational regularization for improved stability and generalization.

entry.title: SSNAPS: Audio-Visual Separation of Speech and Background Noise with Diffusion Inverse Sampling

author.name: Yochai Yemini, Yoav Ellinson, Rami Ben-Ari, Sharon Gannot, Ethan Fetaya

entry.summary: Proposes SSNAPS for audio-visual speech separation using diffusion inverse sampling with dedicated priors for clean speech and ambient noise. Unsupervised method outperforms supervised baselines on WER.

entry.title: Non-Uniform Noise-to-Signal Ratio in the REINFORCE Policy-Gradient Estimator

author.name: Haoyu Han, Heng Yang

entry.summary: Characterizes noise-to-signal ratio of REINFORCE estimator exactly for linear/polynomial systems with Gaussian policies, explaining training instability as learning progresses.

entry.title: Minimax optimal differentially private synthetic data for smooth queries

author.name: Rundong Ding, Yiyun He, Yizhe Zhu

entry.summary: Studies differentially private synthetic data for smooth queries, showing that exploiting smoothness beyond Lipschitz bounds yields improved utility. Provides minimax optimal rates.

entry.title: Physics-Informed Chebyshev Polynomial Neural Operator for Parametric Partial Differential Equations

author.name: Biao Chen, Jing Wang, Hairun Xie, Qineng Wang, Shuai Zhang, Yifan Xia, Jifa Zhang

entry.summary: Proposes Physics-Informed Chebyshev Polynomial Neural Operator (CPNO) replacing MLPs with Chebyshev spectral basis for improved stability in physics-informed settings.

entry.title: Learning Sequential Decisions from Multiple Sources via Group-Robust Markov Decision Processes

author.name: Mingyuan Xu, Zongqi Xia, Tianxi Cai, Doudou Zhou, Nian Si

entry.summary: Studies distributionally robust MDPs with group-linear structure for learning from heterogeneous multi-site offline datasets. Develops pessimistic value iteration with per-site estimation.

entry.title: SpikingGamma: Surrogate-Gradient Free and Temporally Precise Online Training of Spiking Neural Networks with Smoothed Delays

author.name: Roel Koopman, Sebastian Otte, Sander Boht\'e

entry.summary: Proposes SpikingGamma for training SNNs without surrogate gradients using smoothed delay representation with gamma distributions, addressing temporal precision in neuromorphic computing.

entry.title: Training-free score-based diffusion for parameter-dependent stochastic dynamical systems

author.name: Minglei Yang, Sicheng He

entry.summary: Proposes training-free conditional diffusion framework for parameter-dependent SDEs using joint kernel-weighted Monte Carlo estimator without neural network training.

entry.title: Personalized Image Generation via Human-in-the-loop Bayesian Optimization

author.name: Rajalaxmi Rajagopalan, Debottam Dutta, Yu-Lin Wei, Romit Roy Choudhury

entry.summary: Proposes MultiBO for personalized image generation using preferential Bayesian optimization when language prompts are insufficient. Leverages human comparison feedback to close gap to mental image.

entry.title: Masked Autoencoders as Universal Speech Enhancer

author.name: Rajalaxmi Rajagopalan, Ritwik Giri, Zhiqiang Tang, Kyu Han

entry.summary: Develops masked autoencoder-based universal speech enhancer that is self-supervised and distortion-agnostic, learning to remove various distortions while reconstructing masked regions.

entry.title: DETOUR: An Interactive Benchmark for Dual-Agent Search and Reasoning

author.name: Li Siyan, Darshan Deshpande, Anand Kannappan, Rebecca Qian

entry.summary: Introduces DETOUR, a dual-agent benchmark for tip-of-the-tongue search where a Primary Agent must identify recollected entities through multi-turn interaction with a Memory Agent. Contains 1,011 prompts testing interactive retrieval.

entry.title: LegalOne: A Family of Foundation Models for Reliable Legal Reasoning

author.name: Haitao Li, Yifan Chen, Shuo Miao, Qian Dong, Jia Chen, Yiran Hu, Junjie Chen, Minghao Qin, Qingyao Ai, Yiqun Liu, Cheng Luo, Quan Zhou, Ya Zhang, Jikun Hu

entry.summary: Introduces LegalOne, a family of Chinese legal domain LLMs developed through a three-phase pipeline including Plasticity-Adjusted Sampling for domain adaptation. Targets judicial reasoning capabilities.

entry.title: Exploring Knowledge Purification in Multi-Teacher Knowledge Distillation for LLMs

author.name: Ruihan Jin, Pengpeng Shao, Zhengqi Wen, Jinyang Wu, Mingkuan Feng, Shuo Yang, Chu Yuan Zhang, Jianhua Tao

entry.summary: Introduces Knowledge Purification concept for multi-teacher distillation that consolidates rationales from multiple teachers into single rationale, mitigating conflicts and enhancing efficiency.

entry.title: Typologically-Informed Candidate Reranking for LLM-based Translation into Low-Resource Languages

author.name: Nipuna Abeykoon, Ashen Weerathunga, Pubudu Wijesinghe, Parameswari Krishnamurthy

entry.summary: Presents framework using linguistic typology for low-resource translation without parallel data. Includes Universal Metalinguistic Framework with 16 typological dimensions and typological compliance scoring.

entry.title: MedAraBench: Large-Scale Arabic Medical Question Answering Dataset and Benchmark

author.name: Mouath Abu-Daoud, Leen Kharouf, Omar El Hajj, Dana El Samad, Mariam Al-Omari, Jihad Mallat, Khaled Saleh, Nizar Habash, Farah E. Shamout

entry.summary: Introduces MedAraBench, a large-scale Arabic medical QA dataset manually digitized from academic materials by medical professionals, with training/test splits for multilingual medical AI.

entry.title: WorldCup Sampling for Multi-bit LLM Watermarking

author.name: Yidan Wang, Yubing Ren, Yanan Cao, Li Guo

entry.summary: Proposes WorldCup, a multi-bit watermarking framework embedding message bits directly into token selection via hierarchical competition with entropy-aware modulation.

entry.title: CodeOCR: On the Effectiveness of Vision Language Models in Code Understanding

author.name: Yuling Shi, Chaoxiang Xie, Zhensu Sun, Yeheng Chen, Chenxu Zhang, Longfei Yun, Chengcheng Wan, Hongyu Zhang, David Lo, Xiaodong Gu

entry.summary: Proposes treating source code as rendered images for multimodal LLMs to process, exploiting image compression to reduce computational costs compared to text tokenization. Tests vision-language models on code understanding tasks with potential efficiency gains.

entry.title: Closing the Loop: Universal Repository Representation with RPG-Encoder

author.name: Jane Luo, Chengyu Yin, Xin Zhang, Qingtao Li, Steven Liu, Yiming Huang, Jie Wu, Hao Liu, Yangyu Huang, Yu Kang, Fangkai Yang, Ying Xin, Scarlett Li

entry.summary: RPG-Encoder creates unified repository representations by treating comprehension and generation as inverse processes, combining semantic features with code dependencies in a bidirectional framework.

entry.title: Language Steering for Multilingual In-Context Learning

author.name: Neeraja Kirtane, Kuan-Hao Huang

entry.summary: Proposes training-free language vectors that leverage activation differences between source and target languages to steer multilingual in-context learning, addressing performance gaps on non-English languages.

entry.title: Adapting Where It Matters: Depth-Aware Adaptation for Efficient Multilingual Speech Recognition in Low-Resource Languages

author.name: Yang Xiao, Eun-Jung Holden, Ting Dang

entry.summary: DAMA adapts speech recognition models with depth-aware LoRA, finding U-shaped pattern where early and late layers need more adaptation while intermediate layers retain shared semantics.

entry.title: Shedding the Facades, Connecting the Domains: Detecting Shifting Multimodal Hate Video with Test-Time Adaptation

author.name: Jiao Li, Jian Lang, Xikai Tang, Wenzheng Shu, Ting Zhong, Qiang Gao, Yong Wang, Leiting Chen, Fan Zhou

entry.summary: SCANNER is first test-time adaptation framework for hate video detection, addressing severe semantic drift as hateful content evolves to evade censorship.

entry.title: YOLOE-26: Integrating YOLO26 with YOLOE for Real-Time Open-Vocabulary Instance Segmentation

author.name: Ranjan Sapkota, Manoj Karkee

entry.summary: YOLOE-26 integrates YOLO26 architecture with YOLOE's open-vocabulary learning for real-time open-vocabulary instance segmentation, replacing fixed class logits with object embedding head.

entry.title: MASC: Metal-Aware Sampling and Correction via Reinforcement Learning for Accelerated MRI

entry.summary: MASC is unified RL framework jointly optimizing metal-aware k-space sampling and artifact correction for accelerated MRI, with physics-based simulation for paired training data.

entry.title: Enhancing Open-Vocabulary Object Detection through Multi-Level Fine-Grained Visual-Language Alignment

author.name: Tianyi Zhang, Antoine Simoulin, Kai Li, Sana Lakdawala, Shiqing Yu, Arpit Mittal, Hongyu Fu, Yu Lin

entry.summary: Proposes VLDet for open-vocabulary object detection with multi-level fine-grained visual-language alignment through a feature pyramid approach. Addresses challenges of adapting CLIP to detection frameworks.

entry.title: HPC: Hierarchical Point-based Latent Representation for Streaming Dynamic Gaussian Splatting Compression

author.name: Yangzhi Ma, Bojun Liu, Wenting Liao, Dong Liu, Zhu Li, Li Li

entry.summary: Introduces HPC for streaming dynamic Gaussian Splatting compression using hierarchical point-based latent representation to exploit local correlations while avoiding modeling unoccupied space.

entry.title: JoyAvatar: Unlocking Highly Expressive Avatars via Harmonized Text-Audio Conditioning

author.name: Ruikui Wang, Jinheng Feng, Lang Tian, Huaishao Luo, Chaochao Li, Liangbo Zhou, Huan Zhang, Youzheng Wu, Xiaodong He

entry.summary: Presents JoyAvatar for generating long-duration avatar videos with improved text-audio alignment using twin-teacher enhanced training for handling complex prompts with full-body movement and camera trajectories.

entry.title: Invariance on Manifolds: Understanding Robust Visual Representations for Place Recognition

author.name: Jintao Cheng, Weibin Li, Zhijian He, Jin Wu, Chi Man Vong, Wei Zhang

entry.summary: Proposes second-order geometric statistics framework for visual place recognition using covariance descriptors on SPD manifolds without training, achieving robustness to environmental changes.

entry.title: FUSE-Flow: Scalable Real-Time Multi-View Point Cloud Reconstruction Using Confidence

author.name: Chentian Sun

entry.summary: Proposes FUSE-Flow for real-time multi-view point cloud reconstruction using confidence-based fusion, achieving scalability to many cameras with quality preservation.

entry.title: EMFormer: Efficient Multi-Scale Transformer for Accumulative Context Weather Forecasting

author.name: Hao Chen, Tao Han, Jie Zhang, Song Guo, Fenghua Ling, Lei Bai

entry.summary: Proposes EMFormer for long-term weather forecasting with efficient multi-scale transformer and accumulative context finetuning to reduce error accumulation and training overhead.

entry.title: Interacted Planes Reveal 3D Line Mapping

author.name: Zeran Ke, Bin Tan, Gui-Song Xia, Yujun Shen, Nan Xue

entry.summary: Proposes LiP-Map for 3D line mapping from RGB images by modeling lines as edges of planar patches, pioneering integration of planar topology for accurate and efficient reconstruction.

entry.title: BioTamperNet: Affinity-Guided State-Space Model Detecting Tampered Biomedical Images

author.name: Soumyaroop Nandi, Prem Natarajan

entry.summary: Proposes BioTamperNet for detecting duplicated regions in tampered biomedical images using affinity-guided attention inspired by SSM approximations for scientific integrity.

entry.title: Samba+: General and Accurate Salient Object Detection via A More Unified Mamba-based Framework

author.name: Wenzhuo Zhao, Keren Fu, Jiahao He, Xiaohong Liu, Qijun Zhao, Guangtao Zhai

entry.title: Federated Vision Transformer with Adaptive Focal Loss for Medical Image Classification

author.name: Xinyuan Zhao, Yihang Wu, Ahmad Chaddad, Tareef Daqqaq, Reem Kateb

entry.summary: Proposes federated learning framework for medical image classification using Vision Transformer with dynamic adaptive focal loss and client-aware aggregation to handle data heterogeneity and class imbalance.

entry.title: VRGaussianAvatar: Integrating 3D Gaussian Avatars into VR

author.name: Hail Song, Boram Yoon, Seokhwan Yang, Seoyoung Kang, Hyunjeong Kim, Henning Metzmacher, Woontack Woo

entry.summary: Presents VRGaussianAvatar for real-time full-body 3DGS avatars in VR using only HMD tracking. Introduces Binocular Batching for efficient stereo rendering.

author.name: Qian Xu, Xi Li, Fei Gao, Jie Guo, Haojuan Yuan, Shuaipeng Fan, Mingjin Zhang

entry.summary: Introduces SPIRIT for adapting Vision Foundation Models to infrared small target detection with memory-attention temporal propagation unifying single and multi-frame inference.

entry.title: Trust but Verify: Adaptive Conditioning for Reference-Based Diffusion Super-Resolution via Implicit Reference Correlation Modeling

author.name: Yuan Wang, Yuhao Wan, Siming Zheng, Bo Li, Qibin Hou, Peng-Tao Jiang

entry.summary: Proposes Ada-RefSR for reference-based super-resolution using 'Trust but Verify' principle with Adaptive Implicit Correlation Gating to handle unreliable correspondences.

entry.title: Teacher-Guided Student Self-Knowledge Distillation Using Diffusion Model

author.name: Yu Wang, Chuanguang Yang, Zhulin An, Weilun Feng, Jiarui Zhao, Chengqing Yu, Libo Huang, Boyu Diao, Yongjun Xu

entry.summary: Proposes DSKD using diffusion models for knowledge distillation with teacher-guided denoising of student features and locality-sensitive hashing loss.

entry.title: Deep learning enables urban change profiling through alignment of historical maps

author.name: Sidi Wu, Yizi Chen, Maurizio Gribaudi, Konrad Schindler, Cl\'ement Mallet, Julien Perret, Lorenz Hurni

entry.summary: Presents fully automated deep learning framework for urban change analysis from historical maps with dense alignment, multi-temporal detection, and change profiling.

entry.title: Enhancing Indoor Occupancy Prediction via Sparse Query-Based Multi-Level Consistent Knowledge Distillation

author.name: Xiang Li, Yupeng Zheng, Pengfei Li, Yilun Chen, Ya-Qin Zhang, Wenchao Ding

entry.summary: Introduces DiScene for sparse query-based indoor occupancy prediction with multi-level consistent knowledge distillation from large teacher models.

entry.title: Uncertainty-Aware Image Classification In Biomedical Imaging Using Spectral-normalized Neural Gaussian Processes

author.name: Uma Meleti, Jeffrey J. Nirschl

entry.summary: Implements Spectral-normalized Neural Gaussian Process (SNGP) for uncertainty-aware image classification in biomedical imaging, improving OOD detection without ensembles.

entry.title: Catalyst: Out-of-Distribution Detection via Elastic Scaling

author.name: Abid Hassan, Tuan Ngo, Saad Shafiq, Nenad Medvidovic

entry.summary: Proposes Catalyst for OOD detection exploiting under-utilized channel-wise statistics from pre-pooling feature maps to compute input-dependent scaling factors.

entry.title: APEX: A Decoupled Memory-based Explorer for Asynchronous Aerial Object Goal Navigation

author.name: Daoxuan Zhang, Ping Chen, Xiaobo Xia, Xiu Su, Ruichen Zhen, Jianqiang Xiao, Shuo Yang

entry.summary: Introduces APEX, a hierarchical agent for aerial object goal navigation using dynamic spatio-semantic mapping and LLM-based decision making for UAVs.

entry.title: UniMotion: A Unified Motion Framework for Simulation, Prediction and Planning

author.name: Nan Song, Junzhe Jiang, Jingyu Li, Xiatian Zhu, Li Zhang

entry.summary: Introduces UniMotion, a unified framework for motion simulation, prediction, and planning in autonomous driving, leveraging shared capabilities across tasks.

entry.title: Physics-informed Diffusion Mamba Transformer for Real-world Driving

author.name: Hang Zhou, Qiang Zhang, Peiran Liu, Yihao Qin, Zhaoxu Yan, Yiding Ji

entry.summary: Combines Diffusion, Mamba, Transformer, and Port-Hamiltonian Neural Networks for physics-informed trajectory planning in autonomous driving.

entry.title: Learning Adaptive Cross-Embodiment Visuomotor Policy with Contrastive Prompt Orchestration

author.name: Yuhang Zhang, Chao Yan, Jiaxi Yu, Jiaping Xiao, Mir Feroskhan

entry.summary: Proposes CAPO for cross-embodiment visuomotor policy learning using contrastive prompt learning and adaptive prompt orchestration.

entry.title: Reinforcement Learning for Active Perception in Autonomous Navigation

author.name: Grzegorz Malczyk, Mihir Kulkarni, Kostas Alexis

entry.summary: Proposes end-to-end RL framework for active perception in autonomous navigation where robot controls both motion and camera for information gathering.

entry.title: Uncertainty-Aware Non-Prehensile Manipulation with Mobile Manipulators under Object-Induced Occlusion

author.name: Jiwoo Hwang, Taegeun Yang, Jeil Jeong, Minsung Yoon, Sung-Eui Yoon

entry.summary: Proposes CURA-PPO, RL framework for non-prehensile manipulation under object-induced occlusion, modeling uncertainty to enable active perception.

entry.title: BTGenBot-2: Efficient Behavior Tree Generation with Small Language Models

author.name: Riccardo Andrea Izzo, Gianluca Bardaro, Matteo Matteucci

entry.summary: Introduces BTGenBot-2, a 1B-parameter small language model for converting natural language to executable behavior trees for robots.

entry.title: Relationship-Aware Hierarchical 3D Scene Graph for Task Reasoning

author.name: Albert Gassol Puigjaner, Angelos Zacharia, Kostas Alexis

entry.summary: Proposes hierarchical 3D scene graphs integrating open-vocabulary features and object-relational reasoning via Vision Language Models for autonomous navigation and task reasoning.

author.name: Jiaqi Xu, Tao Huang, Kai Zhang

entry.title: Sublinear Time Quantum Algorithm for Attention Approximation

author.name: Zhao Song, Jianfei Xue, Jiahao Zhang, Lichen Zhang

entry.summary: Proposes quantum algorithm approximating attention rows in sublinear time O(n^0.x) using only row queries to Q, K, V matrices via quantum data structures.

author.name: Ying Shu, Pujian Zhan, Huiqi Yang, Hehe Fan, Youfang Lin, Kai Lv

entry.summary: Proposes DRFormer for person re-identification combining DINO (fine-grained textures) and CLIP (global semantics) features through dual-regularized bidirectional transformer.

author.name: Ayushman Sarkar, Zhenyu Yu, Chu Chen, Wei Tang, Kangning Cui, Mohd Yamani Idna Idris

entry.summary: Proposes ReDiStory for consistent visual story generation via region-disentangled diffusion that decomposes embeddings into identity and frame-specific components to reduce inter-frame interference.

entry.title: Autonomous Data Processing using Meta-Agents

author.name: Udayan Khurana

entry.summary: Presents ADP-MA framework where meta-agents dynamically construct, execute, and refine data processing pipelines through hierarchical orchestration. Enables autonomous monitoring and optimization beyond traditional static pipelines.

entry.title: OpenGuanDan: A Large-Scale Imperfect Information Game Benchmark

author.name: Chao Li, Shangdong Yang, Chiheng Zhan, Zhenxing Ge, Yujing Hu, Bingkun Bao, Xingguo Chen, Yang Gao

entry.summary: Develops LLM-based chained prompt framework for automating systematic review search strategy development, replicating manual design procedures while leveraging LLMs for PICO extraction and query formalization.

author.name: Yingquan Wang, Tianyu Wei, Qinsi Li, Li Zeng

entry.summary: Proposes Generative GraphRAG framework for automated knowledge modeling and personalized exercise generation in educational systems, addressing scalability limitations of manual knowledge graph curation.

entry.title: Synthetic Student Responses: LLM-Extracted Features for IRT Difficulty Parameter Estimation

author.name: Matias Hoyl

entry.summary: Uses LLM-extracted features including solution steps, cognitive complexity, and misconceptions to estimate IRT difficulty parameters without student testing, using neural network trained on synthetic responses.

entry.title: Quantum Circuit-Based Learning Models: Bridging Quantum Computing and Machine Learning

author.name: Fan Fan, Yilei Shi, Mihai Datcu, Bertrand Le Saux, Luigi Iapichino, Francesca Bovolo, Silvia Liberata Ullo, Xiao Xiang Zhu

entry.summary: Comprehensive survey on quantum circuit-based machine learning bridging quantum computing and ML, covering the integration of these fields and recent research trends.

entry.title: SPGCL: Effective Graph Contrastive Learning via SVD-Guided Structural Perturbation

author.name: Hao Deng, Yingping Li, Shuiping Gou, Bo Liu

entry.summary: Proposes SPGCL combining SVD-guided structural perturbation with stochastic edge removal for robust graph contrastive learning, addressing limitations of random and purely spectral augmentations.

entry.summary: Presents SITUATE synthetic dataset for training VLMs on counting tasks with spatial constraints, showing finetuning improves out-of-distribution generalization compared to real data finetuning.

author.name: Alexander Blezinger, Wolfgang Nejdl, Ming Tang

entry.summary: Systematically evaluates histopathology foundation models for regression-based HRD score prediction, comparing five state-of-the-art models against contrastive learning baselines.

entry.summary: Introduces calibration framework for survival models with competing risks, proposing two novel calibration measures that are proper (minimized for oracle estimators) and showing existing measures are inadequate.

author.name: Zafar Iqbal, Anwar Ul Haq, Srimannarayana Grandhi

entry.summary: Proposes hybrid quantum-classical attention model for quantum phase recognition using swap tests and parameterized quantum circuits to classify ground states in many-body systems.

entry.title: S$^3$POT: Contrast-Driven Face Occlusion Segmentation via Self-Supervised Prompt Learning

entry.summary: Uses MLLMs with remote sensing imagery for UAV emergency landing site assessment, combining semantic segmentation with vision-language reasoning for hazard detection.

author.name: Arijit Chakma, Peng He, Honglu Liu, Zeyuan Wang, Tingting Li, Tiffany D. Do, Feng Liu

entry.summary: Proposes DrawSim-PD for generating NGSS-aligned student-like science drawings with controllable pedagogical imperfections using capability profiles for teacher professional development.

author.name: Minghao Li, Ruihang Wang, Rui Tan, Yonggang Wen

entry.summary: DCoPilot combines LLMs for interpreting operational specifications with deep RL for generating control policies in data centers, enabling rapid adaptation to changing workloads and SLA requirements.

author.name: Marina Mastroleo, Alberto Archetti, Federico Mastroleo, Matteo Matteucci

entry.summary: SurvKAN replaces restrictive Cox model assumptions with Kolmogorov-Arnold Networks for survival analysis, enabling learning of non-linear covariate effects while maintaining interpretability for clinical adoption.
