entry.summary: multipanda_ros2 provides open-source ROS2 architecture for multi-robot Franka control with 1kHz real-time torque control and sub-2ms controller switching for reproducible benchmarking.

entry.title: Spark: Modular Spiking Neural Networks

author.name: Mario Franco, Carlos Gershenson

entry.summary: Spark framework for modular spiking neural networks designed for efficient hardware implementation with flexible plasticity mechanisms for improved data efficiency.

entry.title: Artificial Intelligence and Symmetries: Learning, Encoding, and Discovering Structure in Physical Data

author.name: Veronica Sanz

entry.summary: Review of how machine learning can identify, encode, and discover symmetries in physical data through representation learning, focusing on data-driven approaches rather than architecture-enforced symmetries.

entry.title: GEPC: Group-Equivariant Posterior Consistency for Out-of-Distribution Detection in Diffusion Models

author.name: Aikaterini Karoni, Rajit Rajpal, Benedict Leimkuhler, Gabriel Stoltz

entry.summary: Proposes continuous-time optimization with adaptive per-parameter momentum regulated by kinetic energy. Relates adaptive friction to cubic damping from structural dynamics. Shows robustness matching or outperforming Adam on ViT, BERT, GPT2.

entry.title: Fed-Listing: Federated Label Distribution Inference in Graph Neural Networks

author.name: Suprim Nakarmi, Junggab Son, Yue Zhao, Zuobin Xiong

entry.summary: Introduces Fed-Listing attack inferring label distributions from gradient updates in Federated Graph Neural Networks. Demonstrates privacy vulnerability even in federated settings.

entry.title: Partition of Unity Neural Networks for Interpretable Classification with Explicit Class Regions

author.name: Akram Aldroubi

entry.summary: Introduces Partition of Unity Neural Networks where class probabilities arise directly from learned partition of unity without softmax. Each function directly represents P(class|x) with explicit class regions.

entry.title: OpenDDI: A Comprehensive Benchmark for DDI Prediction

author.name: Xinmo Jin, Bowen Fan, Xunkai Li, Henan Sun, YuXin Zeng, Zekai Chen, Yuxuan Sun, Jia Li, Qiangqiang Dai, Hongchao Qin, Rong-Hua Li, Guoren Wang

entry.title: PHAT: Modeling Period Heterogeneity for Multivariate Time Series Forecasting

author.name: Jiaming Ma, Guanjun Wang, Qihe Huang, Sheng Huang, Haofeng Ma, Zhengyang Zhou, Pengkun Wang, Binwu Wang, Yang Wang

entry.title: MGKAN: Predicting Asymmetric Drug-Drug Interactions via a Multimodal Graph Kolmogorov-Arnold Network

author.name: Kunyi Fan, Mengjie Chen, Longlong Li, Cunquan Qu

entry.summary: Proposes MGKAN using Graph Kolmogorov-Arnold Networks with learnable basis functions for asymmetric drug-drug interaction prediction, integrating multiple network views.

entry.title: Deep Multivariate Models with Parametric Conditionals

author.name: Dmitrij Schlesinger, Boris Flach, Alexander Shekhovtsov

entry.summary: Proposes representing joint distributions through conditional distributions for each variable group, enabling flexible use for various downstream tasks from a single model.

entry.title: SNAP: A Self-Consistent Agreement Principle with Application to Robust Computation

author.name: Xiaoyi Jiang, Andreas Nienk\"otter

entry.summary: Introduces SNAP (Self-coNsistent Agreement Principle) for robust computation based on mutual agreement, with exponential suppression of outlier weights.

entry.title: Maximizing Reliability with Bayesian Optimization

author.name: Jack M. Buckingham, Ivo Couckuyt, Juergen Branke

entry.summary: Proposes Thompson sampling and knowledge gradient methods for Bayesian optimization targeting extremely rare failure probabilities (10^-6 to 10^-8) in manufacturing reliability, incorporating importance sampling.

entry.summary: Proposes workflow aligning experimental databases with CIF files to enable GNN training for materials property prediction from experimental data.

entry.title: Robust Sublinear Convergence Rates for Iterative Bregman Projections

entry.title: Robust Generalization with Adaptive Optimal Transport Priors for Decision-Focused Learning

author.name: Haixiang Sun, Andrew L. Liu

entry.summary: Proposes Prototype-Guided DRO for few-shot learning, learning class-adaptive priors via hierarchical optimal transport and embedding them in Sinkhorn DRO for robust decisions.

entry.title: Cross-Domain Fake News Detection on Unseen Domains via LLM-Based Domain-Aware User Modeling

author.name: Xuankai Yang, Yan Wang, Jiajie Zhu, Pengfei Ding, Hongyang Liu, Xiuzhen Zhang, Huan Liu

author.name: Gachon Erell, J\'er\'emie Bigot, Elsa Cazelles

entry.title: Well-Posed KL-Regularized Control via Wasserstein and Kalman-Wasserstein KL Divergences

author.name: Viktor Stein, Adwait Datar, Nihat Ay

entry.title: CURP: Codebook-based Continuous User Representation for Personalized Generation with LLMs

entry.summary: Proposes CURP, a personalization framework using bidirectional user encoder and discrete prototype codebook to extract user traits. Achieves plug-and-play personalization with ~20M trainable parameters.

entry.title: Ebisu: Benchmarking Large Language Models in Japanese Finance

author.name: Xueqing Peng, Ruoyu Xiang, Fan Zhang, Mingzi Song, Mingyang Jiang, Yan Wang, Lingfei Qian, Taiki Hara, Yuqing Guo, Jimin Huang, Junichi Tsujii, Sophia Ananiadou

entry.summary: Introduces Ebisu benchmark for Japanese financial language understanding with expert-annotated tasks testing implicit commitment recognition and financial terminology extraction.

entry.title: WildGraphBench: Benchmarking GraphRAG with Wild-Source Corpora

author.name: Pengyu Wang, Benfeng Xu, Licheng Zhang, Shaohan Wang, Mingxuan Du, Chiwei Zhu, Zhendong Mao

entry.summary: WildGraphBench evaluates GraphRAG systems using Wikipedia's structure with long, heterogeneous reference documents, providing more realistic evaluation than curated short passages.

entry.title: Cross-Lingual Stability of LLM Judges Under Controlled Generation: Evidence from Finno-Ugric Languages

author.name: Isaac Chung, Linda Freienthal

entry.summary: Studies cross-lingual evaluation stability by testing LLM judges on synthetic dialogues across Estonian, Finnish, and Hungarian, finding systematic ranking instabilities between languages.

entry.title: Deep Learning Pose Estimation for Multi-Label Recognition of Combined Hyperkinetic Movement Disorders

author.name: Laura Cif, Diane Demailly, Gabriella A. Horv\`ath, Juan Dario Ortigoza Escobar, Nathalie Dorison, Mayt\'e Castro Jim\'enez, C\'ecile A. Hubsch, Thomas Wirth, Gun-Marie Hariz, Sophie Huby, Morgan Dornadic, Zohra Souei, Muhammad Mushhood Ur Rehman, Simone Hemm, Mehdi Boulayme, Eduardo M. Moraud, Jocelyne Bloch, Xavier Vasques

entry.summary: Deep learning pose estimation for recognizing multiple co-occurring hyperkinetic movement disorders from routine clinical videos, achieving classification from pose-derived kinematic features.

entry.title: On the Assessment of Sensitivity of Autonomous Vehicle Perception

author.name: Apostol Vassilev, Munawar Hasan, Edward Griffor, Honglan Jin, Pavel Piliptchak, Mahima Arora, Thoshitha Gamage

entry.summary: Evaluates autonomous vehicle perception sensitivity using ensemble models and adversarial perturbations, providing robustness assessment methodology for AV systems.

entry.title: Robust automatic brain vessel segmentation in 3D CTA scans using dynamic 4D-CTA data

author.name: Alberto Mario Ceballos-Arroyo, Shrikanth M. Yadav, Chu-Hsuan Lin, Jisoo Kim, Geoffrey S. Young, Huaizu Jiang, Lei Qin

entry.summary: Novel methodology for brain vessel annotation using 4D-CTA dynamic scans, subtracting bone and soft tissue across time points to enhance vessel visualization for deep learning training.

entry.title: PSGS: Text-driven Panorama Sliding Scene Generation via Gaussian Splatting

author.name: Xin Zhang, Shen Chen, Jiale Zhou, Lei Li

entry.summary: PSGS generates text-driven panoramic 3D scenes using two-layer optimization (layout reasoning + self-optimization) and panorama sliding mechanism for globally consistent Gaussian Splatting.

entry.title: SPARK: Stochastic Propagation via Affinity-guided Random walK for training-free unsupervised segmentation

author.name: Kunal Mahatha, Jose Dolz, Christian Desrosiers

entry.summary: SPARK training-free segmentation using stochastic random walks on affinity graphs, challenging spectral partitioning assumptions. Addresses cluster pre-selection and boundary oversmoothing limitations.

entry.title: Bridging Degradation Discrimination and Generation for Universal Image Restoration

author.name: JiaKui Hu, Zhengjian Yao, Lujia Jin, Yanye Lu

entry.summary: Presents BDG for universal image restoration that bridges degradation discrimination and generation using multi-angle/scale gray level co-occurrence matrices. Proposes a three-stage diffusion training process.

entry.title: Video Understanding: Through A Temporal Lens

author.name: Thong Thanh Nguyen

entry.summary: PhD thesis exploring temporal relations for video understanding with contributions including automatic annotation with VLMs, recurrent adapters for temporal dynamics, and State Space Layers for long-form video.

entry.title: DVLA-RL: Dual-Level Vision-Language Alignment with Reinforcement Learning Gating for Few-Shot Learning

author.name: Wenhao Li, Xianjing Meng, Qiangchang Wang, Zhongyi Han, Zhibin Wu, Yilong Yin

entry.summary: Proposes DVLA-RL for few-shot learning with dual-level vision-language alignment using LLM-generated attributes and reinforcement learning gating for adaptive fusion.

entry.title: GMAC: Global Multi-View Constraint for Automatic Multi-Camera Extrinsic Calibration

author.name: Chentian Sun

entry.summary: Proposes GMAC for multi-camera extrinsic calibration using implicit geometric representations learned by multi-view reconstruction networks, modeling extrinsics as global variables.

entry.title: Baseline Method of the Foundation Model Challenge for Ultrasound Image Analysis

author.name: Bo Deng, Yitong Tang, Jiake Li, Yuxin Huang, Li Wang, Yu Zhang, Yufei Zhan, Hua Lu, Xiaoshen Zhang, Jieyun Bai

entry.summary: Presents official baseline for FM_UIA 2026 ultrasound foundation model challenge using Multi-Head Multi-Task Learning framework supporting segmentation, classification, detection, and regression.

entry.title: OASIS-DC: Generalizable Depth Completion via Output-level Alignment of Sparse-Integrated Monocular Pseudo Depth

author.name: Jaehyeon Cho, Jhonghyun An

entry.summary: Proposes OASIS-DC for generalizable depth completion by calibrating relative monocular depth with sparse measurements to create pseudo metric depth priors for refinement.

entry.title: MTC-VAE: Multi-Level Temporal Compression with Content Awareness

author.name: Yubo Dong, Linchao Zhu

entry.summary: Proposes MTC-VAE for multi-level temporal compression in video VAEs through minimal fine-tuning, analyzing how compression levels affect different video content types.

entry.title: UV-M3TL: A Unified and Versatile Multimodal Multi-Task Learning Framework for Assistive Driving Perception

author.name: Wenzhuo Liu, Qiannan Guo, Zhen Wang, Wenshuo Wang, Lei Yang, Yicheng Qiao, Lening Wang, Zhiwei Li, Chen Lv, Shanghang Zhang, Junqiang Xi, Huaping Liu

entry.summary: Proposes UV-M3TL framework for unified multimodal multi-task learning in driver assistance, jointly recognizing driver behavior, emotion, vehicle behavior, and traffic context while mitigating negative transfer.

entry.title: SMTrack: State-Aware Mamba for Efficient Temporal Modeling in Visual Tracking

author.name: Yinchao Ma, Dengqing Yang, Zhangyu He, Wenfei Yang, Tianzhu Zhang

entry.summary: Proposes SMTrack using Mamba state space model for visual tracking with efficient temporal modeling. Provides neat training and tracking pipeline without custom modules.

entry.title: MagicFuse: Single Image Fusion for Visual and Semantic Reinforcement

author.name: Hao Zhang, Yanping Zha, Zizhuo Li, Meiqi Gong, Jiayi Ma

entry.summary: Proposes MagicFuse for single-image fusion that derives cross-spectral scene representation from a single low-quality visible image using diffusion models.

entry.title: LDRNet: Large Deformation Registration Model for Chest CT Registration

author.name: Cheng Wang, Qiyu Gao, Fandong Zhang, Shu Zhang, Yizhou Yu

entry.summary: Proposes LDRNet for chest CT registration handling large deformations with coarse-to-fine refinement and rigid transformation learning.

entry.title: Leveraging Latent Vector Prediction for Localized Control in Image Generation via Diffusion Models

author.name: Pablo Domingo-Gregorio, Javier Ruiz-Hidalgo

entry.summary: Proposes methodology for precise local control over user-defined image regions in diffusion models through latent vector prediction.

entry.title: Eliminating Registration Bias in Synthetic CT Generation: A Physics-Based Simulation Framework

author.name: Lukas Zimmermann, Michael Rauter, Maximilian Schmid, Dietmar Georg, Barbara Kn\"ausl

entry.summary: Proposes physics-based CBCT simulation to provide geometrically aligned training pairs for synthetic CT generation, addressing registration bias in supervised learning.

entry.title: LIEREx: Language-Image Embeddings for Robotic Exploration

author.name: Felix Igelbrink, Lennart Niecksch, Marian Renz, Martin G\"unther, Martin Atzmueller

entry.summary: Presents LIEREx, integrating CLIP-based vision-language models with 3D semantic scene graphs for open-set robotic exploration and navigation.

entry.title: USS-Nav: Unified Spatio-Semantic Scene Graph for Lightweight UAV Zero-Shot Object Navigation

author.name: Weiqi Gai, Yuman Gao, Yuan Zhou, Yufan Xie, Zhiyang Liu, Yuze Wu, Xin Zhou, Fei Gao, Zhijun Meng

entry.summary: Presents USS-Nav, a lightweight framework for zero-shot UAV navigation using spatio-semantic scene graphs with LLM-augmented reasoning.

entry.title: Learning When to Jump for Off-road Navigation

author.name: Zhipeng Zhao, Taimeng Fu, Shaoshu Su, Qiwei Du, Ehsan Tarkesh Esfahani, Karthik Dantu, Souma Chowdhury, Chen Wang

entry.summary: Introduces Motion-aware Traversability (MAT) that models terrain cost as a function of velocity, enabling safe high-speed maneuvers like jumps in off-road driving.

entry.title: A Closed-Form Geometric Retargeting Solver for Upper Body Humanoid Robot Teleoperation

author.name: Chuizheng Kong, Yunho Cho, Wonsuhk Jung, Idris Wibowo, Parth Shinde, Sundhar Vinodh-Sangeetha, Long Kiu Chung, Zhenyang Chen, Andrew Mattei, Advaith Nidumukkala, Alexander Elias, Danfei Xu, Taylor Higgins, Shreyas Kousik

entry.summary: Introduces SEW-Mimic, a closed-form geometric solution for humanoid teleoperation retargeting based on shoulder-elbow-wrist orientation alignment.

entry.title: From Knowing to Doing Precisely: A General Self-Correction and Termination Framework for VLA models

author.name: Wentao Zhang, Aolan Sun, Wentao Mo, Xiaoyang Qu, Yuxin Zheng, Jianzong Wang

entry.summary: Proposes VLA-SCT, a training-free self-correction framework for VLA models addressing spatial deviations and task completion recognition.

entry.title: Dimension-Free Multimodal Sampling via Preconditioned Annealed Langevin Dynamics

author.name: Lorenzo Baldassari, Josselin Garnier, Knut Solna, Maarten V. de Hoop

entry.summary: Provides dimension-free analysis of continuous-time Annealed Langevin Dynamics for multimodal targets approximable by Gaussian mixtures. Proves stability guarantees independent of dimension.

entry.title: Inter- and Intra-Subject Variability in EEG: A Systematic Survey

author.name: Xuan-The Tran, Thien-Nhan Vo, Son-Tung Vu, Thoa-Thi Tran, Manh-Dat Nguyen, Thomas Do, Chin-Teng Lin

entry.summary: Systematic survey of inter- and intra-subject variability in EEG across resting-state, ERP, and task-related paradigms. Finds inter-subject differences typically larger than within-subject fluctuations with feature-dependent stability.

entry.title: LocalScore: Local Density-Aware Similarity Scoring for Biometrics

author.name: Yiyang Su, Minchul Kim, Jie Zhu, Christopher Perry, Feng Liu, Anil Jain, Xiaoming Liu

entry.summary: Proposes LocalScore for open-set biometrics that incorporates local density of gallery feature distribution using k-nearest neighbors, providing plug-and-play improvement for any system.

entry.title: Koo-Fu CLIP: Closed-Form Adaptation of Vision-Language Models via Fukunaga-Koontz Linear Discriminant Analysis

author.name: Matej Suchanek, Klara Janouskova, Ondrej Vasatko, Jiri Matas

entry.summary: Proposes Koo-Fu CLIP for supervised CLIP adaptation using Fukunaga-Koontz Linear Discriminant Analysis in whitened embedding space for closed-form efficient adaptation.

entry.title: TF-Lane: Traffic Flow Module for Robust Lane Perception

author.name: Yihan Xie, Han Xia, Zhen Yang

entry.summary: Proposes TF-Lane that integrates traffic flow information for robust lane perception in scenarios with insufficient visual cues like occlusions or missing lane markings.

entry.title: T2M Mamba: Motion Periodicity-Saliency Coupling Approach for Stable Text-Driven Motion Generation

author.name: Xingzu Zhan, Chen Xie, Honghang Chen, Yixun Lin, Xiaochun Mai

entry.summary: Proposes T2M Mamba for text-to-motion generation addressing periodicity-saliency coupling and semantic paraphrase sensitivity using Mamba architecture with coupled modeling.

entry.title: Uncovering Latent Communication Patterns in Brain Networks via Adaptive Flow Routing

author.name: Tianhao Huang, Guanghui Min, Zhenyu Lei, Aiying Zhang, Chen Chen

entry.summary: Proposes adaptive flow routing approach to uncover latent communication patterns between brain regions by modeling multi-modal SC-FC relationships. Uses neuroscience insights to explain coupling-heterogeneity dynamics.

entry.title: Neuro-symbolic AI for Predictive Maintenance (PdM) -- review and recommendations

author.name: Kyle Hamilton, Ali Intizar

entry.summary: Systematic review of neuro-symbolic AI approaches for predictive maintenance in industrial settings. Identifies limitations of pure deep learning including data requirements, generalization, and transparency.

entry.title: Transforming Vehicle Diagnostics: A Multimodal Approach to Error Patterns Prediction

author.name: Hugo Math, Rainer Lienhart

entry.summary: Introduces BiCarFormer for multimodal vehicle diagnostics integrating DTC sequences with environmental sensor data. First multimodal approach to multi-label error pattern classification.

entry.title: ToPT: Task-Oriented Prompt Tuning for Urban Region Representation Learning

author.name: Zitao Guo, Changyang Jiang, Tianhong Zhao, Jinzhou Cao, Genan Dai, Bowen Zhang

entry.summary: ToPT provides task-oriented prompt tuning for urban region representation learning with spatial-aware embedding and explicit task alignment for applications like crime prediction and resource allocation.

entry.title: Generating Synthetic Health Sensor Data for Privacy-Preserving Wearable Stress Detection

author.name: Lucas Lange, Nils Wenzlitschke, Erhard Rahm

entry.summary: Uses GANs with differential privacy to generate synthetic smartwatch health data for stress detection, enabling privacy-aware data sharing for medical research while maintaining utility.

entry.title: SafeTalkCoach: Diversity-Driven Multi-Agent Simulation for Parent-Teen Health Conversations

author.name: Benyamin Tabarsi, Wenbo Li, Tahreem Yasir, Aryan Santhosh Kumar, Laura Widman, Dongkuan Xu, Tiffany Barnes

entry.summary: Presents SafeTalkCoach, a multi-agent framework for simulating parent-child sexual health conversations using crowd-sourced scenarios, health guidelines, and evidence-based personas with diversity controls.

entry.title: A longitudinal geospatial multimodal dataset of post-discharge frailty, physiology, mobility, and neighborhoods

author.name: Ali Abedi, Charlene H. Chu, Shehroz S. Khan

entry.summary: Presents GEOFRAIL, a longitudinal geospatial multimodal dataset for monitoring post-discharge frailty in older adults, combining physiological, mobility, and neighborhood data.

entry.title: See Without Decoding: Motion-Vector-Based Tracking in Compressed Video

author.name: Axel Duch\'e, Cl\'ement Chatelain, Gilles Gasso

entry.summary: Presents a lightweight tracking model that operates directly on compressed video streams without RGB decoding, using motion vectors and transform coefficients. Achieves 3.7x speedup with only 4% mAP drop.

entry.title: Vision-Language Model Purified Semi-Supervised Semantic Segmentation for Remote Sensing Images

author.name: Shanwen Wang, Xin Sun, Danfeng Hong, Fei Zhou

entry.summary: SemiEarth introduces VLM pseudo-label purifying structure to improve semi-supervised semantic segmentation for remote sensing, significantly improving pseudo-label quality at class boundaries.

entry.title: Subspace Clustering on Incomplete Data with Self-Supervised Contrastive Learning

author.name: Huanran Li, Daniel Pimentel-Alarc\'on

entry.summary: CSC is a contrastive self-supervised framework for subspace clustering with incomplete data, using masked views and SimCLR-style loss to learn invariant embeddings.

entry.title: Bridging the Semantic Chasm: Synergistic Conceptual Anchoring for Generalized Few-Shot and Zero-Shot OOD Perception

author.name: Alexandros Christoforos, Sarah Jenkins, Michael Brown, Tuan Pham, David Chen

entry.summary: SynerNet uses four specialized neural agents for OOD detection in VLMs through collaborative message-propagation protocol and semantic context interchange for few-shot adaptation.

entry.title: Robustness of AutoML on Dirty Categorical Data

author.name: Marcos L. P. Bueno, Joaquin Vanschoren

entry.summary: Evaluates AutoML robustness on dirty categorical data with high cardinality from automated collection, proposing pipeline improvements using morphological encoders.

entry.title: PAIR-Former: Budgeted Relational MIL for miRNA Target Prediction

author.name: Jiaqi Yin, Baiming Chen, Jia Fei, Mingjun Yang

entry.summary: PAIR-Former addresses miRNA target prediction as Budgeted Relational MIL, using cheap full-pool scan to select top-K diverse candidate target sites for expensive Set Transformer processing.

entry.title: Hermes the Polyglot: A Unified Framework to Enhance Expressiveness for Multimodal Interlingual Subtitling

author.name: Chaoqun Cui, Shijing Wang, Liangbin Huang, Qingqing Gu, Zhaolong Huang, Xiao Zeng, Wenji Mao

entry.summary: Presents Hermes, an LLM-based automated subtitling framework that integrates speaker diarization, terminology identification, and expressiveness enhancement for interlingual subtitle translation.

entry.title: Improving Neuropathological Reconstruction Fidelity via AI Slice Imputation

author.name: Marina Crespo Aguirre, Jonathan Williams-Ramirez, Dina Zemlyanker, Xiaoling Hu, Lucas J. Deden-Binder, Rogeny Herisse, Mark Montine, Theresa R. Connors, Christopher Mount, Christine L. MacDonald, C. Dirk Keene, Caitlin S. Latimer, Derek H. Oakley, Bradley T. Hyman, Ana Lawry Aguila, Juan Eugenio Iglesias

entry.summary: Introduces a super-resolution step for imputing slices to generate isotropic 3D brain volumes from anisotropic reconstructions of dissection photographs. Uses domain-randomized synthetic training for cross-protocol generalization.

entry.title: TLDiffGAN: A Latent Diffusion-GAN Framework with Temporal Information Fusion for Anomalous Sound Detection

author.name: Chengyuan Ma, Peng Jia, Hongyue Guo, Wenming Yang

entry.summary: Presents TLDiffGAN, combining latent diffusion models with GANs for unsupervised anomalous sound detection, using adversarial training and pretrained audio encoders.

entry.title: AI Meets Plasticity: A Comprehensive Survey

author.name: Hadi Bakhshan, Sima Farshbaf, Junior Ramirez Machado, Fernando Rastellini Canela, Josep Maria Carbonell

entry.summary: Comprehensive survey on AI applications in materials plasticity, covering data-driven discovery, surrogate models, and emulation of plastic behavior across scales.

entry.title: Adaptive Quantum-Safe Cryptography for 6G Vehicular Networks via Context-Aware Optimization

author.name: Poushali Sengupta, Mayank Raikwar, Sabita Maharjan, Frank Eliassen, Yan Zhang

entry.summary: Proposes adaptive post-quantum cryptography framework for 6G vehicular networks using evolutionary algorithms to dynamically select cryptographic configurations meeting latency/security constraints.

entry.title: Cross-Paradigm Evaluation of Gaze-Based Semantic Object Identification for Intelligent Vehicles

author.name: Penghao Deng, Jidong J. Yang, Jiachen Bian

entry.summary: Compares vision-based approaches for semantic identification of driver gaze targets: direct detection (YOLO), segmentation-assisted classification, and VLMs for intelligent vehicle systems.

entry.title: Draw2Learn: A Human-AI Collaborative Tool for Drawing-Based Science Learning

author.name: Yuqi Hang

entry.summary: Presents Draw2Learn, an AI-assisted system for drawing-based science learning where AI generates drawing quests, provides scaffolds, monitors progress, and delivers multidimensional feedback.

entry.title: Meta Engine: A Unified Semantic Query Engine on Heterogeneous LLM-Based Query Systems

author.name: Ruyu Li, Tinghui Zhang, Haodi Ma, Daisy Zhe Wang, Yifan Wang

entry.summary: Meta Engine provides a unified semantic query interface over heterogeneous LLM-based query systems, addressing integration challenges from disparate APIs and lack of standardization in multimodal data access.

entry.title: PIMCST: Physics-Informed Multi-Phase Consensus and Spatio-Temporal Few-Shot Learning for Traffic Flow Forecasting

author.name: Abdul Joseph Fofanah, Lian Wen, David Chen

entry.summary: PIMCST introduces multi-phase consensus framework for few-shot traffic forecasting using diffusion, synchronization, and spectral embeddings for cross-city generalization with limited data.

entry.title: FORLER: Federated Offline Reinforcement Learning with Q-Ensemble and Actor Rectification

author.name: Nan Qiao, Sheng Yue

entry.summary: FORLER tackles offline federated reinforcement learning where devices learn from fixed, potentially low-quality datasets by combining Q-ensemble aggregation on servers with actor rectification on devices. This addresses 'policy pollution' where one device's suboptimal policy degrades the global model.

entry.title: LEC-KG: An LLM-Embedding Collaborative Framework for Domain-Specific Knowledge Graph Construction -- A Case Study on SDGs

author.name: Yikai Zeng, Yingchao Piao, Jianhui Li

entry.summary: LEC-KG combines LLMs for semantic understanding with knowledge graph embeddings for structural reasoning to construct domain-specific knowledge graphs, featuring hierarchical relation extraction and evidence-guided chain-of-thought feedback.

entry.title: Toxicity Assessment in Preclinical Histopathology via Class-Aware Mahalanobis Distance for Known and Novel Anomalies

author.name: Olga Graf, Dhrupal Patel, Peter Gro{\ss}, Charlotte Lempp, Matthias Hein, Fabian Heinemann

entry.summary: Framework for detecting drug-induced toxicity in histopathology whole-slide images using class-aware Mahalanobis distance, capable of identifying both known pathologies and novel anomalies without training examples.

entry.title: Back to the Future: Look-ahead Augmentation and Parallel Self-Refinement for Time Series Forecasting

author.name: Sunho Kim, Susik Yoon

entry.summary: BTTF improves long-term time series forecasting through look-ahead augmentation and self-corrective refinement, bridging direct and iterative multi-step forecasting approaches.

entry.title: Cardinality-Preserving Structured Sparse Graph Transformers for Molecular Property Prediction

author.name: Abhijit Gupta

entry.summary: CardinalGraphFormer combines Graphormer-style structural biases with structured sparse attention limited to 3-hop neighborhoods for molecular property prediction with cardinality-preserving aggregation.

entry.title: SEDformer: Event-Synchronous Spiking Transformers for Irregular Telemetry Time Series Forecasting

author.name: Ziyu Zhou, Yuchen Fang, Weilin Ruan, Shiyu Wang, James Kwok, Yuxuan Liang

entry.summary: SEDformer addresses irregular multivariate time series forecasting by exploiting Sparsity-Event Duality property using spiking transformers for event-synchronous processing.

entry.title: VQ-Style: Disentangling Style and Content in Motion with Residual Quantized Representations

author.name: Fatemeh Zargarbashi, Dhruv Agrawal, Jakob Buhmann, Martin Guay, Stelian Coros, Robert W. Sumner

entry.summary: VQ-Style uses Residual Vector Quantized VAEs to disentangle style and content in human motion data, leveraging insight that content corresponds to coarse motion and style to fine details.

entry.title: Measurement for Opaque Systems: Multi-source Triangulation with Interpretable Machine Learning

author.name: Margaret Foster

entry.summary: Measurement framework for difficult-to-access contexts using indirect data traces, interpretable ML, and theory-guided triangulation when conventional statistical inference is impossible.

entry.title: THDC: Training Hyperdimensional Computing Models with Backpropagation

author.name: Hanne Dejonghe, Sam Leroux

entry.summary: Proposes Trainable Hyperdimensional Computing (THDC) enabling end-to-end training via backpropagation. Replaces random hypervectors with trainable embeddings and achieves state-of-the-art HDC accuracy with dimensionality reduced from 10,000 to 64.

entry.title: Reducing Class-Wise Performance Disparity via Margin Regularization

author.name: Beier Zhu, Kesen Zhao, Jiequan Cui, Qianru Sun, Yuan Zhou, Xun Yang, Hanwang Zhang

entry.summary: Proposes MR² regularization to reduce class-wise performance disparity by dynamically adjusting margins in logit and representation spaces. Provides theoretical class-sensitive generalization bound showing how per-class feature variability contributes to error.

entry.title: Localized, High-resolution Geographic Representations with Slepian Functions

author.name: Arjun Rao, Ruth Crasto, Tessa Ooms, David Rolnick, Konstantin Klemmer, Marc Ru{\ss}wurm

entry.summary: Proposes geographic location encoder using spherical Slepian functions that concentrate representational capacity in region-of-interest. Enables high-resolution local encoding without computational explosion.

entry.title: Invertible Memory Flow Networks

author.name: Liyu Zerihun, Alexandr Plashchinsky

entry.summary: Proposes Invertible Memory Flow Networks for long sequence compression through binary tree of sweeper modules performing 2-to-1 compression. Achieves O(log N) depth with sublinear error accumulation.

entry.title: Beyond the Node: Clade-level Selection for Efficient MCTS in Automatic Heuristic Design

author.name: Kezhao Lai, Yutao Lai, Hai-Lin Liu

entry.summary: Proposes Clade-AHD replacing node-level MCTS estimates with clade-level Bayesian beliefs for automatic heuristic design. Aggregates descendant evaluations into Beta distributions with Thompson Sampling for better exploration.

entry.title: Safe Langevin Soft Actor Critic

author.name: Mahesh Keswani, Samyak Jain, Raunak P. Bhattacharyya

entry.summary: Proposes Safe Langevin SAC combining adaptive SGLD for reward critics, distributional cost estimation via IQN with CVaR, and reactive Lagrangian relaxation. Addresses sharp minima and heavy-tailed risk in safe RL.

entry.title: Riemannian Flow Matching for Disentangled Graph Domain Adaptation

author.name: Yingxu Wang, Xinwang Liu, Mengzhu Wang, Siyang Gao, Nan Yin

entry.summary: Proposes DisRFM for graph domain adaptation using Riemannian embedding with polar coordinates to disentangle structure (radius) from semantics (angle). Uses flow-based transport to address adversarial training instability.

entry.title: From drift to adaptation to the failed ml model: Transfer Learning in Industrial MLOps

author.name: Waqar Muhammad Ashraf, Talha Ansar, Fahad Ahmed, Jawad Hussain, Muhammad Mujtaba Abbas, Vivek Dua

entry.summary: Compares transfer learning strategies for updating failed ML models under data drift in industrial settings, using thermal power plant as case study.

entry.title: Finite and Corruption-Robust Regret Bounds in Online Inverse Linear Optimization under M-Convex Action Sets

author.name: Taihei Oki, Shinsaku Sakaue

entry.summary: Studies online inverse linear optimization with M-convex action sets, achieving regret bounds with polynomial dependence on dimension and robustness to corruptions.

entry.title: Autocorrelated Optimize-via-Estimate: Predict-then-Optimize versus Finite-sample Optimal

author.name: Zichun Wang, Gar Goei Loke, Ruiting Zuo

entry.summary: Proposes Autocorrelated Optimize-via-Estimate (A-OVE) model for data-driven optimization under VARMA processes, comparing predict-then-optimize vs finite-sample optimal approaches.

entry.title: Choice-Model-Assisted Q-learning for Delayed-Feedback Revenue Management

author.name: Owen Shen, Patrick Jaillet

entry.summary: Proposes a choice-model-assisted RL approach for revenue management where value is determined by delayed customer actions (cancellations/modifications). Uses calibrated choice models to impute delayed rewards at decision time with theoretical convergence guarantees.

entry.title: Conflict-Aware Client Selection for Multi-Server Federated Learning

author.name: Mingwei Hong, Zheng Lin, Zehang Lin, Lin Li, Miao Yang, Xia Du, Zihan Fang, Zhaolu Kang, Dianxin Luan, Shunzhi Zhu

entry.summary: RL-CRP uses decentralized reinforcement learning with conflict risk prediction to optimize client selection in multi-server federated learning, addressing resource contention from overlapping client coverage.

entry.title: The Quantum Learning Menagerie (A survey on Quantum learning for Classical concepts)

author.name: Sagnik Chatterjee

entry.summary: Survey of quantum learning theory focusing on PAC learning with quantum-encoded classical concepts. Consolidates known complexity separations between classical and quantum learning, presenting 23 open problems.

entry.title: WAKESET: A Large-Scale, High-Reynolds Number Flow Dataset for Machine Learning of Turbulent Wake Dynamics

author.name: Zachary Cooper-Baldock, Paulo E. Santos, Russell S. A. Brinkworth, Karl Sammut

entry.summary: Introduces WAKESET, a large-scale high-Reynolds number turbulent wake flow dataset for training ML models. Addresses scarcity of high-fidelity CFD datasets for complex engineering flows.

entry.title: Online Social Welfare Function-based Resource Allocation

author.name: Kanad Pardeshi, Samsara Foubert, Aarti Singh

entry.summary: Develops framework for online resource allocation optimizing social welfare functions with confidence sequences valid for any monotonic, concave, Lipschitz-continuous SWF. Provides anytime-valid bounds.

entry.title: ST-BCP: Tightening Coverage Bound for Backward Conformal Prediction via Non-Conformity Score Transformation

author.name: Junxian Liu, Hao Zeng, Hongxin Wei

entry.summary: Introduces ST-BCP improving Backward Conformal Prediction coverage bounds via data-dependent transformation of nonconformity scores, narrowing gap between estimated and empirical coverage.

entry.title: Hippasus: Effective and Efficient Automatic Feature Augmentation for Machine Learning Tasks on Relational Data

author.name: Serafeim Papadias, Kostas Patroumpas, Dimitrios Skoutas

entry.summary: Proposes Hippasus for automatic feature augmentation in relational databases, addressing scalability through efficient join path discovery and feature selection for ML tasks.

entry.title: Enhancing Diffusion-Based Quantitatively Controllable Image Generation via Matrix-Form EDM and Adaptive Vicinal Training

author.name: Xin Ding, Yun Chen, Sen Zhang, Kao Zhang, Nenglun Chen, Peibei Cao, Yongwei Wang, Fei Wu

entry.summary: Proposes improved continuous conditional diffusion model (iCCDM) integrating EDM framework with matrix-form modifications and adaptive vicinal training for regression-label conditioned generation.

entry.title: Reasoning by Commented Code for Table Question Answering

author.name: Seho Pyo, Jiheon Seok, Jaejin Lee

entry.summary: Presents a commented code generation framework for Table QA that decomposes reasoning into multi-line Python programs with natural language comments, improving numerical accuracy and interpretability.

entry.title: PARSE: An Open-Domain Reasoning Question Answering Benchmark for Persian

author.name: Jamshid Mozafari, Seyed Parsa Mousavinasab, Adam Jatowt

entry.summary: Introduces PARSE, the first open-domain Persian reasoning QA benchmark with 10,800 questions across multiple formats and reasoning types, built via controlled LLM generation with human validation.

entry.title: The Art of Socratic Inquiry: A Framework for Proactive Template-Guided Therapeutic Conversation Generation

author.name: Mingwen Zhang, Minqiang Yang, Changsheng Ma, Yang Yu, Hui Bai, Chen Xu, Xiangzhen Kong, Bin Hu

entry.summary: Proposes Socratic Inquiry Framework (SIF) for therapeutic LLMs, decoupling when to ask (Strategy Anchoring) from what to ask (Template Retrieval) for proactive cognitive-behavioral guidance.

entry.title: AXE: Low-Cost Cross-Domain Web Structured Information Extraction

author.name: Abdelrahman Mansour, Khaled W. Alshaer, Moataz Elsaban

entry.summary: Introduces AXE, a web scraping pipeline that prunes HTML DOM trees before feeding to a small 0.6B LLM, achieving state-of-the-art zero-shot extraction with minimal compute. Uses grounded XPath resolution to ensure traceable extractions.

entry.title: Evaluating Metalinguistic Knowledge in Large Language Models across the World's Languages

author.name: Tja\v{s}a Ar\v{c}on (University of Ljubljana, Faculty of Computer and Information Science, Slovenia), Matej Klemen (University of Ljubljana, Faculty of Computer and Information Science, Slovenia), Marko Robnik-\v{S}ikonja (University of Ljubljana, Faculty of Computer and Information Science, Slovenia), Kaja Dobrovoljc (University of Ljubljana, Faculty of Computer and Information Science, Slovenia)

entry.summary: Evaluates metalinguistic knowledge—explicit reasoning about language structure rather than use—across many languages. Finds GPT-4o achieves only moderate accuracy (0.367), with open-source models lagging further.

entry.title: Large Language Models for Mental Health: A Multilingual Evaluation

author.name: Nishat Raihan, Sadiya Sayara Chowdhury Puspo, Ana-Maria Bucur, Stevie Chancellor, Marcos Zampieri

entry.summary: Evaluates LLMs on mental health datasets across multiple languages including machine-translated versions, comparing zero-shot, few-shot, and fine-tuned settings against conventional baselines.

entry.title: D3R-Net: Dual-Domain Denoising Reconstruction Network for Robust Industrial Anomaly Detection

author.name: Dmytro Filatov, Valentyn Fedorov, Vira Filatova, Andrii Zelenchuk

entry.summary: D3R-Net combines self-supervised denoising with frequency-aware regularization for unsupervised anomaly detection in manufacturing, addressing oversmoothing of high-frequency details.

entry.title: SDCM: Simulated Densifying and Compensatory Modeling Fusion for Radar-Vision 3-D Object Detection in Internet of Vehicles

author.name: Shucong Li, Xiaoluo Zhou, Yuqian He, Zhenyu Liu

entry.summary: SDCM framework for radar-vision 3D object detection addresses radar sparsity through simulated densifying and handles vision degradation in challenging conditions through compensatory fusion.

entry.title: World-Shaper: A Unified Framework for 360{\deg} Panoramic Editing

author.name: Dong Liang, Yuhao Liu, Jinyuan Jia, Youjun Zhao, Rynson W. H. Lau

entry.summary: World-Shaper enables 360° panoramic editing directly in equirectangular projection domain with geometry-aware framework bridging panoramic generation and editing.

entry.title: GTATrack: Winner Solution to SoccerTrack 2025 with Deep-EIoU and Global Tracklet Association

author.name: Rong-Lin Jian, Ming-Chi Luo, Chen-Wei Huang, Chia-Ming Lee, Yu-Fan Lin, Chih-Chung Hsu

entry.summary: GTATrack hierarchical tracking framework won first place in SoccerTrack Challenge 2025, combining Deep-EIoU for online association with Global Tracklet Association for trajectory refinement.

entry.title: MRAD: Zero-Shot Anomaly Detection with Memory-Driven Retrieval

author.name: Chaoran Xu, Chengkan Lv, Qiyu Chen, Feng Zhang, Zhengtao Zhang

entry.summary: MRAD zero-shot anomaly detection replaces parametric fitting with memory retrieval from auxiliary data, constructing two-level memory bank for feature-label pairs.

entry.title: GLAD: Generative Language-Assisted Visual Tracking for Low-Semantic Templates

author.name: Xingyu Luo, Yidong Cai, Jie Liu, Jie Tang, Gangshan Wu, Limin Wang

entry.summary: Proposes GLAD for vision-language tracking that uses generative language assistance to handle low-semantic templates like blurry or low-resolution images. Addresses cross-modal understanding degradation.

entry.title: Diff-PC: Identity-preserving and 3D-aware Controllable Diffusion for Zero-shot Portrait Customization

author.name: Yifang Xu, Benxiang Zhai, Chenyu Zhang, Ming Li, Yang Li, Sidan Du

entry.summary: Proposes Diff-PC for zero-shot portrait customization using 3D face predictors to reconstruct facial priors with expressions and poses, achieving high identity fidelity and precise face control.

entry.title: VVLoc: Prior-free 3-DoF Vehicle Visual Localization

author.name: Ze Huang, Zhongyang Xiao, Mingliang Song, Longan Yang, Hongyuan Yuan, Li Sun

entry.summary: Proposes VVLoc for unified prior-free vehicle visual localization using multi-camera systems that jointly performs topological and metric localization with confidence quantification.

entry.title: ReLayout: Versatile and Structure-Preserving Design Layout Editing via Relation-Aware Design Reconstruction

author.name: Jiawei Lin, Shizhao Sun, Danqing Huang, Ting Liu, Ji Li, Jiang Bian

entry.summary: Proposes ReLayout for design layout editing using standardized editing operations and relation-aware reconstruction to preserve structure while satisfying edits despite limited triplet training data.

entry.title: PandaPose: 3D Human Pose Lifting from a Single Image via Propagating 2D Pose Prior to 3D Anchor Space

author.name: Jinghong Zheng, Changlong Jiang, Yang Xiao, Jiaqi Li, Haohong Kuang, Hang Xu, Ran Wang, Zhiguo Cao, Min Du, Joey Tianyi Zhou

entry.summary: Proposes PandaPose for 3D human pose lifting using joint-wise 3D anchors and depth-aware anchors in canonical space to mitigate 2D estimation errors and self-occlusion.

entry.title: DeCorStory: Gram-Schmidt Prompt Embedding Decorrelation for Consistent Storytelling

author.name: Ayushman Sarkar, Zhenyu Yu, Mohd Yamani Idna Idris

entry.summary: Proposes DeCorStory using Gram-Schmidt decorrelation on prompt embeddings to orthogonalize frame-level semantics, reducing color leakage and identity drift in storytelling.

entry.title: HandMCM: Multi-modal Point Cloud-based Correspondence State Space Model for 3D Hand Pose Estimation

author.name: Wencan Cheng, Gim Hee Lee

entry.summary: Proposes HandMCM for 3D hand pose estimation using Mamba state space model with correspondence modeling to handle occlusion scenarios. Integrates multi-modal image features.

entry.title: Moonworks Lunara Aesthetic II: An Image Variation Dataset

author.name: Yan Wang, Partho Hassan, Samiha Sadeka, Nada Soliman, M M Sayeef Abdullah, Sabit Hassan

entry.summary: Introduces Lunara Aesthetic II dataset with 2,854 anchor-linked image variation pairs for evaluating contextual consistency in image generation. Features identity-preserving contextual transformations.

entry.title: Tail-Aware Post-Training Quantization for 3D Geometry Models

author.name: Sicheng Pan, Chen Tang, Shuzhao Xie, Ke Yang, Weixiang Zhang, Jiawei Li, Bin Chen, Shu-Tao Xia, Zhi Wang

entry.summary: Proposes TAPTQ, a tail-aware post-training quantization pipeline for 3D geometry models addressing distribution challenges in quantizing point cloud networks.

entry.title: Efficient Cross-Country Data Acquisition Strategy for ADAS via Street-View Imagery

author.name: Yin Wu, Daniel Slieter, Carl Esselborn, Ahmed Abouelazm, Tsung Yuan Tseng, J. Marius Z\"ollner

entry.summary: Proposes street-view-guided data acquisition strategy for ADAS using publicly available imagery to identify places of interest for cross-country deployment.

entry.title: Reg4Pru: Regularisation Through Random Token Routing for Token Pruning

author.name: Julian Wyatt, Ronald Clark, Irina Voiculescu

entry.summary: Introduces Reg4Pru, a regularization technique for token pruning that improves segmentation performance at deeper layers by mitigating instability from pruned representations.

entry.title: Advanced Geometric Correction Algorithms for 3D Medical Reconstruction: Comparison of Computed Tomography and Macroscopic Imaging

author.name: Tomasz Les, Tomasz Markiewicz, Malgorzata Lorent, Miroslaw Dziekiewicz, Krzysztof Siwek

entry.summary: Introduces hybrid two-stage registration framework for 3D kidney reconstruction from macroscopic slices using CT reference, combining OCM global alignment with VoxelMorph refinement.

entry.title: A texture-based framework for foundational ultrasound models

author.name: Tal Grutman, Carmel Shinar, Tali Ilovitsh

entry.summary: Proposes a texture-based framework for ultrasound foundation models that accounts for ultrasound-specific physics rather than treating images like natural images.

entry.title: RANKVIDEO: Reasoning Reranking for Text-to-Video Retrieval

author.name: Tyler Skow, Alexander Martin, Benjamin Van Durme, Rama Chellappa, Reno Kriz

entry.summary: Proposes RANKVIDEO, a reasoning-based reranker for video retrieval using explicit reasoning over query-video pairs with a two-stage curriculum training.

entry.title: FISC: A Fluid-Inspired Framework for Decentralized and Scalable Swarm Control

author.name: Mohini Priya Kolluri, Ammar Waheed, Zohaib Hasnain

entry.summary: Proposes FISC, a fluid dynamics-inspired framework for decentralized swarm control that models robot swarms as flowing fluid, enabling coordination without inter-agent communication.

entry.title: Safe Stochastic Explorer: Enabling Safe Goal Driven Exploration in Stochastic Environments and Safe Interaction with Unknown Objects

author.name: Nikhil Uday Shinde, Dylan Hirsch, Michael C. Yip, Sylvia Herbert

entry.summary: Introduces Safe Stochastic Explorer framework for safe goal-driven exploration in stochastic environments, accounting for uncertainty in dynamics.

entry.title: Geometry-Aware Sampling-Based Motion Planning on Riemannian Manifolds

author.name: Phone Thiha Kyaw, Jonathan Kelly

entry.summary: Presents geometry-aware sampling-based motion planning framework that operates directly on Riemannian manifolds for configuration-dependent metrics.

entry.title: LLM-Based Behavior Tree Generation for Construction Machinery

author.name: Akinosuke Tsutsumi, Tomoya Itsuka, Yuichiro Kasahara, Tomoya Kouno, Kota Akinari, Genki Yamauchi, Daisuke Endo, Taro Abe, Takeshi Hashimoto, Keiji Nagatani, Ryo Kurazume

entry.summary: Uses LLMs to generate behavior trees for construction machinery coordination, addressing scalability challenges in multi-machine cooperation.

entry.title: Failure-Aware Bimanual Teleoperation via Conservative Value Guided Assistance

author.name: Peng Zhou, Zhongxuan Li, Jinsong Wu, Jiaming Qi, Jun Hu, David Navarro-Alarcon, Jia Pan, Lihua Xie, Shiyao Zhang, Zeqing Zhang

entry.summary: Proposes failure-aware bimanual teleoperation framework using conservative value learning to provide haptic assistance while preserving human authority.

entry.title: Sem-NaVAE: Semantically-Guided Outdoor Mapless Navigation via Generative Trajectory Priors

author.name: Gonzalo Olguin, Javier Ruiz-del-Solar

entry.summary: Introduces Sem-NaVAE combining CVAEs for trajectory generation with VLM semantic segmentation for outdoor mapless navigation.

entry.title: Vision-only UAV State Estimation for Fast Flights Without External Localization Systems: A2RL Drone Racing Finalist Approach

author.name: Filip Nov\'ak, Mat\v{e}j Petrl\'ik, Matej Novosad, Parakh M. Gupta, Robert P\v{e}ni\v{c}ka, Martin Saska

entry.summary: Presents vision-only UAV state estimation for fast drone racing using VIO drift compensation with onboard landmark detection, achieving finalist performance in A2RL competition.

entry.title: ForSim: Stepwise Forward Simulation for Traffic Policy Fine-Tuning

author.name: Keyu Chen, Wenchao Sun, Hao Cheng, Zheng Fu, Sifa Zheng

entry.summary: Proposes ForSim, a stepwise closed-loop forward simulation paradigm for traffic policy fine-tuning that improves upon non-reactive simulation.

entry.title: Efficiently Solving Mixed-Hierarchy Games with Quasi-Policy Approximations

author.name: Hamzah Khan, Dong Ho Lee, Jingqi Li, Tianyu Qiu, Christian Ellis, Jesse Milzman, Wesley Suttle, David Fridovich-Keil

entry.summary: Studies N-robot forest-structured mixed-hierarchy games combining Nash and Stackelberg equilibria. Derives KKT conditions and proposes quasi-policy approximations to reduce computational complexity.

entry.title: When Is Generalized Bayes Bayesian? A Decision-Theoretic Characterization of Loss-Based Updating

author.name: Kenichiro McAlinn, K\=osaku Takanashi

entry.summary: Gives decision-theoretic characterization of loss-based updating (generalized Bayes), distinguishing belief posteriors from decision posteriors. Shows loss-based posterior equals Bayes iff loss is negative log-likelihood.

entry.title: Applying Temperature to LLM Outputs Semantically to Minimise Low-Temperature Hallucinations

author.name: Brodie Eaton

entry.summary: Proposes applying temperature to LLM outputs semantically rather than per-token, arguing that when similar-meaning tokens have cumulative probability exceeding the modal token, semantic aggregation should determine output.

entry.title: From Prompt to Graph: Comparing LLM-Based Information Extraction Strategies in Domain-Specific Ontology Development

author.name: Xuan Liu, Ziyu Li, Mu He, Ziyang Ma, Xiaoxu Wu, Gizem Yilmaz, Yiyuan Xia, Bingbing Li, He Tan, Jerry Ying Hsi Fuh, Wen Feng Lu, Anders E. W. Jarfors, Per Jansson

entry.summary: Compares three LLM approaches (pre-trained, ICL, fine-tuning) for extracting terms and relations from domain texts to build ontologies. Applies to casting manufacturing domain with limited data.

entry.title: Visible Singularities Guided Correlation Network for Limited-Angle CT Reconstruction

author.name: Yiyang Wen, Liu Shi, Zekun Zhou, WenZhe Shan, Qiegen Liu

entry.summary: Proposes Visible Singularities Guided Correlation Network for limited-angle CT reconstruction, leveraging the theoretical relationship between missing projection angles and directional artifact patterns.

entry.title: GraphNNK -- Graph Classification and Interpretability

author.name: Zeljko Bolevic, Milos Brajovic, Isidora Stankovic, Ljubisa Stankovic

entry.summary: Proposes GraphNNK, using Non-Negative Kernel regression instead of parametric classifiers for graph neural networks, enabling interpretable predictions as convex combinations of training examples.

entry.title: Reliable Real-Time Value at Risk Estimation via Quantile Regression Forest with Conformal Calibration

author.name: Du-Yi Wang, Guo Liang, Kun Zhang, Qianwen Zhu

entry.summary: Proposes conformalized quantile regression forest for online VaR estimation with reliability guarantees through conformal calibration in offline-simulation-online-estimation framework.

entry.title: Neural Ising Machines via Unrolling and Zeroth-Order Training

author.name: Sam Reifenstein, Timothee Leleu

entry.summary: Proposes Neural Ising Machines learning update rules for NP-hard optimization via zeroth-order training. Learns shared node-wise update rule with compact MLP, avoiding unstable gradients through long recurrent dynamics.

entry.title: Search Inspired Exploration in Reinforcement Learning

author.name: Georgios Sotirchos, Zlatan Ajanovi\'c, Jens Kober

entry.summary: Proposes SIERL setting sub-goals from the frontier (boundary of known state space) based on learning progress. Sub-goal selection prioritizes exploration toward main objective while expanding known state space.

entry.title: Intra-Class Subdivision for Pixel Contrastive Learning: Application to Semi-supervised Cardiac Image Segmentation

author.name: Jiajun Zhao, Xuan Yang

entry.summary: Proposes intra-class subdivision for pixel contrastive learning in cardiac segmentation, introducing 'unconcerned samples' to distinguish inner and boundary regions and boundary contrastive loss.

entry.title: Tune-Your-Style: Intensity-tunable 3D Style Transfer with Gaussian Splatting

author.name: Yian Zhao, Rushi Ye, Ruochong Zheng, Zesen Cheng, Chaoran Feng, Jiashu Yang, Pengchong Qiao, Chang Liu, Jie Chen

entry.summary: Introduces Tune-Your-Style for 3D style transfer with Gaussian Splatting that allows users to adjust style intensity, addressing the fixed-output limitation of existing methods.

entry.title: Boosting Point-supervised Temporal Action Localization via Text Refinement and Alignment

author.name: Yunchuan Ma, Laiyun Qing, Guorong Li, Yuqing Liu, Yuankai Qi, Qingming Huang

entry.summary: Proposes TRA framework for point-supervised temporal action localization using text descriptions to complement visual features through point-based text refinement and multimodal alignment.

entry.title: FSCA-Net: Feature-Separated Cross-Attention Network for Robust Multi-Dataset Training

author.name: Yuehai Chen

entry.summary: Proposes FSCA-Net for crowd counting with feature separation and cross-attention to handle domain discrepancies in multi-dataset training, disentangling domain-invariant and domain-specific features.

entry.title: Causal Inference for Preprocessed Outcomes with an Application to Functional Connectivity

author.name: Zihang Wang, Razieh Nabi, Benjamin B. Risk

entry.summary: Proposes semiparametric framework for causal inference with derived outcomes obtained after intra-subject preprocessing. Addresses gap between within-subject analysis and between-subject inference.

entry.title: From Detection to Prevention: Explaining Security-Critical Code to Avoid Vulnerabilities

author.name: Ranjith Krishnamurthy, Oshando Johnson, Goran Piskachev, Eric Bodden

entry.summary: Presents an IntelliJ plugin that uses code metrics to identify security-critical methods and LLMs to generate prevention-oriented explanations, shifting from vulnerability detection to prevention.

entry.title: Harnessing Flexible Spatial and Temporal Data Center Workloads for Grid Regulation Services

author.name: Yingrui Fan, Junbo Zhao

entry.summary: Proposes unified framework for data centers to provide grid frequency regulation services by jointly optimizing workload scheduling and regulation capacity bidding.

entry.title: When Classes Evolve: A Benchmark and Framework for Stage-Aware Class-Incremental Learning

author.name: Zheng Zhang, Tao Hu, Xueheng Li, Yang Wang, Rui Li, Jie Zhang, Chengjun Xie

entry.summary: Formalizes Stage-Aware CIL where instances of same semantic class undergo morphological transformations (e.g., larva to butterfly). Creates benchmark addressing intra-class evolution ignored by conventional CIL.

entry.title: CoRe-Fed: Bridging Collaborative and Representation Fairness via Federated Embedding Distillation

author.name: Noorain Mukhtiar, Adnan Mahmood, Quan Z. Sheng

entry.summary: Proposes CoRe-Fed addressing representation and collaborative bias in federated learning through unified optimization. Uses embedding distillation to align client representations and achieve equitable aggregation.

entry.title: Event Driven Clustering Algorithm

author.name: David El-Chai Ben-Ezra, Adar Tal, Daniel Brisk

entry.summary: Introduces asynchronous event-driven clustering algorithm for event camera data with O(n) complexity, leveraging the asynchronous data structure of event cameras.

entry.title: DensiThAI, A Multi-View Deep Learning Framework for Breast Density Estimation using Infrared Images

author.name: Siva Teja Kakileti, Geetha Manjunath

entry.summary: DensiThAI uses multi-view deep learning to estimate breast density from infrared thermal images, offering non-ionizing alternative to mammography-based density assessment.

entry.title: Learning to Price: Interpretable Attribute-Level Models for Dynamic Markets

author.name: Srividhya Sethuraman, Chandrashekar Lakshminarayanan

entry.summary: Introduces AFDLD model for interpretable dynamic pricing where prices decompose into attribute-level contributions, with ADEPT algorithm for online learning. Addresses the interpretability-scalability trade-off in pricing optimization.

entry.title: Physics-informed Diffusion Generation for Geomagnetic Map Interpolation

author.name: Wenda Li, Tongya Zheng, Kaixuan Chen, Shunyu Liu, Haoze Jiang, Yunzhi Hao, Rui Miao, Zujie Ren, Mingli Song, Hang Shi, Gang Chen

entry.summary: Proposes physics-informed diffusion framework for geomagnetic map interpolation using physics-informed mask strategy and physical constraints from Maxwell's equations. Addresses noise and physical consistency.

entry.title: Lyapunov Stability-Aware Stackelberg Game for Low-Altitude Economy: A Control-Oriented Pruning-Based DRL Approach

author.name: Yue Zhong, Jiawen Kang, Yongju Tong, Hong-Ning Dai, Dong In Kim, Abbas Jamalipour, Shengli Xie

entry.summary: Proposes Lyapunov stability-aware Stackelberg game for UAV networks with Sensing-Communication-Computing-Control framework. Uses control-oriented pruning in DRL for low-altitude economy applications.

entry.title: Privacy in Practice: Private COVID-19 Detection in X-Ray Images (Extended Version)

author.name: Lucas Lange, Maja Schneider, Peter Christen, Erhard Rahm

entry.summary: Examines practical differential privacy for COVID-19 detection in X-rays, evaluating utility-privacy trade-offs across stricter privacy budgets and validating through membership inference attacks.

entry.title: ChunkNorris: A High-Performance and Low-Energy Approach to PDF Parsing and Chunking

author.name: Mathieu Ciancone, Clovis Varangot-Reille, Marion Schaeffer

entry.summary: Introduces ChunkNorris, a heuristic-based PDF parsing and chunking technique for RAG that achieves high performance without ML, using simple but effective rules with minimal computational overhead.

entry.title: Sheaf Neural Networks and biomedical applications

author.name: Aneeqa Mehrab, Jan Willem Van Looy, Pietro Demurtas, Stefano Iotti, Emil Malucelli, Francesca Rossi, Ferdinando Zanchetta, Rita Fioresi

entry.summary: Explains sheaf neural network theory and demonstrates applications to biomedical problems, showing improvements over standard GNN architectures like GCN, GAT, and GraphSage.

entry.title: Spec-Driven Development:From Code to Contract in the Age of AI Coding Assistants

author.name: Deepak Babu Piskala

entry.summary: Practitioner guide to spec-driven development in the AI coding era, presenting three levels of specification rigor and analyzing tools from BDD frameworks to GitHub Spec Kit.

entry.title: Multimodal Machine Learning for Integrating Heterogeneous Analytical Systems

author.name: Shun Muroga, Hideaki Nakajima, Taiyo Shimizu, Kazufumi Kobashi, Kenji Hata

entry.summary: Proposes an interpretable multimodal ML framework for unifying heterogeneous analytical systems for materials characterization. Demonstrates on carbon nanotube films by fusing SEM, Raman spectroscopy, gas adsorption, and other measurements.

entry.title: From Utterance to Vividity: Training Expressive Subtitle Translation LLM via Adaptive Local Preference Optimization

author.name: Chaoqun Cui, Shijing Wang, Liangbin Huang, Qingqing Gu, Zhaolong Huang, Xiao Zeng, Wenji Mao

entry.summary: Explores training expressive subtitle translation LLMs using adaptive local preference optimization, validating LLMs as reward models for domain-specific translation tasks.

entry.title: FedBGS: A Blockchain Approach to Segment Gossip Learning in Decentralized Systems

author.name: Fabio Turazza, Marcello Pietri, Marco Picone, Marco Mamei

entry.summary: Proposes FedBGS, integrating blockchain with federated learning to address privacy concerns through gossip-based segment learning in decentralized systems.

entry.title: SentiFuse: Deep Multi-model Fusion Framework for Robust Sentiment Extraction

author.name: Hieu Minh Duong, Rupa Ghosh, Cong Hoan Nguyen, Eugene Levin, Todd Gary, Long Nguyen

entry.summary: Presents SentiFuse, a model-agnostic framework for integrating heterogeneous sentiment models through multiple fusion strategies including decision-level, feature-level, and adaptive fusion.

entry.title: Community-Level Modeling of Gyral Folding Patterns for Robust and Anatomically Informed Individualized Brain Mapping

author.name: Minheng Chen, Tong Chen, Yan Zhuang, Chao Cao, Jing Zhang, Tianming Liu, Lu Zhang, Dajiang Zhu

entry.summary: Proposes spectral graph framework for community-level modeling of cortical three-hinge gyrus folding patterns, capturing mesoscale structure for individualized brain mapping.

entry.title: AgroFlux: A Spatial-Temporal Benchmark for Carbon and Nitrogen Flux Prediction in Agricultural Ecosystems

author.name: Qi Cheng, Licheng Liu, Yao Zhang, Mu Hong, Yiqun Xie, Xiaowei Jia

entry.summary: Introduces AgroFlux, a benchmark for predicting carbon and nitrogen fluxes in agricultural ecosystems, addressing the challenge of measuring greenhouse gas emissions from agriculture which accounts for 25% of global emissions.

entry.title: Towards Autonomous Instrument Tray Assembly for Sterile Processing Applications

author.name: Raghavasimhan Sankaranarayanan, Paul Stuart, Nicholas Ahn, Arno Sungarian, Yash Chitalia

entry.summary: Presents a robotic system for automated surgical instrument sorting and tray assembly using YOLO12 detection and cascaded ResNet classification, trained on 31 instruments with 6,975 annotated images.

entry.title: See2Refine: Vision-Language Feedback Improves LLM-Based eHMI Action Designers

author.name: Ding Xia, Xinyue Gui, Mark Colley, Fan Gao, Zhongyi Zhou, Dongyuan Li, Renhe Jiang, Takeo Igarashi

entry.summary: See2Refine creates a closed-loop system where VLMs automatically evaluate and provide feedback to improve LLM-generated external Human-Machine Interface actions for autonomous vehicles, eliminating the need for human annotation.

entry.title: WADEPre: A Wavelet-based Decomposition Model for Extreme Precipitation Nowcasting with Multi-Scale Learning

author.name: Baitian Liu, Haiping Zhang, Huiling Yuan, Dongjing Wang, Ying Li, Feng Chen, Hao Wu

entry.summary: WADEPre addresses extreme precipitation forecasting by decomposing the problem in wavelet domain, using separate networks for low-frequency stable patterns and high-frequency convective events to avoid regression-to-mean bias.

entry.title: An Optimization Method for Autoregressive Time Series Forecasting

author.name: Zheng Li, Jerry Cheng, Huanying Gu

entry.summary: Novel training method for autoregressive time series forecasting that penalizes violations of expected error increase with horizon and enables concatenating short-term predictions for longer horizons.

entry.title: Hallucination or Creativity: How to Evaluate AI-Generated Scientific Stories?

author.name: Alex Argese, Pasquale Lisena, Rapha\"el Troncy

entry.summary: StoryScore composite metric for evaluating AI-generated scientific stories integrating semantic alignment, narrative control, structural fidelity, and entity-level hallucination detection.

entry.title: Building a Correct-by-Design Lakehouse. Data Contracts, Versioning, and Transactional Pipelines for Humans and Agents

author.name: Weiming Sheng, Jinlang Wang, Manuel Barros, Aldrin Montana, Jacopo Tagliabue, Luca Bigon

entry.summary: Bauplan lakehouse framework ensures data correctness through typed table contracts, Git-like data versioning, and transactional pipeline atomicity for safe concurrent operations on production data.

entry.title: Multi-head automated segmentation by incorporating detection head into the contextual layer neural network

author.name: Edwin Kys, Febian Febian

entry.summary: Gated multi-head Transformer for medical image segmentation uses parallel detection head to suppress false positives in anatomically invalid slices through slice-level gating.

entry.title: ELLMPEG: An Edge-based Agentic LLM Video Processing Tool

author.name: Zoha Azimi, Reza Farahani, Radu Prodan, Christian Timmerer

entry.summary: ELLMPEG provides edge-enabled agentic LLM framework for automated video processing command generation using tool-aware RAG to leverage local tools and models.

entry.title: RAPTOR-AI for Disaster OODA Loop: Hierarchical Multimodal RAG with Experience-Driven Agentic Decision-Making

author.name: Takato Yasuno

entry.summary: RAPTOR-AI creates hierarchical multimodal RAG system for disaster response integrating textual manuals, historical lessons, and aerial/ground imagery for humanitarian assistance decision support.

entry.title: Generative AI-enhanced Probabilistic Multi-Fidelity Surrogate Modeling Via Transfer Learning

author.name: Jice Zeng, David Barajas-Solano, Hui Chen

entry.summary: Proposes a multi-fidelity surrogate modeling framework using normalizing flows with transfer learning, first pretraining on abundant low-fidelity data then fine-tuning on scarce high-fidelity data. Addresses data scarcity in scientific computing applications.

entry.title: Trade-offs Between Individual and Group Fairness in Machine Learning: A Comprehensive Review

author.name: Sandra Ben\'itez-Pe\~na, Blas Kolic, Victoria Menendez, Bel\'en Pulido

entry.summary: Comprehensive survey examining methods that jointly address Group Fairness and Individual Fairness in ML, characterizing trade-offs between these notions. Provides systematic review of hybrid fairness approaches.

entry.title: How Understanding Forecast Uncertainty Resolves the Explainability Problem in Machine Learning Models

author.name: Joseph L. Breeden

entry.summary: Argues that explainability concerns about methods like LIME/SHAP near decision boundaries reflect misunderstanding: instability matches inherently high forecast uncertainty. Proposes checking forecast reliability before seeking explanations.

entry.title: DROGO: Default Representation Objective via Graph Optimization in Reinforcement Learning

author.name: Hon Tik Tse, Marlos C. Machado

entry.summary: Derives objective for directly approximating principal eigenvector of default representation in RL with neural networks. Avoids expensive eigendecomposition for applications like reward shaping, exploration, and option discovery.

entry.title: SEER: Transformer-based Robust Time Series Forecasting via Automated Patch Enhancement and Replacement

author.name: Xiangfei Qiu, Xvyuan Liu, Tianen Shen, Xingjian Wu, Hanyin Cheng, Bin Yang, Jilin Hu

entry.summary: Proposes SEER for robust time series forecasting with automated patch enhancement and replacement. Dynamically selects patches to handle low-quality data issues like missing values, distribution shifts, and noise.

entry.title: Actor-Dual-Critic Dynamics for Zero-sum and Identical-Interest Stochastic Games

author.name: Ahmed Said Donmez, Yuksel Arslantas, Muhammed O. Sayin

entry.summary: Proposes independent payoff-based learning framework for stochastic games with actor-dual-critic architecture. Uses fast critic responding to payoffs and slow critic for dynamic programming, converging to equilibria.

entry.title: Domain-Adaptive and Scalable Dense Retrieval for Content-Based Recommendation

author.name: Mritunjay Pandey (Aditya Birla Group)

entry.summary: Presents a dense retrieval system for e-commerce recommendation using bi-encoder fine-tuned with contrastive learning on Amazon Reviews data.

entry.title: SwiftRepertoire: Few-Shot Immune-Signature Synthesis via Dynamic Kernel Codes

author.name: Rong Fu, Wenxin Zhang, Muge Qi, Yang Li, Yabin Jin, Jiekai Wu, Jiaxuan Lu, Chunlei Meng, Youjin Wang, Zeli Su, Juntao Gao, Li Bao, Qi Zhao, Wei Luo, Simon Fong

entry.summary: Introduces SwiftRepertoire for few-shot immune signature synthesis using dynamic kernel codes from learned prototypes, enabling quick adaptation without full fine-tuning.

entry.title: Key Principles of Graph Machine Learning: Representation, Robustness, and Generalization

author.name: Yassine Abbahaddou

entry.summary: PhD dissertation investigating GNN challenges in representation learning, robustness to adversarial perturbations, and generalization through three main contributions.

entry.title: Enhancing Generalization in Evolutionary Feature Construction for Symbolic Regression through Vicinal Jensen Gap Minimization

author.name: Hengzhe Zhang, Qi Chen, Bing Xue, Wolfgang Banzhaf, Mengjie Zhang

entry.summary: Proves theoretical bounds relating vicinal risk to empirical risk plus a regularization term (vicinal Jensen gap) for genetic programming feature construction. Proposes an evolutionary framework jointly optimizing both terms to improve generalization.

entry.title: Learning Half-Spaces from Perturbed Contrastive Examples

author.name: Aryan Alavi Razavi Ravari, Farnam Mansouri, Yuxin Chen, Valentio Iverson, Adish Singla, Sandra Zilles

entry.summary: Studies learning half-spaces from perturbed contrastive examples where ideal contrastive point is perturbed by noise function depending on distance to boundary.

entry.title: Asynchronous MultiAgent Reinforcement Learning for 5G Routing under Side Constraints

author.name: Sebastian Racedo, Brigitte Jaumard, Oscar Delgado, Meysam Masoudi

entry.summary: Proposes asynchronous multi-agent RL framework for 5G routing where independent PPO agents for different services plan routes in parallel and commit to shared resources.

entry.title: Refining Context-Entangled Content Segmentation via Curriculum Selection and Anti-Curriculum Promotion

author.name: Chunming He, Rihan Zhang, Fengyang Xiao, Dingming Zhang, Zhiwen Cao, Sina Farsiu

entry.summary: Proposes CurriSeg, combining curriculum and anti-curriculum learning for context-entangled content segmentation like camouflaged object detection. Dynamically selects training samples based on temporal difficulty assessment.

entry.title: Nonlinear model reduction for transport-dominated problems

author.name: Jan S. Hesthaven, Benjamin Peherstorfer, Benjamin Unger

entry.summary: Survey of nonlinear model reduction methods for transport-dominated PDEs, organizing techniques around parametrizations, reduced dynamics, and online solvers. Addresses Kolmogorov barrier.

entry.title: Position: The Need for Ultrafast Training

author.name: Duc Hoang

entry.summary: Position paper arguing for ultrafast on-chip learning on FPGAs, shifting from inference-only accelerators to systems supporting training under sub-microsecond latency constraints.

entry.title: Scale-covariant spiking wavelets

author.name: Jens Egholm Pedersen, Tony Lindeberg, Peter Gerstoft

entry.summary: Establishes theoretical connection between wavelet transforms and SNNs through scale-space theory, implementing discrete mother wavelets via leaky integrate-and-fire neurons.

entry.title: Adaptive Quality-Diversity Trade-offs for Large-Scale Batch Recommendation

entry.summary: Proposes B-DivRec algorithm combining determinantal point processes with diversity constraints for batch recommendation balancing quality and diversity at scale.

entry.title: NAB: Neural Adaptive Binning for Sparse-View CT reconstruction

author.name: Wangduo Xie, Matthew B. Blaschko

entry.title: Energy-Efficient Neuromorphic Computing for Edge AI: A Framework with Adaptive Spiking Neural Networks and Hardware-Aware Optimization

author.name: Olaf Yunus Laitinen Imanov, Derya Umut Kulali, Taner Yilmaz, Duygu Erisken, Rana Irem Turhan

entry.summary: Introduces NeuEdge, a framework combining adaptive spiking neural networks with hardware-aware optimization for edge deployment. Uses temporal coding that blends rate and spike-timing to reduce activity while maintaining accuracy.

entry.title: Tendem: A Hybrid AI+Human Platform

entry.title: Understanding QA generation: Extracting Parametric and Contextual Knowledge with CQA for Low Resource Bangla Language

entry.summary: Introduces BanglaCQA, first Counterfactual QA dataset for Bangla to disentangle parametric and contextual knowledge in QA models.

entry.title: Argument Rarity-based Originality Assessment for AI-Assisted Writing

author.name: Keito Inoshita, Michiaki Omura, Tsukasa Yamanaka, Go Maeda, Kentaro Tsuji

entry.summary: Proposes AROA framework for evaluating argumentative originality in student essays using rarity-based metrics: structural rarity, claim rarity, evidence rarity, and cognitive depth.

entry.title: Orthogonal Hierarchical Decomposition for Structure-Aware Table Understanding with Large Language Models

entry.summary: Proposes Orthogonal Hierarchical Decomposition framework for representing complex tables with multi-level headers and merged cells to LLMs. Uses orthogonal tree structures to preserve hierarchical relationships.

entry.title: ROG: Retrieval-Augmented LLM Reasoning for Complex First-Order Queries over Knowledge Graphs

entry.summary: ROG combines query-aware neighborhood retrieval with LLM chain-of-thought for first-order logic queries over incomplete knowledge graphs, decomposing multi-operator queries into single-operator sub-queries.

entry.title: Causally Disentangled Contrastive Learning for Multilingual Speaker Embeddings

author.name: Mari\"ette Olijslager, Seyed Sahand Mohammadi Ziabari, Ali Mohammed Mansoor Alsahag

entry.summary: Investigates demographic information leakage in speaker embeddings and evaluates adversarial training and causal bottleneck architectures for debiasing while maintaining speaker verification performance.

entry.title: AI-Driven Three-Dimensional Reconstruction and Quantitative Analysis for Burn Injury Assessment

author.name: S. Kalaycioglu, C. Hong, K. Zhai, H. Xie, J. N. Wong

entry.title: Computer Vision and Its Relationship to Cognitive Science: A perspective from Bayes Decision Theory

author.name: Alan Yuille, Daniel Kersten

entry.summary: Tutorial introduction to computer vision from Bayes Decision Theory perspective, connecting Bayesian frameworks and deep neural networks to cognitive science and visual neuroscience.

entry.title: ZS-TreeSeg: A Zero-Shot Framework for Tree Crown Instance Segmentation

author.name: Pengyu Chen, Fangzheng Lyu, Sicheng Wang, Cuizhen Wang

author.name: Nick DiSanto, Ehsan Khodapanah Aghdam, Han Liu, Jacob Watson, Yuankai K. Tao, Hao Li, Ipek Oguz

entry.title: GDPR-Compliant Person Recognition in Industrial Environments Using MEMS-LiDAR and Hybrid Data

author.name: Dennis Basile, Dennis Sprute, Helene D\"orksen, Holger Flatt

entry.summary: Presents GDPR-compliant person recognition using MEMS-LiDAR with hybrid synthetic-real data for privacy-preserving detection in industrial environments.

entry.title: Lung Nodule Image Synthesis Driven by Two-Stage Generative Adversarial Networks

author.name: Lu Cao, Xiquan He, Junying Zeng, Chaoyun Mai, Min Luo

entry.summary: Proposes two-stage GAN for lung nodule image synthesis decoupling morphological structure and texture features for improved diversity and controllability.

author.name: Ti Ti Nguyen, Thanh-Dung Le, Vu Nguyen Ha, Duc-Dung Tran, Hung Nguyen-Kha, Dinh-Hieu Tran, Carlos L. Marcos-Rojas, Juan C. Merlano-Duncan, Symeon Chatzinotas

entry.summary: Investigates Deep Joint Source-Channel Coding for Earth Observation imagery transmission, analyzing semantic loss for satellite communication constraints.

entry.title: A Renderer-Enabled Framework for Computing Parameter Estimation Lower Bounds in Plenoptic Imaging Systems

author.name: Abhinav V. Sambasivan, Liam J. Coulter, Richard G. Paxman, Jarvis D. Haupt

entry.summary: Presents framework for computing parameter estimation lower bounds in plenoptic imaging using computer graphics rendering to synthesize forward models for indirect imaging.

entry.summary: Proposes SanD-Planner, a sample-efficient diffusion-based local planner operating in B-spline space for robust navigation in cluttered environments.

author.name: Astik Srivastava, Thomas J Chackenkulam. Bitla Bhanu Teja, Antony Thomas, Madhava Krishna

author.name: Xiangyu Li, Mingwei Lai, Mengke Zhang, Junxiao Lin, Tiancheng Lai, Junping Zhi, Chao Xu, Fei Gao, Yanjun Cao

entry.summary: Presents TriphiBot, a triphibious robot combining quadcopter with passive wheels for aerial, terrestrial, and aquatic motion with eccentric CoG design.

entry.summary: Proposes Bayesian optimization framework for co-designing rover wheel geometry and controller parameters using full-vehicle terramechanics simulations.

entry.summary: Proposes reframing agent goals as 'goal-models' (analogous to world-models but representing desired states) rather than utility functions, inspired by predictive processing frameworks.

entry.title: Culinary Crossroads: A RAG Framework for Enhancing Diversity in Cross-Cultural Recipe Adaptation

Provides convergence guarantees for parameter estimation when combining frozen pre-trained experts with trainable adapters.

entry.summary: Studies robustness of commercial presentation attack detection (PAD) systems under low-light and auto-capture conditions, finding significant performance degradation.

entry.title: Model Optimization for Multi-Camera 3D Detection and Tracking

author.name: Ethan Anderson (Clemson University), Justin Silva (Clemson University), Kyle Zheng (Clemson University), Sameer Pusegaonkar (NVIDIA), Yizhou Wang (NVIDIA), Zheng Tang (NVIDIA), Sujit Biswas (NVIDIA)

entry.title: HSSDCT: Factorized Spatial-Spectral Correlation for Hyperspectral Image Fusion

author.name: Chia-Ming Lee, Yu-Hao Ho, Yu-Fan Lin, Jen-Wei Lee, Li-Wei Kang, Chih-Chung Hsu

entry.summary: HSSDCT for hyperspectral image fusion uses hierarchical dense-residue transformer blocks and spectral decorrelation to address redundancy and quadratic attention complexity.

entry.title: Supervised makeup transfer with a curated dataset: Decoupling identity and makeup features for enhanced transformation

author.name: Qihe Pan, Yiming Wu, Xing Zhao, Liang Xie, Guodao Sun, Ronghua Liang

entry.title: Effectiveness of Automatically Curated Dataset in Thyroid Nodules Classification Algorithms Using Deep Learning

author.name: Jichen Yang, Jikai Zhang, Benjamin Wildman-Tobriner, Maciej A. Mazurowski
