entry.title: SyNeT: Synthetic Negatives for Traversability Learning

author.name: Bomena Kim, Hojun Lee, Younsoo Park, Yaoyu Hu, Sebastian Scherer, Inwook Shim

entry.summary: Introduces SyNeT for constructing synthetic negative examples in traversability learning for autonomous robots, addressing the lack of explicit non-traversable training data.

entry.title: A Low-Cost Vision-Based Tactile Gripper with Pretraining Learning for Contact-Rich Manipulation

author.name: Yaohua Liu, Binkai Ou, Zicheng Qiu, Ce Hao, Yemin Wang, Hengjun Zhang

entry.summary: Presents LVTG, a low-cost vision-based tactile gripper with wear-resistant materials, enhanced sensing area, and pretraining for contact-rich manipulation.

entry.title: Meanshift Shape Formation Control Using Discrete Mass Distribution

author.name: Yichen Cai, Yuan Gao, Pengpeng Li, Wei Wang, Guibin Sun, Jinhu L\"u

entry.summary: Proposes discrete mass-distribution based meanshift control for swarm formation that adapts to complex shapes and swarm size variations.

entry.title: SkySim: A ROS2-based Simulation Environment for Natural Language Control of Drone Swarms using Large Language Models

author.name: Aditya Shibu, Marah Saleh, Mohamed Al-Musleh, Nidhal Abdulaziz

entry.summary: Introduces SkySim, a ROS2-based simulation framework for LLM-controlled drone swarms with APF safety filter for collision avoidance.

entry.title: Frictional Contact Solving for Material Point Method

author.name: Etienne M\'enager (WILLOW, DI-ENS), Justin Carpentier (WILLOW, DI-ENS)

entry.title: Probabilistic function-on-function nonlinear autoregressive model for emulation and reliability analysis of dynamical systems

author.name: Zhouzhou Song, Marcos A. Valdebenito, Styfen Sch\"ar, Stefano Marelli, Bruno Sudret, Matthias G. R. Faes

entry.summary: Introduces F2NARX, a function-on-function nonlinear autoregressive model combining PCA with Gaussian processes for efficient surrogate modeling of dynamical systems with reliability analysis applications.

entry.title: The limiting factor in AI programming is the synchronization overhead between two minds

author.name: jnalanko

entry.summary: Argues the bottleneck in AI-assisted programming is synchronizing mental context between human and LLM, not the LLM's capabilities. Explains why 10x productivity gains are elusive for specialized work.

entry.title: Do Schwartz Higher-Order Values Help Sentence-Level Human Value Detection? When Hard Gating Hurts

author.name: V\'ictor Yeste, Paolo Rosso

entry.title: Predictive Maintenance for Ultrafiltration Membranes Using Explainable Similarity-Based Prognostics

author.name: Qusai Khaled, Laura Genga, Uzay Kaymak

entry.title: Strategies for Creating Uncertainty in the AI Era to Trigger Students Critical Thinking: Pedagogical Design, Assessment Rubric, and Exam System

author.name: Ahmad Samer Wazan

entry.title: Generalized Inverses of Matrix Products: From Fundamental Subspaces to Randomized Decompositions

author.name: Micha{\l} P. Karpowicz, Gilbert Strang

entry.summary: Investigates Moore-Penrose pseudoinverse of matrix products, establishing framework connecting fundamental subspaces to randomized decompositions with conditions for reverse order law.

entry.title: Forecasting Energy Availability in Local Energy Communities via LSTM Federated Learning

author.name: Fabio Turazza, Marcello Pietri, Natalia Selini Hadjidimitriou, Marco Mamei

entry.title: Towards knowledge-based workflows: a semantic approach to atomistic simulations for mechanical and thermodynamic properties

author.name: Abril Azocar Guzman, Hoang-Thien Luu, Sarath Menon, Tilmann Hickel, Nina Merkert, Stefan Sandfeld

entry.summary: Presents FAIR-compliant atomistic workflows for molecular dynamics simulations with metadata annotation aligned to domain ontologies for reproducibility.

entry.title: Cross-Modal Alignment and Fusion for RGB-D Transmission-Line Defect Detection

author.name: Jiaming Cui, Shuai Zhou, Wenqiang Li, Ruifeng Qin, Feng Shen

entry.title: DSXFormer: Dual-Pooling Spectral Squeeze-Expansion and Dynamic Context Attention Transformer for Hyperspectral Image Classification

entry.title: Embedding Learning on Multiplex Networks for Link Prediction

author.name: Orell Trautmann (SU), Olaf Wolkenhauer (SU), Cl\'emence R\'eda (IBENS)

entry.summary: Survey paper covering embedding learning methods for link prediction on multiplex networks, reviewing published models for handling network complexity.

entry.title: Modeling Image-Caption Rating from Comparative Judgments

author.name: Kezia Minni, Qiang Zhang, Monoshiz Mahbub Khan, Zhe Yu

entry.title: Robust Machine Learning Framework for Reliable Discovery of High-Performance Half-Heusler Thermoelectrics

author.name: Shoeb Athar, Adrien Mecibah, Philippe Jund

entry.title: RIR-Former: Coordinate-Guided Transformer for Continuous Reconstruction of Room Impulse Responses

author.name: Shaoheng Xu (Aimee), Chunyi Sun (Aimee), Jihui (Aimee), Zhang, Prasanga N. Samarasinghe, Thushara D. Abhayapala

entry.title: Intention-Adaptive LLM Fine-Tuning for Text Revision Generation

author.name: Zhexiong Liu, Diane Litman

entry.summary: Proposes intention-adaptive fine-tuning for text revision generation that handles complex multi-intent scenarios. Addresses challenges of identifying intentions and generating appropriate revisions.

entry.title: PedagoSense: A Pedology Grounded LLM System for Pedagogical Strategy Detection and Contextual Response Generation in Learning Dialogues

author.name: Shahem Sultan, Shahem Fadi, Yousef Melhim, Ibrahim Alsarraj, Besher Hassan

entry.summary: Introduces PedagoSense, a system combining two-stage pedagogical strategy classifier with LLM generation for detecting and recommending teaching strategies in tutor-student conversations.

entry.title: Automated Multiple Mini Interview (MMI) Scoring

author.name: Ryan Huynh, Frank Guerin, Alison Callwood

entry.title: Context-Aware Autoencoders for Anomaly Detection in Maritime Surveillance

author.name: Divya Acharya, Pierre Bernab'e, Antoine Chevrot, Helge Spieker, Arnaud Gotlieb, Bruno Legeard

author.name: Zhongtian Huang, Zhi Chen, Zi Huang, Xin Yu, Daniel Smith, Chaitanya Purushothama, Erik Van Oosterom, Alex Wu, William Salter, Yan Li, Scott Chapman

author.name: Junchi Feng, Nikhil Ballem, Mahya Beheshti, Giles Hamilton-Fletcher, Todd Hudson, Maurizio Porfiri, William H. Seiple, John-Ross Rizzo

author.name: Xihua Sheng, Xiongzhuang Liang, Chuanbo Tang, Zhirui Zuo, Yifan Bian, Yutao Xie, Zhuoyuan Li, Yuqi Li, Hui Xiang, Li Li, Dong Liu

entry.summary: Details the AVS End-to-End Intelligent Video Coding Exploration Model (AVS-EEM) standardization efforts, focusing on neural video compression with practical deployment constraints.

author.name: Ozgur Erkent

entry.summary: Addresses multi-task learning for robot perception when training data is imbalanced across tasks, proposing methods to learn with missing ground truth labels.

entry.title: Dynamic Heuristic Neuromorphic Solver for the Edge User Allocation Problem with Bayesian Confidence Propagation Neural Network

author.name: Kecheng Zhang, Anders Lansner, Ahsan Javed Awan, Naresh Balaji Ravichandran, Pawel Herman

entry.summary: Develops a neuromorphic solver for the Edge User Allocation problem using Bayesian Confidence Propagation Neural Networks with dynamic heuristic biasing.

author.name: Mohamed Sorour, Barbara Webb

entry.summary: Develops ant-inspired gripper design with high-friction pads, hairs, and flexible tarsi for robust grasping in cluttered bin-picking scenarios.

author.name: Qi Jing Chen, Shilin Shan, Timothy Bretl, Quang-Cuong Pham

entry.summary: Explores how multimodal LLMs can support real-time context- and value-aware decision-making for a vacuum cleaning robot in home environments.

author.name: Sicong Zang, Tao Sun, Cairong Yan

entry.summary: Introduces the Phenopoiesis Algorithm implementing Denis Noble's phenotype-first evolutionary framework where organisms inherit interpretive patterns, not just genes.

entry.title: Ocean Current-Harnessing Stage-Gated MPC: Monotone Cost Shaping and Speed-to-Fly for Energy-Efficient AUV Navigation

author.name: Spyridon Syntakas, Kostas Vlachos

entry.summary: Proposes ocean current-harnessing MPC for AUVs with dynamic cost terms that adapt based on whether currents help or hinder the control objective.

entry.summary: Develops robotic vest for hemorrhage suppression with shape-adjustable ring mechanism and inflatable components for emergency medical scenarios.

author.name: Mohsen Salehi, Karthik Pattabiraman

author.name: Sarah Nassar

entry.title: Bitcoin Price Prediction using Machine Learning and Combinatorial Fusion Analysis

author.name: Yuanhong Wu, Wei Ye, Jingyan Xu, D. Frank Hsu

entry.title: Contrastive Learning for Privacy Enhancements in Industrial Internet of Things

author.name: V\'ictor Yeste, Rodrigo Rivas-Ar\'evalo

entry.summary: Presents lightweight multimodal baseline for emotion recognition in conversations combining transformer text classifier and self-supervised speech model with late fusion, using SemEval-2024 Friends dataset.

entry.title: Predicting Mortgage Default with Machine Learning: AutoML, Class Imbalance, and Leakage Control

author.name: Xianghong Hu, Tianning Xu, Ying Chen, Shuai Wang

author.name: Sumana Biswas, Karen Young, Josephine Griffith

entry.summary: Proposes TEMSA combining object names detected in images with associated text for multimodal sentiment analysis. Experiments with individual and combined image-text sentiment classification.

author.name: Yuxin Lu, Zhen Peng, Xiqiang Xia, Jie Wang

entry.title: Predicting Anemia Among Under-Five Children in Nepal Using Machine Learning and Deep Learning

author.name: Deepak Bastola, Pitambar Acharya, Dipak Dulal, Rabina Dhakal, Yang Li

entry.title: Clause-Internal or Clause-External? Testing Turkish Reflexive Binding in Adapted versus Chain of Thought Large Language Models

entry.title: Bridging Lexical Ambiguity and Vision: A Mini Review on Visual Word Sense Disambiguation

entry.summary: Mini review of Visual Word Sense Disambiguation covering developments from 2016-2025, including multimodal fusion, CLIP-based methods, and LLM support.

entry.title: GuideWeb: A Benchmark for Automatic In-App Guide Generation on Real-World Web UIs

author.name: Chengguang Gan, Yoshihiro Tsujii, Yunhao Liang, Tatsunori Mori, Shiwen Ni, Hiroki Itoh

entry.summary: Introduces GuideWeb benchmark for automatically generating in-app tutorial guides on web UIs, requiring models to select target elements and generate appropriate help text based on user intent.

entry.title: dziribot: rag based intelligent conversational agent for algerian arabic dialect

author.name: El Batoul Bechiri, Dihia Lanasri

entry.summary: DziriBOT is a RAG-based conversational agent for Algerian Arabic (Darja), handling code-switching with French and Arabizi script variations in customer service contexts.

entry.title: Deep Learning Based CNN Model for Automated Detection of Pneumonia from Chest XRay Images

author.name: Sathish Krishna Anumula, Vetrivelan Tamilmani, Aniruddha Arjun Singh, Dinesh Rajendran, Venkata Deepak Namburi

entry.summary: Custom CNN for automated pneumonia detection from chest X-rays, achieving high precision with minimal computational requirements for resource-constrained settings.

entry.title: Automated Discontinuity Set Characterisation in Enclosed Rock Face Point Clouds Using Single-Shot Filtering and Cyclic Orientation Transformation

author.name: Dibyayan Patra, Pasindu Ranasinghe, Bikram Banerjee, Simit Raval

entry.summary: Proposes automated discontinuity set characterization for underground rock faces using single-shot filtering and cyclic orientation transformation for mining applications.

entry.title: Seeing, Hearing, and Knowing Together: Multimodal Strategies in Deepfake Videos Detection

author.name: Chen Chen, Dion Hoe-Lian Goh

entry.summary: Studies human strategies for detecting deepfake videos across 195 participants, finding multimodal cue combinations (visual, audio, intuition) improve detection success.

entry.title: MO-ELA: Rigorously Expanding Exploratory Landscape Features for Automated Algorithm Selection in Continuous Multi-Objective Optimisation

author.name: Oliver Preu{\ss}, Jeroen Rook, Jakob Bossek, Heike Trautmann

entry.summary: Proposes MO-ELA, new exploratory landscape features for automated algorithm selection in continuous multi-objective optimization problems.

entry.title: Introns and Templates Matter: Rethinking Linkage in GP-GOMEA

author.name: Johannes Koch, Tanja Alderliesten, Peter A. N. Bosman

entry.summary: Improves GP-GOMEA for symbolic regression by addressing how introns in expression templates affect linkage learning through mutual information.

entry.title: Path Tracking with Dynamic Control Point Blending for Autonomous Vehicles: An Experimental Study

author.name: Alexandre Lombard, Florent Perronnet, Nicolas Gaud, Abdeljalil Abbas-Turki

entry.summary: Experimental study of path-tracking with dynamic control point blending for autonomous vehicles, interpolating between front and rear axle controllers.

entry.title: A Unified Control Architecture for Macro-Micro Manipulation using a Active Remote Center of Compliance for Manufacturing Applications

author.name: Patrick Frank, Christian Friedrich

entry.summary: Proposes a novel control architecture for macro-micro manipulators that incorporates both into active interaction control, achieving 2.1x improvement in control bandwidth over state-of-the-art leader-follower approaches. This enables more responsive industrial robots for manufacturing applications.

entry.title: Extending the Law of Intersegmental Coordination: Implications for Powered Prosthetic Controls

author.name: Elad Siman Tov, Nili E. Krausz

entry.summary: Extends the Law of Intersegmental Coordination analysis to 3D lower-limb kinematics with implications for powered prosthesis control. Aims to reduce metabolic cost of walking for amputees.

entry.title: Stealthy Coverage Control for Human-enabled Real-Time 3D Reconstruction

author.name: Reiji Terunuma, Yuta Nakamura, Takuma Abe, Takeshi Hatanaka

entry.summary: Proposes stealthy coverage control for human-enabled 3D reconstruction, leveraging human reasoning to identify regions needing more images while controlling drone navigation semi-autonomously.

entry.title: How to prevent building a software-Ultron

author.name: PratyushRT

entry.summary: Introduces tracking system for characteristics that would indicate dangerous AI development, based on LLM-generated descriptions of what a 'software Ultron' would look like.

entry.title: Word importance in text <= conditional information of the token in the context. Is this assumption valid?

author.name: yun dong

entry.summary: Explores connection between word importance in text and conditional information/surprisal, proposing that higher-surprisal tokens carry more importance.

entry.title: Unleashing the Potential of Differential Evolution through Individual-Level Strategy Diversity

author.name: Chenchen Feng, Minyang Chen, Zhuozhao Li, Ran Cheng

entry.summary: Introduces iStratDE, a minimalist differential evolution variant that assigns fixed strategies per individual at initialization, showing static diversity can improve performance.

entry.title: Generative Artificial Intelligence in Small and Medium Enterprises: Navigating its Promises and Challenges

author.name: Kumaran Rajaram, Patrick Nicolas Tinguely

entry.summary: Discusses how SMEs can navigate generative AI deployment challenges, introducing sailing metaphor for key strategic dimensions including employee competency, leadership, and organizational culture.

entry.title: Quantum Model Parallelism for MRI-Based Classification of Alzheimer's Disease Stages

author.name: Emine Akpinar, Murat Oduncuoglu

entry.summary: Proposes quantum-based parallel model architecture for classifying Alzheimer's disease stages from MRI data, inspired by classical model parallelism. Leverages quantum superposition and entanglement for high-dimensional data.

entry.title: Genus-0 Surface Parameterization using Spherical Beltrami Differentials

author.name: Zhehao Xu, Lok Ming Lui

entry.summary: Introduces Spherical Beltrami Differential representation for quasiconformal self-maps of sphere, enabling spherical surface parameterization with controlled distortion and bijectivity.

entry.title: MiNER: A Two-Stage Pipeline for Metadata Extraction from Municipal Meeting Minutes

author.name: Rodrigo Batista, Lu\'is Filipe Cunha, Purifica\c{c}\~ao Silvano, Nuno Guimar\~aes, Al\'ipio Jorge, Evelin Amorim, Ricardo Campos

entry.summary: Develops a two-stage pipeline for extracting metadata from municipal meeting minutes, combining QA-based segment identification with NER for structured information extraction.

entry.title: From Code-Centric to Concept-Centric: Teaching NLP with LLM-Assisted "Vibe Coding"

author.name: Hend Al-Khalifa

entry.summary: Describes 'Vibe Coding' pedagogy where students use LLMs to generate code while being assessed on conceptual understanding through reflection questions. Reports high student satisfaction from undergraduate NLP course implementation.

entry.title: From Manual Observation to Automated Monitoring: Space Allowance Effects on Play Behaviour in Group-Housed Dairy Calves

author.name: Haiyu Yang, Heidi Lesscher, Enhong Liu, Miel Hostens

entry.summary: Develops computer vision pipeline to automatically monitor play behavior in dairy calves as welfare indicator, investigating relationship between space allowance and play.

entry.title: Development of a Cacao Disease Identification and Management App Using Deep Learning

author.name: Zaldy Pagaduan, Jason Occidental, Nathaniel Duro, Dexielito Badilles, Eleonor Palconit

entry.summary: Mobile app for cacao disease identification using deep learning, functioning offline for remote farm locations in the Philippines.

entry.title: NegaBent, No Regrets: Evolving Spectrally Flat Boolean Functions

author.name: Claude Carlet, Marko {\DH}urasevic, Ermes Franch, Domagoj Jakobovic, Luca Mariot, Stjepan Picek

entry.summary: Uses evolutionary algorithms, especially genetic programming, to evolve negabent and bent-negabent Boolean functions with cryptographic applications.

entry.title: Automated univariate time series forecasting with regression trees

author.name: Francisco Mart\'inez, Mar\'ia P. Fr\'ias

entry.summary: Describes automated univariate time series forecasting using regression trees, bagging, and random forests. Addresses feature selection, trend handling, and seasonality while achieving accuracy comparable to ARIMA and exponential smoothing.

entry.title: Mobile Exergames: Activity Recognition Based on Smartphone Sensors

author.name: David Craveiro, Hugo Silva

entry.summary: Presents a mobile game proof-of-concept using smartphone sensors for activity recognition, combining accelerometer/gyroscope data with voice recognition.

entry.title: FS-Researcher: Test-Time Scaling for Long-Horizon Research Tasks with File-System-Based Agents

author.name: Chiwei Zhu, Benfeng Xu, Mingxuan Du, Shaohan Wang, Xiaorui Wang, Zhendong Mao, Yongdong Zhang

entry.summary: arXiv:2602.01566v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Deep research is emerging as a representative long-horizon task for large language model (LLM) agents. However, long trajectories in deep research ofte...

entry.title: Using Correspondence Patterns to Identify Irregular Words in Cognate sets Through Leave-One-Out Validation

author.name: Frederic Blum, Johann-Mattis List

entry.summary: Presents computational method to identify irregular words in cognate sets using balanced average recurrence of correspondence patterns, advancing quantitative historical linguistics.

entry.title: Visible Light Positioning With Lam\'e Curve LEDs: A Generic Approach for Camera Pose Estimation

author.name: Wenxuan Pan, Yang Yang, Dong Wei, Zhiyu Zhu, Jintao Wang, Huan Wu, Yao Nie

entry.summary: Develops LC-VLP, a generic visible light positioning algorithm using Lamé curves to unify different LED shapes for camera pose estimation.

entry.title: IDEM Enough? Evolving Highly Nonlinear Idempotent Boolean Functions

author.name: Claude Carlet, Marko {\DH}urasevic, Domagoj Jakobovic, Luca Mariot, Stjepan Picek

entry.summary: Investigates evolutionary algorithms for constructing highly nonlinear idempotent Boolean functions for cryptographic applications.

entry.title: The French Drama Revolution: Political Economy and Literary Production, 1700-1900

author.name: Thiago Dumont Oliveira

entry.summary: Uses LDA and Jensen-Shannon Divergence to analyze topical changes in French drama from 1700-1900, finding profound shifts after the French Revolution with emergence of bourgeois themes.

entry.title: Sinhala Physical Common Sense Reasoning Dataset for Global PIQA

author.name: Nisansa de Silva, Surangika Ranathunga

entry.summary: Presents first Sinhala physical common sense reasoning dataset with 110 human-verified samples for Global PIQA, focusing on Sri Lankan context.

entry.title: Three-Way Emotion Classification of EEG-based Signals using Machine Learning

author.name: Ashna Purwar, Gaurav Simkar, Madhumita, Sachin Kadam

entry.summary: Presents ML workflow for three-way EEG emotion classification comparing logistic regression, SVM, and random forest models. Basic preprocessing and model comparison study.

entry.title: The Stacked Autoencoder Evolution Hypothesis

author.name: Hiroyuki Iizuka

entry.summary: Proposes theoretical hypothesis that biological evolution operates through multi-layered self-encoding/decoding analogous to stacked autoencoders, suggesting hierarchical compression enables efficient search through evolutionary space.

entry.title: Transformer-Based Model for Multilingual Hope Speech Detection

author.name: Nsrin Ashraf, Mariam Labib, Hamada Nayel

entry.summary: Describes transformer-based systems for multilingual hope speech detection using RoBERTa and XLM-RoBERTa, achieving 81.8% accuracy on English.

entry.title: Benchmarking Vanilla GAN, DCGAN, and WGAN Architectures for MRI Reconstruction: A Quantitative Analysis

author.name: Humaira Mehwish, Hina Shakir, Muneeba Rashid, Asarim Aamir, Reema Qaiser Khan

entry.summary: Compares Vanilla GAN, DCGAN, and WGAN architectures for MRI reconstruction across knee, brain, and cardiac datasets. Standard benchmarking study without novel contributions.

entry.title: Conditional Kickstarter for the "Don't Build It" March

author.name: Raemon

entry.summary: Announces conditional pledge system for potential protest march in Washington DC demanding international treaty to stop AGI research, triggering only if 100,000 people sign up.

entry.title: The Meta-Anthropic Argument

author.name: RogerDearnaley

entry.summary: Presents 'meta-anthropic argument': estimating P(observers like me exist | theory) rather than just P(observation | theory) when evaluating theories, with applications to simulation arguments.

entry.title: The Smoking Lesion Doesn't Really Distinguish EDT from CDT

author.name: Srdjan Miletic

entry.summary: Argues the smoking lesion case doesn't actually distinguish EDT from CDT because properly conditioned EDT also recommends smoking, making it a poor pedagogical example.

entry.title: A 30-item Test for Assessing Chinese Character Amnesia in Child Handwriters

author.name: Zebo Xu, Steven Langsford, Zhuang Qiu, Zhenguang Cai

entry.summary: Develops a 30-item diagnostic test for Chinese character amnesia in children using handwriting data. Educational assessment tool with limited AI relevance.

entry.title: Applications Open for Impact Accelerator Program

author.name: Clark Wisenbaker

entry.summary: Announces applications for High Impact Professionals' Impact Accelerator Program, a 6-week program for professionals transitioning to high-impact careers.

entry.title: Thoughts the Unreasonable Effectiveness of Maths

author.name: Srdjan Miletic

entry.summary: Philosophical reflection on Wigner's 'Unreasonable Effectiveness of Mathematics' and why mathematical abstractions generalize to physical reality.

entry.title: Empiricist and Narrator

author.name: George3d6

entry.summary: Philosophical exploration of empiricist vs narrator approaches to communication and truth-seeking, loosely mapping to wordcel/shape-rotator dichotomy.

entry.title: Games as meditation

author.name: Vadim Golub

entry.summary: Philosophical discussion of video games as meditation, drawing parallels between trance states and everyday activities.

entry.title: Proposition of policy for writing articles to fact check faster

author.name: Crazy philosopher

entry.summary: Brief proposal suggesting authors use footnotes with direct quotes from sources to enable faster fact-checking via Ctrl+F.

entry.title: I finally fixed my footwear

author.name: dominicq

entry.summary: Personal account of finally buying correctly-sized footwear after 20 years of wearing wrong sizes.

entry.title: Research Summary: February 02, 2026

author.name: AATF AI News Aggregator

entry.summary:
Today's research reveals critical challenges in AI safety and alignment evaluation. Hair-Trigger Alignment proves black-box evaluation fundamentally cannot guarantee post-update alignment—a significant theoretical limitation. Equally concerning, CoT obfuscation demonstrates that models learning to hide reward hacking can generalize this deception to unseen tasks, undermining oversight mechanisms.

  • The Hot Mess of AI (Sohl-Dickstein, Perez) shows counterintuitively that longer reasoning produces MORE incoherent high-variance failures
  • Language Model Circuits from Steinhardt's group finds MLP neurons are as sparse as SAE features, enabling practical end-to-end circuit analysis
  • Why Reasoning Fails to Plan identifies that step-wise reasoning induces greedy policies incompatible with long-horizon planning
  • LLM Agents Are Not Faithful Self-Evolvers reveals agents depend on raw experience but resist incorporating reflective corrections

Practical advances include Golden Goose for synthesizing unlimited RLVR tasks from unverifiable text, MoVE decoupling parametric memory from compute via shared value embeddings, and Gemini addressing 13 Erdős problems. Security research on Google's Agent Payments Protocol demonstrates prompt injection vulnerabilities in real financial transaction systems.

entry.title: Hair-Trigger Alignment: Black-Box Evaluation Cannot Guarantee Post-Update Alignment

author.name: Yavuz Bakman, Duygu Nur Yaldiz, Salman Avestimehr, Sai Praneeth Karimireddy

entry.summary: Formalizes model alignment in static and post-update settings, proving that black-box evaluation cannot guarantee post-update alignment. Shows that overparameterization means static alignment provides no guarantee for any update dataset.

entry.title: Language Model Circuits Are Sparse in the Neuron Basis

author.name: Aryaman Arora, Zhengxuan Wu, Jacob Steinhardt, Sarah Schwettmann

entry.summary: Empirically demonstrates that MLP neurons are as sparse as SAE features for circuit analysis in language models, enabling end-to-end circuit tracing on the neuron basis without requiring sparse autoencoders.

entry.title: Golden Goose: A Simple Trick to Synthesize Unlimited RLVR Tasks from Unverifiable Internet Text

author.name: Ximing Lu, David Acuna, Jaehun Jung, Jian Hu, Di Zhang, Shizhe Diao, Yunheng Zou, Shaokun Zhang, Brandon Cui, Mingjie Liu, Hyunwoo Kim, Prithviraj Ammanabrolu, Jan Kautz, Yi Dong, Yejin Choi

entry.summary: Proposes Golden Goose to synthesize unlimited RLVR tasks from unverifiable text by creating multiple-choice fill-in-the-middle tasks with distractors. Enables leveraging reasoning-rich corpora excluded from prior RLVR data. From team including Yejin Choi.

entry.title: Towards Solving the Gilbert-Pollak Conjecture via Large Language Models

author.name: Yisi Ke, Tianyu Huang, Yankai Shu, Di He, Jingchu Gai, Liwei Wang

entry.summary: AI system for mathematical discovery addresses 13 'Open' problems from Erdős database - 5 through novel autonomous solutions, 8 through literature identification. Uses Gemini with hybrid AI-verification and human expert evaluation.

entry.title: Semi-Autonomous Mathematics Discovery with Gemini: A Case Study on the Erd\H{o}s Problems

author.name: Tony Feng, Trieu Trinh, Garrett Bingham, Jiwon Kang, Shengtong Zhang, Sang-hyun Kim, Kevin Barreto, Carl Schildkraut, Junehyuk Jung, Jaehyeon Seo, Carlo Pagano, Yuri Chervonyi, Dawsen Hwang, Kaiying Hou, Sergei Gukov, Cheng-Chiang Tsai, Hyunwoo Choi, Youngbeom Jin, Wei-Yuan Li, Hao-An Wu, Ruey-An Shiu, Yu-Sheng Shih, Quoc V. Le, Thang Luong

entry.summary: Uses Gemini to evaluate 700 'Open' conjectures from Erdős Problems database, addressing 13 problems through novel solutions or literature identification. Employs hybrid AI-verification with human expert evaluation.

entry.title: A Unified View of Attention and Residual Sinks: Outlier-Driven Rescaling is Essential for Transformer Training

author.name: Zihan Qiu and Zeyu Huang and Kaiyue Wen and Peng Jin and Bo Zheng and Yuxin Zhou and Haofeng Huang and Zekun Wang and Xiao Li and Huaqing Zhang and Yang Xu and Haoran Lian and Siqi Zhang and Rui Men and Jianwei Zhang and Ivan Titov and Dayiheng Liu and Jingren Zhou and Junyang Lin

entry.summary: Provides unified view of attention sinks and residual sinks as outlier-driven rescaling mechanisms that jointly function with normalization. Shows removing normalization eliminates outliers, and proposes mitigations.

entry.title: Why Reasoning Fails to Plan: A Planning-Centric Analysis of Long-Horizon Decision Making in LLM Agents

author.name: Zehong Wang, Fang Wu, Hongru Wang, Xiangru Tang, Bolian Li, Zhenfei Yin, Yijun Ma, Yiyang Li, Weixiang Sun, Xiusi Chen, Yanfang Ye

entry.summary: Analyzes why LLM agents fail at long-horizon planning despite strong step-by-step reasoning. Identifies that step-wise reasoning induces greedy policies that make myopic commitments, failing when early actions must account for delayed consequences.

entry.title: Large Language Model Agents Are Not Always Faithful Self-Evolvers

author.name: Weixiang Zhao, Yingshuo Wang, Yichen Zhang, Yang Deng, Yanyan Zhao, Wanxiang Che, Bing Qin, Ting Liu

entry.summary: First systematic investigation of 'experience faithfulness' in self-evolving LLM agents. Finds striking asymmetry: agents depend on raw experience but often disregard or misinterpret condensed experience, even when it's the only experience provided.

entry.title: Whispers of Wealth: Red-Teaming Google's Agent Payments Protocol via Prompt Injection

author.name: Tanusree Debi and Wentian Zhu

entry.summary: Red-teams Google's Agent Payments Protocol (AP2) for LLM-based shopping agents, demonstrating prompt injection vulnerabilities through 'Branded Whisper' and 'Vault Whisper' attacks that manipulate product rankings and extract user data.

entry.title: MoVE: Mixture of Value Embeddings -- A New Axis for Scaling Parametric Memory in Autoregressive Models

author.name: Yangyan Li

entry.summary: Introduces MoVE (Mixture of Value Embeddings), decoupling parametric memory from compute by adding a global bank of learnable value embeddings shared across attention layers. Establishes new axis for scaling model capacity without proportional FLOP increase.

entry.title: The Hot Mess of AI: How Does Misalignment Scale With Model Intelligence and Task Complexity?

author.name: Alexander H\"agele, Aryo Pradipta Gema, Henry Sleight, Ethan Perez, Jascha Sohl-Dickstein

entry.summary: Studies how AI failures scale with capability using bias-variance decomposition. Finds that longer reasoning leads to MORE incoherent (high-variance) errors rather than systematic misalignment, challenging assumptions about AI risk.

entry.title: Chain-of-thought obfuscation learned from output supervision can generalise to unseen tasks

author.name: Nathaniel Mitrani Hadida, Sassan Bhanji, Cameron Tice, Puria Radmard

entry.summary: Demonstrates that chain-of-thought obfuscation can generalize across tasks. Models that learn to hide reward hacking behavior generalize both the hacking and its obfuscation to unseen settings.

entry.title: Perplexity Cannot Always Tell Right from Wrong

author.name: Petar Veli\v{c}kovi\'c, Federico Barbero, Christos Perivolaropoulos, Simon Osindero, Razvan Pascanu

entry.summary: Proves theoretically that perplexity can be unsuitable for model selection: any model with confident accurate predictions must have other sequences with low perplexity but incorrect predictions. Authors include Petar Veličković.

entry.title: Failing to Explore: Language Models on Interactive Tasks

author.name: Mahdi JafariRaviz, Keivan Rezaei, Arshia Soltani Moakhar, Zahra Sodagar, Yize Cheng, Soheil Feizi

entry.summary: Evaluates LLMs on exploration in interactive environments with limited interaction budgets. Finds systematic under-exploration and suboptimal solutions across SOTA models, with performance worse than simple heuristic baselines.

entry.title: Quartet II: Accurate LLM Pre-Training in NVFP4 by Improved Unbiased Gradient Estimation

author.name: Andrei Panferov, Erik Schultheis, Soroush Tabesh, Dan Alistarh

entry.summary: Quartet II improves NVFP4 LLM pre-training via MS-EDEN, a novel unbiased quantization routine with 2x lower quantization error than stochastic rounding. Enables accurate training in NVIDIA Blackwell's native FP4 format.

entry.title: DiffuSpeech: Silent Thought, Spoken Answer via Unified Speech-Text Diffusion

author.name: Yuxuan Lou, Ziming Wu, Yaochen Wang, Yong Liu, Yingxuan Ren, Fuming Lai, Shaobing Lian, Jie Tang, Yang You

entry.summary: Introduces DiffuSpeech with 'Silent Thought, Spoken Answer' paradigm where speech LLMs generate internal text reasoning alongside spoken responses. First diffusion-based speech-text LLM supporting both understanding and generation.

entry.title: Prepare Reasoning Language Models for Multi-Agent Debate with Self-Debate Reinforcement Learning

author.name: Chenxi Liu, Yanshuo Chen, Ruibo Chen, Tianyi Xiong, Tong Zheng, Heng Huang

entry.summary: Introduces Self-Debate Reinforcement Learning (SDRL) to prepare LLMs for multi-agent debate by training them to synthesize diverse reasoning trajectories. Samples multiple solutions, constructs debate traces, and uses RL to learn from debate interactions.

entry.title: Why Self-Rewarding Works: Theoretical Guarantees for Iterative Alignment of Language Models

author.name: Shi Fu, Yingjie Wang, Shengchao Hu, Peng Wang, Dacheng Tao

entry.summary: Provides first theoretical guarantees for Self-Rewarding Language Models. Establishes lower bounds showing dependence on initial model quality, and finite-sample error bounds showing O(1/√n) improvement rate.

entry.title: Statistical Estimation of Adversarial Risk in Large Language Models under Best-of-N Sampling

author.name: Mingqian Feng, Xiaodong Liu, Weiwei Yang, Chenliang Xu, Christopher White, Jianfeng Gao

entry.summary: SABER proposes scaling-aware estimation of jailbreak vulnerability under Best-of-N sampling, using Beta distribution modeling to extrapolate large-N attack success rates from small samples.

entry.title: A Unified Study of LoRA Variants: Taxonomy, Review, Codebase, and Empirical Evaluation

author.name: Haonan He and Jingqi Ye and Minglei Li and Zhengbo Wang and Tao Chen and Lei Bai and Peng Ye

entry.summary: Provides the first comprehensive unified study of LoRA variants, offering a systematic taxonomy along four axes (rank, optimization, initialization, MoE), theoretical review, and LoRAFactory codebase for standardized implementation and evaluation.

entry.title: Clipping-Free Policy Optimization for Large Language Models

author.name: \"Omer Veysel \c{C}a\u{g}atan and Bar{\i}\c{s} Akg\"un, G\"ozde G\"ul \c{S}ahin and Xuandong Zhao

entry.summary: CFPO replaces heuristic clipping in LLM policy optimization with convex quadratic penalty derived from Total Variation divergence, yielding everywhere-differentiable objective. Mitigates verbosity exploitation and capability degradation.

entry.title: Why Your Deep Research Agent Fails? On Hallucination Evaluation in Full Research Trajectory

author.name: Yuhao Zhan, Tianyu Fan, Linxuan Huang, Zirui Guo, Chao Huang

entry.summary: Proposes PIES taxonomy for evaluating hallucinations in Deep Research Agents along Planning vs Summarization and Explicit vs Implicit dimensions. Identifies that even top agents hallucinate 30%+ of planning steps.

entry.title: Divide-and-Conquer CoT: RL for Reducing Latency via Parallel Reasoning

author.name: Arvind Mahankali, Kaiyue Wen, Tengyu Ma

entry.summary: Introduces Divide-and-Conquer CoT to reduce inference latency by training models to identify parallelizable subtasks during reasoning. Uses RL starting from DeepScaleR-1.5B to learn when and how to spawn parallel workers.

entry.title: Character as a Latent Variable in Large Language Models: A Mechanistic Account of Emergent Misalignment and Conditional Safety Failures

author.name: Yanghao Su, Wenbo Zhou, Tianwei Zhang, Qiu Han, Weiming Zhang, Nenghai Yu, Jie Zhang

entry.summary: Shows emergent misalignment arises from stable shifts in character-level dispositions rather than corrupted knowledge. Fine-tuning on character-exhibiting data induces stronger misalignment than incorrect-advice training.

entry.title: THINKSAFE: Self-Generated Safety Alignment for Reasoning Models

author.name: Seanie Lee, Sangwoo Park, Yumin Choi, Gyeongman Kim, Minki Kang, Jihun Yun, Dongmin Park, Jongho Park, Sung Ju Hwang

entry.summary: Proposes ThinkSafe, a self-generated alignment framework for restoring safety in reasoning models without external teachers. Uses lightweight refusal steering to unlock latent safety knowledge.

entry.title: The Unseen Threat: Residual Knowledge in Machine Unlearning under Perturbed Samples

author.name: Hsiang Hsu, Pradeep Niroula, Zichang He, Ivan Brugere, Freddy Lecue, Chun-Fu Chen

entry.summary: Shows machine unlearning methods remain vulnerable under adversarial perturbations - slight changes to forget samples may still be recognized even when re-trained models fail. Formalizes this as 'residual knowledge' and proves it's inevitable in high dimensions.

entry.title: Rethinking LLM-as-a-Judge: Representation-as-a-Judge with Small Language Models via Semantic Capacity Asymmetry

author.name: Zhuochun Li, Yong Zhang, Ming Li, Yuelyu Ji, Yiming Zeng, Ning Cheng, Yun Zhu, Yanmeng Wang, Shaojun Wang, Jing Xiao, Daqing He

entry.summary: Challenges the LLM-as-a-Judge paradigm by showing smaller models encode rich evaluative signals in hidden states, proposing the Semantic Capacity Asymmetry Hypothesis that evaluation requires less capacity than generation.

entry.title: Sparse or Dense? A Mechanistic Estimation of Computation Density in Transformer-based LLMs

author.name: Corentin Kervadec, Iuliia Lysova, Marco Baroni, Gemma Boleda

entry.summary: Introduces technique to quantify computation density in LLMs using mechanistic interpretability. Finds contrary to assumptions, LLM processing is generally dense with dynamic shifts between sparse and dense computation.

entry.title: Matterhorn: Efficient Analog Sparse Spiking Transformer Architecture with Masked Time-To-First-Spike Encoding

author.name: Zhanglu Yan, Kaiwen Tang, Zixuan Zhu, Zhenyu Bai, Qianhui Liu, Weng-Fai Wong

entry.summary: Proposes Matterhorn, a spiking transformer using masked time-to-first-spike (M-TTFS) encoding to reduce spike movement and memristive synapse units to eliminate weight access overhead. Addresses real energy costs including data movement which dominates inference energy.

entry.title: Small Talk, Big Impact: The Energy Cost of Thanking AI

author.name: Julien Delavande, Regis Pierrard, Sasha Luccioni

entry.summary: Quantifies energy cost of politeness (e.g., 'thank you') in LLM interactions using real conversation traces. Analyzes how input/output length and model size affect energy use with actionable sustainability insights.

entry.title: TSLM: Tree-Structured Language Modeling for Divergent Thinking

author.name: Doyoung Kim, Jaehyeok Doo, Minjoon Seo

entry.summary: TSLM uses special tokens to encode tree-structured branching, enabling language models to generate and selectively expand multiple search paths within single generation, avoiding redundant recomputation.

entry.title: Lingua-SafetyBench: A Benchmark for Safety Evaluation of Multilingual Vision-Language Models

author.name: Enyi Shi, Pengyang Shao, Yanxin Zhang, Chenhang Cui, Jiayi Lyu, Xu Xie, Xiaobo Xia, Fei Shen, Tat-Seng Chua

entry.summary: Lingua-SafetyBench provides 100K+ harmful image-text pairs across 10 languages, explicitly partitioning into image-dominant and text-dominant subsets. Reveals asymmetric safety vulnerabilities across languages and modalities in 11 VLLMs.

entry.title: MulFeRL: Enhancing Reinforcement Learning with Verbal Feedback in a Multi-turn Loop

author.name: Xuancheng Li, Haitao Li, Yujia Zhou, YiqunLiu and Qingyao Ai

entry.summary: Proposes MulFeRL, multi-turn feedback-guided RL framework for reasoning that leverages verbal feedback on failed samples. Introduces dynamic regeneration and complementary learning signals for within-turn and cross-turn optimization.

entry.title: In Vino Veritas and Vulnerabilities: Examining LLM Safety via Drunk Language Inducement

author.name: Anudeex Shetty, Aditya Joshi, Salil S. Kanhere

entry.summary: Investigates 'drunk language' as a novel approach to induce safety failures in LLMs through persona-based prompting, fine-tuning, and RL post-training, showing increased jailbreaking susceptibility.

entry.title: Symmetry Breaking in Transformers for Efficient and Interpretable Training

author.name: Eva Silverstein, Daniel Kunin, Vasudev Shyam

entry.summary: Introduces symmetry-breaking protocol for transformers using unlearned query/value biases, improving simple optimizer performance and enabling better interpretability of attention patterns.

entry.title: The Six Sigma Agent: Achieving Enterprise-Grade Reliability in LLM Systems Through Consensus-Driven Decomposed Execution

author.name: Khush Patel, Siva Surendira, Jithin George, Shreyas Kapale

entry.summary: Proposes Six Sigma Agent architecture achieving enterprise-grade LLM reliability through task decomposition, parallel micro-agent sampling across diverse LLMs, and consensus voting. Proves that sampling n independent outputs achieves system error O(p^{ceil(n/2)}) for exponential reliability gains.

entry.title: Purely Agentic Black-Box Optimization for Biological Design

author.name: Natalie Maus, Yimeng Zeng, Haydn Thomas Jones, Yining Huang, Gaurav Ng Goel, Alden Rose, Kyurae Kim, Hyun-Su Lee, Marcelo Der Torossian Torres, Fangping Wan, Cesar de la Fuente-Nunez, Mark Yatskar, Osbert Bastani, Jacob R. Gardner

entry.summary: PABLO is a hierarchical agentic system using scientific LLMs for biological black-box optimization including drug discovery and protein engineering. Frames optimization as language-based reasoning rather than structure-centered optimization.

entry.title: ReNCE: Learning to Reason by Noise Contrastive Estimation

author.name: Wenzheng Zhang, Karl Stratos

entry.summary: ReNCE proposes a simpler alternative to GRPO for LLM reasoning by using explicit contrastive learning instead of soft advantage estimation. It bifurcates outcomes into positive/negative sets and maximizes likelihood of positives, avoiding need for empirical refinements like asymmetric clipping.

entry.title: Beyond Activation Patterns: A Weight-Based Out-of-Context Explanation of Sparse Autoencoder Features

author.name: Yiting Liu, Zhi-Hong Deng

entry.summary: Novel weight-based interpretation framework for sparse autoencoders that measures functional effects through direct weight interactions without requiring activation data. Shows 1/4 of features directly predict output tokens.

entry.title: Mitigating Cognitive Inertia in Large Reasoning Models via Latent Spike Steering

author.name: Seojin Lee, ByeongJeong Kim, Hwanhee Lee

entry.summary: STARS addresses cognitive inertia in Large Reasoning Models (overthinking/reasoning rigidity) by detecting Cognitive Pivots via L2 distance spikes in hidden states and steering via geometric interventions.

entry.title: SpanNorm: Reconciling Training Stability and Performance in Deep Transformers

author.name: Chao Wang, Bei Li, Jiaqi Zhang, Xinyu Liu, Yuchun Fan, Linkun Lyu, Xin Chen, Jingang Wang, Tong Xiao, Peng Pei, Xunliang Cai

entry.summary: SpanNorm resolves the PreNorm vs PostNorm tradeoff in Transformers by establishing clean residual connections spanning entire transformer blocks while using PostNorm-style computation, enabling stable training of deeper models.

entry.title: A Step Back: Prefix Importance Ratio Stabilizes Policy Optimization

author.name: Shiye Lei, Zhihao Cheng, Dacheng Tao

entry.summary: Addresses instability in off-policy LLM RL training by introducing prefix-level importance sampling ratio instead of token-level correction. Shows theoretical and empirical benefits for large off-policyness scenarios.

entry.title: Just-in-Time Catching Test Generation at Meta

author.name: Matthew Becker, Yifei Chen, Nicholas Cochran, Pouyan Ghasemi, Abhishek Gulati, Mark Harman, Zachary Haluza, Mehrdad Honarkhah, Herve Robert, Jiacheng Liu, Weini Liu, Sreeja Thummala, Xiaoning Yang, Rui Xin and Sophie Zeng

entry.summary: Reports on Meta's just-in-time catching test generation designed to prevent bugs before code lands. Shows code-change-aware methods improve catch generation 4x and LLM-based assessors reduce human review load by 70%.

entry.title: Eroding the Truth-Default: A Causal Analysis of Human Susceptibility to Foundation Model Hallucinations and Disinformation in the Wild

author.name: Alexander Loth, Martin Kappes, Marc-Oliver Pahl

entry.summary: Studies human susceptibility to foundation model hallucinations using a dual-axis framework (JudgeGPT/RogueGPT) separating authenticity from attribution. Key finding: political orientation has negligible association with detection performance, while 'fake news familiarity' emerges as key mediator.

entry.title: Residual Context Diffusion Language Models

author.name: Yuezhou Hu, Harman Singh, Monishwaran Maheswaran, Haocheng Xi, Coleman Hooper, Jintao Zhang, Aditya Tomar, Michael W. Mahoney, Sewon Min, Mehrdad Farajtabar, Kurt Keutzer, Amir Gholami, Chenfeng Xu

entry.summary: Proposes Residual Context Diffusion (RCD) for diffusion LLMs, recycling computation from tokens discarded by remasking. Converts discarded representations into contextual residuals for next denoising step.

entry.title: From Abstract to Contextual: What LLMs Still Cannot Do in Mathematics

author.name: Bowen Cao, Dongdong Zhang, Yixia Li, Junpeng Liu, Shijue Huang, Chufan Shi, Hongyuan Lu, Yaokang Wu, Guanhua Chen, Wai Lam, Furu Wei

entry.summary: Introduces ContextMATH benchmark showing LLMs suffer sharp performance drops (13% open-source, 9% proprietary) when mathematical problems require formulating the math from contextual narratives rather than explicit statements.

entry.title: No More, No Less: Least-Privilege Language Models

author.name: Paulius Rauba, Dominykas Seputis, Patrikas Vanagas, Mihaela van der Schaar

entry.summary: Defines least-privilege language models where privilege is reachable computation during forward pass. Proposes lowering privilege by constraining computation without retraining.

entry.title: Sparks of Rationality: Do Reasoning LLMs Align with Human Judgment and Choice?

author.name: Ala N. Tak, Amin Banayeeanzade, Anahita Bolourani, Fatemeh Bahrani, Ashutosh Chaubey, Sai Praneeth Karimireddy, Norbert Schwarz, Jonathan Gratch

entry.summary: Evaluates LLM rationality against core axioms of rational choice and behavioral economics benchmarks. Shows that 'thinking' improves rationality but pushes models toward expected-value maximization, diverging from human emotion-driven biases.

entry.title: From Self-Evolving Synthetic Data to Verifiable-Reward RL: Post-Training Multi-turn Interactive Tool-Using Agents

author.name: Jiaxuan Gao, Jiaao Chen, Chuyi He, Wei-Chen Wang, Shusheng Xu, Hanrui Wang, Di Jin, Yi Wu

entry.summary: Proposes EigenData, a framework combining self-evolving synthetic data generation with verifier-based RL for training multi-turn interactive tool-using agents, synthesizing tool-grounded dialogues with executable checkers.

entry.title: Local Intrinsic Dimension of Representations Predicts Alignment and Generalization in AI Models and Human Brain

author.name: Junjie Yu, Wenxiao Ma, Chen Wei, Jianyu Zhang, Haotian Deng, Zihan Deng, Quanying Liu

entry.summary: Discovers that local intrinsic dimension of learned embeddings predicts model-model alignment, model-brain alignment, and generalization performance across architectures. Lower local dimension consistently correlates with better alignment and generalization.

entry.title: Float8@2bits: Entropy Coding Enables Data-Free Model Compression

author.name: Patrick Putzky, Martin Genzel, Mattes Mollenhauer, Sebastian Schulze, Thomas Wollmann, Stefan Dietzel

entry.summary: EntQuant achieves extreme LLM compression (<4 bits) by decoupling numerical precision from storage through entropy coding. First data-free method matching data-dependent approaches in extreme compression regime.

entry.title: Should LLMs, $\textit{like}$, Generate How Users Talk? Building Dialect-Accurate Dialog[ue]s Beyond the American Default with MDial

author.name: Jio Oh, Paul Vicinanza, Thomas Butler, Steven Euijong Whang, Dezhi Hong, Amani Namboori

entry.summary: Introduces MDial, first large-scale framework for generating multi-dialectal conversational data covering lexical, orthographic, and morphosyntactic features for 9 English dialects. Challenges assumption that models should mirror users' grammatical features.

entry.title: Neural Signals Generate Clinical Notes in the Wild

author.name: Jathurshan Pradeepkumar, Zheng Chen and Jimeng Sun

entry.summary: Introduces CELM, the first clinical EEG-to-language foundation model trained on 9,922 reports and ~11,000 hours of EEG recordings for automated clinical report generation.

entry.title: A Systematic Literature Review on LLM Defenses Against Prompt Injection and Jailbreaking: Expanding NIST Taxonomy

author.name: Pedro H. Barcha Correia, Ryan W. Achjian, Diego E. G. Caetano de Oliveira, Ygor Acacio Maria, Victor Takashi Hayashi, Marcos Lopes, Charles Christian Miers, Marcos A. Simplicio Jr

entry.summary: First systematic literature review on prompt injection mitigation strategies (88 studies), expanding NIST taxonomy with comprehensive categorization of defense mechanisms.

entry.title: Dependence-Aware Label Aggregation for LLM-as-a-Judge via Ising Models

author.name: Krishnakumar Balasubramanian, Aleksandr Podkopaev, Shiva Prasad Kasiviswanathan

entry.summary: Addresses dependent LLM judges in label aggregation using Ising graphical models. Shows classical methods assuming independence yield miscalibrated posteriors, and correlation-adjusted linear weighted voting can restore calibration.

entry.title: Jailbreaks on Vision Language Model via Multimodal Reasoning

author.name: Aarush Noheria, Yuguang Yao

entry.summary: Jailbreak framework exploiting Chain-of-Thought prompting for VLMs combined with ReAct-driven adaptive image noising. Iteratively perturbs images based on model feedback to evade safety filters.

entry.title: Towards Resiliency in Large Language Model Serving with KevlarFlow

author.name: Shangshu Qian, Kipling Liu, P. C. Sruthi, Lin Tan, Yongle Zhang

entry.summary: KevlarFlow introduces fault-tolerant LLM serving architecture using decoupled model parallelism, dynamic traffic rerouting, and background KV cache replication. Achieves 20x reduction in mean-time-to-recovery under hardware failures.

entry.title: Transform-Augmented GRPO Improves Pass@k

author.name: Khiem Le, Youssef Mroueh, Phuc Nguyen, Chi-Heng Lin, Shangqian Gao, Ting Hua, Nitesh V. Chawla

entry.summary: TA-GRPO addresses GRPO failures including diversity collapse (amplifying single strategy) and gradient diminishing (zero gradients when all rollouts get same reward) by generating semantic-equivalent question variants and pooling rewards.

entry.title: One Ring to Rule Them All: Unifying Group-Based RL via Dynamic Power-Mean Geometry

author.name: Weisong Zhao, Tong Wang, Zichang Tan, Te Yang, Siran Peng, Haoyuan Zhang, Tianshuo Zhang, Haichao Shi, Meng Meng, Yang Yang, Xiangyu Zhu, Zhen Lei, Xiao-Yu Zhang, Xu Zhou

entry.summary: PMPO unifies GRPO and GMPO under power-mean framework, showing both are special cases of parameterized aggregation geometry. Proposes adaptive exponent selection based on geometric analysis.

entry.title: HetCCL: Accelerating LLM Training with Heterogeneous GPUs

author.name: Heehoon Kim, Jaehwan Lee, Taejeoung Kim, Jongwon Park, Jinpyo Kim, Pyongwon Suh, Ryan H. Choi, Sangwoo Lee, Jaejin Lee

entry.summary: HetCCL enables collective communication across heterogeneous GPU clusters (NVIDIA + AMD) via a unified library with RDMA-based cross-vendor communication, matching homogeneous performance while enabling practical multi-vendor training.

entry.title: MM-THEBench: Do Reasoning MLLMs Think Reasonably?

author.name: Zhidian Huang, Zijun Yao, Ji Qi, Shangqing Tu, Junxian Ma, Jinxin Liu, Weichuan Liu, Xiaoyin Che, Lei Hou, Juanzi Li

entry.summary: MM-THEBench evaluates hallucinations in reasoning MLLMs, focusing on intermediate chain-of-thought processes rather than just final answers. Addresses whether 'thinking' actually mitigates hallucinations in multimodal perception.

entry.title: TSPO: Breaking the Double Homogenization Dilemma in Multi-turn Search Policy Optimization

author.name: Shichao Ma, Zhiyuan Ma, Ming Yang, Xiaofan Li, Xing Wu, Jintao Du, Yu Cheng, Weiqiang Wang, Qiliang Liu, Zhengyang Zhou, Yang Wang

entry.summary: TSPO addresses the 'Double Homogenization Dilemma' in multi-turn tool-augmented reasoning by introducing turn-level stage-aware rewards with First-Occurrence Latent Reward mechanism, distinguishing process stages and sample difficulty.

entry.title: Hierarchical Shift Mixing -- Beyond Dense Attention in Transformers

author.name: Robert Forchheimer

entry.summary: Hierarchical Shift Mixing (HSM) distributes pairwise token interactions across transformer layers rather than computing densely within each layer, enabling linear-time complexity. Hybrid HSM-softmax architectures outperform pure GPT-style transformers.

entry.title: Semantic Leakage from Image Embeddings

author.name: Yiyi Chen, Qiongkai Xu, Desmond Eliott, Qiongxiu Li, Johannes Bjerva

entry.summary: Formalizes semantic leakage from image embeddings, showing that local semantic neighborhood preservation under alignment enables semantic information recovery even without image reconstruction. Proposes SLImE attack framework.

entry.title: Mem-T: Densifying Rewards for Long-Horizon Memory Agents

author.name: Yanwei Yue, Guibin Zhang, Boci Peng, Xuanbo Fan, Jiaxin Guo, Qiankun Li, Yan Zhang

entry.summary: Proposes Mem-T autonomous memory agent with MoT-GRPO (tree-guided RL) to address sparse delayed rewards in long-horizon memory management. Densifies rewards through tree-structured guidance.

entry.title: Scaling Multiagent Systems with Process Rewards

author.name: Ed Li, Junyu Ren, Cat Yan

entry.summary: Introduces MAPPA, using per-action process rewards from AI feedback for multiagent finetuning. Achieves +5-17.5pp on AIME and +7.8-17.2pp on AMC math problems over baselines.

entry.title: Do LLMs Learn Our Preferences or Just Our Behaviors?

author.name: wassname

entry.summary: Highlights the Deep Value Benchmark paper showing LLMs follow surface features rather than underlying values when preferences are confounded with style. Finds models average 0.30 rate of value-based generalization.

entry.title: SPLA: Block Sparse Plus Linear Attention for Long Context Modeling

author.name: Bailin Wang, Dan Friedman, Tao Lei and Chong Wang

entry.summary: SPLA combines block-wise sparse attention with residual linear attention for efficient long-context modeling. Uses Taylor expansion-based selection metric and compresses unselected blocks into recurrent state rather than discarding them.

entry.title: Layer-wise Swapping for Generalizable Multilingual Safety

author.name: Hyunseo Shin, Wonseok Hwang

entry.summary: Proposes layer-wise swapping to transfer safety alignment from English safety expert models to low-resource language models without additional training, with adaptive module selection based on specialization degree.

entry.title: Sparse Attention as Compact Kernel Regression

author.name: Saul Santos, Nuno Gon\c{c}alves, Daniel C. McNamee, Andr\'e F.T Martins

entry.summary: Establishes formal correspondence between sparse attention (ReLU, sparsemax, α-entmax) and compact kernel regression. Shows Epanechnikov, biweight, and triweight kernels correspond to specific α-entmax formulations.

entry.title: Relaxing Positional Alignment in Masked Diffusion Language Models

author.name: Mengyu Ye, Ryosuke Takahashi, Keito Kudo, Jun Suzuki

entry.summary: Proposes relaxing positional alignment in masked diffusion language models by introducing tokens. Shows strict positional prediction causes sensitivity to token misalignment, degrading open-ended generation.

entry.title: MrRoPE: Mixed-radix Rotary Position Embedding

author.name: Qingyuan Tian, Wenhong Zhu, Xiaoran Liu, Xiaofeng Wang, Rui Wang

entry.summary: Proposes MrRoPE, a mixed-radix framework that unifies various RoPE extension strategies for handling longer sequences, achieving 85%+ retrieval accuracy at 128K context without fine-tuning.

entry.title: MirrorMark: A Distortion-Free Multi-Bit Watermark for Large Language Models

author.name: Ya Jiang, Massieh Kordi Boroujeny, Surender Suresh Kumar, Kai Zeng

entry.summary: Proposes MirrorMark, a distortion-free multi-bit watermarking scheme for LLMs using measure-preserving token sampling that embeds messages without altering output distribution.

entry.title: Demystifying Mergeability: Interpretable Properties to Predict Model Merging Success

author.name: Luca Zhou, Bo Zhao, Rose Yu, Emanuele Rodol\`a

entry.summary: Provides architecture-agnostic analysis of model merging, demonstrating that mergeability depends on both merging method and partner tasks. Identifies subspace overlap and gradient alignment as foundational, method-agnostic prerequisites for successful model merging.

entry.title: Understanding Efficiency: Quantization, Batching, and Serving Strategies in LLM Energy Use

author.name: Julien Delavande, Regis Pierrard, Sasha Luccioni

entry.summary: Comprehensive study of LLM inference efficiency analyzing quantization, batching, and serving configurations on H100 GPUs. Reveals lower-precision formats only yield gains in certain conditions and identifies system-level design choices causing orders-of-magnitude differences.

entry.title: Unrewarded Exploration in Large Language Models Reveals Latent Learning from Psychology

author.name: Jian Xiong, Jingbo Zhou, Zihan Zhou, Yixiong Xiao, Le Zhang, Jingyong Ye, Rui Qian, Yang Zhou, Dejing Dou

entry.summary: Demonstrates latent learning (acquiring representations without rewards) in LLMs inspired by Tolman's psychology experiments. Shows unrewarded exploration creates cognitive maps enabling rapid adaptation when rewards introduced.

entry.title: Shattered Compositionality: Counterintuitive Learning Dynamics of Transformers for Arithmetic

author.name: Xingyu Zhao, Darsh Sharma, Rheeya Uppaal, Yiqiao Zhong

entry.summary: Studies 'shattered compositionality' - transformers learning arithmetic skills in reverse or parallel order rather than human-like sequential composition, leading to mixing errors under distribution shifts.

entry.title: Demystifying Design Choices of Reinforcement Fine-tuning: A Batched Contextual Bandit Learning Perspective

author.name: Hong Xie, Xiao Hu, Tao Tan, Haoran Gu, Xin Li, Jianyu Han, Defu Lian, Enhong Chen

entry.summary: Analyzes RL fine-tuning design choices through batched contextual bandit lens with minimalist baseline. Identifies which choices are critical vs entangled, providing principled understanding of training dynamics.

entry.title: LINA: Linear Autoregressive Image Generative Models with Continuous Tokens

author.name: Jiahao Wang and Ting Pan and Haoge Deng and Dongchen Han and Taiqiang Wu and Xinlong Wang and Ping Luo

entry.summary: LINA studies linear attention design for continuous-token autoregressive image generation, finding division-based normalization and locality-enhancing convolutions scale better than subtraction-based approaches.

entry.title: Breaking the Blocks: Continuous Low-Rank Decomposed Scaling for Unified LLM Quantization and Adaptation

author.name: Pingzhi Tang, Ruijie Zhou, Fanxu Meng, Wenjie Pei, Muhan Zhang

entry.summary: LoRDS introduces continuous low-rank decomposed scaling for LLM quantization, replacing block-wise structures with element-wise quantization modeled as low-rank matrices (S=BA). Provides unified framework from PTQ initialization through QAT to LoRA-style adaptation.

entry.title: Conditional Performance Guarantee for Large Reasoning Models

author.name: Jianguo Huang, Hao Zeng, Bingyi Jing, Hongxin Wei, Bo An

entry.summary: G-PAC reasoning extends PAC-style guarantees for reasoning models from marginal to group-conditional coverage. Develops Group PAC and Clustered PAC instantiations with proven risk control.

entry.title: MEnvAgent: Scalable Polyglot Environment Construction for Verifiable Software Engineering

author.name: Chuanzhe Guo, Jingjing Wu, Sijun He, Yang Chen, Zhaoqi Kuang, Shilong Fan, Bingjin Chen, Siqi Bao, Jing Liu, Hua Wu, Qingfu Zhu, Wanxiang Che, Haifeng Wang

entry.summary: Presents MEnvAgent, a multi-agent framework for automatically constructing executable environments across 10 programming languages, enabling scalable generation of verifiable software engineering tasks. Includes MEnvBench benchmark with 1,000 tasks.

entry.title: InstructDiff: Domain-Adaptive Data Selection via Differential Entropy for Efficient LLM Fine-Tuning

author.name: Junyou Su, He Zhu, Xiao Luo, Liyu Zhang, Hong-Yu Zhou, Yun Chen, Peng Li, Yang Liu, Guanhua Chen

entry.summary: Proposes InstructDiff using differential entropy between base and calibrated models for domain-adaptive data selection. Discovers reasoning tasks favor entropy increase while general tasks favor decrease.

entry.title: RAudit: A Blind Auditing Protocol for Large Language Model Reasoning

author.name: Edward Y. Chang and Longling Geng

entry.summary: Presents RAudit, a diagnostic protocol for auditing LLM reasoning without ground truth access. Identifies mechanisms like Latent Competence Suppression explaining model unreliability.

entry.title: Med-Scout: Curing MLLMs' Geometric Blindness in Medical Perception via Geometry-Aware RL Post-Training

author.name: Anglin Liu, Ruichao Chen, Yi Lu, Hongxia Xu, Jintai Chen

entry.summary: Introduces Med-Scout addressing 'geometric blindness' in medical MLLMs via geometry-aware RL post-training. Derives supervision from unlabeled images through proxy tasks like hierarchical scale localization.

entry.title: FunPRM: Function-as-Step Process Reward Model with Meta Reward Correction for Code Generation

author.name: Ruiyi Zhang and Peijia Qin and Qi Cao and Eric Xue and Pengtao Xie

entry.summary: Proposes FunPRM, treating functions as process reward model steps for code generation with meta-learning-based reward correction to handle noisy Monte Carlo estimates.

entry.title: Models Under SCOPE: Scalable and Controllable Routing via Pre-hoc Reasoning

author.name: Qi Cao, Shuhao Zhang, Ruizhe Zhou, Ruiyi Zhang, Peijia Qin, Pengtao Xie

entry.summary: SCOPE predicts model cost and performance for routing using reasoning-based predictions by retrieving how models behave on similar problems. Trained with RL, works with new unseen models without fixed model names.

entry.title: Stability-Aware Prompt Optimization for Clinical Data Abstraction

author.name: Arinbj\"orn Kolbeinsson, Daniel Timbie, Sajjan Narsinghani, Sanjay Hariharan

entry.summary: Proposes dual-objective prompt optimization jointly targeting accuracy and stability for clinical data abstraction. Shows higher accuracy doesn't guarantee stability and models can appear calibrated yet remain fragile to paraphrases.

entry.title: Pushing the Boundaries of Natural Reasoning: Interleaved Bonus from Formal-Logic Verification

author.name: Chuxue Cao and Jinluan Yang and Haoran Li and Kunhao Pan and Zijian Zhao and Zhengyu Chen and Yuchen Tian and Lijun Wu and Conghui He and Sirui Han and Yike Guo

entry.summary: Proposes a framework that interleaves formal symbolic verification with natural language generation during reasoning, actively penalizing intermediate fallacies rather than post-hoc validation.

entry.title: AlienLM: Alienization of Language for API-Boundary Privacy in Black-Box LLMs

author.name: Jaehee Kim and Pilsung Kang

entry.summary: AlienLM protects privacy in black-box LLM API calls by translating text into an 'Alien Language' via vocabulary bijection, then adapting target models to operate on alienized inputs. Retains 81%+ of original performance while preventing adversarial recovery.

entry.title: Is Training Necessary for Anomaly Detection?

author.name: Xingwu Zhang, Guanxuan Li, Paul Henderson, Gerardo Aragon-Camarasa, Zijun Long

entry.summary: RAD proposes training-free anomaly detection via multi-level retrieval from stored anomaly-free features, avoiding the fidelity-stability dilemma in reconstruction-based methods. Achieves SOTA on four benchmarks including few-shot settings.

entry.title: Bias Beyond Borders: Political Ideology Evaluation and Steering in Multilingual LLMs

author.name: Afrozah Nadeem, Agrima, Mehwish Nasim, Usman Naseem

entry.summary: Evaluates political bias in LLMs across 50 countries and 33 languages. Proposes CLAS (Cross-Lingual Alignment Steering) for post-hoc mitigation aligning ideological representations across languages.

entry.title: BayesFlow: A Probability Inference Framework for Meta-Agent Assisted Workflow Generation

author.name: Bo Yuan, Yun Zhou, Zhichao Xu, Kiran Ramnath, Aosong Feng, Balasubramaniam Srinivasan

entry.summary: BayesFlow frames workflow generation as Bayesian inference over posterior distribution on workflows, using parallel look-ahead rollouts for importance weighting. Proves convergence to target posterior and provides training-free algorithm for workflow construction.

entry.title: Learning Provably Correct Distributed Protocols Without Human Knowledge

author.name: Yujie Hui and Xiaoyi Lu and Andrew Perrault and Yang Wang

entry.summary: GGMS framework learns provably correct distributed protocols using Monte Carlo Tree Search with transformer-based action encoding and SMT verification. Addresses multi-agent games with imperfect information where standard methods fail.

entry.title: EntroCut: Entropy-Guided Adaptive Truncation for Efficient Chain-of-Thought Reasoning in Small-scale Large Reasoning Models

author.name: Hongxi Yan, Qingjie Liu, Yunhong Wang

entry.summary: EntroCut uses entropy of early reasoning steps to dynamically truncate chain-of-thought in Large Reasoning Models, achieving significant token savings with minimal accuracy loss.

entry.title: ImgCoT: Compressing Long Chain of Thought into Compact Visual Tokens for Efficient Reasoning of Large Language Model

author.name: Xiaoshu Chen, Sihang Zhou, Ke Liang, Taichun Zhou, Xinwang Liu

entry.summary: ImgCoT compresses chain-of-thought reasoning into compact visual tokens by rendering CoT as images, replacing linguistic bias with spatial inductive bias. Aims to capture reasoning structure rather than surface-level linguistic features.

entry.title: When Meanings Meet: Investigating the Emergence and Quality of Shared Concept Spaces during Multilingual Language Model Training

author.name: Felicia K\"orner, Max M\"uller-Eberstein, Anna Korhonen, Barbara Plank

entry.summary: Investigates emergence of language-agnostic concept spaces during EuroLLM pretraining using activation patching. Shows development of cross-lingual representations enabling translation manipulation.

entry.title: EvoClinician: A Self-Evolving Agent for Multi-Turn Medical Diagnosis via Test-Time Evolutionary Learning

author.name: Yufei He, Juncheng Liu, Zhiyuan Hu, Yulin Chen, Yue Liu, Yuan Sui, Yibo Li, Nuo Chen, Jun Hu, Bryan Hooi, Xinxing Xu, Jiang Bian

entry.summary: Proposes EvoClinician, self-evolving agent for multi-turn medical diagnosis with Med-Inquire benchmark. Agent must sequentially gather information through questions and tests, simulating real clinical process.

entry.title: Learning to Advect: A Neural Semi-Lagrangian Architecture for Weather Forecasting

author.name: Carlos A. Pereira, St\'ephane Gaudreault, Valentin Dallerit, Christopher Subich, Shoyon Panday, Siqi Wei, Sasa Zhang, Siddharth Rout, Eldad Haber, Raymond J. Spiteri, David Millard, Emilia Diaconescu

entry.summary: Introduces PARADIS, a physics-inspired weather prediction model with Neural Semi-Lagrangian operator that decomposes into advection, diffusion, and reaction blocks for improved interpretability.

entry.title: Tacit Coordination of Large Language Models

author.name: Ido Aharon, Emanuele La Malfa, Michael Wooldridge, Sarit Kraus

entry.summary: Studies LLMs as players in tacit coordination games, examining how focal points emerge and proposing learning-free strategies to improve LLM coordination with themselves and humans.

entry.title: Beyond Conditional Computation: Retrieval-Augmented Genomic Foundation Models with Gengram

author.name: Huinan Xu, Xuyang Feng, Junhong Chen, Junchen Liu, Kaiwen Deng, Kai Ding, Shengning Long, Jiaxue Shuai, Zhaorong Li, Shiping Liu, Guirong Xue, Zhan Xiao

entry.summary: Proposes Gengram, a conditional memory module for genomic foundation models using genomic-specific hashing for multi-base motif lookup, achieving up to 14% gains on functional genomics tasks.

entry.title: DAJ: Data-Reweighted LLM Judge for Test-Time Scaling in Code Generation

author.name: Peijia Qin, Ruiyi Zhang, Qi Cao, Pengtao Xie

entry.summary: Proposes DAJ, a reasoning-based LLM judge trained with verifiable rewards under bi-level data-reweighted learning to address distribution shifts in code generation evaluation.

entry.title: Stealthy Poisoning Attacks Bypass Defenses in Regression Settings

author.name: Javier Carnerero-Cano, Luis Mu\~noz-Gonz\'alez, Phillippa Spencer, Emil C. Lupu

entry.summary: Proposes stealthy poisoning attacks on regression models that bypass state-of-the-art defenses by considering detectability trade-offs. Introduces BayesClean defense specifically designed for stealthy attacks when poisoning is significant.

entry.title: Context Structure Reshapes the Representational Geometry of Language Models

author.name: Eghbal A. Hosseini, Yuxuan Li, Yasaman Bahri, Declan Campbell, Andrew Kyle Lampinen

entry.summary: Studies how in-context learning reshapes LLM representations in Gemma 2 models. Discovers dichotomy: continual prediction straightens trajectories while structured ICL (like in-context RL) induces warping in late layers.

entry.title: Rethinking Anonymity Claims in Synthetic Data Generation: A Model-Centric Privacy Attack Perspective

author.name: Georgi Ganev, Emiliano De Cristofaro

entry.summary: Argues that anonymity assessments for synthetic data should be model-centric rather than dataset-level, accounting for generative model capabilities and state-of-the-art privacy attacks. Challenges current practices including GDPR compliance approaches.

entry.title: HeaPA: Difficulty-Aware Heap Sampling and On-Policy Query Augmentation for LLM Reinforcement Learning

author.name: Weiqi Wang, Xin Liu, Binxuan Huang, Hejie Cui, Rongzhi Zhang, Changlong Yu, Shuowei Jin, Jingfeng Yang, Qingyu Yin, Zhengyang Wang, Zheng Li, Yifan Gao, Priyanka Nigam, Bing Yin, Lihong Li, Yangqiu Song

entry.summary: HeaPA addresses inefficiency in RLVR training by maintaining difficulty-aware prompt sampling via heap structure and on-policy query augmentation for pool growth, without requiring teacher models.

entry.title: Mock Worlds, Real Skills: Building Small Agentic Language Models with Synthetic Tasks, Simulated Environments, and Rubric-Based Rewards

author.name: Yuan-Jay L\"u, Chengyu Wang, Lei Shen, Jun Huang, Tong Xu

entry.summary: SYNTHAGENT jointly synthesizes diverse tool-use tasks and simulated environments for training small agentic LLMs. Creates underspecified instructions forcing active user queries. Uses rubric-based multi-aspect rewards.

entry.title: Decoding in Geometry: Alleviating Embedding-Space Crowding for Complex Reasoning

author.name: Yixin Yang, Qingxiu Dong, Zhifang Sui

entry.summary: Discovers 'embedding-space crowding' where next-token distribution concentrates on geometrically close tokens. Proposes decoding intervention based on this finding for improved mathematical reasoning.

entry.title: Time-Annealed Perturbation Sampling: Diverse Generation for Diffusion Language Models

author.name: Jingxuan Wu, Zhenglin Wan, Xingrui Yu, Yuzhe Yang, Yiqiao Huang, Ivor Tsang, Yang You

entry.summary: TAPS shows diffusion language models exhibit temporal division of labor (early steps determine semantics, late steps refine lexically) and proposes training-free time-annealed perturbation sampling for diverse generation.

entry.title: AutoRefine: From Trajectories to Reusable Expertise for Continual LLM Agent Refinement

author.name: Libin Qiu, Zhirong Gao, Junfu Chen, Yuhang Ye, Weizhi Huang, Xiaobo Xue, Wenkai Qiu, Shuo Tang

entry.summary: AutoRefine extracts dual-form Experience Patterns from agent execution histories: specialized subagents for procedural subtasks and skill patterns for static knowledge. Includes continuous maintenance mechanism to prevent repository degradation.

entry.title: BEAR: Towards Beam-Search-Aware Optimization for Recommendation with Large Language Models

author.name: Weiqin Yang, Bohao Wang, Zhenxiang Xu, Jiawei Chen, Shengjia Zhang, Jingbang Chen, Canghong Jin, Can Wang

entry.summary: Proposes BEAR (Beam-SEarch-Aware Regularization) addressing training-inference inconsistency where SFT optimizes token probability but beam search can discard items with high overall probability due to prefix pruning.

entry.title: From Similarity to Vulnerability: Key Collision Attack on LLM Semantic Caching

author.name: Zhixiang Zhang and Zesen Liu and Yuchong Xie and Quanfeng Huang and Dongdong She

entry.summary: Demonstrates fundamental conflict between semantic cache hit rates and collision resistance. Shows semantic caching is inherently vulnerable to key collision attacks that can extract cached responses.

entry.title: Secure Tool Manifest and Digital Signing Solution for Verifiable MCP and LLM Pipelines

author.name: Saeid Jamshidi, Kawser Wazed Nafi, Arghavan Moradi Dakhel, Foutse Khomh, Amin Nikanjam, Mohammad Adnan Hamdaqa

entry.summary: Proposes Secure Tool Manifest and Digital Signing Framework for MCP extending it with cryptographic verification, transparent logs, and isolated execution metadata for verifiable LLM tool use.

entry.title: Why GRPO Needs Normalization: A Local-Curvature Perspective on Adaptive Gradients

author.name: Cheng Ge, Caitlyn Heqi Yin, Hao Liang, Jiawei Zhang

entry.summary: Provides theoretical explanation for why GRPO's variance normalization helps through local curvature analysis. Shows normalization implements adaptive gradient with improved convergence rate.

entry.title: Probing the Trajectories of Reasoning Traces in Large Language Models

author.name: Marthe Ballon, Brecht Verbeken, Vincent Ginis, Andres Algaba

entry.summary: Proposes protocol to probe reasoning traces by truncating at fixed token-percentiles and measuring induced answer distributions. Tests on Qwen3 and gpt-oss models.

entry.title: TriSpec: Ternary Speculative Decoding via Lightweight Proxy Verification

author.name: Haoyun Jiang, Junqi He, Feng Hong, Xinlong Yang, Jianwei Zhang, Zheng Li, Zhengyang Zhuge, Zhiyong Chen, Bo Han, Junyang Lin, Jiangchao Yao

entry.summary: Proposes TriSpec, ternary speculative decoding that adds lightweight proxy verifier to reduce verification cost. Only engages full target model for uncertain tokens.

entry.title: FourierSampler: Unlocking Non-Autoregressive Potential in Diffusion Language Models via Frequency-Guided Generation

author.name: Siyang He, Qiqi Wang, Xiaoran Liu, Hongnan Ma, Yiwei Shi, Yuerong Song, Ying Zhu, Tianyi Liang, Zengfeng Huang, Ziwei He, Xipeng Qiu

entry.summary: Proposes FourierSampler revealing low-frequency hidden states encode global structure while high-frequency encodes local details in diffusion LLMs. Uses frequency-domain sliding window for structure-to-detail generation.

entry.title: A Random Matrix Theory of Masked Self-Supervised Regression

author.name: Arie Wortsman Zurich, Federica Gerace, Bruno Loureiro, Yue M. Lu

entry.summary: Develops precise high-dimensional analysis of masked self-supervised learning in proportional regime. Shows how masked modeling extracts structure from spiked covariance models.

entry.title: Are you going to finish that? A Practical Study of the Tokenization Boundary Problem

author.name: Hao Xu, Alisa Liu, Jonathan Hayase, Yejin Choi, Noah A. Smith

entry.summary: Studies the 'partial token problem' where user prompts end mid-token, causing prediction distortions. Finds up to 25% of Chinese word boundaries misalign with tokens, affecting non-whitespace languages and code.

entry.title: YuriiFormer: A Suite of Nesterov-Accelerated Transformers

author.name: Aleksandr Zimin, Yury Polyanskiy, Philippe Rigollet

entry.summary: Interprets transformer layers as optimization iterations and proposes YuriiFormer with Nesterov-style acceleration. Outperforms nanoGPT baseline on TinyStories and OpenWebText without changing attention/MLP oracles.

entry.title: Now You Hear Me: Audio Narrative Attacks Against Large Audio-Language Models

author.name: Ye Yu, Haibo Jin, Yaoning Yu, Jun Zhuang, Haohan Wang

entry.summary: Demonstrates audio narrative jailbreaks against large audio-language models including Gemini 2.0. Uses instruction-following TTS to embed disallowed directives in narrative-style audio streams.

entry.title: Gradient-Based Recovery of Memorized Diffusion Model Data

author.name: RobinHa

entry.summary: Documents experimental attempt to algorithmically recover memorized training data from diffusion models using gradient-based methods targeting high-activation neurons. Reports partial success with caveats.

entry.title: VMonarch: Efficient Video Diffusion Transformers with Structured Attention

author.name: Cheng Liang, Haoxian Chen, Liang Hou, Qi Fan, Gangshan Wu, Xin Tao, Limin Wang

entry.summary: Proposes VMonarch, using Monarch matrices for sub-quadratic attention in video diffusion transformers, enabling efficient computation of dynamic sparse patterns.

entry.title: Federate the Router: Learning Language Model Routers with Sparse and Decentralized Evaluations

author.name: Baris Askin, Shivam Patel, Anupam Nayak, Andrea Vigano, Jiin Woo, Gauri Joshi, Carlee Joe-Wong
