entry.summary: First federated framework for LLM routing, enabling clients to collaboratively learn routers from distributed, privacy-sensitive evaluation data. Addresses scenario where query-model evaluations are fragmented across users and organizations.

entry.title: Recoverability Has a Law: The ERR Measure for Tool-Augmented Agents

author.name: Sri Vatsa Vuddanti, Satwik Kumar Chittiprolu

entry.summary: Introduces Expected Recovery Regret (ERR) metric formalizing recoverability in tool-augmented agents. Derives quantitative law relating ERR to observable Efficiency Score, validated across five tool-use benchmarks.

entry.title: SP^2DPO: An LLM-assisted Semantic Per-Pair DPO Generalization

author.name: Chaoyue He, Xin Zhou, Di Wang, Hong Xu, Wei Liu, Chunyan Miao

entry.summary: SP²DPO replaces global DPO temperature with instance-specific schedules derived from semantic-gap annotations produced by teacher LLMs. Handles heterogeneous preference pairs including safety, factuality, and style distinctions.

entry.title: PhoStream: Benchmarking Real-World Streaming for Omnimodal Assistants in Mobile Scenarios

author.name: Xudong Lu, Huankang Guan, Yang Bo, Jinpeng Chen, Xintong Guo, Shuhan Li, Fang Liu, Peiwen Sun, Xueying Li, Wei Zhang, Xue Yang, Rui Liu, Hongsheng Li

entry.summary: Introduces PhoStream, the first mobile-centric streaming benchmark for omnimodal assistants with 5,572 open-ended QA pairs from 578 videos across on-screen and off-screen scenarios, evaluating real-time video, audio, and temporal reasoning.

entry.title: Real-Time Aligned Reward Model beyond Semantics

author.name: Zixuan Huang, Xin Xia, Yuxi Ren, Jianbin Zheng, Xuefeng Xiao, Hongyan Xie, Li Huaqiu, Songshi Liang, Zhongxiang Dai, Fuzhen Zhuang, Jianxin Li, Yikun Ban and Deqing Wang

entry.summary: R2M addresses reward overoptimization in RLHF by maintaining real-time alignment between reward model and policy through continuous adaptation during policy distribution shifts.

entry.title: Decomposing Epistemic Uncertainty for Causal Decision Making

author.name: Md Musfiqur Rahman, Ziwei Jiang, Hilaf Hasson, Murat Kocaoglu

entry.summary: Proposes a framework to decompose epistemic uncertainty in causal inference, distinguishing between fundamental non-identifiability under confounding and finite-sample limitations. Addresses overconfidence in neural network-based causal effect bounds.

entry.title: How Much of a Model Do We Need? Redundancy and Slimmability in Remote Sensing Foundation Models

author.name: Leonard Hackel and Tom Burgert and Beg\"um Demir

entry.summary: Studies redundancy in remote sensing foundation models using post-hoc slimming. Finds RS FMs become overparameterized at smaller scales than CV counterparts, with significant width reduction possible without performance loss.

entry.title: Game-Theoretic Co-Evolution for LLM-Based Heuristic Discovery

author.name: Xinyi Ke, Kai Li, Junliang Xing, Yifan Zhang, and Jian Cheng

entry.summary: Proposes ASRO (Algorithm Space Response Oracles), game-theoretic framework for LLM-based heuristic discovery modeling solver-instance interaction as two-player zero-sum game. Replaces static evaluation with adaptive co-evolution.

entry.title: TriCEGAR: A Trace-Driven Abstraction Mechanism for Agentic AI

author.name: Roham Koohestani, Ate\c{s} G\"orpelio\u{g}lu, Egor Klimov, Burcu Kulahcioglu Ozkan, Maliheh Izadi

entry.summary: Proposes TriCEGAR, trace-driven abstraction mechanism for agentic AI verification automating state construction from execution logs. Enables online MDP construction for behavioral verification.

entry.title: Molecular Representations in Implicit Functional Space via Hyper-Networks

author.name: Zehong Wang, Xiaolong Han, Qi Yang, Xiangru Tang, Fang Wu, Xiaoguang Guo, Weixiang Sun, Tianyi Ma, Pietro Lio, Le Cong, Sheng Wang, Chuxu Zhang, Yanfang Ye

entry.summary: Proposes modeling molecules as continuous functions over 3D space rather than discrete objects, using hyper-networks to represent molecular fields. Shows conventional representations arise as particular samplings from this unified framework.

entry.title: MERMAID: Memory-Enhanced Retrieval and Reasoning with Multi-Agent Iterative Knowledge Grounding for Veracity Assessment

author.name: Yupeng Cao, Chengyang He, Yangyang Yu, Ping Wang, K.P. Subbalakshmi

entry.summary: MERMAID is a multi-agent veracity assessment framework with memory-enhanced retrieval that tightly couples retrieval and reasoning. Uses structured knowledge representations and persistent memory for evidence management across claims.

entry.title: Stabilizing Transformer Training Through Consensus

author.name: Shyam Venkatasubramanian, Sean Moushegian, Michael Lin, Mir Park, Ankit Singhal, Connor Lee

entry.summary: Shows that replacing attention with a consensus mechanism stabilizes Transformer training across wider learning rate ranges, with experiments on text, DNA, and protein modalities.

entry.title: Stabilizing Consistency Training: A Flow Map Analysis and Self-Distillation

author.name: Youngjoong Kim, Duhoe Kim, Woosung Kim, Jaesik Park

entry.summary: Provides theoretical analysis of consistency models from flow map perspective, clarifying how training stability and convergence behavior can produce degenerate solutions, and revisits self-distillation as remedy.

entry.title: Vision-Language Models Unlock Task-Centric Latent Actions

author.name: Alexander Nikulin, Ilya Zisman, Albina Klepach, Denis Tarasov, Alexander Derevyagin, Andrei Polubarov, Lyubaykin Nikita, Vladislav Kurenkov

entry.summary: Proposes using VLMs' common-sense reasoning to provide task-conditioned representations for Latent Action Models, separating controllable changes from distractors in video data. Benchmarks multiple VLMs for this purpose.

entry.title: Understanding Generalization from Embedding Dimension and Distributional Convergence

author.name: Junjie Yu, Zhuoli Ouyang, Haotian Deng, Chen Wei, Wenxiao Ma, Jianyu Zhang, Zihan Deng, Quanying Liu

entry.summary: Shows population risk can be bounded by embedding distribution's intrinsic dimension (controlling convergence rate in Wasserstein distance) and downstream mapping's Lipschitz constant. Provides representation-centric generalization analysis.

entry.title: MTDrive: Multi-turn Interactive Reinforcement Learning for Autonomous Driving

author.name: Xidong Li, Mingyu Guo, Chenchao Xu, Bailin Li, Wenjing Zhu, Yangang Zou, Rui Chen, Zehuan Wang

entry.summary: Presents MTDrive for multi-turn trajectory planning with MLLMs, introducing mtGRPO to compute relative advantages across turns for iterative refinement. Addresses limitation of single-turn reasoning in autonomous driving.

entry.title: dgMARK: Decoding-Guided Watermarking for Diffusion Language Models

author.name: Pyo Min Hong, Albert No

entry.summary: Proposes dgMARK, watermarking method for discrete diffusion LLMs exploiting their sensitivity to unmasking order. Steers order toward positions satisfying parity constraint without reweighting probabilities.

entry.title: Graceful Forgetting in Generative Language Models

author.name: Chunyang Jiang, Chi-min Chan, Yiyang Cai, Yulong Liu, Wei Xue, Yike Guo

entry.summary: Explores graceful forgetting in generative language models to address negative transfer from pre-training, selectively discarding irrelevant knowledge to improve fine-tuning plasticity.

entry.title: Lost in Space? Vision-Language Models Struggle with Relative Camera Pose Estimation

author.name: Ken Deng, Yifu Qiu, Yoni Kasten, Shay B. Cohen, Yftah Ziser

entry.summary: Introduces VRRPI-Bench for evaluating VLMs on relative camera pose estimation, revealing that most VLMs fail to generalize beyond 2D heuristics for 3D spatial reasoning.

entry.title: JAF: Judge Agent Forest

author.name: Sahil Garg, Brad Cheezum, Sridhar Dutta, Vishal Agarwal

entry.summary: Introduces JAF (Judge Agent Forest) where judge agents evaluate multiple query-response pairs jointly, enabling cross-instance pattern discovery for improved primary agent feedback.

entry.title: Conformal Prediction for Generative Models via Adaptive Cluster-Based Density Estimation

author.name: Qidong Yang, Qianyu Julie Zhu, Jonathan Giezendanner, Youssef Marzouk, Stephen Bates, Sherrie Wang

entry.summary: CP4Gen provides conformal prediction for conditional generative models using clustering-based density estimation. Creates prediction sets that are less sensitive to outliers and more interpretable than existing uncertainty quantification methods.

entry.title: MixQuant: Pushing the Limits of Block Rotations in Post-Training Quantization

author.name: Sai Sanjeet, Ian Colbert, Pablo Monteagudo-Lago, Giuseppe Franco, Yaman Umuroglu, Nicholas J. Fraser

entry.summary: MixQuant provides first systematic analysis of outlier suppression for block Hadamard rotations in post-training quantization. Shows outlier suppression is limited by input vector geometry and proposes mass redistribution via permutations.

entry.title: SAIR: Cost-Efficient Multi-Stage ML Pipeline Autoscaling via In-Context Reinforcement Learning

author.name: Jianchang Su, Yifan Zhang, Shengkai Lin, Shizhen Zhao, Yusheng Zheng, Yiwei Yang, Wei Zhang

entry.summary: SAIR uses LLM as in-context RL controller for autoscaling multi-stage ML inference pipelines. Combines Pareto-dominance reward shaping with surprisal-guided experience retrieval and fine-grained GPU control.

entry.title: AI and My Values: User Perceptions of LLMs' Ability to Extract, Embody, and Explain Human Values from Casual Conversations

author.name: Bhada Yun, Renn Su, April Yi Wang

entry.summary: VAPT toolkit studies how LLMs reflect human values through month-long chatbot interactions. 13/20 participants became convinced AI can understand values. Warns about 'weaponized empathy' - AI using understanding of values to persuade.

entry.title: CARE: Multi-Task Pretraining for Latent Continuous Action Representation in Robot Control

author.name: Jiaqi Shi, Xulong Zhang, Xiaoyang Qu, Jianzong Wang

entry.summary: CARE trains Vision-Language-Action models without action supervision by learning continuous latent action representations from video-text pairs through multi-task pretraining, then fine-tuning action heads with small labeled data.

entry.title: $\rho$-$\texttt{EOS}$: Training-free Bidirectional Variable-Length Control for Masked Diffusion LLMs

author.name: Jingyi Yang, Yuxian Jiang, Jing Shao

entry.summary: ρ-EOS enables variable-length generation for masked diffusion LLMs by using implicit EOS token density as signal of generation sufficiency, allowing bidirectional length adjustment without training.

entry.title: Darwinian Memory: A Training-Free Self-Regulating Memory System for GUI Agent Evolution

author.name: Hongze Mi, Yibo Feng, WenJie Lu, Song Cao, Jinyuan Li, Yanming Li, Xuelin Zhang, Haotian Luo, Songyang Peng, He Cui, Tengfei Tian, Jun Fang, Hua Chai, Naiqiang Tan

entry.summary: Darwinian Memory System for GUI agents creates self-evolving memory ecosystem governed by survival-of-fittest principle. Decomposes trajectories into reusable units, eliminates outdated experience causing hallucination.

entry.title: Are LLM Evaluators Really Narcissists? Sanity Checking Self-Preference Evaluations

author.name: Dani Roytburg, Matthew Bozoukov, Matthew Nguyen, Mackenzie Puig-Hall, Narmeen Oozeer

entry.summary: Identifies methodological confound in LLM self-preference bias studies that could reduce measurement error by 89.6%. Proposes Evaluator Quality Baseline to decouple self-preference from difficulty confounds.

entry.title: Mitigating Hallucinations in Video Large Language Models via Spatiotemporal-Semantic Contrastive Decoding

author.name: Yuansheng Gao, Jinman Zhao, Tong Zhang, Xingguo Xu, Han Bao, Zonghui Wang, Wenzhi Chen

entry.summary: Proposes spatiotemporal-semantic contrastive decoding to mitigate hallucinations in Video LLMs by precisely capturing the root causes of hallucinations and their fine-grained temporal and semantic correlations.

entry.title: UCPO: Uncertainty-Aware Policy Optimization

author.name: Xianzhou Zeng, Jing Huang, Chunmei Xie, Gongrui Nan, Siye Chen, Mengyu Lu, Weiqi Xiong, Qixuan Zhou, Junhao Zhang, Qiang Zhu, Yadong Li, Xingzhong Xu

entry.summary: UCPO addresses reward hacking and overconfidence in RL for LLMs using ternary advantage decoupling that separately normalizes deterministic and uncertain rollouts.

entry.title: Best-of-Q: Improving VLM agents with Q-function Action Ranking at Inference

author.name: Emilien Bir\'e, Mar\'ia Santos, Kai Yuan

entry.summary: Introduces Best-of-Q, a method that decouples VLM action proposal from selection by using a lightweight Q-function to rerank candidate actions at inference time without retraining the base policy. This enables VLM agents to adapt to dynamic environments without expensive fine-tuning.

entry.title: OSNIP: Breaking the Privacy-Utility-Efficiency Trilemma in LLM Inference via Obfuscated Semantic Null Space

author.name: Zhiyuan Cao and Zeyu Ma and Chenhao Yang and Han Zheng and Mingang Chen

entry.summary: OSNIP proposes privacy-preserving LLM inference by injecting perturbations that project embeddings into an 'Obfuscated Semantic Null Space' while preserving semantic fidelity. Uses key-dependent stochastic mapping for individualized protection.

entry.title: When Anomalies Depend on Context: Learning Conditional Compatibility for Anomaly Detection

author.name: Shashank Mishra, Didier Stricker, Jason Rambach

entry.summary: Introduces CAAD-3K benchmark for contextual anomaly detection where anomaly labels depend on subject-context compatibility rather than intrinsic appearance. Proposes conditional compatibility learning approach for this understudied setting.

entry.title: Mano: Restriking Manifold Optimization for LLM Training

author.name: Yufei Gu and Zeke Xie

entry.summary: Proposes Mano optimizer for LLM training using manifold optimization on rotational Oblique manifold. Projects momentum onto tangent space while constraining parameters on manifold.

entry.title: One-shot Optimized Steering Vector for Hallucination Mitigation for VLMs

author.name: Youxu Shi and Suorong Yang and Dong Liu

entry.summary: Proposes OSGA, an input-independent steering framework for mitigating VLM hallucinations using a single optimized steering vector. Uses variance-based sample selection and generative anchoring for efficient one-shot optimization.

entry.title: ExplainerPFN: Towards tabular foundation models for model-free zero-shot feature importance estimations

author.name: Joao Fonseca, Julia Stoyanovich

entry.summary: Introduces ExplainerPFN, a foundation model for zero-shot Shapley value estimation without access to the target model. Built on TabPFN, pretrained on synthetic datasets from causal models.

entry.title: CATTO: Balancing Preferences and Confidence in Language Models

author.name: Nisarg Parikh, Kunjal Panchal, Ananya Sai, Pannaga Shivaswamy, Andrew Lan

entry.summary: Proposes CATTO, a calibration-aware training objective that aligns predicted confidence with empirical correctness. Can be combined with preference optimization to reduce miscalibration.

entry.title: SPICE: Submodular Penalized Information-Conflict Selection for Efficient Large Language Model Training

author.name: Powei Chang, Jinpeng Zhang, Bowen Chen, Chenyu Wang, Chenlu Guo, Yixing Zhang, Yukang Gao, JianXiang Xiang, Yue Gao, Chaoqun Sun, Yiyi Chen, and Dongying Kong

entry.summary: Proposes SPICE, conflict-aware data selection for instruction tuning using submodular optimization with gradient conflict penalty. Provides theoretical analysis of approximation factors.

entry.title: DIFFA-2: A Practical Diffusion Large Language Model for General Audio Understanding

author.name: Jiaming Zhou, Xuxin Cheng, Shiwan Zhao, Yuhang Jia, Cao Liu, Ke Zeng, Xunliang Cai, Yong Qin

entry.summary: Introduces DIFFA-2, a practical diffusion-based large audio language model for general audio understanding. Upgrades from proof-of-concept DIFFA with instruction tuning and preference alignment.

entry.title: Names Don't Matter: Symbol-Invariant Transformer for Open-Vocabulary Learning

author.name: \.Ilker I\c{s}{\i}k and Wenchao Li

entry.summary: Proposes Symbol-Invariant Transformer using parallel embedding streams and aggregated attention to achieve provable invariance to renaming of interchangeable tokens like bound variables.

entry.title: ReGuLaR: Variational Latent Reasoning Guided by Rendered Chain-of-Thought

author.name: Fanmeng Wang, Haotian Liu, Guojiang Zhao, Hongteng Xu, Zhifeng Gao

entry.summary: Proposes ReGuLaR for compressing CoT into latent space using VAE framework with rendered CoT guidance. Samples latent reasoning states from posterior conditioned on previous states.

entry.title: AgentScore: Autoformulation of Deployable Clinical Scoring Systems

author.name: Silas Ruhrberg Est\'evez, Christopher Chiu, Mihaela van der Schaar

entry.summary: AgentScore uses agentic search to automatically formulate interpretable clinical scoring systems as unit-weighted checklists. Designed to be compatible with clinical workflow constraints like memorability and bedside execution.

entry.title: Graph is a Substrate Across Data Modalities

author.name: Ziming Li, Xiaoming Wu, Zehong Wang, Jiazheng Li, Yijun Tian, Jinhe Bi, Yunpu Ma, Yanfang Ye, Chuxu Zhang

entry.summary: Proposes treating graph structure as persistent substrate across modalities and tasks rather than reconstructing it in isolation. Implements unified graph representation that accumulates structural regularities across heterogeneous learning contexts.

entry.title: TimeMachine-bench: A Benchmark for Evaluating Model Capabilities in Repository-Level Migration Tasks

author.name: Ryo Fujii, Makoto Morishita, Kazuki Yano, Jun Suzuki

entry.summary: TimeMachine-bench evaluates LLM agents on real-world Python software migration tasks where tests fail due to dependency updates, with automated benchmark construction and human-verified subset.

entry.title: NAG: A Unified Native Architecture for Encoder-free Text-Graph Modeling in Language Models

author.name: Haisong Gong, Zhibo Liu, Qiang Liu, Shu Wu and Liang Wang

entry.summary: NAG proposes internalizing graph processing within language model architecture by repurposing self-attention to enforce topological constraints, eliminating need for external GNN encoders.

entry.title: Fire on Motion: Optimizing Video Pass-bands for Efficient Spiking Action Recognition

author.name: Shuhan Ye, Yuanbin Qian, Yi Yu, Chong Wang, Yuqi Xie, Jiazhen Xu, Kun Wang, Xudong Jiang

entry.summary: Diagnoses pass-band mismatch in SNNs where spiking dynamics act as temporal low-pass filters attenuating motion information, proposing Pass-Bands Optimizer module to improve video action recognition.

entry.title: Gated Relational Alignment via Confidence-based Distillation for Efficient VLMs

author.name: Yanlong Chen, Amirhossein Habibian, Luca Benini, Yawei Li

entry.summary: GRACE unifies knowledge distillation and quantization-aware training for VLMs under the Information Bottleneck principle. Uses confidence-gated distillation and relational alignment to maintain performance under aggressive quantization.

entry.title: Learning with Challenges: Adaptive Difficulty-Aware Data Generation for Mobile GUI Agent Training

author.name: Linjia Kang, Zhimin Wang, Yongkang Zhang, Duo Wu, Jinghe Wang, Ming Ma, Haopeng Yan, Zhi Wang

entry.summary: MobileGen generates training data for mobile GUI agents with adaptive difficulty control, aligning task difficulty with agent capability frontier. Decouples structural and semantic difficulty for curriculum learning.

entry.title: Decomposing and Composing: Towards Efficient Vision-Language Continual Learning via Rank-1 Expert Pool in a Single LoRA

author.name: Zhan Fa, Yue Duan, Jian Zhang, Lei Qi, Wanqi Yang, Yinghuan Shi

entry.summary: Restructures single LoRA as decomposable Rank-1 Expert Pool for VLM continual learning. Uses CLS token semantics to dynamically compose sparse task-specific updates with Activation-Guided Orthogonal loss.

entry.title: Protecting Private Code in IDE Autocomplete using Differential Privacy

author.name: Evgeny Grigorenko and David Stanojevi\'c and David Ili\'c and Egor Bogomolov and Kostadin Cvejoski

entry.summary: Investigates differential privacy for training code completion models, fine-tuning Mellum model with DP for Kotlin. Demonstrates strong defense against membership inference while maintaining utility.

entry.title: Stabilizing the Q-Gradient Field for Policy Smoothness in Actor-Critic

author.name: Jeong Woon Lee, Kyoleen Kwak, Daeho Kim, and Hyoseok Hwang

entry.summary: Establishes that policy non-smoothness is governed by Q-function's differential geometry. Proposes PAVE to stabilize Q-gradient field, theoretically bounded by ratio of mixed-partial derivative to action-space curvature.

entry.title: UniFinEval: Towards Unified Evaluation of Financial Multimodal Models across Text, Images and Videos

author.name: Zhi Yang, Lingfeng Zeng, Fangqi Lou, Qi Qi, Wei Zhang, Zhenyu Wu, Zhenxiong Yu, Jun Han, Zhiheng Jin, Lejie Zhang, Xiaoming Huang, Xiaolong Liang, Zheng Wei, Junbo Zou, Dongpo Cheng, Zhaowei Liu, Xin Guo, Rongjunchen Zhang, Liwen Zhang

entry.summary: Introduces UniFinEval, the first unified multimodal benchmark for financial AI covering text, images, and videos with 3,767 questions across five core financial scenarios.

entry.title: Geometry without Position? When Positional Embeddings Help and Hurt Spatial Reasoning

author.name: Jian Shi, Michael Birsak, Wenqing Cui, Zhenyu Li, Peter Wonka

entry.summary: Investigates positional embeddings as geometric priors in ViTs through token-level diagnostics across 14 foundation models, showing PEs causally govern spatial structure.

entry.title: ZK-HybridFL: Zero-Knowledge Proof-Enhanced Hybrid Ledger for Federated Learning

author.name: Amirhossein Taherpour, and Xiaodong Wang

entry.summary: ZK-HybridFL combines federated learning with zero-knowledge proofs for privacy-preserving model validation, using DAG ledger structure with sidechains. Achieves faster convergence and higher accuracy while detecting adversarial behavior.

entry.title: Bifocal Attention: Harmonizing Geometric and Spectral Positional Embeddings for Algorithmic Generalization

author.name: Kanishk Awadhiya

entry.summary: Bifocal Attention decouples positional encoding into Geometric Eyes (standard RoPE) for local syntax and Spectral Eyes using Discrete Fourier Transform for long-range periodic structures in algorithmic reasoning.

entry.title: MM-OpenFGL: A Comprehensive Benchmark for Multimodal Federated Graph Learning

author.name: Xunkai Li, Yuming Ai, Yinlin Zhu, Haodong Lu, Yi Zhang, Guohao Fu, Bowen Fan, Qiangqiang Dai, Rong-Hua Li, Guoren Wang

entry.summary: MM-OpenFGL is first comprehensive benchmark for multimodal federated graph learning, formalizing the MMFGL paradigm. Addresses challenges unique to combining multimodal graphs with federated learning.

entry.title: Tuning the Implicit Regularizer of Masked Diffusion Language Models: Enhancing Generalization via Insights from $k$-Parity

author.name: Jianhao Huang, Baharan Mirzasoleiman

entry.summary: Studies implicit regularization in Masked Diffusion Language Models using k-parity problem. Decomposes MD objective into Signal regime (feature learning) and Noise regime (implicit regularizer), showing MD enables rapid generalization without grokking.

entry.title: Spectral Gradient Descent Mitigates Anisotropy-Driven Misalignment: A Case Study in Phase Retrieval

author.name: Guillaume Braun, Han Bao, Wei Huang, Masaaki Imaizumi

entry.summary: Analyzes spectral gradient methods like the Muon optimizer through phase retrieval, showing they mitigate anisotropy-driven misalignment by discarding scale information in gradient updates.

entry.title: Unveiling Scaling Behaviors in Molecular Language Models: Effects of Model Size, Data, and Representation

author.name: Dong Xu, Qihua Pan, Sisi Yuan, Jianqiang Li, Zexuan Zhu, Junkai Ji

entry.summary: Systematically investigates scaling behavior of molecular language models across 300 models and 10K experiments, controlling for compute budget while varying model size, tokens, and molecular representation.

entry.title: CVeDRL: An Efficient Code Verifier via Difficulty-aware Reinforcement Learning

author.name: Ji Shi, Peiming Guo, Meishan Zhang, Miao Zhang, Xuebo Liu, Min Zhang, Weili Guan

entry.summary: CVeDRL improves code verifiers for LLM code generation via difficulty-aware RL with rewards modeling branch coverage, sample difficulty, and correctness. Addresses limitations of supervised fine-tuning for unit test generation.

entry.title: Alignment among Language, Vision and Action Representations

author.name: Nicola Milano, Stefano Nolfi

entry.summary: Investigates whether language, vision, and action learning produce shared or distinct representations. Finds action-grounded language embeddings from behavioral cloning align with vision and language embeddings, supporting representational convergence.

entry.title: Learnable Permutation for Structured Sparsity on Transformer Models

author.name: Zekai Li, Ji Liu, Guanchen Li, Yixing Xu, Ziqiong Liu, Xuanwu Yin, Dong Li, Emad Barsoum

entry.summary: Proposes end-to-end learnable permutation framework for structured sparsity in transformers. Uses learnable cost matrix to quantify channel swap costs with differentiable soft-assignment.

entry.title: Guided by Trajectories: Repairing and Rewarding Tool-Use Trajectories for Tool-Integrated Reasoning

author.name: Siyu Gong, Linan Yue, Weibo Gao, Fangzhou Yao, Shimin Di, Lei Feng, Min-Ling Zhang

entry.summary: Proposes AutoTraj for tool-integrated reasoning that repairs low-quality tool-use trajectories using LLM-as-Repairer and uses a LLM-as-Ranker for dense reward signal during RL. Achieves improvements over baselines on math and QA tasks.

entry.title: From Absolute to Relative: Rethinking Reward Shaping in Group-Based Reinforcement Learning

author.name: Wenzhe Niu, Wei He, Zongxia Xie, Jinpeng Ou, Huichuan Fan, Yuchen Ge, Yanru Sun, Ziyin Wang, Yizhao Sun, Chengshun Shi, Jiuchong Gao, Jinghua Hao, Renqing He

entry.summary: Proposes RLRR framework shifting reward shaping from absolute scores to relative rankings for reinforcement learning. Addresses sparse supervision in verifiable tasks and score instability in open-ended scenarios.

entry.title: Safer Policy Compliance with Dynamic Epistemic Fallback

author.name: Joseph Marvin Imperial, Harish Tayyar Madabushi

entry.summary: Introduces Dynamic Epistemic Fallback (DEF), a safety protocol that nudges LLMs to flag inconsistencies and fall back to parametric knowledge when encountering perturbed policy texts in compliance tasks.

entry.title: Behemoth: Benchmarking Unlearning in LLMs Using Fully Synthetic Data

author.name: Eugenia Iofinova, Dan Alistarh

entry.summary: Introduces Behemoth benchmark for LLM unlearning using fully synthetic data with controlled properties. Enables systematic evaluation of model editing methods.

entry.title: Beyond Fixed Frames: Dynamic Character-Aligned Speech Tokenization

author.name: Luca Della Libera, Cem Subakan, Mirco Ravanelli

entry.summary: Introduces DyCAST for variable-frame-rate speech tokenization through character-level alignment and explicit duration modeling. Enables control over token durations at decode time.

entry.title: Make Anything Match Your Target: Universal Adversarial Perturbations against Closed-Source MLLMs via Multi-Crop Routed Meta Optimization

author.name: Hui Lu, Yi Yu, Yiming Yang, Chenyu Yi, Xueyi Ke, Qixing Zhang, Bingquan Shen, Alex Kot, Xudong Jiang

entry.summary: Studies Universal Targeted Transferable Adversarial Attacks on closed-source MLLMs where single perturbation steers arbitrary inputs to target. Proposes multi-crop routed meta optimization.

entry.title: Deep Search with Hierarchical Meta-Cognitive Monitoring Inspired by Cognitive Neuroscience

author.name: Zhongxiang Sun, Qipeng Wang, Weijie Yu, Jingxuan Yang, Haolang Lu, Jun Xu

entry.summary: Proposes Deep Search with Meta-Cognitive Monitoring (DS-MCM) using hierarchical metacognition with Fast Consistency Monitor and experience-driven reflection for search agents.

entry.title: MonoScale: Scaling Multi-Agent System with Monotonic Improvement

author.name: Shuai Shao, Yixiang Liu, Bingwei Lu, Weinan Zhang

entry.summary: Proposes MonoScale for scaling multi-agent systems with monotonic improvement guarantees. Generates familiarization tasks for new agents and distills interaction evidence into natural-language memory.

entry.title: Video-o3: Native Interleaved Clue Seeking for Long Video Multi-Hop Reasoning

author.name: Xiangyu Zeng, Zhiqiu Zhang, Yuhan Zhu, Xinhao Li, Zikang Wang, Changlian Ma, Qingyu Zhang, Zizheng Huang, Kun Ouyang, Tianxiang Jiang, Ziang Yan, Yi Wang, Hongjie Zhang, Yali Wang, Limin Wang

entry.summary: Introduces Video-o3, a framework for long video understanding that iteratively discovers visual clues with adaptive termination. Proposes Task-Decoupled Attention Masking to handle multi-turn tool invocation.

entry.title: TEON: Tensorized Orthonormalization Beyond Layer-Wise Muon for Large Language Model Pre-Training

author.name: Ruijie Zhang, Yequan Zhao, Ziyue Liu, Zhengyang Wang, Dongyang Li, Yupeng Su, Sijia Liu, Zheng Zhang

entry.summary: Proposes TEON, extending Muon optimizer by modeling gradients as higher-order tensors across layers. Shows improved convergence over layer-wise Muon on GPT and LLaMA models up to 1B parameters.

entry.title: FOCUS: DLLMs Know How to Tame Their Compute Bound

author.name: Kaihua Liang, Xin Tan, An Zhong, Hong Xu, Marco Canini

entry.summary: Identifies inefficiency in Diffusion LLM decoding where most compute is wasted on non-decodable tokens. Proposes FOCUS to dynamically focus computation on decodable tokens, improving throughput.

entry.title: VideoGPA: Distilling Geometry Priors for 3D-Consistent Video Generation

author.name: Hongyang Du, Junjie Ye, Xiaoyan Cong, Runhao Li, Jingcheng Ni, Aman Agarwal, Zeqi Zhou, Zekun Li, Randall Balestriero, Yue Wang

entry.summary: Proposes VideoGPA using geometry foundation models to derive preference signals for training 3D-consistent video diffusion models via DPO. Improves temporal stability without human annotations.

entry.title: How does reasoning affect Ethical/Moral task results?

author.name: Kaustubh Kislay

entry.summary: Original empirical study testing how different reasoning elicitation strategies affect LLM performance on moral/ethical tasks. Compares direct, chain-of-thought, devil's advocate, and two-pass reflection approaches.

entry.title: DP-$\lambda$CGD: Efficient Noise Correlation for Differentially Private Model Training

author.name: Nikita P. Kalinin, Ryan McKenna, Rasmus Pagh, Christoph H. Lampert

entry.summary: DP-λCGD correlates noise only with immediately preceding iteration for differentially private training, using pseudorandom noise regeneration to eliminate memory overhead. Achieves competitive privacy-utility tradeoffs without storing past noise.

entry.title: Minimal-Action Discrete Schr\"odinger Bridge Matching for Peptide Sequence Design

author.name: Shrey Goel, Pranam Chatterjee

entry.summary: MadSBM formulates peptide sequence generation as controlled continuous-time Markov process on amino-acid edit graph using Schrödinger Bridge matching. Generates high-likelihood sequences by staying near plausible neighborhoods throughout generation.

entry.title: DART-ing Through the Drift: Dynamic Tracing of Knowledge Neurons for Adaptive Inference-Time Pruning

author.name: Abhishek Tyagi, Yunuo Cen, Shrey Dhorajiya, Bharadwaj Veeravalli, Xuanyao Fong

entry.summary: DART performs training-free, context-aware LLM pruning by monitoring attention score distribution shifts to dynamically update neuron-level masks during autoregressive generation.

entry.title: VisionTrim: Unified Vision Token Compression for Training-Free MLLM Acceleration

author.name: Hanxun Yu, Wentong Li, Xuan Qu, Song Wang, Junbo Chen, Jianke Zhu

entry.summary: VisionTrim proposes training-free MLLM acceleration by selecting dominant vision tokens via global-local view and performing text-guided token merging for image and video tasks.

entry.title: Color Matters: Demosaicing-Guided Color Correlation Training for Generalizable AI-Generated Image Detection

author.name: Nan Zhong, Yiran Xu, Mian Zou

entry.summary: DCCT exploits color correlations from camera CFA demosaicing for AI-generated image detection. Trains self-supervised model to predict missing color channels, using distributional mismatch as detection signal.

entry.title: SOMBRERO: Measuring and Steering Boundary Placement in End-to-End Hierarchical Sequence Models

author.name: Pit Neitemeier, Alessio Serra, Jiaze Li, Sascha Wirges, Lukas Balles, Jan Hendrik Metzen

entry.summary: SOMBRERO introduces boundary enrichment metric B for hierarchical sequence models and proposes confidence-alignment boundary loss to steer boundary placement toward high-surprisal positions.

entry.title: FlexLoRA: Entropy-Guided Flexible Low-Rank Adaptation

author.name: Muqing Liu, Chongjie Si, Yuheng Jia

entry.summary: Proposes FlexLoRA with entropy-guided rank allocation that can both prune redundant and expand capacity in LoRA adaptation. Uses matrix-wise entropy to distinguish layer adaptation needs.

entry.title: Value-at-Risk Constrained Policy Optimization

author.name: Rohan Tangri and Jan-Peter Calliess

entry.summary: Introduces VaR-CPO for Value-at-Risk constrained policy optimization achieving zero constraint violations during training. Uses one-sided Chebyshev inequality for tractable surrogate.

entry.title: SparseGS-W: Sparse-View 3D Gaussian Splatting in the Wild with Generative Priors

author.name: Yiqing Li, Xuan Wang, Jiawei Wu, Yikun Ma, Zhi Jin

entry.summary: Proposes SparseGS-W for 3D Gaussian Splatting reconstruction from as few as 5 images using geometric and diffusion priors to handle sparse input and appearance changes in outdoor scenes.

entry.title: Causal Imitation Learning Under Measurement Error and Distribution Shift

author.name: Shi Bo, AmirEmad Ghassami

entry.summary: Proposes CausIL for causal imitation learning under measurement error, treating noisy observations as proxy variables with theoretical guarantees for robustness under distribution shift.

entry.title: Latent Spherical Flow Policy for Reinforcement Learning with Combinatorial Actions

author.name: Lingkai Kong, Anagha Satish, Hezi Jiang, Akseli Kangaslahti, Andrew Ma, Wenbo Chen, Mingxiao Song, Lily Xu, Milind Tambe

entry.summary: Proposes LSFlow, a latent spherical flow policy for RL with combinatorial action spaces that guarantees feasibility by design through solver-induced projection.

entry.title: Tabular Foundation Models Can Do Survival Analysis

author.name: Da In Kim, Wei Siang Lai, Kelly W. Zhang

entry.summary: Demonstrates that tabular foundation models can perform survival analysis through classification-based reformulation, handling censoring as missing labels with theoretical guarantees.

entry.title: SurrogateSHAP: Training-Free Contributor Attribution for Text-to-Image (T2I) Models

author.name: Mingyu Lu, Soham Gadgil, Chris Lin, Chanwoo Kim, Su-In Lee

entry.summary: Proposes SurrogateSHAP, a retraining-free framework for valuing data contributors in text-to-image models using Shapley values with inference-based approximation.

entry.title: Learning Reward Functions for Cooperative Resilience in Multi-Agent Systems

author.name: Manuela Chacon-Chamorro and Luis Felipe Giraldo and Nicanor Quijano

entry.summary: Studies cooperative resilience in multi-agent reinforcement learning for mixed-motive settings, introducing a framework that learns reward functions from ranked trajectories guided by a resilience metric. Evaluates against traditional individual rewards and static social metrics.

entry.title: Sylber 2.0: A Universal Syllable Embedding

author.name: Cheol Jun Cho, Nicholas Lee, Alan W Black, and Gopala K. Anumanchipalli

entry.summary: Sylber 2.0 provides self-supervised syllable-level speech tokenization achieving ~5 Hz token frequency while retaining linguistic and acoustic detail across languages. Enables efficient TTS modeling with high-fidelity reconstruction.

entry.title: Label-Efficient Monitoring of Classification Models via Stratified Importance Sampling

author.name: Lupo Marsigli, Angel Lopez de Haro

entry.summary: Framework based on Stratified Importance Sampling for efficiently monitoring classification model performance with strict labeling budgets. Provides unbiased estimators with provable MSE improvements over importance sampling and stratified random sampling.

entry.title: PoSafeNet: Safe Learning with Poset-Structured Neural Nets

author.name: Kiwan Wong, Wei Xiao, Daniela Rus

entry.summary: PoSafeNet enforces heterogeneous safety constraints with partial priority relations using poset-structured neural safety layer. Provides sequential closed-form projection under constraint orderings for safe robot learning.

entry.title: Culturally Grounded Personas in Large Language Models: Characterization and Alignment with Socio-Psychological Value Frameworks

author.name: Candida M. Greco, Lucio La Cava, Andrea Tagarelli

entry.summary: Investigates alignment of LLM-generated culturally-grounded personas with World Values Survey and Moral Foundations Theory. Examines whether synthetic personas accurately reflect value systems across cultural conditionings.

entry.title: AsyncMesh: Fully Asynchronous Optimization for Data and Pipeline Parallelism

author.name: Thalaiyasingam Ajanthan, Sameera Ramasinghe, Gil Avraham, Hadi Mohaghegh Dolatabadi, Chamin P Hewa Koneputugodage, Violetta Shevchenko, Yan Zuo, Alexander Long

entry.summary: AsyncMesh introduces fully asynchronous optimization for data and pipeline parallelism using weight look-ahead and sparse averaging with EMA correction. Provides convergence guarantees for both methods.

entry.title: Anytime Safe PAC Efficient Reasoning

author.name: Chengyao Yu, Hao Zeng, Youxin Zhu, Jianguo Huang, Huajun Zeng, Bingyi Jing

entry.summary: B-PAC reasoning enables safe and efficient online routing for Large Reasoning Models under partial feedback. Uses inverse propensity scoring and test supermartingales to dynamically adjust routing thresholds.

entry.title: Countering the Over-Reliance Trap: Mitigating Object Hallucination for LVLMs via a Self-Validation Framework

author.name: Shiyu Liu, Xinyi Wen, Zhibin Lan, Ante Wang, Jinsong Su

entry.summary: Proposes self-validation framework to mitigate object hallucination in LVLMs. Analysis shows over-reliance on language priors increases with generation length, inflating hallucinated object token probability.

entry.title: AI Decodes Historical Chinese Archives to Reveal Lost Climate History

author.name: Sida He, Lingxi Xie, Xiaopeng Zhang, Qi Tian

entry.summary: AI framework inverts historical chronicler logic to extract quantitative climate patterns from Chinese historical archives, producing sub-annual precipitation reconstruction for 1368-1911 AD including El Niño dynamics.

entry.title: MC-GRPO: Median-Centered Group Relative Policy Optimization for Small-Rollout Reinforcement Learning

author.name: Youngeun Kim

entry.summary: MC-GRPO improves Group Relative Policy Optimization for small-rollout settings by replacing mean baseline with median baseline, reducing advantage sign flips caused by outlier rewards.

entry.title: TTCS: Test-Time Curriculum Synthesis for Self-Evolving

author.name: Chengyi Yang, Zhishang Xiang, Yunbo Tang, Zongpei Teng, Chengsong Huang, Fei Long, Yuhan Liu, Jinsong Su

entry.summary: TTCS uses test-time curriculum synthesis where a question synthesizer and reasoning solver co-evolve, generating progressively challenging variants to improve reasoning on difficult problems.

entry.title: GUDA: Counterfactual Group-wise Training Data Attribution for Diffusion Models via Unlearning

author.name: Naoki Murata, Yuhta Takida, Chieh-Hsin Lai, Toshimitsu Uesaka, Bac Nguyen, Stefano Ermon, and Yuki Mitsufuji

entry.summary: GUDA approximates counterfactual group-wise attribution for diffusion models using machine unlearning instead of expensive leave-one-group-out retraining.

entry.title: FNF: Functional Network Fingerprint for Large Language Models

author.name: Yiheng Liu, Junhao Ning, Sichen Xia, Haiyang Sun, Yang Yang, Hanyang Chi, Xiaohui Gao, Ning Qiang, Bao Ge, Junwei Han, Xintao Hu

entry.summary: FNF proposes training-free method to detect if a suspect LLM derives from a victim model by comparing functional network activity patterns, which remain consistent across scale/architecture variations.

entry.title: DAVIS: OOD Detection via Dominant Activations and Variance for Increased Separation

author.name: Abid Hassan, Tuan Ngo, Saad Shafiq, Nenad Medvidovic

entry.summary: DAVIS improves out-of-distribution detection by capturing channel-wise variance and dominant activations that are lost through global average pooling. Sets new benchmarks across diverse evaluation settings by enriching feature representations.

entry.title: AR-BENCH: Benchmarking Legal Reasoning with Judgment Error Detection, Classification and Correction

author.name: Yifei Li, Richong Zhang, Wanyu Tu, Zhijie Nie, Haokun Luo, Chuantao Yin and Pengchong Li

entry.summary: AR-BENCH introduces the novel task of appellate review for legal AI, focusing on detecting, classifying, and correcting errors in judicial judgments. Provides 8,700+ annotated cases treating this as anomaly detection rather than prediction.

entry.title: RASST: Fast Cross-modal Retrieval-Augmented Simultaneous Speech Translation

author.name: Jiaxuan Luo, Siqi Ouyang, Lei Li

entry.summary: RASST integrates cross-modal retrieval into simultaneous speech translation for accurate terminology translation. Trains lightweight speech-to-text retriever and lets model decide when to apply retrieved terms during incremental generation.

entry.title: NativeTok: Native Visual Tokenization for Improved Image Generation

author.name: Bin Wu, Mengqi Huang, Weinan Jia and Zhendong Mao

entry.summary: NativeTok enforces causal dependencies during visual tokenization to address mismatch between tokenizer and generative model. Uses Meta Image Transformer with relational constraints within token sequences.

entry.title: Learning to Build Shapes by Extrusion

author.name: Thor Vestergaard Christiansen and Karran Pandey and Alba Reinders and Karan Singh and Morten Rieger Hannemose and J. Andreas B{\ae}rentzen

entry.summary: Introduces Text Encoded Extrusion (TEE), representing 3D mesh construction as face extrusion sequences, enabling LLMs to generate manifold meshes with arbitrary face counts. This approach mirrors how artists create meshes and supports both generation and editing.

entry.title: PlatoLTL: Learning to Generalize Across Symbols in LTL Instructions for Multi-Task RL

author.name: Jacques Cloete, Mathias Jackermeier, Ioannis Havoutis, Alessandro Abate

entry.summary: Presents PlatoLTL enabling RL policies to zero-shot generalize across LTL formula structures and propositions by treating propositions as inputs rather than fixed vocabulary. Achieves parametric generalization in multi-task RL.

entry.title: LLMs Explain't: A Post-Mortem on Semantic Interpretability in Transformer Models

author.name: Alhassan Abdelhalim, Janick Edinger, S\"oren Laue, Michaela Regneri

entry.summary: Reports failed attempts to detect linguistic abstraction in LLMs using probing and feature-mapping methods. Provides important negative results and methodological insights about interpretability limitations.

entry.title: Triage: Hierarchical Visual Budgeting for Efficient Video Reasoning in Vision-Language Models

author.name: Anmin Wang, Nan Zhang, Wei Tao, Xiaoyang Qu, Guokuan Li, Jiguang Wan, Jianzong Wang

entry.summary: Introduces Triage, training-free framework for video reasoning as hierarchical visual budgeting. Frame-level budgeting identifies keyframes, token-level budgeting allocates core and context tokens using batched MMR.

entry.title: Quantifying Model Uniqueness in Heterogeneous AI Ecosystems

author.name: Lei You

entry.summary: Introduces framework for auditing model uniqueness in AI ecosystems using In-Silico Quasi-Experimental Design. Quantifies uniqueness as Peer-Inexpressible Residual (PIER), component irreducible to peer combinations.

entry.title: MedMCP-Calc: Benchmarking LLMs for Realistic Medical Calculator Scenarios via MCP Integration

author.name: Yakun Zhu, Yutong Huang, Shengqian Qin, Zhongzhen Huang, Shaoting Zhang, Xiaofan Zhang

entry.summary: Introduces MedMCP-Calc, first benchmark for realistic medical calculator usage requiring EHR interaction, calculator selection, and multi-step computation via Model Context Protocol integration. Tests 23 LLMs across 4 clinical domains.

entry.title: Towards Explicit Acoustic Evidence Perception in Audio LLMs for Speech Deepfake Detection

author.name: Xiaoxuan Guo, Yuankun Xie, Haonan Cheng, Jiayi Zhou, Jian Liu, Hengyan Huang, Long Ye, Qin Zhang

entry.summary: Proposes audio LLM approach for speech deepfake detection that explicitly grounds decisions in acoustic artifacts rather than semantic cues. Addresses tendency of LLMs to rely on semantically correlated features.

entry.title: Robust and Generalized Humanoid Motion Tracking

author.name: Yubiao Ma, Han Yu, Jiayin Xie, Changtai Lv, Qiang Luo, Chi Zhang, Yunpeng Yin, Boyang Xing, Xuemei Ren, and Dongdong Zheng

entry.summary: Proposes dynamics-conditioned command aggregation for humanoid motion tracking using causal temporal encoder and multi-head cross-attention. Includes fall recovery curriculum. Claims 3.5 hours training time.

entry.title: Temporally Coherent Imitation Learning via Latent Action Flow Matching for Robotic Manipulation

author.name: Wu Songwei, Jiang Zhiduo, Xie Guanghu, Liu Yang, Liu Hong

entry.summary: Proposes LG-Flow Policy for robot manipulation using flow matching in continuous latent action space. Decouples global motion structure from low-level noise for stable real-time execution.

entry.title: To See Far, Look Close: Evolutionary Forecasting for Long-term Time Series

author.name: Jiaming Ma and Siyuan Mu and Ruilin Tang and Haofeng Ma and Qihe Huang and Zhengyang Zhou and Pengkun Wang and Binwu Wang and Yang Wang

entry.summary: Shows models trained on short horizons outperform those trained directly on long horizons when using proposed Evolutionary Forecasting paradigm. Attributes to optimization pathology in direct forecasting.

entry.title: Evaluating the Utility of Grounding Documents with Reference-Free LLM-based Metrics

author.name: Yilun Hua, Giuseppe Castellucci, Peter Schulam, Heba Elfardy, Kevin Small

entry.summary: Proposes GroGU, a model-specific, reference-free metric for RAG content utility based on generation entropy. Uses it to train query-rewriter via DPO.

entry.title: On Safer Reinforcement Learning Policies for Sedation and Analgesia in Intensive Care

author.name: Joel Romero-Hernandez, Oscar Camara

entry.summary: Investigates RL for ICU sedation and analgesia dosing under partial observability. Finds prior work optimized objectives that don't value patient survival and used inappropriate algorithms.

entry.title: MeshGraphNet-Transformer: Scalable Mesh-based Learned Simulation for Solid Mechanics

author.name: Mikel M. Iparraguirre, Iciar Alfaro, David Gonzalez, Elias Cueto

entry.summary: Proposes MeshGraphNet-Transformer combining global Transformer processing with GNN geometric bias. Eliminates need for deep message-passing stacks on high-resolution meshes.

entry.title: TSAQA: Time Series Analysis Question And Answering Benchmark

author.name: Baoyu Jing, Sanhorn Chen, Lecheng Zheng, Boyu Liu, Zihao Li, Jiaru Zou, Tianxin Wei, Zhining Liu, Zhichen Zeng, Ruizhong Qiu, Xiao Lin, Yuchen Yan, Dongqi Fu, Jingchao Ni, Jingrui He, Hanghang Tong

entry.summary: Introduces TSAQA benchmark for time series QA expanding beyond forecasting to six diverse tasks including characterization, comparison, and temporal relationship analysis across 210k samples.

entry.title: Knowledge-Informed Kernel State Reconstruction for Interpretable Dynamical System Discovery

author.name: Luca Muscarnera, Silas Ruhrberg Est\'evez, Samuel Holt, Evgeny Saveliev, Mihaela van der Schaar

entry.summary: MAAT framework for interpretable symbolic discovery of governing equations from noisy observations using kernel state reconstruction. Incorporates physical priors like conservation laws and handles heterogeneous sampling.

entry.title: FlexMap: Generalized HD Map Construction from Flexible Camera Configurations

author.name: Run Wang, Chaoyi Zhou, Amir Salarpour, Xi Liu, Zhi-Qi Cheng, Feng Luo, Mert D. Pes\'e, Siyu Huang

entry.summary: FlexMap constructs HD maps from variable camera configurations without per-configuration retraining. Uses geometry-aware foundation model with cross-frame attention to implicitly encode 3D understanding.

entry.title: Lethe:Adapter-Augmented Dual-Stream Update for Persistent Knowledge Erasure in Federated Unlearning

author.name: Hanwei Tan, Wentai Hu, Ligang He, Yijun Quan

entry.summary: Lethe addresses 'knowledge resurfacing' in federated unlearning where continued training re-activates previously unlearned knowledge, using adapter-augmented dual-stream updates for persistent erasure.

entry.title: From Horizontal Layering to Vertical Integration: A Comparative Study of the AI-Driven Software Development Paradigm

author.name: Chi Zhang, Zehan Li, Ziqian Zhong, Haibing Ma, Dan Xiao, Chen Lin, and Ming Dong

entry.summary: Comparative study finding that AI-native development achieves 8-33x resource reduction over traditional approaches through 'Super Employees' who span role boundaries, eliminating coordination overhead.

entry.title: Discovering Scaling Exponents with Physics-Informed M\"untz-Sz\'asz Networks

author.name: Gnankan Landry Regis N'guessan and Bum Jun Kim

entry.summary: Introduces physics-informed Müntz-Szász Networks that treat scaling exponents as trainable parameters for systems near singularities and critical points. Proves identifiability and achieves high accuracy on corner singularity recovery.

entry.title: A Comparative Evaluation of Large Vision-Language Models for 2D Object Detection under SOTIF Conditions

author.name: Ji Zhou and Yilin Ding and Yongqi Zhao and Jiachen Xu and Arno Eichberger

entry.summary: Systematic evaluation of 10 LVLMs for safety-critical 2D object detection under SOTIF conditions using PeSOTIF dataset. Compares against YOLO baseline for autonomous driving perception.

entry.title: From Data Leak to Secret Misses: The Impact of Data Leakage on Secret Detection Models

author.name: Farnaz Soltaniani, Mohammad Ghafari

entry.summary: Investigates data leakage in benchmark datasets for secret detection, showing how duplicates across train/test splits can inflate reported model performance.

entry.title: Learning Geometrically-Grounded 3D Visual Representations for View-Generalizable Robotic Manipulation

author.name: Di Zhang, Weicheng Duan, Dasen Gu, Hongye Lu, Hai Zhang, Hang Yu, Junqiao Zhao, Guang Chen

entry.summary: Presents framework for learning geometrically-grounded 3D visual representations for robotic manipulation that generalize across camera viewpoints from single-view inference.

entry.title: DimABSA: Building Multilingual and Multidomain Datasets for Dimensional Aspect-Based Sentiment Analysis

author.name: Lung-Hao Lee, Liang-Chih Yu, Natalia Loukashevich, Ilseyar Alimova, Alexander Panchenko, Tzu-Mi Lin, Zhe-Yu Xu, Jian-Yu Zhou, Guangmin Zheng, Jin Wang, Sharanya Awasthi, Jonas Becker, Jan Philip Wahle, Terry Ruas, Shamsuddeen Hassan Muhammad, Saif M. Mohammed

entry.summary: Introduces DimABSA, first multilingual dimensional aspect-based sentiment analysis resource with valence-arousal scores. Covers 76,958 instances across 42,570 sentences in multiple languages.

entry.title: Coarse-to-Real: Generative Rendering for Populated Dynamic Scenes

author.name: Gonzalo Gomez-Nogales, Yicong Hong, Chongjian Ge, Marc Comino-Trinidad, Dan Casas and Yi Zhou

entry.summary: C2R (Coarse-to-Real) synthesizes realistic urban crowd videos from coarse 3D simulations using a neural renderer guided by text prompts. Employs mixed CG-real training strategy to overcome lack of paired training data.

entry.title: Matrix Factorization for Practical Continual Mean Estimation Under User-Level Differential Privacy

author.name: Nikita P. Kalinin, Ali Najar, Valentin Roth, Christoph H. Lampert

entry.summary: Analyzes continual mean estimation under user-level differential privacy with approximate DP using matrix factorization. Introduces efficient factorization achieving asymptotically lower MSE bounds than pure DP approaches.

entry.title: Amortized Simulation-Based Inference in Generalized Bayes via Neural Posterior Estimation

author.name: Shiyi Sun, Geoff K. Nicholls, Jeong Eun Lee

entry.summary: First fully amortized variational approximation for generalized Bayesian inference, training single neural posterior estimator conditioned on both data and temperature parameter. Enables single forward-pass sampling without simulator calls or MCMC.

entry.title: Optimization, Generalization and Differential Privacy Bounds for Gradient Descent on Kolmogorov-Arnold Networks

author.name: Puyu Wang, Junyu Zhou, Philipp Liznerski, Marius Kloft

entry.summary: Analyzes gradient descent for Kolmogorov-Arnold Networks deriving bounds for training dynamics, generalization, and differential privacy. Shows polylogarithmic width suffices for O(1/T) optimization and O(1/n) generalization rates.

entry.title: FedCARE: Federated Unlearning with Conflict-Aware Projection and Relearning-Resistant Recovery

author.name: Yue Li, Mingmin Chu, Xilei Yang, Da Xiao, Ziqi Xu, Wei Shao, Qipeng Song, Hui Li

entry.summary: FedCARE addresses federated unlearning with conflict-aware projection and relearning-resistant recovery, preventing unlearned knowledge from resurfacing during continued training.

entry.title: ScholarPeer: A Context-Aware Multi-Agent Framework for Automated Peer Review

author.name: Palash Goyal, Mihir Parmar, Yiwen Song, Hamid Palangi, Tomas Pfister, Jinsung Yoon

entry.summary: ScholarPeer is a multi-agent framework for automated peer review using historian agents for domain context, baseline scouts for missing comparisons, and claim verification against external sources.

entry.title: Do Transformers Have the Ability for Periodicity Generalization?

author.name: Huanyu Liu, Ge Li, Yihong Dong, Sihan Wu, Peixu Wang, Sihao Cheng, Taozhi Chen, Kechi Zhang, Hao Zhu, Tongxuan Liu

entry.summary: Investigates Transformer periodicity generalization through abstract algebra perspective, showing models struggle with composite periodicity and constructing Coper benchmark for evaluation.

entry.title: GaussianOcc3D: A Gaussian-Based Adaptive Multi-modal 3D Occupancy Prediction

author.name: A. Enes Doruk, Hasan F. Ates

entry.summary: GaussianOcc3D proposes a multi-modal framework for 3D occupancy prediction using 3D Gaussian representations to bridge camera and LiDAR data. Addresses modality heterogeneity and spatial misalignment in autonomous driving perception.

entry.title: Hide and Seek in Embedding Space: Geometry-based Steganography and Detection in Large Language Models

author.name: Charles Westphal, Keivan Navaie, Fernando E. Rosas

entry.summary: Studies LLM steganography using embedding-space-derived encodings for low recoverability. Shows embedding-based mappings reduce payload recoverability while improving secret encoding compared to arbitrary mappings.

entry.title: Evaluating Large Language Models for Security Bug Report Prediction

author.name: Farnaz Soltaniani, Shoaib Razzaq, Mohammad Ghafari

entry.summary: Evaluates LLMs for security bug report prediction comparing prompting vs fine-tuning. Finds clear trade-off: prompted models have high recall but low precision; fine-tuned models have opposite pattern.

entry.title: MiTa: A Hierarchical Multi-Agent Collaboration Framework with Memory-integrated and Task Allocation

author.name: XiaoJie Zhang, JianHan Wu, Xiaoyang Qu, Jianzong Wang

entry.summary: Proposes MiTa, hierarchical multi-agent framework with manager-member structure enabling global task allocation and episodic memory integration to address memory inconsistency and behavioral conflicts.

entry.title: Automatic Constraint Policy Optimization based on Continuous Constraint Interpolation Framework for Offline Reinforcement Learning

author.name: Xinchen Han, Qiuyang Fang, Hossam Afifi, Michel Marot

entry.summary: Proposes Continuous Constraint Interpolation (CCI) unifying weighted BC, density regularization, and support constraints in offline RL. Develops Automatic Constraint Policy Optimization with adaptive selection.

entry.title: BGTplanner: Maximizing Training Accuracy for Differentially Private Federated Recommenders via Strategic Privacy Budget Allocation

author.name: Xianzhi Zhang, Yipeng Zhou, Miao Hu, Di Wu, Pengshan Liao, Mohsen Guizani, Michael Sheng

entry.summary: Develops BGTplanner for strategic privacy budget allocation in differentially private federated recommender systems to maximize training accuracy under privacy constraints.

entry.title: BioMedSearch: A Multi-Source Biomedical Retrieval Framework Based on LLMs

author.name: Congying Liu, Xingyuan Wei, Peipei Liu, Yiqing Shen, Yanxu Mao, Tiehan Cui

entry.summary: Introduces BioMedSearch, a multi-source retrieval framework for biomedical queries using LLMs integrated with authoritative databases to reduce hallucinations about proteins and diseases.

entry.title: Do Open-Vocabulary Detectors Transfer to Aerial Imagery? A Comparative Evaluation

author.name: Christos Tsourveloudis

entry.summary: First systematic benchmark evaluating five state-of-the-art open-vocabulary object detectors on aerial imagery, revealing severe domain transfer failure (best model: 27.6% F1).

entry.title: Large Language Models: A Mathematical Formulation

author.name: Ricardo Baptista, Andrew Stuart, Son Tran

entry.summary: Provides comprehensive mathematical framework for understanding LLMs including tokenization, architecture, training, and deployment using information theory, probability, and optimization.

entry.title: Learning to Recommend Multi-Agent Subgraphs from Calling Trees

author.name: Xinyuan Song, Liang Zhao

entry.summary: Formulates agent recommendation in multi-agent systems as constrained decision problem, introducing graph-based framework for orchestrating agents from growing marketplaces.

entry.title: Task-Uniform Convergence and Backward Transfer in Federated Domain-Incremental Learning with Partial Participation

author.name: Longtao Xu, Jian Li

entry.summary: Proposes SPECIAL for federated domain-incremental learning with theoretical guarantees for backward knowledge transfer under partial participation, using server-side anchor mechanism.

entry.title: PersonaCite: VoC-Grounded Interviewable Agentic Synthetic AI Personas for Verifiable User and Design Research

author.name: Mario Truss

entry.summary: PersonaCite is an agentic system that creates AI personas grounded in actual voice-of-customer evidence, providing source attribution and explicitly abstaining when evidence is missing. Validated with 14 industry experts for design research applications.

entry.title: SCALAR: Quantifying Structural Hallucination, Consistency, and Reasoning Gaps in Materials Foundation Models

author.name: Can Polat, Erchin Serpedin, Mustafa Kurban, Hasan Kurban

entry.summary: SCALAR benchmark evaluates geometric scale generalization in materials foundation models, testing on ~100,000 structures from a few atoms to 18,000+ atoms. Defines tasks for CIF-to-property prediction, chain-of-thought reasoning, and physics grounding.

entry.title: Specialists or Generalists? Multi-Agent and Single-Agent LLMs for Essay Grading

author.name: Jamiu Adekunle Idowu and Ahmed Almasoud

entry.summary: Evaluates single-agent vs multi-agent LLM architectures for essay grading using GPT-5.1. Multi-agent system with specialist agents better identifies weak essays while single-agent performs better on mid-range essays.

entry.title: Weak Diffusion Priors Can Still Achieve Strong Inverse-Problem Performance

author.name: Jing Jia, Wei Yuan, Sifan Liu, Liyue Shen, Guanyang Wang

entry.summary: Studies when weak or mismatched diffusion priors still perform well for inverse problems. Finds weak priors succeed when measurements are highly informative, with theoretical analysis based on Bayesian consistency.

entry.title: Machine Unlearning in Low-Dimensional Feature Subspace

author.name: Kun Fang, Qinghua Tao, Junxu Liu, Yaxin Xiao, Qingqing Ye, Jian Sun and Haibo Hu

entry.summary: LOFT performs machine unlearning in low-dimensional feature subspace via principal projections that maximize remaining data information while minimizing forgetting data influence. Only requires one-shot feature fetching.

entry.title: Elastic Spectral State Space Models for Budgeted Inference

author.name: Dachuan Song and Xuan Wang

entry.summary: ES-SSM enables runtime-scalable state space models via Hankel spectral filtering. Single training at full capacity allows arbitrary-scale truncation for budgeted inference without retraining.

entry.title: RoboStriker: Hierarchical Decision-Making for Autonomous Humanoid Boxing

author.name: Kangning Yin, Zhe Cao, Wentao Dong, Weishuai Zeng, Tianyi Zhang, Qiang Zhang, Jingbo Wang, Jiangmiao Pang, Ming Zhou, Weinan Zhang

entry.summary: RoboStriker enables autonomous humanoid boxing via hierarchical framework: learn boxing skills from mocap, distill into repertoire, then train strategic MARL on top. Decouples strategy from physical execution.

entry.title: Enhancing TableQA through Verifiable Reasoning Trace Reward

author.name: Tung Sum Thomas Kwok, Xinyu Wang, Hengzhi He, Xiaofeng Lin, Peng Lu, Liheng Ma, Chunhe Wang, Ying Nian Wu, Lei Ding, Guang Cheng

entry.summary: RE-Tab enhances TableQA via verifiable rewards on table transformation actions, formulating as POMDP. Provides explicit feedback on state transitions and simulative reasoning during trajectory search.

entry.title: Benchmarking Long Roll-outs of Auto-regressive Neural Operators for the Compressible Navier-Stokes Equations with Conserved Quantity Correction

author.name: Sean Current, Chandan Kumar, Datta Gaitonde, Srinivasan Parthasarathy

entry.summary: Conserved quantity correction is model-agnostic technique for incorporating physical conservation in neural PDE operators. Improves long-term stability of autoregressive neural operators for Navier-Stokes.

entry.title: Exo-Plore: Exploring Exoskeleton Control Space through Human-aligned Simulation

author.name: Geonho Leem, Jaedong Lee, Jehee Lee, Seungmoon Song, Jungdam Won

entry.summary: Exo-plore optimizes hip exoskeleton assistance through simulation combining neuromechanical modeling and deep RL, avoiding extensive human experiments. Enables optimization for users who can't participate in demanding trials.

entry.title: PerfGuard: A Performance-Aware Agent for Visual Content Generation

author.name: Zhipeng Chen, Zhongrui Zhang, Chao Zhang, Yifan Xu, Lan Yang, Jun Liu, Ke Li, Yi-Zhe Song

entry.summary: Proposes PerfGuard, an agent framework for visual content generation that models tool performance boundaries and integrates them into task planning, addressing the unrealistic assumption that tool executions always succeed.

entry.title: Test-Time Mixture of World Models for Embodied Agents in Dynamic Environments

author.name: Jinwoo Jang, Minjong Yoo, Sihyung Yoon, Honguk Woo

entry.summary: TMoW extends Mixture-of-Experts to embodied agents by updating routing functions over world models at test time, improving adaptability to unseen domains in dynamic environments.

entry.title: Visual Personalization Turing Test

author.name: Rameen Abdal, James Burgess, Sergey Tulyakov, Kuan-Chieh Jackson Wang

entry.summary: VPTT introduces Visual Personalization Turing Test evaluating whether personalized outputs are indistinguishable from content a person might plausibly create, with 10k-persona benchmark.

entry.title: Bi-MCQ: Reformulating Vision-Language Alignment for Negation Understanding

author.name: Tae Hun Kim and Hyun Gyu Lee

entry.summary: Bi-MCQ reformulates vision-language alignment as conditional semantic comparison to address VLM weakness in understanding negation, using bi-directional multiple-choice learning.

entry.title: AEGIS: White-Box Attack Path Generation using LLMs and Training Effectiveness Evaluation for Large-Scale Cyber Defence Exercises

author.name: Ivan K. Tung, Yu Xiang Shi, Alex Chien, Wenkai Liu, Lawrence Zheng

entry.summary: AEGIS uses LLMs with Monte Carlo Tree Search to generate attack paths for cyber defense exercises without pre-existing vulnerability graphs. Validated at CIDeX 2025 with comparable training effectiveness to human-authored scenarios.

entry.title: Is Softmax Loss All You Need? A Principled Analysis of Softmax-family Loss

author.name: Yuanhao Pu, Defu Lian, Enhong Chen

entry.summary: Provides principled analysis of Softmax-family losses using Fenchel-Young framework, examining consistency with classification/ranking metrics and gradient dynamics. Introduces systematic taxonomy for scalability approximations.

entry.title: Diachronic Stereo Matching for Multi-Date Satellite Imagery

author.name: El\'ias Masquil (IIE, UDELAR), Luca Savant Aira (Polito), Roger Mar\'i, Thibaud Ehret (AMIAD), Pablo Mus\'e (IIE, UDELAR, CB), Gabriele Facciolo (CB, IUF)

entry.summary: First diachronic stereo matching method for satellite imagery, enabling 3D reconstruction from image pairs captured months apart despite seasonal, illumination, and shadow changes that violate standard stereoscopic assumptions.

entry.title: Inference-Time Dynamic Modality Selection for Incomplete Multimodal Classification

author.name: Siyi Du, Xinzhe Luo, Declan P. O'Regan, Chen Qin

entry.summary: DyMo dynamically selects which recovered modalities to integrate at inference time for incomplete multimodal classification. Addresses discard-vs-impute dilemma by identifying reliable recovered modalities per sample.

entry.title: EmoShift: Lightweight Activation Steering for Enhanced Emotion-Aware Speech Synthesis

author.name: Li Zhou, Hao Jiang, Junjie Li, Tianrui Wang, Haizhou Li

entry.summary: Presents EmoShift, a lightweight activation steering framework for emotion-aware text-to-speech with only 10M trainable parameters. Learns steering vectors in output embedding space to capture emotion-specific latent characteristics.

entry.title: Scalable Topology-Preserving Graph Coarsening with Graph Collapse

author.name: Xiang Wu, Rong-Hua Li, Xunkai Li, Kangfei Zhao, Hongchao Qin and Guoren Wang

entry.summary: Proposes STPGC for scalable topology-preserving graph coarsening using graph strong collapse and edge collapse from algebraic topology. Eliminates dominated nodes/edges while preserving topological features.

entry.title: Improved Algorithms for Nash Welfare in Linear Bandits

author.name: Dhruv Sarkar, Nishant Pandey, Sayak Ray Chowdhury

entry.summary: Achieves order-optimal Nash regret bound in linear bandits using new analytical tools. Also initiates study of p-means regret as unified fairness-utility framework.

entry.title: PIDSMaker: Building and Evaluating Provenance-based Intrusion Detection Systems

author.name: Tristan Bilot, Baoxiang Jiang, Thomas Pasquier

entry.summary: Presents PIDSMaker, open-source framework for developing and evaluating provenance-based intrusion detection systems with standardized protocols. Consolidates 8 systems with consistent preprocessing.

entry.title: Causal Characterization of Measurement and Mechanistic Anomalies

author.name: Hendrik Suhr, David Kaltenpoth, Jilles Vreeken

entry.summary: Proposes a causal framework distinguishing measurement errors from mechanism shifts in anomaly detection by treating outliers as latent interventions. Shows both types are identifiable and provides maximum likelihood estimation for practical use.

entry.title: Asymptotic Theory of Iterated Empirical Risk Minimization, with Applications to Active Learning

author.name: Hugo Cui, Yue M. Lu

entry.summary: Develops sharp asymptotic characterization of iterated empirical risk minimization where predictions from first estimator enter the second's loss function. Provides explicit predictions for active learning performance in high-dimensional regime.

entry.title: MOSAIC: Modular Scalable Autonomy for Intelligent Coordination of Heterogeneous Robotic Teams

author.name: David Oberacker, Julia Richer, Philip Arm, Marvin Grosse Besselmann, Lennart Puck, William Talbot, Maximilian Schik, Sabine Bellmann, Tristan Schnell, Hendrik Kolvenbach, R\"udiger Dillmann, Marco Hutter, Arne Roennau

entry.summary: Presents MOSAIC, a scalable autonomy framework for multi-robot exploration using Points of Interest abstraction and multiple autonomy layers. Validated in space-analog field experiments with heterogeneous robot teams.

entry.title: SplineFlow: Flow Matching for Dynamical Systems with B-Spline Interpolants

author.name: Santanu Subhash Rathod, Pietro Li\`o, Xiao Zhang

entry.summary: Proposes SplineFlow using B-spline interpolation for flow matching on dynamical systems. Addresses instability of naive polynomial paths and enables joint modeling across irregular observations.

entry.title: OrLog: Resolving Complex Queries with LLMs and Probabilistic Reasoning

author.name: Mohanna Hoveyda, Jelle Piepenbrock, Arjen P de Vries, Maarten de Rijke, Faegheh Hasibi

entry.summary: Introduces OrLog, a neuro-symbolic retrieval framework decoupling predicate-level plausibility estimation from logical reasoning for complex queries with multiple constraints.

entry.title: Vision-Language Controlled Deep Unfolding for Joint Medical Image Restoration and Segmentation

author.name: Ping Chen, Zicheng Huang, Xiangming Wang, Yungeng Liu, Bingyu Liang, Haijin Zeng, Yongyong Chen

entry.summary: Proposes VL-DUN for joint medical image restoration and segmentation using vision-language controlled deep unfolding. Formulates as unified optimization with frequency-aware Mamba mechanism.

entry.title: FlowCalib: LiDAR-to-Vehicle Miscalibration Detection using Scene Flows

author.name: Ilir Tahiraj, Peter Wittal, Markus Lienkamp

entry.summary: Introduces FlowCalib for detecting LiDAR-to-vehicle miscalibration using motion cues from scene flow of static objects. First framework addressing individual sensor miscalibration.

entry.title: Distribution-informed Efficient Conformal Prediction for Full Ranking

author.name: Wenbo Liao, Huipeng Huang, Chen Jia, Huajun Xi, Hao Zeng, Hongxin Wei

entry.summary: Proposes Distribution-informed Conformal Ranking (DCR) for efficient prediction sets by deriving exact distribution of non-conformity scores using Negative Hypergeometric distributions.

entry.title: Unsupervised Hierarchical Skill Discovery

author.name: Damion Harvey (1), Geraud Nangue Tasse (1 and 2), Branden Ingram (1 and 2), Benjamin Rosman (1 and 2), Steven James (1 and 2) ((1) University of the Witwatersrand, Johannesburg, South Africa, (2) Machine Intelligence and Neural Discovery (MIND) Institute, University of the Witwatersrand, Johannesburg, South Africa)

entry.summary: Proposes grammar-based approach for unsupervised skill segmentation and hierarchical discovery from unlabeled trajectories. Evaluated on Craftax and full Minecraft.

entry.title: Segment Any Events with Language

author.name: Seungjun Lee, Gim Hee Lee

entry.summary: Introduces SEAL, first framework for open-vocabulary event instance segmentation supporting both instance and part-level granularity with visual prompts on event sensors.

entry.title: Monotonic Reference-Free Refinement for Autoformalization

author.name: Lan Zhang, Marco Valentino, Andr\'e Freitas

entry.summary: Proposes reference-free iterative refinement for full-theorem autoformalization using complementary feedback from theorem provers and LLM judges without ground-truth proofs.

entry.title: Learning to Execute Graph Algorithms Exactly with Graph Neural Networks

author.name: Muhammad Fetrat Qharabagh, Artur Back de Luca, George Giapitzakis, Kimon Fountoulakis

entry.summary: Proves exact learnability results for graph algorithms with GNNs under bounded-degree and finite-precision constraints using NTK theory. Trains MLP ensemble then uses as GNN update function.

entry.title: Disentangling multispecific antibody function with graph neural networks

author.name: Joshua Southern, Changpeng Lu, Santrupti Nerli, Samuel D. Stanton, Andrew M. Watkins, Franziska Seeger, Fr\'ed\'eric A. Dreyer

entry.summary: Introduces computational framework for multispecific antibody design with graph neural networks capturing domain topology. Proposes synthetic functional landscape generation for training.

entry.title: Strongly Polynomial Time Complexity of Policy Iteration for $L_\infty$ Robust MDPs

author.name: Ali Asadi, Krishnendu Chatterjee, Ehsan Goharshady, Mehrdad Karrabi, Alipasha Montaseri, Carlo Pagano

entry.summary: Proves strongly polynomial time complexity for policy iteration in L∞ robust MDPs, extending classical MDP results to uncertainty-aware settings. Establishes theoretical foundations for robust sequential decision making.

entry.title: Solving Inverse Problems with Flow-based Models via Model Predictive Control

author.name: George Webber, Alexander Denker, Riccardo Barbano, Andrew J Reader

entry.summary: Proposes MPC-Flow, using model predictive control for training-free conditional generation with flow-based models. Provides theoretical guarantees linking the MPC formulation to optimal control objectives.

entry.title: Training-Free Test-Time Adaptation with Brownian Distance Covariance in Vision-Language Models

author.name: Yi Zhang, Chun-Wun Cheng, Angelica I. Aviles-Rivero, Zhihai He, Liang-Jie Zhang

entry.summary: Proposes TaTa for training-free test-time adaptation of VLMs using Brownian Distance Covariance to capture nonlinear dependencies. Avoids backpropagation while improving domain shift robustness.

entry.title: Particle-Guided Diffusion Models for Partial Differential Equations

author.name: Andrew Millard, Fredrik Lindsten, Zheng Zhao

entry.summary: Introduces physics-guided diffusion sampling using PDE residuals within Sequential Monte Carlo for solving PDEs. Achieves lower numerical error than existing generative PDE solvers.

entry.title: PaperBanana: Automating Academic Illustration for AI Scientists

author.name: Dawei Zhu, Rui Meng, Yale Song, Xiyu Wei, Sujian Li, Tomas Pfister, Jinsung Yoon

entry.summary: Introduces PaperBanana, an agentic framework for generating publication-ready academic illustrations. Provides benchmark of 292 methodology diagrams from NeurIPS 2025 publications.

entry.title: UPA: Unsupervised Prompt Agent via Tree-Based Search and Selection

author.name: Siran Peng, Weisong Zhao, Tianyu Fu, Chenxu Zhao, Tianshuo Zhang, Haoyuan Zhang, Xiangyu Zhu, Minghui Wu, Zhen Lei

entry.summary: Proposes UPA for unsupervised prompt optimization using tree-based search with LLM pairwise comparisons. Addresses practical limitation of requiring supervised reward signals in prompt agents.

entry.title: Decoupled Diffusion Sampling for Inverse Problems on Function Spaces

author.name: Thomas Y.L. Lin, Jiachen Yao, Lufang Chiang, Julius Berner, Anima Anandkumar

entry.summary: Proposes DDIS decoupling coefficient prior learning from PDE physics modeling for inverse problems. Proves theoretical guarantees avoiding guidance attenuation in diffusion posterior sampling.

entry.title: Exact closed-form Gaussian moments of residual layers

author.name: Simon Kuang, Xinfan Lin

entry.summary: Derives exact closed-form Gaussian moments for residual neural network layers with probit, GeLU, ReLU, Heaviside, and sine activations. Achieves orders-of-magnitude improvements in KL divergence over alternatives, with applications to variational Bayesian networks.

entry.title: Knowledge Gradient for Preference Learning

author.name: Kaiwen Wu and Jacob R. Gardner

entry.summary: Derives exact and analytical knowledge gradient for preferential Bayesian optimization where only pairwise comparisons are available. Addresses previously intractable look-ahead computation requiring non-Gaussian posterior.

entry.title: FIRE: Multi-fidelity Regression with Distribution-conditioned In-context Learning using Tabular Foundation Models

author.name: Rosen Ting-Ying Yu, Nicholas Sung, Faez Ahmed

entry.summary: FIRE uses tabular foundation models for zero-shot multi-fidelity regression via cross-fidelity information transfer. Couples TFMs with high-fidelity correction model conditioned on low-fidelity posterior distributions.

entry.title: Learn More with Less: Uncertainty Consistency Guided Query Selection for RLVR

author.name: Hao Yi, Yulan Hu, Xin Li, Sheng Ouyang, Lizhong Ding, Yong Liu

entry.summary: Introduces active learning into RLVR (Reinforcement Learning with Verifiable Rewards) using an uncertainty consistency metric to select more informative queries, reducing annotation costs while maintaining performance.

entry.title: Unsupervised Synthetic Image Attribution: Alignment and Disentanglement

author.name: Zongfang Liu, Guangyi Chen, Boyang Sun, Tongliang Liu and Kun Zhang

entry.summary: Proposes unsupervised synthetic image attribution that identifies generative model sources without paired supervision through alignment and disentanglement of basic concept representations.

entry.title: SQUAD: Scalable Quorum Adaptive Decisions via ensemble of early exit neural networks

author.name: Matteo Gambella, Fabrizio Pittorino, Giuliano Casale, Manuel Roveri

entry.summary: SQUAD combines early-exit neural networks with ensemble learning using a quorum-based stopping criterion. Improves uncertainty estimation while reducing inference time by requiring consensus across multiple early-exit learners.

entry.title: Cascaded Flow Matching for Heterogeneous Tabular Data with Mixed-Type Features

author.name: Markus Mueller, Kathrin Gruber, Dennis Fok

entry.summary: Cascaded flow matching for tabular data addresses mixed-type features by first generating low-resolution categorical representation then conditioning high-resolution flow matching with novel guided probability path.

entry.title: DINO-SAE: DINO Spherical Autoencoder for High-Fidelity Image Reconstruction and Generation

author.name: Hun Chang, Byunghee Cha, Jong Chul Ye

entry.summary: Presents DINO-SAE using spherical autoencoder with DINO for high-fidelity image reconstruction. Key insight: semantic information is encoded in feature direction while magnitude preserves fine-grained details.

entry.title: Environment-Conditioned Tail Reweighting for Total Variation Invariant Risk Minimization

author.name: Wang Yuanchao, Lai Zhao-Rong, Zhong Tianqi and Li Fengnan

entry.summary: Proposes ECTR combining environment-level invariance with within-environment robustness via tail reweighting for OOD generalization. Addresses both correlation shifts and diversity shifts.

entry.title: Self-Imitated Diffusion Policy for Efficient and Robust Visual Navigation
