author.name: Runhua Zhang, Junyi Hou, Changxu Cheng, Qiyi Chen, Tao Wang, Wuyue Zhao

entry.summary: Proposes Self-Imitated Diffusion Policy (SIDP) for visual navigation, learning from self-sampled trajectories filtered by reward. Addresses sub-optimality from expert demonstrations without generate-then-filter pipeline.

entry.title: From Retrieving Information to Reasoning with AI: Exploring Different Interaction Modalities to Support Human-AI Coordination in Clinical Decision-Making

author.name: Behnam Rahdari, Sameer Shaikh, Jonathan H Chen, Tobias Gerstenberg and Shriti Raj

entry.summary: Qualitative study with 12 clinicians examining how they perceive different AI interaction modalities (text, UI, voice) for clinical decision support. Finds clinicians use LLMs for information retrieval rather than active deliberation.

entry.title: Score-based Integrated Gradient for Root Cause Explanations of Outliers

author.name: Phuoc Nguyen, Truyen Tran, Sunil Gupta, Svetha Venkatesh

entry.summary: SIREN attributes outlier root causes by estimating score functions and computing integrated gradients along paths from outlier toward normal distribution. Satisfies three Shapley axioms plus asymmetry from causal structure.

entry.title: Layerwise Progressive Freezing Enables STE-Free Training of Deep Binary Neural Networks

author.name: Evan Gibson Smith, Bashima Islam

entry.summary: StoMPP uses layerwise stochastic masking to progressively binarize weights/activations without straight-through estimators, enabling STE-free training of binary neural networks.

entry.title: AscendCraft: Automatic Ascend NPU Kernel Generation via DSL-Guided Transcompilation

author.name: Zhongzhen Wen, Shudi Shao, Zhong Li, Yu Ge, Tongtong Xu, Yuanyi Lin, Tian Zhang

entry.summary: AscendCraft uses DSL-guided transcompilation for automatic kernel generation on Ascend NPUs. Addresses the gap between GPU and NPU kernel generation due to limited documentation and examples.

entry.title: Aligning the Unseen in Attributed Graphs: Interplay between Graph Geometry and Node Attributes Manifold

author.name: Aldric Labarthe (CB, UNIGE), Roland Bouffanais (UNIGE), Julien Randon-Furling (CB)

entry.summary: Addresses geometric incompatibility in attributed graph learning by separating manifold learning from structural alignment. Quantifies metric distortion between attribute manifold and graph Heat Kernel as interpretable descriptor.

entry.title: A Real-Time Privacy-Preserving Behavior Recognition System via Edge-Cloud Collaboration

author.name: Huan Song, Shuyu Tian, Junyi Hao, Cheng Yuan, Zhenyu Jia, Jiawei Shao, Xuelong Li

entry.summary: Presents privacy-preserving behavior recognition system for high-privacy environments using edge-cloud architecture with source desensitization and irreversible feature mapping.

entry.title: Autonomous Chain-of-Thought Distillation for Graph-Based Fraud Detection

author.name: Yuan Li, Jun Hu, Bryan Hooi, Bingsheng He, Cheng Chen

entry.summary: Proposes FraudCoT for graph-based fraud detection using autonomous chain-of-thought distillation. Generates diverse reasoning paths and integrates them into node representations for GNN training.

entry.title: I Know You Can't See Me: Dynamic Occlusion-Aware Safety Validation of Strategic Planners for Autonomous Vehicles Using Hypergames

author.name: Maximilian Kahn, Atrisha Sarkar and Krzysztof Czarnecki

entry.summary: Develops a hypergame-based framework for assessing dynamic occlusion risk in autonomous vehicle scenarios and achieves 4000% speedup in safety validation compared to naturalistic data testing.

entry.title: HEAL: Learning-Free Source Free Unsupervised Domain Adaptation for Cross-Modality Medical Image Segmentation

author.name: Yulong Shi, Jiapeng Li and Lin Qi

entry.summary: Proposes HEAL, a learning-free source-free unsupervised domain adaptation framework for cross-modality medical image segmentation using hierarchical denoising and edge-guided selection.

entry.title: Attention Isn't All You Need for Emotion Recognition:Domain Features Outperform Transformers on the EAV Dataset

author.name: Anmol Guragain

entry.summary: Shows that domain-appropriate features (delta MFCCs for audio, frequency-domain for EEG) outperform sophisticated attention mechanisms for multimodal emotion recognition on small datasets.

entry.title: FedAdaVR: Adaptive Variance Reduction for Robust Federated Learning under Limited Client Participation

author.name: S M Ruhul Kabir Howlader, Xiao Chen, Yifei Xie, Lu Liu

entry.summary: Proposes FedAdaVR combining adaptive optimizer with variance reduction for federated learning under partial client participation, with quantized variant reducing memory by up to 87.5%.

entry.title: Riemannian Lyapunov Optimizer: A Unified Framework for Optimization

author.name: Yixuan Wang, Omkar Sudhir Patil, Warren E. Dixon

entry.summary: Introduces Riemannian Lyapunov Optimizers (RLOs), a family of optimization algorithms derived from control theory that unifies classic optimizers within a geometric framework. The approach reinterprets optimization as a dynamical system on a Riemannian manifold with provable convergence guarantees.

entry.title: Gaussian Process Bandit Optimization with Machine Learning Predictions and Application to Hypothesis Generation

author.name: Xin Jennifer Chen and Yunjin Tong

entry.summary: PA-GP-UCB combines expensive ground-truth oracle with cheap ML predictions and offline data for efficient Bayesian optimization. Uses control-variates estimator from joint GP posterior to correct prediction bias.

entry.title: Spectral Filtering for Learning Quantum Dynamics

author.name: Elad Hazan, Annie Marsden

entry.summary: Proposes Quantum Spectral Filtering for learning quantum dynamical systems, formulating task as learning Complex-Valued LDS with sector-bounded eigenvalues. Proves learnability governed by effective dimension rather than Hilbert dimension.

entry.title: Automating Forecasting Question Generation and Resolution for AI Evaluation

author.name: Nikos I. Bosse, Peter M\"uhlbacher, Jack Wildman, Lawrence Phillips, Dan Schwarz

entry.summary: System for automatically generating and resolving forecasting questions using LLM-powered web research agents. Produces 1499 diverse real-world questions with ~96% verifiable and unambiguous quality.

entry.title: Temporal Graph Pattern Machine

author.name: Yijun Ma, Zehong Wang, Weixiang Sun, Yanfang Ye

entry.summary: TGPM is a foundation framework for temporal graph learning that models interactions as patches via temporally-biased random walks, capturing multi-scale structural semantics for transferable evolution mechanisms.

entry.title: EvoEGF-Mol: Evolving Exponential Geodesic Flow for Structure-based Drug Design

author.name: Yaowei Jin, Junjie Wang, Cheng Cao, Penglei Wang, Duo An, Qian Shi

entry.summary: EvoEGF-Mol addresses structure-based drug design from information-geometric perspective, modeling molecules as exponential-family distributions with flows along Fisher-Rao geodesics. Uses evolving targets to avoid trajectory collapse.

entry.title: SSL: Sweet Spot Learning for Differentiated Guidance in Agentic Optimization

author.name: Jinyang Wu and Changpeng Yang and Yuhao Shen and Fangzhi Xu and Bolin Ni and Chonghua Liao and Yuchen Liu and Hongzhen Wang and Shuai Nie and Shuai Zhang and Haoran Luo and Jiaming Xu

entry.summary: SSL (Sweet Spot Learning) provides tiered rewards for agent optimization, guiding policies toward optimal 'sweet spot' region of solution space instead of binary rewards.

entry.title: Action-Sufficient Goal Representations

author.name: Jinu Hyeon, Woobin Park, Hongjoon Ahn, and Taesup Moon

entry.summary: Proposes action-sufficient goal representations for hierarchical offline GCRL. Shows value-sufficient representations can collapse goals that need differentiation for action learning.

entry.title: DNA: Uncovering Universal Latent Forgery Knowledge

author.name: Jingtong Dou, Chuancheng Shi, Yemin Wang, Shiming Guo, Anqi Yi, Wenhua Wu, Li Zhang, Fei Shen, Tat-Seng Chua

entry.summary: DNA framework for forgery detection uses coarse-to-fine excavation of pretrained models, showing forgery detection is encoded in existing models rather than requiring end-to-end retraining.

entry.title: Corrected Samplers for Discrete Flow Models

author.name: Zhengyan Wan, Yidong Ouyang, Liyan Xie, Fang Fang, Hongyuan Zha, Guang Cheng

entry.summary: Establishes non-asymptotic error bounds for discrete flow model samplers without boundedness restrictions. Introduces corrected samplers with reduced discretization error and faster convergence.

entry.title: SHED Light on Segmentation for Dense Prediction

author.name: Seung Hyun Lee, Sangwoo Mo, Stella X. Yu

entry.summary: SHED encoder-decoder architecture enforces geometric prior in dense prediction via hierarchical segment pooling/unpooling. Segmentation emerges without explicit supervision, improving depth boundary sharpness.

entry.title: Towards the Holographic Characteristic of LLMs for Efficient Short-text Generation

author.name: Shun Qian, Bingquan Liu, Chengjie Sun, Zhen Xu, Baoxun Wang

entry.summary: HOLO discovers 'Holographic Characteristic' of LLMs - models capture target-side keywords at generation start. Uses this to extract keywords and guide efficient short-text generation.

entry.title: EUGens: Efficient, Unified, and General Dense Layers

author.name: Sang Min Kim, Byeongchan Kim, Arijit Sehanobish, Somnath Basu Roy Chowdhury, Rahul Kidambi, Dongseok Shim, Avinava Dubey, Snigdha Chaturvedi, Min-hwan Oh, Krzysztof Choromanski

entry.summary: Proposes EUGens, a new class of dense neural network layers that use random features to reduce inference complexity from quadratic to linear time while incorporating input norm dependence. The approach unifies existing efficient feedforward layer extensions.

entry.title: SYMPHONY: Synergistic Multi-agent Planning with Heterogeneous Language Model Assembly

author.name: Wei Zhu, Zhiwen Tang, Kun Yue

entry.summary: SYMPHONY uses heterogeneous language model-based agents in a multi-agent planning framework with MCTS to improve exploration diversity and planning performance.

entry.title: Beyond Fixed Rounds: Data-Free Early Stopping for Practical Federated Learning

author.name: Youngjoon Lee, Hyukjoon Lee, Seungrok Jung, Andy Luo, Jinu Gong, Yang Cao, Joonhyuk Kang

entry.summary: Proposes data-free early stopping for federated learning by monitoring task vector growth rate using only server-side parameters, avoiding validation data requirements.

entry.title: OOVDet: Low-Density Prior Learning for Zero-Shot Out-of-Vocabulary Object Detection

author.name: Binyi Su, Chenghao Huang, Haiyong Chen

entry.summary: OOVDet addresses zero-shot out-of-vocabulary detection by synthesizing region-level OOV prompts from low-likelihood regions in text embedding space to prevent misclassifying undefined objects.

entry.title: OpenVTON-Bench: A Large-Scale High-Resolution Benchmark for Controllable Virtual Try-On Evaluation

author.name: Jin Li, Tao Chen, Shuai Jiang, Weijie Wang, Jingwen Luo, Chenhui Wu

entry.summary: OpenVTON-Bench provides ~100K high-resolution image pairs (up to 1536x1536) for virtual try-on evaluation with DINOv3 clustering and Gemini-powered captioning. Covers 20 fine-grained garment categories with multi-modal evaluation protocol.

entry.title: GRANITE: A Generalized Regional Framework for Identifying Agreement in Feature-Based Explanations

author.name: Julia Herbinger, Gabriel Laberge, Maximilian Muschalik, Yann Pequignot, Marvin N. Wright, Fabian Fumagalli

entry.summary: GRANITE provides a generalized regional explanation framework that partitions feature space to minimize interaction and distribution influences, aligning different explanation methods for more consistent interpretability.

entry.title: Robust Rigid Body Assembly via Contact-Implicit Optimal Control with Exact Second-Order Derivatives

author.name: Christian Dietz, Sebastian Albrecht, Gianluca Frison, Moritz Diehl, Armin Nurkanovi\'c

entry.summary: Proposes sample-efficient robust optimal control for robotic assembly using differentiable physics simulation with second-order analytic derivatives. Combines informative gradients with accurate contact simulation.

entry.title: OptiMAG: Structure-Semantic Alignment via Unbalanced Optimal Transport

author.name: Yilong Zuo, Xunkai Li, Zhihan Zhang, Qiangqiang Dai, Ronghua Li, Guoren Wang

entry.summary: Proposes OptiMAG, an unbalanced optimal transport framework to address discrepancies between semantic structure and explicit graph structure in multimodal attributed graphs. The method regularizes node representation learning by aligning modality-specific embeddings with graph topology.

entry.title: Multi-Cue Anomaly Detection and Localization under Data Contamination

author.name: Anindya Sundar Das and Monowar Bhuyan

entry.summary: Proposes robust anomaly detection framework for real-world industrial settings with contaminated training data and access to some labeled anomalies. Addresses both data contamination and leveraging partial anomaly labels.

entry.title: OneFlowSBI: One Model, Many Queries for Simulation-Based Inference

author.name: Mayank Nautiyal, Li Ju, Melker Ernfors, Klara Hagland, Ville Holma, Maximilian Werk\"o S\"oderholm, Andreas Hellander, Prashant Singh

entry.summary: Introduces OneFlowSBI, unified framework for simulation-based inference learning joint distribution over parameters and observations. Single model supports posterior sampling, likelihood estimation, and arbitrary conditionals.

entry.title: EAG-PT: Emission-Aware Gaussians and Path Tracing for Indoor Scene Reconstruction and Editing

author.name: Xijie Yang, Mulin Yu, Changjian Jiang, Kerui Ren, Tao Lu, Jiangmiao Pang, Dahua Lin, Bo Dai, Linning Xu

entry.summary: Introduces EAG-PT combining 2D Gaussians with path tracing for physically-based indoor scene reconstruction and editing. Enables correct light transport while avoiding mesh reconstruction bottlenecks.

entry.title: RN-D: Discretized Categorical Actors with Regularized Networks for On-Policy Reinforcement Learning

author.name: Yuexin Bian, Jie Feng, Tao Wang, Yijiang Li, Sicun Gao, Yuanyuan Shi

entry.summary: Revisits policy representation for on-policy RL, proposing discretized categorical actors with regularized networks. Shows simple replacement of standard actor network improves continuous control.

entry.title: Rethinking Transferable Adversarial Attacks on Point Clouds from a Compact Subspace Perspective

author.name: Keke Tang, Xianheng Liu, Weilong Peng, Xiaofei Wang, Daizong Liu, Peican Zhu, Can Lu, and Zhihong Tian

entry.summary: Proposes CoSA for transferable adversarial attacks on point clouds using compact subspace perspective. Represents point clouds as class-specific prototypes and optimizes perturbations in low-rank subspace.

entry.title: Manifold-Aware Perturbations for Constrained Generative Modeling

author.name: Katherine Keegan, Lars Ruthotto

entry.summary: Develops constraint-aware perturbation method for generative models on equality-constrained domains. Perturbs data distribution while preserving manifold geometry.

entry.title: Hi-Light: A Path to high-fidelity, high-resolution video relighting with a Novel Evaluation Paradigm

author.name: Xiangrui Liu, Haoxiang Li, Yezhou Yang

entry.summary: Introduces Hi-Light, a training-free framework for high-fidelity video relighting with lightness prior anchoring, motion-adaptive smoothing, and LAB-based detail fusion.

entry.title: Ensuring Semantics in Weights of Implicit Neural Representations through the Implicit Function Theorem

author.name: Tianming Qiu, Christos Sonis, Hao Shen

entry.summary: Uses Implicit Function Theorem to establish rigorous mapping between data space and INR weight representation space. Analyzes hypernetwork framework for mapping embeddings to INR weights.

entry.title: Scale-Cascaded Diffusion Models for Super-Resolution in Medical Imaging

author.name: Darshan Thaker, Mahmoud Mostapha, Radu Miron, Shihan Qiu, Mariappan Nadar

entry.summary: Proposes scale-cascaded diffusion for medical image super-resolution decomposing images into Laplacian pyramid scales with separate priors per frequency band.

entry.title: High-quality generation of dynamic game content via small language models: A proof of concept

author.name: Morten I. K. Munk, Arturo Valdivia, Paolo Burelli

entry.summary: Proposes strategy for high-quality SLM generation through aggressive fine-tuning on deliberately scoped tasks with narrow context. Uses DAG-based synthetic data generation for game content.

entry.title: Learning Policy Representations for Steerable Behavior Synthesis

author.name: Beiming Li, Sergio Rozada, Alejandro Ribeiro

entry.summary: Learns policy representations as expectations of state-action feature maps for behavior steering at test time. Uses variational generative approach with contrastive learning to shape latent space for smooth behavior interpolation.

entry.title: Bonnet: Ultra-fast whole-body bone segmentation from CT scans

author.name: Hanjiang Zhu, Pedro Martelleto Rezende, Zhang Yang, Tong Ye, Bruce Z. Gao, Feng Luo, Siyu Huang, Jiancheng Yang

entry.summary: Bonnet achieves ultra-fast whole-body bone segmentation from CT scans in 2.69 seconds using sparse convolutions and HU-based preprocessing, compared to minutes for existing methods like nnU-Net.

entry.title: Task-Aware LLM Council with Adaptive Decision Pathways for Decision Support

author.name: Wei Zhu, Lixing Yu, Hao-Ren Yao, Zhiwen Tang, Kun Yue

entry.summary: TALC integrates multiple LLMs with Monte Carlo Tree Search using structured success memory profiles for semantic matching, enabling dynamic expert selection based on task characteristics.

entry.title: StreamSense: Streaming Social Task Detection with Selective Vision-Language Model Routing

author.name: Han Wang, Deyi Ji, Lanyun Zhu, Jiebo Luo, Roy Ka-Wei Lee

entry.summary: StreamSense couples lightweight streaming encoders with selective VLM routing for real-time social signal detection in live streams. Uses cross-modal contrastive learning and IoU-weighted loss for robust boundary handling.

entry.title: CALM: Joint Contextual Acoustic-Linguistic Modeling for Personalization of Multi-Speaker ASR

author.name: Muhammad Shakeel, Yosuke Fukumoto, Chikara Maeda, Chyi-Jiunn Lin, Shinji Watanabe

entry.summary: CALM jointly models target-speaker extraction and contextual biasing for multi-speaker ASR. Integrates speaker embedding-driven extraction with dynamic vocabulary-based biasing in end-to-end framework.

entry.title: Q-Hawkeye: Reliable Visual Policy Optimization for Image Quality Assessment

author.name: Wulin Xie, Rui Dai, Ruidong Ding, Kaikui Liu, Xiangxiang Chu, Xinwen Hou, Jie Wen

entry.summary: Proposes Q-Hawkeye for image quality assessment using RL with uncertainty-aware dynamic optimization and visual perception enhancement. Addresses stability variation across samples and visual perception limitations.

entry.title: Self-Supervised Slice-to-Volume Reconstruction with Gaussian Representations for Fetal MRI

author.name: Yinsong Wang, Thomas Fletcher, Xinzhe Luo, Aine Travers Dineen, Rhodri Cusack, Chen Qin

entry.summary: Proposes GaussianSVR for self-supervised fetal MRI slice-to-volume reconstruction using 3D Gaussian representations. Alleviates need for ground truth through simulated forward acquisition model.

entry.title: Adaptive Benign Overfitting (ABO): Overparameterized RLS for Online Learning in Non-stationary Time-series

author.name: Luis Ontaneda Mijares and Nick Firoozye

entry.summary: Introduces Adaptive Benign Overfitting extending recursive least squares to overparameterized regime with QR-based numerical stability for non-stationary time series.

entry.title: Is Hierarchical Quantization Essential for Optimal Reconstruction?

author.name: Shirin Reyhanian, Laurenz Wiskott

entry.summary: Questions whether hierarchical VQ-VAE architectures are necessary for optimal reconstruction, suggesting single-level models with proper training may suffice.

entry.title: FlowSymm: Physics Aware, Symmetry Preserving Graph Attention for Network Flow Completion

author.name: Ege Demirci, Francesco Bullo, Ananthram Swami, Ambuj Singh

entry.summary: FlowSymm recovers missing network flows while exactly respecting conservation laws using group-action on divergence-free flows with graph attention. Combines physics constraints with learned representations.

entry.title: Continual Policy Distillation from Distributed Reinforcement Learning Teachers

author.name: Yuxuan Li, Qijun He, Mingqi Yuan, Wen-Tse Chen, Jeff Schneider, Jiayu Chen

entry.summary: Teacher-student framework for continual RL that decouples single-task teacher training via distributed RL from continual distillation into central generalist model, addressing stability-plasticity dilemma.

entry.title: Gradual Fine-Tuning for Flow Matching Models

author.name: Gudrun Thorkelsdottir, Arindam Banerjee

entry.summary: Gradual Fine-Tuning (GFT) for flow matching models uses temperature-controlled intermediate objectives interpolating between pretrained and target drifts, avoiding erosion of pretraining gains.

entry.title: Variational Bayesian Flow Network for Graph Generation

author.name: Yida Xiong, Jiameng Chen, Xiuwen Gong, Jia Wu, Shirui Pan, Wenbin Hu

entry.summary: VBFN for graph generation performs variational lifting to joint Gaussian space, encoding node-edge coupling in generative geometry rather than relying on implicit network recovery.

entry.title: Training Beyond Convergence: Grokking nnU-Net for Glioma Segmentation in Sub-Saharan MRI

author.name: Mohtady Barakat, Omar Salah, Ahmed Yasser, Mostafa Ahmed, Zahirul Arief, Waleed Khan, Dong Zhang, Aondona Iorumbur, Confidence Raymond, Mohannad Barakat, Noha Magdy

entry.summary: Explores whether 'grokking' (late training jump from memorization to generalization) can improve medical image segmentation by training nnU-Net beyond convergence on Sub-Saharan African glioma data.

entry.title: Full-Graph vs. Mini-Batch Training: Comprehensive Analysis from a Batch Size and Fan-Out Size Perspective

author.name: Mengfan Liu, Da Zheng, Junwei Su, Chuan Wu

entry.summary: Comprehensive analysis comparing full-graph and mini-batch GNN training through batch size and fan-out size perspectives, characterizing model performance and computational efficiency tradeoffs.

entry.title: Approximating $f$-Divergences with Rank Statistics

author.name: Viktor Stein, Jos\'e Manuel de Frutos

entry.summary: Introduces rank-statistic approximation of f-divergences using distribution of ranks, avoiding density-ratio estimation. Proves monotonicity, lower-bound properties, and convergence rates. Extends to sliced version for high-dimensional data.

entry.title: Offline Reinforcement Learning of High-Quality Behaviors Under Robust Style Alignment

author.name: Mathieu Petitbois, R\'emy Portelas and Sylvain Lamprier

entry.summary: SCIQL combines offline goal-conditioned RL techniques with Gated Advantage Weighted Regression for learning style-conditioned policies. Addresses distribution shift and style-reward conflicts in offline RL.

entry.title: Calibrated Multivariate Distributional Regression with Pre-Rank Regularization

author.name: Aya Laajil, Elnura Zhalieva, Naomi Desobry, Souhaib Ben Taieb

entry.summary: Proposes regularization method enforcing multivariate calibration during training using pre-rank functions. Introduces PCA-based pre-rank for principled projection selection.

entry.title: Neural Backward Filtering Forward Guiding

author.name: Gefan Yang, Frank van der Meulen, Stefan Sommer

entry.summary: Presents Neural Backward Filtering Forward Guiding for inference in non-linear continuous stochastic processes on trees. Uses auxiliary linear-Gaussian processes to guide sampling toward high-likelihood regions.

entry.title: Avoiding Premature Collapse: Adaptive Annealing for Entropy-Regularized Structural Inference

author.name: Yizhi Liu

entry.summary: Identifies 'Premature Mode Collapse' as root cause of instability in differentiable matching layers using entropy-regularized optimal transport. Proposes adaptive annealing schedule based on thermodynamic speed limit analysis.

entry.title: HierLoc: Hyperbolic Entity Embeddings for Hierarchical Visual Geolocation

author.name: Hari Krishna Gadi, Daniel Matos, Hongyi Luo, Lu Liu, Yongliang Wang, Yanfeng Zhang, Liqiu Meng

entry.summary: Proposes HierLoc using hyperbolic embeddings for visual geolocation, aligning images to hierarchical geographic entities (country, region, city) through Geo-Weighted Hyperbolic contrastive learning.

entry.title: Regularisation in neural networks: a survey and empirical analysis of approaches

author.name: Christiaan P. Opperman, Anna S. Bosman, and Katherine M. Malan

entry.summary: Comprehensive survey of neural network regularization techniques including double descent theory. Proposes taxonomy and empirically investigates whether regularization always helps.

entry.title: JobResQA: A Benchmark for LLM Machine Reading Comprehension on Multilingual R\'esum\'es and JDs

author.name: Casimiro Pio Carrino, Paula Estrella, Rabih Zbib, Carlos Escolano, Jos\'e A. R. Fonollosa

entry.summary: Introduces JobResQA, multilingual QA benchmark for HR tasks with resumes and job descriptions. 581 QA pairs across 5 languages with three complexity levels.

entry.title: Region-Normalized DPO for Medical Image Segmentation under Noisy Judges

author.name: Hamza Kalisch, Constantin Seibold, Jens Kleesiek, Ken Herrmann, Frederic Jonske

entry.summary: Applies Direct Preference Optimization (DPO) to medical image segmentation using noisy quality control signals instead of ground truth labels. Introduces region-normalized DPO to handle biased preference pairs.

entry.title: Sequence Diffusion Model for Temporal Link Prediction in Continuous-Time Dynamic Graph

author.name: Nguyen Minh Duc and Viet Cuong Ta

entry.summary: Proposes SDG, a sequence-level diffusion framework for temporal link prediction in dynamic graphs. Unifies graph learning with generative denoising to capture uncertainty in future interactions.

entry.title: Graph Attention Network for Node Regression on Random Geometric Graphs with Erd\H{o}s--R\'enyi contamination

author.name: Somak Laha, Suqi Liu, Morgane Austern

entry.summary: Provides theoretical analysis showing GATs have provable advantages over non-attention GNNs for node regression under covariate and edge corruption. Analyzes random geometric graphs with Erdős-Rényi contamination.

entry.title: Nested Slice Sampling: Vectorized Nested Sampling for GPU-Accelerated Inference

author.name: David Yallup, Namu Kroupa, Will Handley

entry.summary: Introduces GPU-friendly Nested Slice Sampling (NSS) using vectorized Hit-and-Run for Bayesian inference. Provides near-optimal slice width rule for high-dimensional problems.

entry.title: IRL-DAL: Safe and Adaptive Trajectory Planning for Autonomous Driving via Energy-Guided Diffusion Models

author.name: Seyed Ahmad Hosseini Miangoleh, Amin Jalal Aghdasian, Farzaneh Abdollahi

entry.summary: Proposes IRL-DAL combining inverse RL with diffusion-based adaptive lookahead planning for autonomous vehicles. Integrates FSM imitation, IRL rewards, and learnable attention masks.

entry.title: Beyond Medical Chatbots: Meddollina and the Rise of Continuous Clinical Intelligence

author.name: Vaibhav Ram S. V. N. S, Swetanshu Agrawal, Samudra Banerjee, Abdul Muhsin

entry.summary: Argues that clinical reasoning requires 'Clinical Contextual Intelligence' beyond text generation, formalizing CCI as a distinct capability class requiring persistent context awareness and intent preservation.

entry.title: PEAR: Pixel-aligned Expressive humAn mesh Recovery

author.name: Jiahao Wu, Yunfei Liu, Lijian Lin, Ye Zhu, Lei Zhu, Jingyi Li, Yu Li

entry.summary: PEAR achieves fast, pixel-aligned expressive human mesh recovery with real-time SMPLX parameter inference, addressing slow inference, coarse poses, and misalignment issues in existing methods.

entry.title: Beauty and the Beast: Imperceptible Perturbations Against Diffusion-Based Face Swapping via Directional Attribute Editing

author.name: Yilong Huang, Songze Li

entry.summary: FaceDefense protects against diffusion-based face swapping using adversarial perturbations with a new diffusion loss and directional facial attribute editing for visual imperceptibility. Addresses the perturbation visibility vs protection effectiveness tradeoff.

entry.title: User-Adaptive Meta-Learning for Cold-Start Medication Recommendation with Uncertainty Filtering

author.name: Arya Hadizadeh Moghaddam, Mohsen Nayebi Kerdabadi, Dongjie Wang, Mei Liu, Zijun Yao

entry.summary: Proposes meta-learning framework for cold-start medication recommendation with uncertainty filtering. Uses medical knowledge graphs and adapts to individual patient characteristics with limited prescription history.

entry.title: Preference-based opponent shaping in differentiable games

author.name: Xinyu Qiao, Yudong Hu, Congying Han, Weiyan Wu, Tiande Guo

entry.summary: Proposes preference-based opponent shaping (PBOS) method for multi-agent games that models behavioral preferences like cooperation and competition to improve strategy learning generalization.

entry.title: Can AI Make Energy Retrofit Decisions? An Evaluation of Large Language Models

author.name: Lei Shu, Dong Zhao

entry.summary: Evaluates seven major LLMs on residential building energy retrofit decisions, assessing accuracy, consistency, sensitivity, and reasoning across 400 homes in 49 US states.

entry.title: astra-langchain4j: Experiences Combining LLMs and Agent Programming

author.name: Rem Collier, Katharine Beaumont, Andrei Ciortea

entry.summary: Presents prototype LLM integration for the ASTRA agent programming language, exploring how traditional agent toolkits can interact with generative AI.

entry.title: SCENE: Semantic-aware Codec Enhancement with Neural Embeddings

author.name: Han-Yu Lin, Li-Wei Chen, Hung-Shin Lee

entry.summary: Proposes lightweight semantic-aware pre-processing framework for video compression that uses vision-language model embeddings to preserve perceptually significant structures.

entry.title: ParalESN: Enabling parallel information processing in Reservoir Computing

author.name: Matteo Pinna, Giacomo Lagomarsini, Andrea Ceni, Claudio Gallicchio

entry.summary: ParalESN enables parallel processing for Reservoir Computing by using diagonal linear recurrence in complex space, addressing scalability constraints from sequential processing and high memory requirements. Preserves Echo State Property while enabling efficient parallel computation.

entry.title: Word-Centered Semantic Graphs for Interpretable Diachronic Sense Tracking

author.name: Imene Kolli, Kai-Robin Lange, Jonas Rieger, Carsten Jentsch

entry.summary: Graph-based framework for analyzing semantic shift using word-centered semantic networks combining distributional similarity from Skip-gram with substitutability from masked LMs. Tracks sense changes through cluster composition.

entry.title: Does My Chatbot Have an Agenda? Understanding Human and AI Agency in Human-Human-like Chatbot Interaction

author.name: Bhada Yun, Evgenia Taranova, April Yi Wang

entry.summary: Month-long study of agency in human-AI chatrooms finds agency is emergent and co-constructed turn-by-turn. Introduces 3-by-5 framework for understanding human-AI agency dynamics.

entry.title: FraudShield: Knowledge Graph Empowered Defense for LLMs against Fraud Attacks

author.name: Naen Xu, Jinghuai Zhang, Ping He, Chunyi Zhou, Jun Wang, Zhihui Fu, Tianyu Du, Zhaoxiang Wang, Shouling Ji

entry.summary: FraudShield protects LLMs from fraud attacks using knowledge graph of fraud tactics and keywords. Constructs and refines fraud tactic-keyword associations for defense.

entry.title: DreamVAR: Taming Reinforced Visual Autoregressive Model for High-Fidelity Subject-Driven Image Generation

author.name: Xin Jiang, Jingwen Chen, Yehao Li, Yingwei Pan, Kezhou Chen, Zechao Li, Ting Yao, Tao Mei

entry.summary: DreamVAR applies Visual Autoregressive models to subject-driven image generation using pre-filled subject features before target prediction, exploring underutilized VAR potential for this task.

entry.title: CoVA: Text-Guided Composed Video Retrieval for Audio-Visual Content

author.name: Gyuwon Han, Young Kyun Jang, Chanho Eom

entry.summary: CoVA introduces composed video retrieval task accounting for both visual and auditory variations. Constructs AV-Comp benchmark and proposes AVT fusion method that selectively aligns query to most relevant modality.

entry.title: Neural-Inspired Posterior Approximation (NIPA)

author.name: Babak Shahbaba and Zahra Moslemi

entry.summary: Neural-inspired sampling algorithm (NIPA) combining model-based planning, model-free habitual responding, and episodic memory-based learning for scalable Bayesian inference.

entry.title: Leveraging Data to Say No: Memory Augmented Plug-and-Play Selective Prediction

author.name: Aditya Sarkar, Yi Li, Jiacheng Cheng, Shlok Mishra, Nuno Vasconcelos

entry.summary: Introduces training-free plug-and-play selective prediction for vision-language foundation models, using external embeddings like CLIP to enable reject options across closed-set to open-set tasks including image captioning.

entry.title: ExpAlign: Expectation-Guided Vision-Language Alignment for Open-Vocabulary Grounding

author.name: Junyi Hu, Tian Bai, Fengyi Wu, Wenyan Li, Zhenming Peng, Yi Zhang

entry.summary: ExpAlign uses principled multiple instance learning formulation for vision-language alignment with attention-based soft MIL pooling over token-region similarities for open-vocabulary grounding.

entry.title: Metric Hub: A metric library and practical selection workflow for use-case-driven data quality assessment in medical AI

author.name: Katinka Becker, Maximilian P. Oppelt, Tobias S. Zech, Martin Seyferth, Sandie Cabon, Vanja Miskovic, Ivan Cimrak, Michal Kozubek, Giuseppe D'Avenio, Ilaria Campioni, Jana Fehr, Kanjar De, Ismail Mahmoudi, Emilio Dolgener Cantu, Laurenz Ottmann, Andreas Kla{\ss}, Galaad Altares, Jackie Ma, Alireza Salehi M., Nadine R. Lang-Richter, Tobias Schaeffter, Daniel Schwabe

entry.summary: Presents METRIC Hub, a library of data quality metrics for evaluating medical AI training and testing data, operationalizing a theoretical framework for fit-for-purpose data assessment. Aims to support regulatory approval and clinical trustworthiness.

entry.title: How Far Can Pretrained LLMs Go in Symbolic Music? Controlled Comparisons of Supervised and Preference-based Adaptation

author.name: Deepak Kumar, Emmanouil Karystinaios, Gerhard Widmer, Markus Schedl

entry.summary: Controlled comparative study of finetuning strategies for symbolic music using pretrained LLMs, comparing instruction-tuned backbones, domain-adapted variants, and music-specialized baselines across ABC-based generation and understanding.

entry.title: FarmMind: Reasoning-Query-Driven Dynamic Segmentation for Farmland Remote Sensing Images

author.name: Haiyang Wu, Weiliang Mu, Jipeng Zhang, Zhong Dandan, Zhuofei Du, Haifeng Li, Tao Chao

entry.summary: FarmMind proposes reasoning-query-driven dynamic segmentation for farmland remote sensing that actively queries auxiliary images for cross-verification in ambiguous cases, mimicking human expert interpretation.

entry.title: Degradation-Aware Frequency Regulation of a Heterogeneous Battery Fleet via Reinforcement Learning

author.name: Tanay Raghunandan Srinivasa, Vivek Deulkar, Jia Bhargava, Mohammad Hajiesmaili, Prashant Shenoy

entry.summary: Addresses real-time scheduling of heterogeneous battery fleets for grid frequency regulation while minimizing cycling degradation. Uses reinforcement learning to handle the non-Markovian nature of rainflow cycle counting for battery degradation.

entry.title: Uncertainty-Aware Extrapolation in Bayesian Oblique Trees

author.name: Viktor Andonovikj and Sa\v{s}o D\v{z}eroski and Pavle Bo\v{s}koski

entry.summary: Extends Bayesian oblique decision trees with Gaussian Process leaf predictors for principled extrapolation beyond training target range. Addresses calibration and extrapolation limitations of standard decision trees.

entry.title: Benchmarking Machine Translation on Chinese Social Media Texts

author.name: Kaiyan Zhao, Zheyong Xie, Zhongtao Miao, Xinze Lyu, Yao Hu, Shaosheng Cao

entry.summary: Introduces CSM-MTBench for benchmarking machine translation on Chinese social media with slang, neologisms, and stylized expressions. Includes Fun Posts and News Parody subsets.

entry.title: WiFiPenTester: Advancing Wireless Ethical Hacking with Governed GenAI

author.name: Haitham S. Al-Sinani and Chris J. Mitchell

entry.summary: Proposes WiFiPenTester integrating LLMs into wireless security assessment for target ranking, attack feasibility estimation, and strategy recommendation while maintaining human oversight.

entry.title: Securing Time in Energy IoT: A Clock-Dynamics-Aware Spatio-Temporal Graph Attention Network for Clock Drift Attacks and Y2K38 Failures

author.name: Saeid Jamshidi, Omar Abdul Wahab, Rolando Herrero and Foutse Khomh

entry.summary: Introduces STGAT framework for detecting clock drift attacks and Y2K38 failures in energy IoT systems. Combines drift-aware temporal embeddings with graph attention.

entry.title: Stochastic Linear Bandits with Parameter Noise

author.name: Daniel Ezer, Alon Peled-Cohen, Yishay Mansour

entry.summary: Studies stochastic linear bandits with parameter noise where reward parameter is sampled i.i.d. Provides tight regret bounds for general and specific action sets.

entry.title: Dynamic Welfare-Maximizing Pooled Testing

author.name: Nicholas Lopez, Francisco Marmolejo-Coss\'io, Jose Roberto Tello Ayala, David C. Parkes

entry.summary: Studies dynamic welfare-maximizing pooled testing with limited sequential tests. Extends classical pooled testing literature from full diagnosis to welfare maximization under resource constraints.

entry.title: Heterogeneous Graph Alignment for Joint Reasoning and Interpretability

author.name: Zahra Moslemi, Ziyi Liang, Norbert Fortin, Babak Shahbaba

entry.summary: MGMT is a unified framework for cross-graph learning that uses Graph Transformer encoders, attention-based supernode selection, and meta-graph construction for joint reasoning across heterogeneous graphs.

entry.title: PEFT-MuTS: A Multivariate Parameter-Efficient Fine-Tuning Framework for Remaining Useful Life Prediction based on Cross-domain Time Series Representation Model

author.name: En Fu, Yanyan Hu, Changhua Hu, Zengwang Jin, Kaixiang Peng

entry.summary: PEFT-MuTS applies parameter-efficient fine-tuning to cross-domain pre-trained time-series models for few-shot remaining useful life prediction, challenging assumptions about transfer learning scope.

entry.title: Models Know Models Best: Evaluation via Model-Preferred Formats

author.name: Joonhak Lee, Sungmok Jung, Jongyeon Park, and Jaejin Lee

entry.summary: Shows LLM performance on multiple-choice tasks varies systematically by format (symbol vs cloze), proposes dynamic format-alignment using classifier trained on model-preference signals.

entry.title: Qualitative Evaluation of LLM-Designed GUI

author.name: Bartosz Sawicki, Tomasz Les, Dariusz Parzych, Aleksandra Wycisk-Ficek, Pawel Trebacz, Pawel Zawadzki

entry.summary: Evaluates GUI mockups generated by GPT o3-mini-high, DeepSeek R1, and Claude 3.5 Sonnet across three interface types. Finds LLMs effective at structured layouts but challenged by accessibility and interactivity.

entry.title: Unconditional flow-based time series generation with equivariance-regularised latent spaces

author.name: Camilo Carvajal Reyes and Felipe Tobar

entry.summary: Proposes latent flow-matching for time-series generation with explicit equivariance regularization for translation and amplitude scaling. Fine-tunes autoencoder latent spaces to enforce consistency under transformations.

entry.title: Synthetic Time Series Generation via Complex Networks

author.name: Jaime Vale and Vanessa Freitas Silva and Maria Eduarda Silva and Fernando Silva

entry.summary: Proposes framework for synthetic time series generation using complex networks, specifically Quantile Graphs with inverse mapping. Evaluates whether reconstructed data preserves statistical and structural properties of originals.

entry.title: Leveraging Multi-Rater Annotations to Calibrate Object Detectors in Microscopy Imaging

author.name: Francesco Campi, Lucrezia Tondo, Ekin Karabati, Johannes Betge, Marie Piraud

entry.summary: Proposes using multi-rater annotations to improve object detector calibration in microscopy by training separate models per expert and aggregating predictions.

entry.title: It's all the (Exponential) Family: An Equivalence between Maximum Likelihood Estimation and Control Variates for Sketching Algorithms

author.name: Keegan Kang, Kerong Wang, Ding Zhang, Rameshwar Pratap, Bhisham Dev Verma, Benedict H.W. Wong

entry.summary: Proves optimal control variate estimators achieve same asymptotic variance as MLE under exponential family conditions, providing EM algorithm interpretation. Shows EM algorithm is faster and more stable than root-finding for MLE.

entry.title: An Efficient Algorithm for Thresholding Monte Carlo Tree Search

author.name: Shoma Nameki (1), Atsuyoshi Nakamura (2), Junpei Komiyama (3 and 4), Koji Tabata (5) ((1) Graduate School of Information Science and Technology, Hokkaido University, (2) Faculty of Information Science and Technology, Hokkaido University, (3) Mohamed bin Zayed University of Artificial Intelligence (MBZUAI), (4) RIKEN AIP, (5) Research Institute for Electronic Science, Hokkaido University)

entry.summary: Develops a δ-correct sequential sampling algorithm for Thresholding Monte Carlo Tree Search with asymptotically optimal sample complexity using Track-and-Stop strategy.

entry.title: Neural Clothing Tryer: Customized Virtual Try-On via Semantic Enhancement and Controlling Diffusion Model

author.name: Zhijing Yang, Weiwei Zhang, Mingliang Yang, Siyuan Peng, Yukai Shi, Junpeng Tan, Tianshui Chen and Liruo Zhong

entry.summary: NCT enables customized virtual try-on with diffusion models, allowing customization of model appearance, posture, and attributes while preserving garment details through semantic enhancement and controlling modules.

entry.title: Toward Fully Autonomous Driving: AI, Challenges, Opportunities, and Needs

author.name: Lars Ullrich, Michael Buchholz, Klaus Dietmayer, and Knut Graichen

entry.summary: Survey analyzing AI challenges and opportunities for fully autonomous driving, examining limitations and foreseeable technological possibilities including safety and transferability concerns.

entry.title: Leveraging Convolutional Sparse Autoencoders for Robust Movement Classification from Low-Density sEMG

author.name: Blagoj Hristov, Zoran Hadzi-Velkov, Katerina Hadzi-Velkova Saneva, Gorjan Nadzinski, Vesna Ojleska Latkoska

entry.summary: Proposes convolutional sparse autoencoder for gesture recognition from only 2 sEMG channels, achieving 94.3% F1-score with few-shot transfer learning for new subjects.

entry.title: Revealed Multi-Objective Utility Aggregation in Human Driving

author.name: Atrisha Sarkar, Kate Larson, Krzysztof Czarnecki

entry.summary: Develops algorithms for estimating multi-objective utility aggregation parameters in human driving using game theory, addressing challenges from unobservable factors and bounded rationality.

entry.title: Application of discrete Ricci curvature in pruning randomly wired neural networks: A case study with chest x-ray classification of COVID-19

author.name: Pavithra Elumalai, Sudharsan Vijayaraghavan, Madhumita Mondal, Areejit Samal

entry.summary: Investigates Ricci curvature measures for pruning randomly wired neural networks, demonstrating effectiveness for COVID-19 chest x-ray classification.

entry.title: Reg-TTR, Test-Time Refinement for Fast, Robust and Accurate Image Registration

author.name: Lin Chen, Yue He, Fengting Zhang, Yaonan Wang, Fengming Lin, Xiang Chen, Min Liu

entry.summary: Proposes Reg-TTR test-time refinement framework combining deep learning with conventional registration techniques, achieving improved accuracy with only 21% additional inference time.

entry.title: Screen, Match, and Cache: A Training-Free Causality-Consistent Reference Frame Framework for Human Animation

author.name: Jianan Wang, Nailei Hei, Li He, Huanzhen Wang, Aoxing Li, Haofen Wang, Yan Wang, Wenqiang Zhang

entry.summary: Proposes FrameCache, a training-free three-stage framework for human animation that maintains temporal coherence through quality-aware frame selection and motion-consistent reference matching.

entry.title: ShellForge: Adversarial Co-Evolution of Webshell Generation and Multi-View Detection for Robust Webshell Defense

author.name: Yizhong Ding

entry.summary: Introduces ShellForge, an adversarial co-evolution framework coupling automated webshell generation with multi-view detection to harden defensive boundaries.

entry.title: A Survey on Semantic Communication for Vision: Categories, Frameworks, Enabling Techniques, and Applications

author.name: Runze Cheng, Yao Sun, Ahmad Taha, Xuesong Liu, David Flynn, and Muhammad Ali Imran

entry.summary: Systematic survey of semantic communication for visual data transmission, analyzing challenges in semantic quantization, extraction, and adaptation to wireless environments.

entry.title: What Lies Beneath: A Call for Distribution-based Visual Question & Answer Datasets

author.name: Jill P. Naiman, Daniel J. Evans, JooYoung Seo

entry.summary: Argues for VQA datasets that include underlying data distributions rather than assuming 1-to-1 correspondence between chart marks and data points.

entry.title: Aligning Microscopic Vehicle and Macroscopic Traffic Statistics: Reconstructing Driving Behavior from Partial Data

author.name: Zhihao Zhang, Keith Redmill, Chengyang Peng, Bowen Weng

entry.summary: Proposes framework to reconstruct human driving behavior from partial traffic data by aligning microscopic vehicle data with macroscopic statistics.

entry.title: Spatially-Adaptive Conformal Graph Transformer for Indoor Localization in Wi-Fi Driven Networks

author.name: Ayesh Abu Lehyeh, Anastassia Gharib, Safwan Wshah

entry.summary: SAC-GT combines Graph Transformer for indoor localization with spatially-adaptive conformal prediction for region-specific uncertainty quantification. Captures Wi-Fi network topology and signal dynamics with calibrated prediction sets.

entry.title: EMBC Special Issue: Calibrated Uncertainty for Trustworthy Clinical Gait Analysis Using Probabilistic Multiview Markerless Motion Capture

author.name: Seth Donahue, Irina Djuraskovic, Kunal Shah, Fabian Sinz, Ross Chafetz, R.James Cotton

entry.summary: Evaluates calibration of probabilistic markerless motion capture for clinical gait analysis. Validates against instrumented walkway and marker-based capture across 68 participants at two institutions.

entry.title: Stop Jostling: Adaptive Negative Sampling Reduces the Marginalization of Low-Resource Language Tokens by Cross-Entropy Loss

author.name: Galim Turumtaev

entry.summary: Proposes adaptive negative sampling to reduce marginalization of rare tokens in low-resource languages during cross-entropy training. Thresholding technique allows rare tokens to learn more effectively.

entry.title: Controllable Information Production

author.name: Tristan Shah and Stas Tiomkin

entry.summary: Introduces Controllable Information Production (CIP), an intrinsic motivation principle derived from optimal control. CIP is the gap between open-loop and closed-loop Kolmogorov-Sinai entropies, rewarding both pursuit and regulation of chaos.

entry.title: PromptMAD: Cross-Modal Prompting for Multi-Class Visual Anomaly Localization

author.name: Duncan McCain, Hossein Kashiani, Fatemeh Afghah

entry.summary: PromptMAD uses cross-modal prompting with CLIP-encoded text for unsupervised visual anomaly detection, integrating semantic guidance through vision-language alignment with Focal loss for pixel-level class imbalance.

entry.title: Keep Rehearsing and Refining: Lifelong Learning Vehicle Routing under Continually Drifting Tasks

author.name: Jiyuan Pei, Yi Mei, Jialin Liu, Mengjie Zhang, Xin Yao

entry.summary: DREE addresses lifelong learning for vehicle routing under continually drifting tasks with limited training per task. Uses dual replay with experience enhancement to improve efficiency and mitigate forgetting.

entry.title: FedDis: A Causal Disentanglement Framework for Federated Traffic Prediction

author.name: Chengyang Zhou, Zijian Zhang, Chunxu Zhang, Hao Miao, Yulin Zhang, Kedi Lyu, Juncheng Hu

entry.summary: FedDis introduces causal disentanglement for federated traffic prediction, separating client-specific local dynamics from cross-client global patterns to address non-IID data challenges.

entry.title: TTSA3R: Training-Free Temporal-Spatial Adaptive Persistent State for Streaming 3D Reconstruction

author.name: Zhijie Zheng, Xinhao Xiang, Jiawei Zhang

entry.summary: TTSA3R proposes training-free temporal-spatial adaptive state updates for streaming 3D reconstruction, addressing catastrophic memory forgetting over long sequences.

entry.title: Human-Centered Explainability in AI-Enhanced UI Security Interfaces: Designing Trustworthy Copilots for Cybersecurity Analysts

author.name: Mona Rajhans

entry.summary: Presents a user study on explanation design in AI-driven security dashboards, comparing natural language, feature attribution, and case-based explanations for cybersecurity analysts.

entry.title: A Cross-Domain Graph Learning Protocol for Single-Step Molecular Geometry Refinement

author.name: Chengchun Liu, Wendi Cai, Boxuan Zhao, Fanyang Mo

entry.summary: GeoOpt-Net uses SE(3)-equivariant graph neural networks to predict DFT-quality molecular geometries in a single forward pass from low-cost initial conformers. Employs two-stage training with fidelity-aware feature modulation.

entry.title: Toward IIT-Inspired Consciousness in LLMs: A Reward-Based Learning Framework

author.name: Hamid Reza Akbari, Mohammad Hossein Sameti, Amir M. Mansourian, Mohammad Hossein Rohban, Hossein Sameti

entry.summary: Investigates implementing Integrated Information Theory (IIT) concepts in LLMs via reward-based learning, creating reward functions quantifying text causality, coherence, and integration as proxies for conscious-like processing.

entry.title: Bayesian Interpolating Neural Network (B-INN): a scalable and reliable Bayesian model for large-scale physical systems

author.name: Chanwook Park, Brian Kim, Jiachen Guo, Wing Kam Liu

entry.summary: Proposes Bayesian Interpolating Neural Network (B-INN) combining high-order interpolation with tensor decomposition for scalable uncertainty quantification in large-scale physical systems. Enables effective dimensionality reduction while maintaining accuracy.

entry.title: Leveraging LLMs For Turkish Skill Extraction

author.name: Ezgi Arslan \.Ilt\"uzer, \"Ozg\"ur An{\i}l \"Ozl\"u, Vahid Farajijobehdar, G\"ul\c{s}en Eryi\u{g}it

entry.summary: Investigates LLM-based skill extraction for Turkish, a low-resource morphologically complex language. Compares different LLMs and prompting strategies including dynamic vs. static few-shot samples.

entry.title: Improving Supervised Machine Learning Performance in Optical Quality Control via Generative AI for Dataset Expansion

author.name: Dennis Sprute and Hanna Senke and Holger Flatt

entry.summary: Explores generative AI for expanding limited datasets in industrial quality control, addressing class imbalance where defective parts are rare.

entry.title: Adaptive Edge Learning for Density-Aware Graph Generation

author.name: Seyedeh Ava Razi Razavi, James Sargant, Sheridan Houghten, Renata Dividino

entry.summary: Proposes density-aware graph generation using WGANs with learnable distance-based edge predictor instead of random sampling. Embeds nodes in latent space where proximity correlates with edge likelihood.

entry.title: On the Impact of Code Comments for Automated Bug-Fixing: An Empirical Study

author.name: Antonio Vitale, Emanuela Guglielmi, Simone Scalabrino and Rocco Oliveto

entry.summary: Empirical study on whether code comments help LLMs with automated bug fixing. Investigates impact of comments during training and inference across model families.

entry.title: Tackling air quality with SAPIENS

author.name: Marcella Bona and Nathan Heatley and Jia-Chen Hua and Adriana Lara and Valeria Legaria-Santiago and Alberto Luviano Juarez and Fernando Moreno-Gomez and Jocelyn Richardson and Natan Vilchis and Xiwen Shirley Zheng

entry.summary: Studies air quality prediction using traffic data from Mexico City. Proposes SAPIENS method for hyper-local air quality forecasts from traffic intensity.

entry.title: Optimal Fair Aggregation of Crowdsourced Noisy Labels using Demographic Parity Constraints

author.name: Gabriel Singer, Samuel Gruffaz, Olivier Vo Van, Nicolas Vayatis, Argyris Kalogeratos

entry.summary: Analyzes fairness guarantees for crowdsourced label aggregation under demographic parity constraints, deriving bounds for Majority Vote and Optimal Bayesian methods. Addresses an understudied problem in fair ML for the small-crowd regime.

entry.title: Agile Reinforcement Learning through Separable Neural Architecture

author.name: Rajib Mostakim and Reza T. Batley and Sourav Saha

entry.summary: Proposes SPAN, a spline-based separable architecture for deep RL that improves parameter efficiency over MLPs. Addresses computational overhead issues of Kolmogorov-Arnold Networks while maintaining efficiency gains.

entry.title: ShotFinder: Imagination-Driven Open-Domain Video Shot Retrieval via Web Search

author.name: Tao Yu, Haopeng Jin, Hao Wang, Shenghua Chai, Yujia Yang, Junhao Gong, Jiaming Guo, Minghui Zhang, Xinlong Chen, Zhenghao Zhang, Yuxuan Zhou, Yanpei Gong, YuanCheng Liu, Yiming Ding, Kangwei Zeng, Pengfei Yang, Zhongtian Luo, Yufei Xiong, Shanbin Zhang, Shaoxiong Cheng, Huang Ruilin, Li Shuo, Yuxi Niu, Xinyuan Zhang, Yueya Xu, Jie Mao, Ruixuan Ji, Yaru Zhao, Mingchen Zhang, Jiabing Yang, Jiaqi Liu, YiFan Zhang, Hongzhu Yi, Xinming Wang, Cheng Zhong, Xiao Ma, Zhang Zhang, Yan Huang, Liang Wang

entry.summary: Introduces ShotFinder benchmark for open-domain video shot retrieval with 1,210 samples across 20 categories. Defines five controllable constraints (temporal, color, style, audio, resolution) for evaluation.

entry.title: How well do generative models solve inverse problems? A benchmark study

author.name: Patrick Kr\"uger, Patrick Materne, Werner Krebs and Hanno Gottschalk

entry.summary: Benchmarks generative models (GANs, INNs, Flow Matching) against traditional Bayesian MCMC for inverse problems in gas turbine design. Proposes evaluation metrics for inverse design accuracy.

entry.title: Structured Over Scale: Learning Spatial Reasoning from Educational Video

author.name: Bishoy Galoaa, Xiangyu Bai, Sarah Ostadabbas

entry.summary: Creates DoraVQA dataset from Dora the Explorer episodes for training VLMs on spatial reasoning. Leverages pedagogical structure (context-question-pause-answer) as self-contained learning signal.

entry.title: End-to-end Optimization of Belief and Policy Learning in Shared Autonomy Paradigms

author.name: MH Farhadi, Ali Rabiee, Sima Ghafoori, Anna Cetera, Andrew Fisher, Reza Abiri

entry.summary: Introduces BRACE for shared autonomy combining Bayesian intent inference with context-adaptive assistance. Enables end-to-end gradient flow between intent inference and assistance arbitration.

entry.title: Situational Awareness is (mostly) here to stay

author.name: atharva

entry.summary: Argues that situational awareness in AI models is largely unavoidable beyond evaluation contexts, suggesting measurement is more practical than reduction. Brief analysis of the problem space.

entry.title: Scalable Batch Correction for Cell Painting via Batch-Dependent Kernels and Adaptive Sampling

author.name: Aditya Narayan Ravi, Snehal Vadvalkar, Abhishek Pandey, Ilan Shomorony

entry.summary: BALANS provides scalable batch correction for Cell Painting microscopy data using batch-dependent kernels and adaptive sampling. Constructs sparse affinity matrix to align samples across batches while preserving biological signal.

entry.title: Accurate Pedestrian Tracking in Urban Canyons: A Multi-Modal Fusion Approach

author.name: Shahar Dubiner, Peng Ren, and Roberto Manduchi

entry.summary: Particle filter-based fusion of GNSS and inertial data for pedestrian navigation in urban canyons, incorporating map priors for areas like buildings. Addresses GNSS limitations critical for blind/low-vision users.

entry.title: FOTBCD: A Large-Scale Building Change Detection Benchmark from French Orthophotos and Topographic Data

author.name: Abdelrrahman Moubane

entry.summary: FOTBCD is a large-scale building change detection dataset spanning 28 French departments with ~28,000 before/after image pairs from authoritative orthophotos and topographic data.

entry.title: UniGeo: A Unified 3D Indoor Object Detection Framework Integrating Geometry-Aware Learning and Dynamic Channel Gating

author.name: Xing Yi, Jinyang Huang, Feng-Qi Cui, Anyang Tong, Ruimin Wang, Liu Liu, and Dan Guo

entry.summary: UniGeo proposes a unified 3D indoor object detection framework with geometry-aware learning and dynamic channel gating for point cloud processing across multiple datasets.

entry.title: Generative and Nonparametric Approaches for Conditional Distribution Estimation: Methods, Perspectives, and Comparative Evaluations

author.name: Yen-Shiu Chin, Zhi-Yu Jou, Toshinari Morimoto, Chia-Tse Wang, Ming-Chung Chang, Tso-Jung Yen, Su-Yun Huang, and Tailen Hsing

entry.summary: Reviews and compares classical nonparametric methods and modern generative models for conditional distribution estimation, covering methods from 2005 to recent diffusion-based approaches.

entry.title: FlyAware: Inertia-Aware Aerial Manipulation via Vision-Based Estimation and Post-Grasp Adaptation

author.name: Biyu Ye, Na Fan, Zhengping Fan, Weiliang Deng, Hongming Chen, Qifeng Chen, and Ximin Lyu

entry.summary: FlyAware enables robust aerial manipulation through vision-based pre-grasp inertia estimation and post-grasp adaptation with gain-scheduled control for handling unknown payloads.

entry.title: UrbanMoE: A Sparse Multi-Modal Mixture-of-Experts Framework for Multi-Task Urban Region Profiling

author.name: Pingping Liu, Jiamiao Liu, Zijian Zhang, Hao Miao, Qi Jiang, Qingliang Li, Qiuzhan Zhou, Irwin King

entry.summary: UrbanMoE applies sparse Mixture-of-Experts to multi-task urban region profiling with multi-modal features. Establishes comprehensive benchmark for this domain with diverse baselines.

entry.title: Reinforcement Learning-Based Co-Design and Operation of Chiller and Thermal Energy Storage for Cost-Optimal HVAC Systems

author.name: Tanay Raghunandan Srinivasa, Vivek Deulkar, Aviruch Bhatia, Vishal Garg

entry.summary: Studies joint operation and sizing of HVAC cooling infrastructure using reinforcement learning to minimize 30-year life-cycle cost. Addresses asymmetry between chiller and thermal energy storage capital costs.

entry.title: Deep in the Jungle: Towards Automating Chimpanzee Population Estimation

author.name: Tom Raynes, Otto Brookes, Timm Haucke, Lukas B\"osch, Anne-Sophie Crunchant, Hjalmar K\"uhl, Sara Beery, Majid Mirmehdi, Tilo Burghardt

entry.summary: Evaluates monocular depth estimation for automated chimpanzee population estimation from camera trap videos. Combines Dense Prediction Transformers and Depth Anything with distance sampling strategies.

entry.title: Non-Intrusive Graph-Based Bot Detection for E-Commerce Using Inductive Graph Neural Networks

author.name: Sichen Zhao, Zhiming Xue, Yalun Qi, Xianling Zeng, and Zihan Yu

entry.summary: Proposes a non-intrusive graph neural network framework for bot detection in e-commerce that captures relational structure and behavioral semantics from user session behavior graphs.

entry.title: MCP-Diag: A Deterministic, Protocol-Driven Architecture for AI-Native Network Diagnostics

author.name: Devansh Lodha, Mohit Panchal, Sameer G. Kulkarni

entry.summary: MCP-Diag proposes a deterministic translation layer that converts network diagnostic CLI output to JSON schemas before LLM ingestion, with mandatory human-in-the-loop authorization for network operations.

entry.title: Beyond Abstract Compliance: Operationalising trust in AI as a moral relationship

author.name: Lameck Mbangula Amugongo and Tutaleni Asino and Nicola J Bidwell

entry.summary: Proposes expanded principles for AI trust drawing on relational ethics and African communitarian philosophies, framing trust as dynamic temporal relationship requiring participatory community engagement throughout AI lifecycle.

entry.title: Comparing How a Chatbot References User Utterances from Previous Chatting Sessions: An Investigation of Users' Privacy Concerns and Perceptions

author.name: Samuel Rhys Cox and Yi-Chieh Lee and Wei Tsang Ooi

entry.summary: Investigates how chatbots referencing previous conversations (verbatim vs paraphrase) affects user perceptions and privacy concerns through a 3-week longitudinal study with 169 participants.

entry.title: Pedestrian-Aware Motion Planning for Autonomous Driving in Complex Urban Scenarios

author.name: Korbinian Moller, Truls Nyberg, Jana Tumova, Johannes Betz

entry.summary: Introduces risk-aware motion planning algorithm combining social force principles for pedestrian simulation with a novel planner for autonomous vehicles in crowded urban scenarios.

entry.title: Deep Lightweight Unrolled Network for High Dynamic Range Modulo Imaging

author.name: Brayan Monroy and Jorge Bacca

entry.summary: Develops deep unrolled network for high dynamic range modulo imaging, formulating HDR reconstruction as an optimization problem with deep prior and lightweight denoiser.

entry.title: Practical Evaluation of Quantum Kernel Methods for Radar Micro-Doppler Classification on Noisy Intermediate-Scale Quantum (NISQ) Hardware

author.name: Vikas Agnihotri, Jasleen Kaur, Sarvagya Kaushik

entry.summary: Evaluates Quantum SVM for radar-based aerial target classification on actual NISQ hardware (IBM Torino/Fez), demonstrating competitive performance with classical SVM.

entry.title: ReloPush-BOSS: Optimization-guided Nonmonotone Rearrangement Planning for a Car-like Robot Pusher

author.name: Jeeho Ahn and Christoforos Mavrogiannis

entry.summary: Presents ReloPush-BOSS for multi-object rearrangement planning using car-like robot pushers in cluttered environments. Uses Dubins path classification to optimize prerelocations and avoid local minima in nonmonotone problem instances.

entry.title: Relative Wasserstein Angle and the Problem of the $W_2$-Nearest Gaussian Distribution

author.name: Binshuai Wang and Peng Wei

entry.summary: Studies quantifying deviation from Gaussianity using optimal transport, introducing relative Wasserstein angle and orthogonal projection distance. Proves moment-matching Gaussian is not the W2-nearest Gaussian.

entry.title: MetaLead: A Comprehensive Human-Curated Leaderboard Dataset for Transparent Reporting of Machine Learning Experiments

author.name: Roelien C. Timmer, Necva B\"ol\"uc\"u, Stephen Wan

entry.summary: MetaLead provides a human-annotated ML leaderboard dataset capturing all experimental results with rich metadata including experiment types (baseline, proposed, variation) and train/test separation. This enables more transparent and nuanced ML benchmarking.

entry.title: Toward Non-Expert Customized Congestion Control

author.name: Mingrui Zhang, Hamid Bagheri, Lisong Xu

entry.summary: NECC enables non-expert users to implement customized congestion control algorithms using LLMs and Berkeley Packet Filter interface. First to address customized CCA implementation problem.

entry.title: Training-Free Representation Guidance for Diffusion Models with a Representation Alignment Projector

author.name: Wenqiang Zu, Shenghao Xie, Bo Lei, Lei Ma

entry.summary: Training-free representation guidance for diffusion transformers. Identifies semantic drift in early denoising and introduces guidance strategy based on self-supervised visual representations.

entry.title: MIRRORTALK: Forging Personalized Avatars Via Disentangled Style and Hierarchical Motion Control

author.name: Renjie Lu, Xulong Zhang, Xiaoyang Qu, Jianzong Wang, Shangfei Wang

entry.summary: MirrorTalk generates personalized talking faces using diffusion model with Semantically-Disentangled Style Encoder to separate speaker style from semantic content, enabling faithful persona transfer.

entry.title: SCOPE-PD: Explainable AI on Subjective and Clinical Objective Measurements of Parkinson's Disease for Precision Decision-Making

author.name: Md Mezbahul Islam, John Michael Templeton, Masrur Sobhan, Christian Poellabauer, Ananda Mohan Mondal

entry.summary: SCOPE-PD integrates subjective and objective Parkinson's disease assessments with explainable AI for personalized risk estimation, addressing lack of interpretability in existing ML approaches.

entry.title: Learning to Defer in Non-Stationary Time Series via Switching State-Space Models

author.name: Yannis Montreuil, Letian Yu, Axel Carlier, Lai Xing Ng, Wei Tsang Ooi

entry.summary: L2D-SLDS models expert residuals using switching linear-Gaussian state-space model for learning-to-defer in non-stationary time series with partial feedback and varying expert availability.

entry.title: Detect and Act: Automated Dynamic Optimizer through Meta-Black-Box Optimization

author.name: Zijian Gao, Yuanting Zhong, Zeyuan Ma, Yue-Jiao Gong, Hongshu Guo

entry.summary: RL-assisted approach for automated variation detection and self-adaptation in evolutionary algorithms for dynamic optimization problems, using meta-black-box optimization framework.

entry.title: DELNet: Continuous All-in-One Weather Removal via Dynamic Expert Library

author.name: Shihong Liu, Kun Zuo, Hanguang Xiao

entry.summary: DELNet introduces continual learning for weather image restoration with a dynamic expert library that distinguishes new from known degradation tasks, enabling continuous optimization without retraining existing models.

entry.title: Local-Global Multimodal Contrastive Learning for Molecular Property Prediction

author.name: Xiayu Liu, Zhengyi Lu, Yunhong Liao, Chan Fan, Hou-biao Li

entry.summary: LGM-CL uses local-global multimodal contrastive learning to jointly model molecular graphs and chemical text representations for property prediction.

entry.title: Procedural Knowledge Extraction from Industrial Troubleshooting Guides Using Vision Language Models

author.name: Guillermo Gil de Avalle, Laura Maruster, Christos Emmanouilidis

entry.summary: Evaluates VLMs on extracting structured procedural knowledge from industrial troubleshooting flowcharts, comparing standard and augmented prompting strategies for operator support systems.

entry.title: Under-Canopy Terrain Reconstruction in Dense Forests Using RGB Imaging and Neural 3D Reconstruction

author.name: Refael Sheffer, Chen Pinchover, Haim Zisman, Dror Ozeri, Roee Litman

entry.summary: Demonstrates reconstruction of terrain hidden beneath forest canopies using only RGB images and Neural Radiance Fields (NeRF), eliminating the need for expensive LiDAR or thermal sensors. Provides specific capture guidelines for successful reconstruction.

entry.title: DC-LA: Difference-of-Convex Langevin Algorithm

author.name: Hoang Phuc Hau Luu and Zhongjian Wang

entry.summary: Studies sampling from distributions with difference-of-convex regularizers using Moreau envelopes to smooth the DC function. Establishes convergence bounds in q-Wasserstein distance.

entry.title: Machine Learning for Energy-Performance-aware Scheduling

author.name: Zheyuan Hu, Yifei Shi

entry.summary: Proposes Bayesian Optimization framework with Gaussian Processes for energy-performance scheduling on heterogeneous architectures. Uses sensitivity analysis for interpretability.

entry.title: WED-Net: A Weather-Effect Disentanglement Network with Causal Augmentation for Urban Flow Prediction

author.name: Qian Hong, Siyuan Chang, Xiao Zhou

entry.summary: WED-Net uses a dual-branch Transformer architecture to separate intrinsic and weather-induced traffic patterns for urban flow prediction under extreme weather conditions.

entry.title: RPWithPrior: Label Differential Privacy in Regression

author.name: Haixia Liu, Ruifan Huang

entry.summary: Proposes regression under label differential privacy using continuous distributions with prior information to overcome limitations of discretization-based methods.

entry.title: Compact Hypercube Embeddings for Fast Text-based Wildlife Observation Retrieval

author.name: Ilyass Moummad, Marius Miron, David Robinson, Kawtar Zaher, Herv\'e Go\"eau, Olivier Pietquin, Pierre Bonnet, Emmanuel Chemla, Matthieu Geist, Alexis Joly

entry.summary: Introduces compact binary hash embeddings for text-based wildlife observation retrieval, extending cross-view hashing to align language with visual/acoustic wildlife data for efficient large-scale search.

entry.title: MOTPose: Multi-object 6D Pose Estimation for Dynamic Video Sequences using Attention-based Temporal Fusion

author.name: Arul Selvam Periyasamy and Sven Behnke

entry.summary: Proposes attention-based temporal fusion for multi-object 6D pose estimation in cluttered bin-picking environments, leveraging video sequences to handle occlusion.

entry.title: Adaptive Cost-Map-based Path Planning in Partially Unknown Environments with Movable Obstacles

author.name: Liviu-Mihai Stan, Ranulfo Bezerra, Shotaro Kojima, Tsige Tadesse Alemayoh, Satoshi Tadokoro, Masashi Konyo, Kazunori Ohno

entry.summary: Presents adaptive LiDAR-based path planning for robots that recognizes and handles movable obstacles in disaster-response scenarios, integrated with ROS2 Nav2.

entry.title: Multitask Learning for Earth Observation Data Classification with Hybrid Quantum Network

author.name: Fan Fan, Yilei Shi, Tobias Guggemos, Xiao Xiang Zhu

entry.summary: Presents hybrid quantum-classical model using multitask learning for Earth observation data classification, leveraging quantum convolution operations.

entry.title: Predicting Intermittent Job Failure Categories for Diagnosis Using Few-Shot Fine-Tuned Language Models

author.name: Henri A\"idasso, Francis Bordeleau, Ali Tizghadam

entry.summary: Introduces FlaXifyer, a few-shot learning approach for predicting intermittent CI job failure categories to help developers diagnose flaky tests.

entry.title: Lantern: A Minimalist Robotic Object Platform

author.name: Victor Nikhil Antony, Zhili Gong, Guanchen Li, Clara Jeon and Chien-Ming Huang

entry.summary: Lantern is a minimalist robotic object platform (~$40 cost) designed for subtle human-environment interaction research. Validated through workshops, case studies, external lab distribution, and public exhibitions.

entry.title: RulePlanner: All-in-One Reinforcement Learner for Unifying Design Rules in 3D Floorplanning

author.name: Ruizhe Zhong, Xingbo Du, Junchi Yan

entry.summary: RulePlanner uses deep RL to handle complex hardware design rules in 3D IC floorplanning, addressing rules not handled by previous approaches. First all-in-one solution for multiple rule types.

entry.title: Head-Aware Visual Cropping: Enhancing Fine-Grained VQA with Attention-Guided Subimage

author.name: Junfei Xie, Peng Pan, Xulong Zhang

entry.summary: HAVC improves VQA visual grounding by filtering attention heads via OCR diagnostic, then refining using spatial entropy and gradient sensitivity to create Visual Cropping Guidance Map.

entry.title: Learn from A Rationalist: Distilling Intermediate Interpretable Rationales

author.name: Jiayi Dai, Randy Goebel

entry.summary: Improves rationale extraction models by distilling intermediate rationales from stronger teacher to weaker select-predict architectures, addressing capability limitations in base networks.

entry.title: Cross-Domain Few-Shot Learning for Hyperspectral Image Classification Based on Mixup Foundation Model

author.name: Naeem Paeedeh, Mahardhika Pratama, Ary Shiddiqi, Zehong Cao, Mukesh Prasad, Wisnu Jatmiko

entry.summary: MIFOMO applies foundation models to cross-domain few-shot learning for hyperspectral image classification using mixup augmentation and parameter-efficient fine-tuning.

entry.title: Assistive Robots and Reasonable Work Assignment Reduce Perceived Stigma toward Persons with Disabilities

author.name: Stina Klein, Birgit Prodinger, Elisabeth Andr\'e, Lars Mikelsons, Nils Mandischer

entry.summary: Vignette study finding that cognitive stigma toward persons with disabilities is reduced when work tasks are suitable or robot-assisted, particularly when robot assistance is offered to everyone.

entry.title: Bayesian Matrix Completion Under Geometric Constraints

author.name: Rohit Varma Chiluvuri and Santosh Nannuru

entry.summary: Introduces hierarchical Bayesian framework for Euclidean distance matrix completion with structured priors on latent point sets. Handles sparse and noisy observations for sensor localization and molecular conformation.

entry.title: Development of Domain-Invariant Visual Enhancement and Restoration (DIVER) Approach for Underwater Images

author.name: Rajini Makam, Sharanya Patil, Dhatri Shankari T M, Suresh Sundaram, Narasimhan Sundararajan

entry.summary: Proposes DIVER framework for underwater image enhancement combining empirical correction with physics-guided modeling. Integrates multiple modules for adaptive luminance enhancement, spectral normalization, and backscatter compensation.

entry.title: Scale Equivariance Regularization and Feature Lifting in High Dynamic Range Modulo Imaging

author.name: Brayan Monroy and Jorge Bacca

entry.summary: Proposes scale-equivariant regularization and feature lifting for HDR image reconstruction from modulo sensors. Helps distinguish true edges from wrap discontinuities.

entry.title: Compressed BC-LISTA via Low-Rank Convolutional Decomposition

author.name: Han Wang, Yhonatan Kvich, Eduardo P\'erez, Florian R\"omer, Yonina C. Eldar

entry.summary: Proposes compressed BC-LISTA using low-rank CNN decomposition for sparse signal recovery in multichannel imaging. Uses OMP for basis filter selection.

entry.title: Agnostic Language Identification and Generation

author.name: Mikael M{\o}ller H{\o}gsgaard, Chirag Pabbaraju

entry.summary: Studies language identification and generation under agnostic conditions without realizability assumptions. Provides novel characterizations and tight statistical rates for the general setup.

entry.title: Denoising the Deep Sky: Physics-Based CCD Noise Formation for Astronomical Imaging

author.name: Shuhong Liu, Xining Ge, Ziying Gu, Lin Gu, Ziteng Cui, Xuangeng Chu, Jun Liu, Dong Li, Tatsuya Harada

entry.summary: Develops physics-based noise synthesis framework for astronomical CCD imaging, modeling photon shot noise, dark current, and cosmic ray artifacts. Enables learning-based denoising without paired training data.

entry.title: User Prompting Strategies and Prompt Enhancement Methods for Open-Set Object Detection in XR Environments

author.name: Junfeng Lin, Yanming Xiu, Maria Gorlatova

entry.summary: Studies how user prompting behavior affects open-set object detection in XR environments. Evaluates GroundingDINO and YOLO-E under ambiguous, underdetailed, and overdetailed prompts.

entry.title: Changepoint Detection As Model Selection: A General Framework

author.name: Michael Grantham, Xueheng Shi, Bertrand Clarke

entry.summary: Presents IRFL framework for changepoint detection based on L0 model selection with adaptive penalty reweighting. Extends to handle trends, seasonality, and autocorrelation.

entry.title: What It's Like To Be A Worm (Notes on Borderline Sentience)

author.name: Niko_McCarty

entry.summary: Explores Darwin's observations on earthworm cognition as entry point for discussing borderline sentience and consciousness. Thoughtful philosophical treatment of animal minds.

entry.title: Postural Virtual Fixtures for Ergonomic Physical Interactions with Supernumerary Robotic Bodies

author.name: Theodora Kastritsi, Marta Lagomarsino, Arash Ajoudani

entry.summary: Control framework for supernumerary robotic bodies that provides kinesthetic feedback when non-ergonomic postures are detected during physical human-robot interaction.

entry.title: HeatMat: Simulation of City Material Impact on Urban Heat Island Effect

author.name: Marie Reinbigler, Romain Rouffet, Peter Naylor, Mikolaj Czerkawski, Nikolaos Dionelis, Elisabeth Brunet, Catalin Fetita, Rosalie Martin

entry.summary: HeatMat simulates individual urban material impact on Urban Heat Island effect at high resolution, estimating materials including building facades using only overhead imagery and standard maps.

entry.title: A Hierarchical Pedestrian Behavior Model to Generate Realistic Human Behavior in Traffic Simulation

author.name: Scott Larter, Rodrigo Queiroz, Sean Sedwards, Atrisha Sarkar, Krzysztof Czarnecki

entry.summary: Introduces a hierarchical pedestrian behavior model combining behavior trees with Social Force model for realistic pedestrian simulation in autonomous vehicle testing.

entry.title: Beyond Pixels: Leveraging the Language of Soccer to Improve Spatio-Temporal Action Detection in Broadcast Videos

author.name: Jeremie Ochin, Raphael Chekroun, Bogdan Stanciulescu, Sotiris Manitsaris

entry.summary: Improves spatio-temporal action detection in soccer broadcasts by adding game-level context reasoning through transformer-based denoising of player-centric predictions.

entry.title: An Entropy-Guided Curriculum Learning Strategy for Data-Efficient Acoustic Scene Classification under Domain Shift

author.name: Peihong Zhang, Yuxuan Liu, Zhixin Li, Rui Sang, Yiqiang Cai, Yizhou Tan, Shengchen Li

entry.summary: Proposes entropy-guided curriculum learning strategy for acoustic scene classification that helps models generalize across recording devices with limited labeled data.

entry.title: Stablecoin Design with Adversarial-Robust Multi-Agent Systems via Trust-Weighted Signal Aggregation

author.name: Shengwei You, Aditya Joshi, Andrey Kuehlkamp, Jarek Nabrzyski

entry.summary: Proposes MVF-Composer, a trust-weighted multi-agent reserve controller for algorithmic stablecoins with stress testing for adversarial scenarios like Black Thursday.

entry.title: AI Narrative Breakdown. A Critical Assessment of Power and Promise

author.name: Rainer Rehak

entry.summary: Critical analysis of AI narratives around agency, autonomy, truthfulness, and societal impact, drawing from STS, philosophy of mind, and critical data studies.
